description:
This place really is the gem that everyone is raving about. Super cute date night spot with a very romantic atmosphere.

We came here on a Saturday night and made reservations at 8pm which wasn't too hard to do the day of.

Ordered the 3 ingredient carbonara, braised pork pappardelle (a special that night), and the ostrich carpaccio.

Everything was really good! We had never tried ostrich before and our waiter said it would be gamey but it didn't taste gamy at all. They put a decent amount of capers, greens, parmesan, and the ostrich was sliced very thin so it was very well balanced flavor wise.

I think our fav pasta was the carbonara. Because they don't use butter or cream, it tasted very fresh and wasn't too heavy. They do put a decent amount of parmesan in it so it was still very flavorful. 

Service was also on point. Our waiter was definitely italian which made the experience much more authentic :)

All in all, a great dinner and it wasn't super pricey either. I recommend this place if you want to have a pasta date.
author: Sheena N.

description:
Very strange... I made a reservation on opentable for 12:00
lunchand arrived at 11:30 to find the place locked up and
no one in sight. Yelp info says they open at 11:00. Even
tried calling and no answer. Have dined here a few times
in the past and the food was really good. Very disappointing.
Call ahead to make sure this place is open!
author: Brad R.

description:
Service here was very subpar. Our server was visibly more friendly and helpful to the older couple sitting next to us. Moreover, our check was tossed to us bare, in no folder or cover AND with the clip still on it! 

Food itself is pretty good (4/5 stars), and prices are $16-$17+ for each dish. I liked the gnocchi in particular because is very soft and flavorful. Unfortunately, it wasn't good enough to make up for the bad service we received and I won't be coming back again.
author: Rebecca Z.

description:
Came here for my birthday. We arrived early so we went to the bar next door (which is owned by the same people) to grab a drink. They came next door to tell us our table was ready.

They start you off with drinks and also very good bread while your food is ready. Place is small, intimate, but you don't feel like you're on top of other people.

We ordered couple of appetizers to start with. The Brussels sprouts were ok, it was my least favorite thing, maybe a bit too greasy for my liking. The fried rice balls were amazing. Next time I am getting two places of that.

Our main course was also very delicious. We ordered a plate of their sausage pasta, and one gnocchi. Both perfectly cooked and tasted amazing. Also the portion was perfect.

I would highly come here again, prices were very good, service amazing. Just make sure to make a reservation.
author: Carlos P.

description:
Excellent pasta's here, even though they don't have a huge selection they are authentic, fresh and simple ingredients that blend well together. The service here is outstanding and all the little extras like free bruschetta and a dessert on the house from our waiter. This place has been around since the 90's and it's just about the only local place left in my hood (or the city) since a bunch of transplant businesses have been taking over and pushing the mom and pop places out of business due to high rents in recent years. This is why i always choose to support locally. Here is my breakdown to make it easier.

Ambiance: 4 stars
Food: 5 Stars
Service: 5 stars
Overall experience: 5 stars

Recommended:

Appetizer-bruschetta (best i ever had) 

Entrees-The three ingredient pasta (trust me!) 
and Squid ink pasta

Dessert-tiramisu (made in house) 
The panna cotta with balsamic vinegar (sounds weird but goes really well together) 

Will be back over and over again!
author: Petra S.

description:
We arrived early for our Friday night reservation, so the hostess escorted us to their bar next door as they prepared our table. She was even kind enough to give us an alternative table to keep us from waiting. The dimly lit lighting gave off a romantic vibe. Highly recommend for a date night! 

Our meals were served simultaneously within 15 minutes of wait time. I ordered the Tagliolini co' Salmone, which was topped with caviar. The caviar I received was orange; however, the photos I've seen from fellow Yelpers were black. The lack of consistency threw it off a little. Overall, the presentation was fantastic, the texture of the pasta was just right (chewy, but not undercooked), and the pasta sauce was just tasty enough so it wouldn't take away the rich flavor from the salmon.
author: Jamie P.

description:
Buonasera!

Bella Trattoria is truly authentic Italian not like any other tourist place in Italian town. The waitress is Italian and speaks Italian to us. We came in without reservation and we brought in our own red wine. 

First, the ambient is cozy and very homie. It's dark but full of happy guests.

Second, a solid 5 Stars for their food. Both of the appetizers we got are making our stomachs smiling face- the calamari and the eggplant meatballs.

We got 1 Sorrentina (Gnocchi that's melts in your mouth that tastes like foie gras), 2 of the Beef Pappardelle and 1 Clams Linguini.

We feel so content that we order another bottle of red. The service is great that they offer us a free desert to share even we decided we are too full to order desert. 

It's our first time going there with our friends from Missouri and we will definitely come back again.

                     -  FIN -
author: Julie L.

description:
I was craving Italian food and this place hit the spot! We came on a Wednesday night. So glad I made reservations bc it was pretty packed - side note I was able to get reservations on open table earlier that day. Probably because it was a weekday. Anywho, we got seated immediately. Wine list was great. Nice romantic mood - definitely do NOT bring your kids here. This is a date night spot for sure. Now for the good stuff - food:

Bruschetta - they brought this out for us complimentary. really good
Fried risotto balls stuffed with mozzarella - this was pretty good. There was something missing flavor wise though. Needed hot sauce or something
Carbonara - yum yum yum
Gnocchi verde - wow. These are not your average gnocchi pieces. They are like little pillows that are so soft and melt in your mouth. The Gorgonzola cream sauce was delicious and paired perfectly with the spinach gnocchi
Tiramisu - topped with crushed almonds. Very interesting and I loved the crunch it added to each bite. Never had that before. The rest of it was so light and delicious
Hazelnut gelato - so good. Gelato was so creamy and delicious. Good hazelnut flavor. 

Loved this place and can't wait to come back!
author: Lisa D.

description:
I've come here twice now and the food is amazing! I recommend that people get a reservation just because the restaurant is small and intimate. However, they do have another side to the restaurant that includes a bar, pool table, and seating. The menus are almost identical.

My favorite fish is their squid ink pasta! (Not pictured).
author: Zoe M.

description:
Came to carbo-load with my family before the SF marathon. Although my sister was the only one running, I was there for moral support. 

The restaurant is pretty small, and since there was 10 of us, we made a reservation for 5:30 on a Saturday evening. We were a few minutes late but seated promptly. The restaurant had a few occupied tables but was filled to capacity by the end of our meal. The service was efficient although not particularly friendly. I don't think the guy smiled once the whole time but he was quick and on top of things which is what really matters, especially with such a large group. 

We had a few bottles of wine and shared a few apps. The calamari was nice and crispy without being over breaded and chewy and the burratta was simple and delicious, but by far, my favorite was the manzo carpaccio. Arugula and a lemon, mushroom, caper salsa were the perfect accompaniments on the thin supple slices of beef tenderloin. Their complimentary house made bread with sun dried tomato olive oil was delicious as well. They also came around with a nice bruschetta amuse bouche. 

Since there were 10 of us, we pretty much ordered one of every entree. Everything was spectacular, no complaints from anyone. We were quiet for almost a full 10 min just enjoying the meal. (which is quite the feat for a Filipino family dinner!) 

Overall a solid authentic Italian restaurant. I can't wait to come back and satisfy my pasta craving!
author: Rachelle Anne J.

description:
This rating should actually be a 3.5. I came here for my parents' birthday dinner, and was a little disappointed. The appetizers were very good, however the pastas were okay.
- brussel sprouts: The mayo was a nice complement to the bacon flavor.
- arancini: very cheesy and had a good crunch to it 
- calamari: this was a little different because it was almost like tempura instead of just calamari, and there was a side of sriracha mayo. This was definitely a nice twist to the calamari.
- butternut squash gnocchi: I did not like this as much because it seemed like the flavors did not go together. The gnocchi itself was sweet, however the stir fry vegetables were a little too bitter/cheesy that it did not blend well in my opinion.
- carbonara: I am a little biased because I do not like bacon that m much to begin with, so this pasta was just a little too salty for me.
author: Amanda C.

description: I came here with my fiance for my birthday a couple weeks ago and loved the experience. The customer service here is so amazing. I didn't see the bone marrow on the menu and asked if they had it. The waitress said they don't serve bone marrow during the weekend since it takes ~20 minutes to make but we were still able to order it. We also ordered the carbonara, and pork dish. While waiting for our food to come out, we were given complimentary bruschetta. Everything tasted so amazing. We were also given complimentary dessert as well. Overall, it was a great birthday dinner and will definitely be back.
author: Michelle C.

description:
I've dinged some major stars because of the overall experience we had at Bella last night. I made a reservation on OpenTable earlier in the week and we were seated promptly at the time I booked. Although we were seated quickly, we were not greeted by a Sever for a long time, nor acknowledged by anyone around. This is a small restaurant, but that does not leave room for neglect.

We finally got the greeting we were waiting for, but our Server was the worst. Her attitude and the way she came off, unfortunately set the worst tone for the entire meal. There was no Hello, Hi, How are you guys tonight.. NOTHING. Not sure how she is employed in the industry where you should have at bare minimum, some manners. 

Any who, onto the food. We each ordered Pasta dish and shared the grilled meatballs and bruschetta. The best dish all night were the meatballs. For my main course, I had the Pappardelle Ragu, which I expected more out of. I thought it would be packed with flavor, but it did not... pretty disappointing. Nothing stood out to me, except the meatballs.. which I would not go back just to have.
author: Tiff C.

description:
Bella Trattoria is buzzing with more service than Pitbull's hotel room. I was truly stupefied at the amount of friendly waiters and free items that my friend and I got. 

I ordered the verde gnocchi, and I'm gonna have to say that I was low-key (locchi) not really having it. (See what happened right there?) The reason for this? The dish was pretty heavy for me. The flavor somehow did not sit right. I should have gotten fetuccine alfredo, something I had been craving for no less than a month. My friend ordered an arabiatta dish with squid ink noodles. Also, extremely pricey. My wallet shed a few tears in the process. 

I do really want to come back the next time I crave Italian food, which is like twice a month, and give this place another try. Update probably to come.
author: Celena C.

description: Ok so my hubby and I found this place a few years ago when we used to live in Sacramento used to drive into SF just to eat dinner here for special occasions. We came recently w my in-laws and my hubby and I both agreed that the quality of the dishes has gone down. My carbonara was on the watery side and the green gnocchi dish we got was lackluster. Still a quaint neighborhood joint and I would be willing to try it again in the future.
author: Julia L.

description:
I think the first time I came to this restaurant was in 2007 for a friend's birthday party. Since then I've been back a few times so when my bf asked for Italian cuisine for his birthday, Bella Trattoria came to mind. The food was great and the bruschetta from Bella's is my favorite bruschetta in all of San Francisco which is a pretty high compliment. The service was great and since I made the reservation on Open Table, we were guaranteed a table at the time that I wanted.

The portions are great here and with 3 appetizers, were were already way too stuffed for the entrees. But happily stuffed. Overall the restaurant is dimly lit, has a nice ambiance, and serves dishes with flavors that blend really well together. 

-1 star for not looking at the Open Table reservations that clearly said this was a birthday celebration. Or it could be that this restaurant doesn't do anything special for special occasions?
author: Denise L.

description:
Wow! Tagliolini co salmone is phenomenal. I've never tasted a seafood pasta dish like this. The salmon had a smokey taste, giving the dish a very unique taste.

From the appetizers to the entrees, each dish was fresh and full of flavor. 

The waiter was very generous and brought complimentary bruschetta and dessert.

Inside is very nice, has a bar area and a couch for a more relaxed night out. There is also a room for private parties.

Please go try the salmon pasta!!!! You won't regret it :)
author: Raisa G.

description: Food was delicious the  service was the worst. Placed an order for bruchetta and it took 20 minutes after having to ask what had happened. The waiter apologized  but then it took another 15 minutes to get service to place our dinner orders. The waiter apologized again and gave me a free glass of champagne, which was nice. But at the end we ordered dessert and once again made us wait 15 minutes for a simple slice of terimiso. His explanation was that he was serving a large party and forgot our orders. Not a good way to impress me especially when this was my first time at the restaurant. Not sure I'll be back again. I left a five percent tip but I still think that was too much. We were celebrating a birthday and it did ruin our experience.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Had a great night at Bella Trattoria. Even though we didn't make a reservation, we walked in at 6:30 on a Tuesday and they sat us immediately. 

Service/ambience was definitely the highlight. We received complimentary bruschetta to start and while our entire table was gluten free so couldn't eat it,  they returned quickly with an eggplant and cheese based appetizer instead. Throughout the evening, the chef came out to talk about the menu personally, deliver dishes, and explain our meals, and to finish, we received a complimentary panna cotta. All these things together simply made our table feel special, which really made the night for me. Feeling like a VIP makes eating out an entirely different experience, and Bella delivers this even to simple walk ins. It is always fun to feel really recognized by and engaged with the restaurant, and through these gifts and displays, the chef turned a casual dinner into a special dining experience.

The food was good too, but nothing amazing in my eyes. To start, we shared the warm spinach salad which was awesome and new, and the tri-color salad which was pretty typical of that type of dish. For mains, I had the smoked salmon tagliolini, which was good, relatively mild, a little sweet (the caviar an awesome, slightly sweet punch of flavor), and filling.. I ordered it with the gluten free pasta which was really good (the gnocchi is already all gluten free). I was happy with my meal but nothing I felt I need to have again soon. Someone else at the table ordered the orchiette which I might have actually preferred, as it was lighter and felt a bit more dynamic flavor wise. Plus, with the braised greens and lamb, it had quite a bit more going on and the flavor felt more robust, which is more my kind of dish.

 All in all good food, awesome service and dining experience, and great dinner out.
author: Tule H.

description: I remember saying I would never come back here because the service was incredibly horrible, but I really wanted pasta. So I decided to give this place another try. The food is still food, but the service definitely still sucks. We weren't really attended to. I had to ask for a straw more than 5 times and it became frustrating. We also had to ask for our change to our bill multiple of times, which was incredibly annoying. I would come back here for the food, but I hope they work on their service. One extra star the for food. Wish they did take out
author: Valerie N.

description: came here on thursday for a friends birthday and i was disappointed in the quality of the food here! the waitress and ambiance great- but the food was not good at all. my friends and i were both disappointed in the taste and flavor of our meals. the location of this restaurant is very convenient, and the design of the restaurant is nice but the menu needs to be improved ASAP!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
This place is a gem. 

The place used to be smaller but now has an additional dining room as well as a private room for events (free of charge and by reservation only).

The place has a divey feel. The original dining room is more intimate but the addition seems quite chic. The food was good. Bread was complimentary with olive oil and sun dried tomatoes, a nice break from just plain olive oil. We also got a meat plate, but it was a bit on the salty side. The pastas were top notch. Loves the creamy salmon pasta with roe. It was a special of the night but the dish was well balanced.

Overall it was a great meal and the service was superior. Also the price can not be beat. 10 out of 10 would come back again!
author: Ryan C.

description: This place is a neighborhood gem. Just really solid food, great service, and an overall good experience. There wasn't any one specific dish we would call out. We enjoyed everything we tried family style.
author: Michael K.

description:
What an awesome experience! Not only was the food super delicious, our service was excellent too. My fiance and I came in on a Sunday afternoon. The restaurant was not very busy and so our server was so attentive to us. From the complimentary bread & oil dip to the dessert, everything was on point. 
- bone marrow appetizer: melts in your mouth, amazing taste
- brushchetta: super tasty
- Tagliolini Salmone: not on their lunch menu but if you ask, they will make it; so good
- a meat pasta dish: good as well
- tiramisu: YUM
Are we coming back? Definitely.
author: Anne G.

description:
It's more of a 3.5, but it's some of the better Italian food I've had in San Francisco (I'm often unimpressed with Italian food) so we'll bump up to 4. 

It's a pretty cute place. A bit dark inside, but feels like a good place to go on a date or take your parents who are visiting out. Waiters seemed actually to be Italian - which is certainly a good sign. 

They did bring out bread - which was uninteresting, but the olive oil with sun-dried tomatoes that came with it was pretty good! Then they brought us each a good sized piece of bruschetta which was quite good and unexpected!

The Padron Peppers turned out to have some hot ones so that was kinda hard, but they were beautiful.

The Eggplant Parmigiana was tasty for sure.

My spinach gnocchi were too soft.  They had almost no actual structure and the pastas themselves were not that flavorful - I do think they were made in house though. The sauce however - a cream mushroom - was VERY flavorful, so much mushroom! - and saved the dish.

The Linguini with shrimp that my friend got was decent. Didn't blow me away.

We ordered a bit too much food for ourselves, but we are not huge eaters.

Was pretty empty when we arrived 6pm on Friday night, but by the time we left at 7:15, it was pretty full. They do take reservations
author: Sarah C.

description:
Best Salmon Pasta I've ever had. Me and my girlfriend's favorite italian place in SF as of now. They take reservations and the service was amazing. Can't see anything wrong with this place, you're
missing out if you dont try it!!
author: Kevin L.

description: Great hospitality at this restaurant. Staffs were extremely generous. We were able to order the bone marrow even though they don't normally serve it on the weekend. Also got free bruschetta and dessert. Would definitely come back.
author: Samson L.

description:
A pretty small restaurant with an intimate, neighborhood feel. My husband reserved a table for 8:15 pm but we weren't seated until 8:45 pm. We were able to wait next door but there was only standing room at the bar. Kind of hard when you are 6 months pregnant. 

Luckily once seated the food and service were great. We had an attentive waitress who was really nice. We ordered the fritto misto and polenta con funghi to start. The fritto misto had lightly fried calamari, green beans, and zucchini. The breading was not too heavy or salty which I liked. It was a big portion too. My husband liked it and ate the whole thing. I enjoyed the polenta cake with mushroom. The gorgonzola cheese was strong but good. It was a nice start to the meal. 

For the entree, my husband had the gnocchi with pork sausage and I had the seafood squid ink pasta. I liked my pasta better. The gnocchi was a bit too soft for me. I like my pasta al dente which the squid ink was. The seafood pasta had calamari, clams,and mussels. Very good. 

We finished with the tiramisu which was good. Not the most amazing one I have eaten but definitely satisfied the pregnancy craving. Wish it was a bigger piece. 

Overall a nice dinner for date night. Will definitely come back for more pasta.
author: Melissa T.

description:
I just don't understand how Bella Trattoria place has such high reviews. 

TIPS & HIGHLIGHTS:
- No take out orders 
- Menu on website doesn't match menu in the restaurant 
- Average Italian food 
- Bad service 

AMBIANCE:
- Don't come here on a date, the interior reminded me of a sleazy dive bar with the pool table in the back and unorganized seating arrangements.

SERVICE:
- My friends and I called on a Saturday night at 6pm to ask how long the wait was and the person on the phone said 1 hour and 30 mins. I put our name down thinking this place is gonna be super packed only to discover that when we arrived the restaurant was empty! Literally no one at the bar and the second room was completely empty. 
- Several times I asked the waiter to bring out butter for the bread and he ignored me and the same thing happened for the check even though the restaurant was pretty quiet that night with about 4-5 other tables and several other waiters. 

FOOD:
-  Squid Ink Pasta: There was no seafood at all in my squid in pasta and the sauce tasted like plain tomato paste. In addition my noodles were extremely al dente. I like al dente but these were borderline hard where even my friends noted it. This pasta dish was unflavorful, lacked creativity, and was just plain average.

OVERALL: 
- Each pasta dish is around $20+ not worth your money for the low quality of the food.
author: Steve C.

description: Excellent service. David is always a great host -- great place to bring friends from out of town!
author: Rory S.

description:
Average food, average price. Below average service. The service person did more than the waiter (waiter showed up once).


Overall quality: 5/10
author: Andrew Y.

description:
Would recommend this restaurant to anyone. The staff was friendly and accommodating when we walked in just before closing on a weekday. The food was life changing! I couldn't get over the little death I experienced with every bite. I even had a chance to taste a bite of all the food our party ordered and wow. The kitchen here does not disappoint! 

The atmosphere is definitely romantic- very dimly lit and quiet. Even though I went with a few friends in no romantic capacity it was still a very relaxing environment that added positively to our dinner experience. I will definitely be back!
author: Blake S.

description:
Came in on a weeknight for date night. Amazing home cooked fresh Italian food! Good thing we came in early because this place got packed really quick at 5:30! We were sitting near the door and seemed to me everyone had made a reservation.

Butratta with arugula this was recommended by our waiter, it our first time trying and thank you for exposing us to something new. I have never had arugula this fresh! We finished the bread that came with this dish and the waiter offered us more bread. 

Carbonara - only 3 ingredient (pancetta, egg, and pecorino) it was too salty for my liking 

Lasagna with meat sauce - I believe this was their daily special, this was delicious! 

Panna cotta (on the house) - pretty refreshing, cleaned out mh palette. 

Will be back to try all the other items.
author: Annie Y.

description: Food is so good. Posting because I saw a few of the bad service reviews below..I've Never had a bad experience here and have been multiple times. I do tend to go right when they open though, so maybe that is it? The service is always quick and servers are friendly. The food is consistently great.
author: Nick M.

description: My son and his girlfriend took me here as it's their go to Italian restaurant in SF. We had Caesar salad, bruschetta and each of us ordered a different pasta. Their pasta is homemade so you can't go wrong. Everything was delicious! It's a small space so you need a reservation in advance.
author: Puna S.

description: This place was VERY dark inside. You can barely see... we had to use our iPhones to look at the menu... very intimate setting lol. Your eyes adjust to it though! The service was phenomenal! Everyone was very friendly, and the service was fast. They give complimentary bread and sauce and it's SO GOOD! I loved the sauce they provide. We got the bruschetta which was also REALLY yummy. I definitely recommend it. I got the gnocchi (I can't find it on the online menu or in the yelp photos) but it had butternut squash, and it was delicious. So good. I really recommend it. The gnocchi was a good texture and was filling. My mom got the carbonara and she did not like it at all. She said it was very heavy... which is funny because there's no cream in the dish. My brother and sister got a really yummy dish (forgot the names of it though) I definitely recommend this place!
author: Kim P.

description:
Really nice place, space is nice and atmosphere is chill, we were during brunch so menu seemed to be limited but we could order other stuff from dinner menus as well. 
Carpaccio was so good, all 3 of them (beef, tuna and ostrich) and the pasta dishes were really nice 

Service was also friendly and helpful 
We would def go back
author: Or D.

description:
Remember to check your bank statement. They will bump up the tips. 

Food is ok
Service is bad
author: Keanu M.

description:
Such a great time here! Came for my birthday and it was perfect! Great service, great food and great atmosphere--packed but still comfortable and friendly!
Everyone's pasta was excellent! We had meatballs in a delicious sauce for our appetizer and a wonderfully yummy creamy tiramisu with a delightful crunchy topping. The waiter brought us a refreshing panna cotta with fresh strawberries and blackberries on the house. When he found out it was my birthday, he added a candle to my surprise!
The grilled hanger steak with Spinach, Gnocchi verde, pappardelle with fennel sausage, tagliolini with smoked salmon and pasta with Chicken-- all wonderful!
We will definitely be back!
author: E W.

description:
Decided to finally come here as I was craving Italian food and it was on my list. We made reservations for 7pm and were seated immediately. While we were waiting they served us bread with sundried tomatoes in olive oil (yum!) and they gave us some complimentary bruschetta. 

I ended up getting a pasta dish with pancetta and they were super nice to add vegetables. My friend got the cream pasta with salmon and she loved it. 

The atmosphere is quite casual so if you're looking for a place where you should dress up, this probably isn't it. It may be different on a Friday/Saturday but on a Monday everyone was dressed down.
author: Mira B.

description: The food here is delicious.  We went to celebrate my son's birthday and it was a nice setting for 7 people. I was happy with the menu choices and the ambience of the restaurant.  It was perfect.
author: Randy F.

description: We're from Central Valley Area in CA ... this place was recommended by a friend. The best food we had while visiting San Francisco this past weekend!! We had the Carbonara and Fried Pork dish with arugula salad, Tiramisu and house coffee/Latte.  Everything from the atmosphere to the food, and service was excellent!!
author: Diane L.

description: Came here last minute which we were able to get a seat. The food was not so amazing, bummer was also they were out of the catch of the day soup. The 4 of us were not that impressed especially with the high reviews. The service is really slow there especially when two waiters are taking order for one party like us they were confusing each other.
author: Manouk B.

description:
My friend and I came here solely for the squid ink pasta. We were a couple of minutes late for our reservation since finding parking in the area is pretty difficult. We ended up having to wait in the next door bar for a while so definitely come early if you're planning on driving.

The ambiance inside is really cozy. The tables are put pretty close together and the lighting is super dim.

Hands down the best Italian food I've had in America! I had the squid ink pasta with seafood and everything just tasted so fresh. The pasta was cooked just the right amount. It featured a marinara sauce that was light and refreshing. 

We appreciated the free Panna cotta dessert too! This was a meal that  makes me smile thinking back on it now :)
author: Becky H.

description:
Great homemade pasta. Service is hit or miss. One woman serving us for lunch was amazing, but another woman with glasses and a nose ring was very snippy, never smiled, and overall cold woman.

When I asked for Parmesan cheese, she hesitated and looked at me if I was bothering her. Hello, it's just cheese, and your are a waitress. She made us feel like we were troubling her, and that's not a great feeling when you go to a restaurant.

Food preparation is also very slow. That is the price you pay for a good home cooking style food.
author: Jacob J.

description: I'm not sure if I should write this review. But I thought about this and honestly I just had to,since my husband didn't think it made sense. They gave "complimentary desserts" to certain tables. Why give to some tables and not others? I don't understand why the discrimination against certain patrons, especially given this is San Fran. Either give it to everyone or make it clear when that's available. While I had no issues with the food itself, we didn't appreciate this. Will I be back? Probably not. Thanks for the great food, but no I will not be back.
author: Deb G.

description:
This is a really nice little spot.  Romantic atmosphere with really good food.   

My girlfriend and I usually get the eggplant Parmesan to start, it's consistently very good.  The bruschetta is also an easy win as well.  

They always have a special or two and those are usually what I choose.  If they have the ragu with some kind of pasta, I would get it any day of the week.  Recently had the lasagna also and that was excellent.  

The staff are always friendly and they have treated us to free bruschetta and dessert.  So you never know what your gonna get.  I highly recommend a visit.  

Looking forward to returning again soon.
author: Dave D.

description:
Where to begin?! This place is staffed with wonderful people who truly make out of towners
Feel like they are right at home. Excellent menu with refined but affordable Italian! Potato gnocchi was to die for, chef sent out not only bruschetta for us before the meal free of charge but also a Panacotta dessert post meal. Dank. Will be back if we return to San Fran !
author: Drew R.

description:
This is my favorite pasta place in sf at the moment :)! It's a little pricey but it's worth it. The quality of the pasta dishes here is better than others I've had in sf for more. 

Service: mostly nice and accommodating. I had one guy waiter who I felt was a little condescending and would never look at me, only explaining things to my male friend even when I asked the question. But other than him, I've had only nice waiters and waitresses 4/5
Food: the complimentary bread and spread is so delicious. The sundries tomatoes in olive oil is such a good combo I always want two servings and they always happily oblige. My favorite pasta dish so far is the one with Italian sausage. It's a perfect combination of sweet, savory, and creamy with perfectly cooked pasta. I thought the charcuterie board was just ok, but I like the pasta so much and the waitress gave us a free dessert that day (panna cotta, also delicious)5/5
author: Anna N.

description:
for starters there's complimentary bread alongside some type of oil with tomato. It is to die for. The water they have tastes so purified. It is definitely not gross tap water. We ordered the parmigiana and bruschetta for appetizers. The bruschetta was amazing. It had a perfect slice of mozzarella on top and when you bite into it the bread was the perfect crunch. It didn't hurt to bite into the bread, the tomatoes didn't fall off, the whole cheese isn't slide off the top. The parmigiana was good. I wish it had more cheese, but it was perfectly cooked. It wasn't mushy or too hard. I was beautifully made. 
I've never had pasta with salmon and roe until tonight, and it definitely was not a disappointment. We also order the frutt de mar and it was a tiny bit spicy and I was thrown off by the squid ink noodles, it was still so good. We also ordered pappardelle al burro and the truffle butter in it complimented the meat perfectly. We also had the tiramisu and the vaniglia affogato and they were both delicious. The service overall was amazing. They checked up on us frequently but not too often where it was a bother. I wish there were an option for 6/5 stars because that's what they would have gotten. I'm so happy we chose this place.
author: Viczel S.

description: The service here is phenomenal. Our waitress was such a sweet heart. The place is pricey but it's authentic and a wonderful family spot. She gave us a free appetizer and dessert! Would not have been the same experience if we didn't have such a great waitress! Definitely recommend for some quality food and excellent service.
author: Hana T.

description:
Brava! Stellar service. Marco you're a star! 
Luxurious pasta, gnocchi and even gluten free options. Legit Italian. Fresh panacotta is amazing!! Everything was soo yummy you can't be disappointed
author: Miche P.

description:
UPDATE TO THE REVIEW WRITTEN BELOW:
As you can see someone from Bella wrote me below asking me to email them about this. I did, multiple times. To absolutely no surprise I never heard back... so like I said about the service...

I have been to Bella four times now so that should tell you that the food is good. The food is actually really good! The service is terrible unfortunately. I waited to write this review because I was hoping to give them a chance to redeem themselves but it's always the same - wonderful food, terrible service. If you can put up with the wait and the service, the food is worth it. 

On my first visit we waited for two hours for two pasta dishes. They came to our table apologizing at the two hour mark saying that their pasta maker was broken. While unfortunate for a restaurant that makes mostly pasta, things happen. They made us dessert for our bad experience. Water under the bridge. 
The second visit a few months later, the same thing. Seems a bit odd. The third visit after a half hour of waiting we had to get up and ask the hostess for a few menus, water, and a server. Took about 15 more minutes for that. So after about an hour of waiting we got service and placed our orders. We ended up getting our water and food but never did get the wine we had ordered with our meal despite our multiple requests as to if our wine was coming. Last night was the 4th time we went. We arrived, got seated and the server was right with us. Everything was overall better than our past experiences however, we had to ask her multiple times for silverware. We asked her twice for more bread and water which never came so we had to get up and go to the kitchen and ask someone over there to help us. 

So again, all in all the food is amazing but they really can't seem to get it together with staff and service. Luckily we are very patient and the food has always been worth it in the end. I do have to say with this being the 4th time of really poor service we'll probably not go back. Maybe we'll just order take-out if we miss it. While the food is amazing, if you're looking for a good overall easy and enjoyable experience there are other places I'd recommend highly over Bella.
author: Lauren P.

description: We had a little family reunion there last night (6 of us) and everyone was so pleased with not only the friendly service but the amazing food.  I think we all had something different and all were thrilled and couldn't say enough about what a fabulous restaurant this is.  We started with the polenta which is so light and fluffy and delicious.  Some had the special of the night which was lasagne and was excellent.  I had the incredible butternut squash gnocchi which was truly to die for.  An extra plus is that they have a gluten free alternative for just about every pasta dish.  We will definitely return and enjoy another fabulous meal.  Only negative is that the bathroom door doesn't lock.
author: Debbie C.

description: Non-flashy, down to earth comfort italian. The gnocchi Verdi melts in your mouth, but it was hard to finish even half the plate as it felt almost too heavy with the Gorgonzola-crimini béchamel.
author: Tina C.

description: Visiting town for a few days and came to this place after Presidio Park. The service was great and food was delicious, and we got a complimentary dessert!
author: Israel M.

description: Great food, great service in a corner Italian restaurant in the Richmond district.  We stopped by after an outing in Marin.  Had the bruschetta as an app and it was just right.  Three of us tried three different pasta dishes and all were really good.  The pasta was excellent and the sauces just right.  We also appreciated the complimentary panna cotta to share at the end of our meal.  Our server was also super helpful and friendly.  We didn't see her when we were leaving, so It was nice for her to come out and find us right outside of the restaurant to say good night.  Really felt like a nice neighborhood place.
author: Ronny T.

description:
One of the better Italian restaurants in the Richmond. 

Tasty, hits the spot, but lacks just that bit more to be special.
author: Nathan N.

description:
Went to Bella the other night as a kind of celebration of life for the wild fires that are still burning up Santa Rosa, my best friend lost her house and so we decided to seek refuge at her grandmas house in the Richmond. We decided to go to an Italian restaurant close to her grandmas house and we ended up here because the other Italian spot down the street was packed.

This place wasn't packed but it was a Monday night at around 7;30

We have all been through alot so we decided to order literally almost the entire menu.

The special pizza with pine nuts and gorgonzola, a pesto stuffed eggplant, carpaccio (wasn't the freshest), a few Cesar salads, and a few pastas; pesto, spinach and egg and the carbonara.

The pizza was decent, very bready and not enough topping.

Out of the pastas, id recommend the carbonara, it had the most flavor, very rich sauce almost like a hollandaise carbonara, the sound of it may be off putting, but it was still tasty. The spinach and egg pasta was good too but I almost got an immediate stomach ache, and the pesto was very fresh and herbaceous but lacked complexity beyond the creamy herby flavor.

The carpaccio kind of tasted like the meat had previously been frozen, there was just a sharp iron taste, like a collection of iron in a specific bite I had. Once I covered the carpaccio in lemon, pepper, mustard and olive oil it tasted a bit better.

Id recommend the eggplant, it was just a pleasant small bite with pesto sandwiched between thin pieces of eggplant

Everything was good overall, the only thing that wasn't amazing was the service, we couldn't really tell which one was our server and they seemed annoyed with us ordering damn near the whole menu, but we didn't care cause were happy to be alive, thriving and eating noodles in San Francisco.
author: Megan K.

description:
Delicious.  Fantastic gnocchi and my husband is in love with the bone marrow . 
We got delivery via postmates and were very happy with the entire experience.
author: Sarah H.

description: Excellent customer service, very patient and nice waiters. The food was good, authentic, perfectly cooked smoked salmon pasta with caviar. It was a little on the saltier side, most likely from the smoked salmon since there was a large quantity of salmon pieces. Overall, great experience and ambiance.
author: Andrea C.

description: My boyfriend brought me here yesterday for my birthday and I was so pleasantly surprised! First we came and since it wasn't too busy we were able to choose our table, and they even asked if we wanted to sit across from one another or on the same side. The waiter was very nice and let us take our time with ordering! The food was so so good, and they kind of give you samples when you're waiting for your food, so when we were waiting for our appetizer, which by the way, the burrata IS A MUST TRY, he gave us samples of the bruschetta and polenta, which were both delicious!!!! Our meal was so good and filling, and I loved how you could taste the authentic Italian food, something you wouldn't get at classic cheese cake factory or Olive Garden! At the end of our meal, he even brought us a dessert for free, so it was great! The bill was also pretty good for how much food and the quality of it! I would love to go again!
author: Linda N.

description:
Why it took me 25+ years to try this restaurant is beyond me. 

I loved it:

- Cute cozy ambiance. Not LOUD at ALL. 
- Wonderful Service. They give a little "on the house" snacks. 
- Food was awesome - flavor and el dente just right! 
- I don't think anything here is bad, if its your first time get the Carbonara. 3 ingredients, best one I've ever had!

This is the kinda place SF needs more of, not that hipster communal table crap.
author: Phantom Of Yel P.

description: Excellent food - somewhat quirky waiter - impatient with a hurry up and wait attitude - risotto and cheese appetizer crunchy on the outside and creamy on the inside - pork chop dish very flavorful - gnocchi dish done to perfection- the vanilla gelato with assorted biscotti and a great cappuccino topped it off!
author: M O.

description:
Despite its location, Bella Trattoria serves some really great Italian food. We had a reservation for 6 pm, which wasn't needed at the time, but I would recommend making a reservation if you plan to eat after 6:30 as the restaurant filled up quickly. Also, don't be alarmed when you arrive and the restaurant looks closed due to the worn down windows. 

They started us off with a bread basket, which looks like your plain jane white soft bread, but omg it was so fresh and soft. It literally came straight from the kitchen and we devoured it instantly. Obviously when they asked us if we wanted a refill, we couldn't decline. In fact, we even wanted and could have ate a third basket had they not forgotten.. 

Between 3 people, we shared the meatballs for an appetizer. To my surprise, they weren't your standard medium / large size meatballs - they were rather small (think IKEA meatball sizes), but they were so tender and delicious. Definitely one of the best I've had. The sauce was fantastic as well as we kept dipping our bread in. For entrees, we went with the thin noodle, which comes with pancetta and truffle oil; the pappardelle with ragu; and the spinach gnocchi with gorgonzola cream sauce. The thin noodle was an after thought order after I was informed that they ran out of the squid ink pasta that I really wanted, which was disappointing at first because the restaurant just opened.. FYI - the menu presented in person was completely different than the menu online; all of the pasta entrees online pretty much aren't on the menu in person. However, all of the pastas were delicious. I loved the thin noodle as the noodles were perfectly cooked, the pancetta wasn't too salty, and the truffle oil really came through. Then, I'd suggest the pappardelle as the ragu was yummy. The spinach gnocchi was good, but didn't really stand out to me. The gnocchi was made too small, so it lacked texture, and the sauce was too salty and much for me. 

All in all, if you're craving pasta, stop by Bella. Make sure you come hungry, so you can carb load.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Holy cow! We were visiting and was looking for good spots to eat. Found this through Yelp or Google or something and decided to try it.

One of the best dining experiences I've had. The place was full-up, but we didn't wait terribly long for our food. The bread was fantastic. The meals were SUPER delicious! I had the lasagna and I forgot what my girlfriend had.
author: Marc V.

description:
I've ate this restaurant twice already. Both dinner experiences were great for me. The food was delicious! Their sparkling moscato is amazingly good. I normally don't order a moscato as my first wine choice, but they do let you try out the wine you are considering to order before actually getting the glass or bottle. I dined in with one of my best friends for dinner both times. It's a great place for a relaxing catch up dinner. Not too loud for a conversation. The restaurant is quite small so I made reservations in case. 

The service was good. It was a bit slow the second time around, maybe they were understaffed that night. I was there to have a catch up meal so I didn't mind. The last time we went, we couldn't get the sparkling moscato. The waiter was probably new, because he had said they didn't have it. It was actually on the dessert menu. It's part of the dessert wines. We didn't see that until the end of our meal. Bummer... It's alright, now we know.

Parking can be a headache in that area especially prime time dinner hours. I would suggest to either go early to find parking or just take an uber/cab so you don't miss your reservations.
author: Lucy L.

description:
I took some out of town guests here for dinner last night. We all agreed that it was one of the best meals we have ever eaten! Every single thing we ate and drank was delicious. The homemade pappardelle was sublime, as was the chicken with arugula. 
My favorite dish was the meatball appetizer. I could easily make an entire meal of just the meatball appetizer with the delicious warm bread and the homemade dip of sun-dried tomatoes in olive oil. Our waiter was great too. I'll be back!
author: Suzanne E.

description: Came to Bella trattoria, sign says go next door to the bar. Get there and no one to seat us just staff socializing not bothering to look up. Finally get seated by a guy who seemed annoyed to have to bring us over. Sat there for 13 min two waiters walk by just stare at us by keep going back to their tables twice maybe 3 times. Just left and they didn't give a damn no care in the world.
author: Al O.

description:
Hands down, some of the BEST (and fresh) pasta in the city!  Truly a neighborhood gem, Bella is tucked away in the Richmond district.  It's cozy and quaint, you can close your eyes and imagine you are in a small town in Italy.  There's a nice bar area in the back you can grab a glass of wine as you wait for your table as well.  

If you are a fan of carbonara, this is your place!  3 simple ingredients yet it is made so wonderfully well and tasty.  I am also in love with their pappardelle, squid ink pasta, and other daily specials (osso bucco) on the board.  Even their  bread with olive oil and sundries tomatoes is delicious....it's always so soft and fluffy too! 

Service is always on point and one of our favorite waitress is actually from Italy herself!  We love hearing stories from her of her growing up in Italy, she is a total sweetheart.  The husband and I love coming here after a long day of work and bringing friends here to try this place.

Save room for dessert as well, you will not be disappointed.  Even if you decide to pass, they usually bring a complimentary panna cotta to the table.  Smooth and silky with fresh fruits, what a great way to end the evening!
author: Janetto L.

description:
Bella 3848 is a separate restaurant & lounge from Bella next door with a separate kitchen and separate waitstaff. The two places have separate head chefs but they work together and share a few dishes but more are individual. The food is just as good as next door.

We had the warm spinach salad and two separate pasta dishes, all were excellent. We tried the sangria and one of the vermouth cocktails, also excellent. And the house wine was very good.
author: Jeff H.

description: Awesome pillowy melt in your mouth gnocchi's! Legit carbonara, the polenta and mushroom appetizer was great! The schnitzel (wasn't called that) was really good too. Really good service, nice people, cute interior design for the place. Somewhat small portions. Would visit again especially for the gnocchi's!
author: Joanne L.

description: Amazing homemade pasta . Great for kids too . Server was super . Will come here again .
author: Sam S.

description: Came for Kevin's birthday. Our server was this male with brown hair, and he was amazingly nice and attentive. We had a great time. Food was incredible. We also got free panna cotta and bruschetta! Panna cotta was so interesting because it had a lot of vinegar glossed on, but it was so surprisingly delicious! Made sure to tip on the amount it would have been if they didn't give all of that for free! Highly recommend this place and will be back.
author: Nadia H.

description: Well, you can cross this place off if you dont have reservations! And yes, there were MANY, MANY open tables. All the guy said was "oh, we are a little busy". Uh, hello, that's what you want, a consistent flow of patrons coming thru!
author: Rod W.

description:
My boyfriend and I just loved this place.
Our food was amazing 
The pasta was outstanding 
3 ingredient carbonara was spot on 
My boyfriend had the salmon pasta that tasted very fresh
The staff was friendly and attentive 
The only complaint was it as loud but we got through it and were able to just enjoy ourselves 
I could see us going back
author: Emily O.

description: Haven't been back to this place in a long time. But from what I can remember I had a good experience. The food was delicious and service was good, really can't think of anything negative to say. Hoping to come back and see how this place has changed over time.
author: Roman L.

description: Just left the restaurant & not only is the food 5 stars but so is the service! They were packed with people but Steve (our waiter) still made sure to be as attentive as he could & it truly made our experience. Everything was excellent & can't wait to come back.
author: Diana V.

description: Took mom here for my birthday :) she really likes the decoration inside. Service is always great, and the pasta is so chewy that you can taste it's the fresh handmade pasta! Everything is so good here! Can't wait to come back next time when I'm back in NorCal.
author: Chelsea L.

description:
I don't like Italian food. But I like this place!

Flavorful al dente noodles. 
Nice ambience. 
Good service. 
Tasty olive oil. 
Couldn't have asked for more
author: J P.

description:
Last year my wife and I ate from authentic Tuscan restaurants and this spot came close with the food. 
Simple yet delicious dishes. Make reservations and arrive 15 mins early for street parking . 
Service was on point and I highly recommend.
author: Phil L.

description:
I recently came here with a friend on my trip to San Francisco. Upon entering, we were asked if we had made a reservation. Seems like people normally make reservations here. 

The restaurant itself is a fancy Italian restaurant on Geary Boulevard in the Richmond district. The ambience inside could be the best described as cozy and familiar, even though the owners seem to go to any lengths to make the restaurant as dim as possible. The restaurant also boasts a small bar with about four seats at the very back of the dining area.

Onto the menu. Apparently it changes daily, and on this particular day, I ordered the Brussels sprouts as an appetizer and a pasta that prominently featured mussels and clams (but not the Frutti' 'E Mar). The brussels sprouts were extremely impressive, especially for such a simple vegetable. The outside was crispy but not overdone, and the inside was soft but not mushy, a perfect combination of textures. The pasta was also splendid; just like the brussels sprouts, the pasta was at the same point of perfection for texture and was accompanied by an aromatic white wine sauce. To top it all off, our waiter offered a complimentary Italian dessert, similar to a ricotta cheesecake.

If I were in the San Francisco area again, I would revisit this restaurant but will keep in mind to make a reservation.
author: Benjamin C.

description:
Bella is definitely one of those places that will keep you coming back for more. I have been here twice and will for sure be back. The first time around I was having a girl's night and decided on the lasagna special of the day. It was so rich and tasty. I sure enjoyed my leftovers the next day. I paired it with a glass of wine and panna cotta dessert at the end which was the perfect ending to a tasty fulfilling meal. The next time around I was on a date and I ordered the Tagliolini Salmone which was pretty darn good. The salmon had a smoky taste to it. Personally it was a bit on the salty side but granted the waiter did tell me about this when I was asking for help choosing a plate so I was more than aware of it. My date ordered the Tagliata al Gorgonzola and oh my that steak was sooo delicious. I've always feared going on a date and liking my partner's plate more than mine but I gotta say it was pretty darn even this time. I loved my plate but definitely did catch myself asking him for some of his steak because it was just THAT good. Again, I ended this meal with the panna cotta because it's so tasty and light. 
The restaurant itself is very quiet and intimate. The lights are very dim and perfect for a date. They do take reservations but both times I went were on a weekday so I was able to sit down without a reservation and no wait time. If you're attending on a weekend I do recommend a reservation because I do live right next to the place and see how busy it gets with people standing around outside of it.
author: Melanie L.

description:
TL DR; Overall Great food. Would recommend and come back again for the pasta. Always ask for recommendations as the food varies from day to day.

For my visit on 9/9/2017 I ordered/received the following:

Bread (Free):
I was initially disappointed with the bread that was provided with tomato and olive oil. It tasted stale like it should tossed 1-2 days ago. There was way too much olive oil and it masked the taste of the sun-dried tomatoes. The flavor of the sun-dried tomatoes were absolutely amazing, but was too subtle. I lacks a robust taste that would have complimented the bread well. They brought another serving of bread, but it was burnt. Extremely disappointed that they were willing to serve burnt bread.

Bone Marrow ($14):
It was decent for the price. It was way too under cooked. It did not compliment well with the toast provided, but was actually a lot better when eaten with the free bread. I recommend eating it with the free bread as it will help absorb the salt and fat to not overload your taste buds.

Pasta:
Maccarun Ca Salsiccia ($16):
Compared to the La Vera Carvonara, this ranks lower, but is still superb. I normally do not like peas, but it goes well with this dish. 

La Vera Carbonara ($17):
This is the star of my visit. Most places that do a La Vera Carbonara wait too long before adding the egg causing it to be not so creamy, but they made this perfectly. The flavors mixed will together and they were able to create a rich, deep taste with only 3 ingredients. Would come back just to eat this.

Bruschetta Mozzarella: 
This made up for the very lacking bread with tomatoes and olive oil. The bread was fresh and not overly toasted. It had the attention to detail I was expecting and the tomatoes had the robust flavor I was looking for. Mozzarella was subtle and helped the tomatoes shine by enhancing the taste.

Dessert Panna Cotta:
This was very well made and they let us end our meal strong. Most of these are usually made with too much gelatin but this was not the case. It had a good combination of gelatin and cream. Fruits were fresh and sweet. No real complaint for the dessert.

Overall: The meal started of weak and was not going very good, but they stepped up their game at the pasta and it changed my bad experience to a good one. The chef afterwards went the extra mile by coming out and talking to all the customers who were still there. I appreciate these small acts of ensuring customer service.
author: Jimmy I.

description:
I've had this place on our list for a while but since it's pretty out of the way, we didn't make it here until almost a year later to try this place. The entrance is located at the corner of the street and is a tight entryway. We were swiftly seated even without a reservation on a Thursday night. I was glad the place wasn't too crowded. Although the venue space isn't that large, they did a good job arranging the tables to fit the most amount of customers in here without it being too cramped. 

Our server greeted us warmly and gave stellar service throughout the night. The other servers would also check in and help out with the dishes, and they were all very lovely waiters and waitresses. We ordered the Arrabiata Calabrese (squid ink pasta) and the Pasta Carbonara. They have a lot of off menu items so be sure to ask the waiter. We then received complimentary bread with sundried tomato oil which was surprisingly really good even though I don't like tomatoes. The pastas came and both looked very yummy and unique. I have to say that both were very good - the arrabiata had a kick to it that tasted like Korean food and the carbonara was very rich. However, both of them were on the saltier side so be prepared to drink lots of water. Another pro of this place is that they give complimentary panna cotta for dessert. This was delicious as well. I really enjoyed the complimentary dishes here and their pastas tasted very authentic!
author: Catherine S.

description:
Best Italian I've eaten including my Italy trips and felt very invited/expected to this family owned restaurant.  Fantastic food and ambiance.  We started with a glass of prosecco and prosciutto at the bar while we waited for our reservation time.  We ordered the gnocchi and it was the best. 

Upon leaving the owner stepped out to wave goodbye to us as we crossed the sidewalk.   I will for sure make an effort to visit my new favorite restaurant in San Francisco on my next trip to the city.
author: Chuck R.

description:
Such a great experience! The food was delicious the service was amazing! Everything was perfect!
I had the salmon pasta, such a treat!
author: Geraldine F.

description: I revise my review, and give it a 4 star, as the owner acknowledged promptly that the discrepancy in tips charge was due to their unfamiliarity of a new software.
author: Sam F.

description: We just had a lovely dinner from start to finish! Staff was friendly and prompt, bringing us extra bruschetta appetizers and a panna cotta to die for. Our pasta was fresh and flavorful, with an extra cheer for the  delicious lasagna. All topped off with sweet peach Bellinis. Definitely coming here again soon.
author: Heidi R.

description: A must visit! Food is authentic Italian. Very delicious. I had the maccarun ca salsiccia - a rigatoni dish with pink sauce and sausages and peas. Exactly what I wanted. And my server Haley was hilarious! She was attentive and charming and had out entire table in stiches. She had mentioned she's in on Weds Fridays and saturdays. I recommend you come those days. Best experience I've ever had. Kutos to whoever hired her
author: ryan f.

description:
We had a wonderful experience at Bella Trattoria. Not sure why we deserved it, but we received complimentary bruschetta for an appetizer and a panna cotta for dessert - both were very good! Service was very friendly and attentive, although I wish there was more conversation about the restaurant. Still, we felt very welcomed.

We ordered several pasta dishes (Tajarin, Arrabbiata, Sorrentina and Carbonara) as well as the Sicilian Arancini. Overall, these were good, but missed on being great. In particular, the Carbonara was over-sauced and dark (see attached photo and compare to other photos of Carbonara for this restaurant) and the gnocchi in the Sorrentina was too soft (perhaps overcooked). The Arancini was perfectly cooked inside and out, but could have benefitted from a flavor punch ingredient such as basil or wine.
author: Colin O.

description: Loved this place... had the gnocchi verdi and a wine that was recommended and can't remember the name of now, but was paired well. The food was delicious and the portions were substantial.
author: David C.

description:
Bella is an amazing gem, not because it's an amazing Italian place in the Richmond but because its an amazing Italian place.

I want to jump straight to the pasta but it would be unkind not to me to mention their excellent starters, aside from standards like bruschetta and caprese salad ( both of which are great) they offer three different carpaccios, tuna, beef, and wild game. I've never seen that combo anywhere else but all three are delicious and worth a visit alone.

Their pasta is amazing, I've had almost all options and everyone it's a spiritual dilemma picking just one, throwing specials into the mix creates a civil war for the palate. If one day I give up on my health and decide to became the 400 pound man you will find me ordering and eating every pasta dish Bella offers. Their gnocchi is light and fluffy, combined with perfectly seasoned Italians sausage. Each bit is life a perfectly spicy pillow of pasta. The pasta puttanesca has more class and refinement than any royal family. I can think of no better way to clog your arteries than their carbonara.

Incredibly Bella also has excellent non pasta entrees, I assume because the chef is some sort of food saint trying to guide humanity towards divinity through our taste buds. Their hanger steak will make you reevaluate what the best cut of meat is, I firmly believe that all trout view ending up in Bella's kitchen as Valhalla.
In short Bella Trattoria is one of the best Italian spots in the city. I normally would try and keep from telling people about them but I'm fairly certain it would be counted a mortal sin to not do my best to ensure their prosperity.
author: Ben M.

description: I had the eggplant appetizer and thought it was delicious. It reminded me of the way they cook it in northern Italy. The only complaint I have is that the bread seemed store-bought and cheap. I think they also make pizza so I'm not sure why they can't use some of the pizza dough to make their bread. I questioned our waiter about the quality of the bread and he assured me it was homemade. After reading some of the reviews, I highly doubt that! Despite the four star review, we will not be returning.
author: E T.

description:
Ok I have been posting a bunch of 5 stars lately.  I grade stars by the potential of the place and type of food the establishment is designed for.  In their category I give it top honors.  I hit a home run last evening.  Craving Italian and was in SF inner Richmond neighborhood.  Loads of places and because of good yelp reviews I decided to give them a try.  I needed togo and they were the best.

Ordered 2 of their recommendations and both my wife and we're so hooked we kept sharing with each other.  Warm spinach salad was off the hook great. 

They have a fantastic wine and beer offering.
author: Mike J.

description:
Seems like a pretty authentic Italian restaurant. The menu was in Italian, at least....

The vibe is a classy, European feeling. I came here at 7:30pm, so it was getting dark and the lights inside are very dim.

The service was great, and I liked it because the place was not too crowded. I'm pretty sure the servers spoke Italian to us as well, which was cool.

I got the carbonara. It wasn't on the menu for the day but I asked about it because I saw pictures of it on Yelp. It was really good! It just got too cheesy as I was almost finished, so I couldn't finish it all the way.

For dessert, we ordered a panna cotta. I've never had one before. It sort of tasted like a cheesecake. But better!
author: Do P.

description:
My girlfriend treated me out to this cute and romantic little spot for my 25th birthday. She made reservations online which were easy and flexible since we showed up an hour early and still seated us. 

The front entrance is tiny, like phone booth tiny haha so be prepared to wait outside. The interior is very homey with nice lighting perfect for a date. Unless you are well versed in Italian cuisine, I would suggest that you look up pics on yelp since we could barely pronounce some of the items on the menu haha! Thankfully, our server told us about the specials. We started with the bruschetta and shared the Maccarune Cu Salsiccia and Osso Buco. 

Oh my goodness, the quality and flavor of these dishes are to die for. The Maccarune Cu Salsiccia is a rigatoni pasta with this smooth, bold, and creamy tomato sauce topped with sausage. The Osso Buco (special) has tender juicy braised pork in a thick meaty sauce with fettucine. Wow both of these were cooked and seasoned to perfection!

With quality and taste like that accompanied with friendly servers and the perfect ambiance I couldn't be any happier. Thanks babe for the treat!
author: Ryan J.

description:
Great pasta, great service, great night! The atmosphere is cozy, candlelight and Venice murals.
A little plus for the Carbonara!
author: Alice A.

description:
How to pretend like you went on vacation to Italy while in SF: dine at Bella for craft pastas with the backdrop of a gorgeous (and quite realistic) mural of docked gondolas overlooking the Venice waterfront. 

Good Italian food can be challenging to find in these days of cookie-cutter lasagna and fettuccine alfredo, and Bella Trattoria is a gem tucked away in a corner in the Inner Richmond. The neighborhood is a lot more calm than the crowded/semi-touristy/quasi-racy North Beach area, and parking is actually not impossible. 

Bella's menu features an enticing selection of pastas, a handful of entrees, and some apps. The real star is the pastas, which are made fresh daily o__O If I lived closer, I would be inclined to adopt a mindset of gotta try 'em all.

(+) Bread with sundried tomato dip (complimentary): Not the best bread and dip I've had, but does set you in the mood for Italian food. The bread is buttery than most breads, a bit heavy with olive oil-based dip. The sundried tomato did not have much of a wow factor; the highlight was the softness of the bread.  

(++) House cocktail ($7; vermouth, prosecco, orange): Described as "the negroni gone wrong", this rogue cocktail takes all the bitterness and alcoholicness out of the classic negroni and makes this very drinkable. It borders on a girl drink, presented elegantly in what looks like a tall shot glass. Would recommend for the general population, though not necessarily for anyone hard-core about strong whiskey and the like.

(++) Bruschetta (complimentary): Despite usually being underwhelmed by chopped tomatoes on bread... this is probably the best chopped tomatoes on bread I've ever had. The base was a delicious buttery toast, topped with garden-fresh juicy tomatoes and aromatic basil garnish. 

(+++) La Vera Carbonara ($17.5; pancetta, pecorino, egg; no cream or butter). I can't believe it's not butter!! A lighter but extremely satisfying rendition of carbonara. The construction of the sauce from purely pecorino and egg makes for a simple and classic, yet unique and novel flavors. I'm still fascinated by the 3-ingredient composition. My only gripe is that the pancetta is chewier than I would have liked. 

(+++) Gnocchi Verdi ($18; spinach gnocchi, shiitake mushrooms, raddichio, gorgonzola bechemel): Although I'm usually not a gnocchi fan (hence my frequent mispronunciation), these little green dumplings were the most memorable bites of the night. The gorgonzola bechemel and raddicchio created a savory sauce heavy with smoky dimensions.The addition of the mushrooms brought back childhood memories of cream of mushroom, only with complex fine-dining-esque flavors. As for the gnocchi itself, it featured the Goldilocks ratio of al dente and softness; the satisfaction of biting into just the right texture was like finding the perfect boba.

(++) Panna cotta (complimentary): I like how it's not too sweet, very vanilla-y, and well complemented with berries. Nice ending to the meal when there isn't quite enough stomach space for tiramisu. (Oh first world problems...)

As Yelpers have mentioned, the ambiance is cute and intimate: you won't fail to impress whether for date night or a nice family dinner. The lighting is dim with modern pendant Edison bulbs, but not so dark that your food pictures look abominable. 

Service was efficient and quite gracious, as they did not frown upon my mispronunciation of gnocchi nor my choice of clothing (hospital scrubs do not seem the most fitting in an upscale Italian restaurant). 

The verdict? Excellent food at reasonable prices, and still cheaper than going to Italy. Ciao!
author: Edna C.

description: Cozy Italian restaurant with delicious pasta and friendly staff that make you want to stay there all night with a glass of Cabernet and a fresh baguette
author: M F.

description:
I would consider this restaurant a 3.5 stars but rounded up to 4 stars. 

I first heard about Bella Trattoria a couple of months ago from some friends - one of whom is from New Jersey where I used to live, so I trust his judgment of Italian food. Located in the Inner Richmond district, surrounded by Asian food options, we were pleasantly surprised to find this cute little restaurant serving tasty homemade Italian food. While Bella Trattoria isn't my favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco, it's a solid option especially if you live nearby. I live near Delfina and Locanda, so I have high standards, but certainly enjoyed my meal that night.

Our favorite dishes of the night were: 
* grilled meatballs with eggplant-tomato caponata (Purpett' a' Mammeta): While the meatballs were good but not spectacular -- they were a bit too dense and rubbery for our liking -- the sauce they came in was to die for. We were busy scraping up every bit of the delicious tomato cream sauce full of zucchini, eggplant and tomato which enrobed each little meatball.
* the special osso bucco pasta with fettuccine: Luscious creamy sauce with mushrooms and carrots and chunks of tender osso bucco (veal shanks) coated each delicious al dente strand of fettuccine. It was by far our favorite dish of the night. I would highly recommend an order of that pasta if you can.

Some other tips/notes: 
* Restaurant is small, with dark wood and dim lighting. Good for dates or intimate dinners with friends. 
* Reservations are recommended.
* Skip the pesto gnocchi if you can. (lacked seasoning)
* Service can be slow, be prepared. 
* Complimentary panna cotta at the end of the meal was a nice touch. 

Find a full review and photos on my blog: http://www.vcinthekitchen.com/bella-trattoria-sf/
author: Vic C.

description:
Overall this place was very underwhelming 

Free bread was a decent baguette with dried tomatoes in oil that tasted a bit old to be honest

The only plus was the free bruschetta and Panna cotta we got on the house

6 HR Ragu pasta: under salted and quite bland. Honestly the ragu tasted like ground pork just tossed with tomatoes. It was quite unspectacular. The portion size was quite tiny as well especially for the $20 price tag. The noodles were not terrible??  

Chicken Pasta bake was on the opposite spectrum and way too salty and garlicy 

P.S their take home boxes are just cardboard and not waxed cardboard. They will LEAK through like ours did on the Uber back

Would not recommend
author: Enojatil O.

description:
Bella Trattoria is perhaps one of our new favorite Italian restaurants. We don't eat out much these days, but the food and the service here were enough to make us immediately consider amending our homebody ways. 

Our server Stephen was exceedingly kind and knowledgeable of the dishes; his conversation made the evening that much more enjoyable. And between pillowy oxtail and pumpkin gnocchi that melts in your mouth, to a simple-yet-impressive carbonara, we couldn't even decide what our favorite dish was. (The appetizers of bruschetta and brussel sprouts with aioli were also great.) To round things out, we'd overheard a couple nearby rave about the tiramisu they'd ordered, so we had to follow suit: we similarly couldn't decide which was more heavenly, that fluffy tiramisu or the panna cotta.
author: J.T. T.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday night around 5:30 without reservations and they were able to seat us. Next time, I would make reservations ahead of time because it did fill up around 6pm. It's a small restaurant so it has a close vibe to it. The staff was super friendly and always made sure we had everything we needed. 

The food was superb. I haven't had fresh Italian food in a while and they definitely did not disappoint. Listen to their specials because that was one of the dishes that I ordered.
author: Justin Y.

description:
Came here on Saturday for a friend date. We walked in around 8pm and they said they had no table openings until 10pm (so make a reservation!), but could accommodate us at the bar. We obliged and enjoyed our meal at the bar. They didn't have anywhere for you to store your jacket/purse aside from a coat rack near the restroom, which was a bit of an inconvenience. 

Staff was really friendly, but while we got a lot of attention from the rest of the staff we had trouble getting attention from our waitress - for things as simple as plates/utensils, water refills, and to place our order. 

Food was good, but could be improved. The complimentary bread was fluffy goodness, and the sun dried tomato in oilve oil for dipping was a delicious accompaniment. We shared the brussels sprouts with pancetta and tajarin al burro (flat thin pasta with sausage in a butter white wine sauce). The brussels sprouts were steamed, rather than roasted, and the pancetta was nothing special - I was disappointed with this dish as I was expecting something quite different. The pasta was just ok/perhaps too plain - I wasn't impressed. If I were to come back I would definitely rather try something new.

If you're not super familiar with pasta names, be prepared to be somewhat stumped by their menu descriptions. 

TL;DR: Food was good, prices were a bit high, and ambiance was nice (minus how cramped the place is) - overall an OK experience for the value.
author: Vivian N.

description:
Cryptic menu hides some delicious food
We just ate here and had the Maccarune Cu Salsiccia and Pasta Norcina.  Both dishes had lots of flavor in the sauce and in the pasta as well.  Very reasonably priced - we'll be back.
author: Joe B.

description:
I took my boyfriend here for a cute dinner. Reservations were easy to make and edit via their website (it'll redirect to open table). Although we showed up an hour early, they were still able to accommodate us. 

When you first open the door, there is a small area with a computer and menus. There is no indoor waiting area, so bring a jacket to wait outside if you are going during a busy time. 

You can check out their menu online/yelp photos, but they also have specials that they tell you verbally. We ordered the bruschetta, Maccarune Cu Salsiccia (rigatoni pasta with sausage and creamy tomato sauce), and Osso Buco with fettucine and creamy sauce (special). All of the items were amazing. Unfortunately I don't have anything to compare it with because I don't eat Italian food often, but the quality of food was great here.

If you're looking for a small, cozy, romantic place, this is it! Make reservations for ease of mind.
author: Lena C.

description:
Italian food in the Richmond? I was skeptical, but when all the waiters have Italian accents, rest assured. Food was great, especially the pumpkin gnocchi and squid ink spaghetti. Service was delightful and welcoming.

There was a bit of a wait, which I was surprised about for 7:30pm on a Wednesday. No worries though, as just an excuse to have an extra glass of wine before dinner next door at the lounge they also own. Great setup!
author: Frank T.

description: Bella Trattoria & David, in behalf of my group, thank you for the sumptuous dinner. Your food is truly delicious and unforgettable. We really appreciate the hospitality from your staff and how you accommodated our large party.
author: Teresa C.

description: Great place with good ambience.  The menu and food are delicious.  It's very nice but still comfortable and accessible.
author: d s.

description:
Drinks and entries are ok. Service is pretty good. Food is meh. 


Meat balls were really good. Sauce was awesome.

Pasta carbonara had a very strong flavor to meat broth or something similar. 

The other pasta was kind is tasteless.

Service was good.
author: Antonio F.

description: Great staff, wine and appetizers. If you love Chardonnay, get the foggy bottom. So yummy! The bruschetta was fresh and the ambiance was on point. Perfect date night spot or just to grab a few appetizers & wine!
author: Erynne M.

description: Food is a 5/5 but the atmosphere and service is why I am giving this place a 4/5. The food was really good italian, comfort food. Big portions and nice wine menu. The house wine was really yummy and reasonably priced.
author: Penelope G.

description:
