This review is for the Bella Trattoria location with a pool table in the back and espresso machine facing the entrance.
The worst food we had tasted in any restaurant in a very long time....
My pasta was simply disgusting; Sara Lee spaghetti soaked in some kind of grease and my husbands eggplant gave him an indigestion that lasted for a day.
Kids told me their "gelato" tasted like ice cream from Trader Joe and my husband took one sip of his espresso and set it aside.
Pay attention to the bread they serve (one reviewer had posted pictures of it, so you can see that I am not making this up). This is the kind of bread sold in Mexican supermarkets and is one grade above Wonderbread.
Heaven forbid that an Italian tourist wonders into this place, America will have one more thing to be ridiculed for (like Trump is not enough...).
author: Laura S.

description: Best gnocchi ever. Melts in your mouth. Comparable to the gnocchi I had in Italy! Also they were super friendly and gave us a free panna cotta at the end!
author: Becca U.

description: Randomly picked Bella tonight while visiting SF. Great ambiance, friendly service. I asked the waitress for a recommendation and she picked out the perfect dish! Everyone in my party thoroughly enjoyed their meals and we all would definitely return
author: Brittney W.

description:
Delicioso! Small, casual, authentic Italiano restaurante. Molto Bene! Feels like eating in a family friend's little restaurant. Hubby ordered the lasagna. thought it was a little too cheesy for his taste. LOVED my gnocchi verde-- spinach gnocchi w/ rice flour, I believe ($18). Rustic, homey, pillowy soft. 2nd favorite gnocchi. Still have dreams of Michael Chiarello's gnocchi in Napa, but this is a close second. 

Cesar salad was a bit heavy on dressing, and not enough anchovies for my taste. ($9). Tiramisu ($11?) was a little too creamy, and not enough ladyfinger/cream ratio, in my opinion. Could use a little more rum too :). 

Overall, excellent restaurant! Will return! Loved the diversity of clients-- looked like lots of regulars-- families, seniors, young Asians, hipsters... all familia!
author: Lisa B.

description:
I agree with Steve C. I also do not understand how this place has such high reviews. 
I do not recommend dining here. There are a lot of better Italien restaurants in the city.

Low Lights
- Below average Italian food 
- Overcooked pasta
- Bland food

High Lights
- Good service
- great wine collection

FOOD:
-  Gnocchi & Tagliatelle with ragu : Gnocchi's were overcooked and extremely soft. Tagliatelle had no flavor.
author: Meli.Lars M.

description:
The food here is not gourmet but it tastes great and satisfies any pasta cravings! 

We got the baked chicken pasta, carbonara, and thin flat noodles with sausage, ranked in order of how much I enjoyed it. Was a little bland for me but the flavor was there and there's salt at the table to add to your dishes. 

Received complimentary appetizer and dessert for our meal which were both great!! Thank you to the waiter and bussers for the amazing service.
author: Shelly L.

description: Horrible experience we made reservations for this place but apparently they share dining area with osteria Bella & the service was horrible. We got seated only to be ignored for 15 minutes because the server seemed to really have his hands full with only 1 other table in the restaurant. When you make reservations they don't tell you they share restaurants so it's very confusing trying to figure out where you're headed. They don't have most of the stuff you order because they ran out! Another way of saying we don't have the funds needed to stock our kitchen! They have Italians working with limited English & service! It might be charming to have an Italian servicing you at an Italian restaurant but they need to learn good old American customer service!
author: Zaro A.

description:
Followed the yelp reviews and met with my daughter to have an Italian lunch. Bella Trottoria is located in the Inner Richmond on Geary. The restaurant is simply decorated with wooden chairs and tables. We arrived at 12:20 and we were the only customers the whole lunch. Why? The food and the service was fabulous. We had one of the best Italian meals in San Francisco in the past several years. The server/ host/ cashier was very helpful in suggesting the best items on the menu.  We ordered the following 

Drinks

Café Americano 
Latte

Appetizers 

White Anchovy 
Grilled Bell Peppers
Soppressa 
Burratta 
Shaved Parmesan Cheese
Cesar salad
Bread with dried tomato olive oil

Entree 

Squid Ink seafood spaghetti 
Sorentina Gnoochi 
Orinquetti pasta with Italian sausage ana cream sauce 

All of the pastas where exceptional, with the Orinquetti being my favorite. The Burratta was creamy soft and the perfect texture. The marinated white anchovy and the cheese were perfect together. 

Service was excellent.  Parking is hard with limited meters. $93 before tip.
author: George F.

description:
It was getting a little late for dinner and we were trying to figure out how to feed ourselves, so I booked a 1000 point Opentable reservation at 9pm here. I have passed by Bella many times, but didn't know what to expect. Except for the sign written in cursive, the exterior reveals very little about what lies inside. It was pretty dark inside, but I could still make out a large picturesque painting of a dock. There is also small bar against the back with a wrought-iron Bella sign above it. Now I know what the term 'neighborhood gem' means. Who'd have thunk there would be an awesome little Italian restaurant across the street from a Burger King? 

They started us off with some complimentary bread & tomato aioli. Then, as a small taster, they served us a little crostini with pesto. It was good, but I thought it was a little odd to offer bread on top of bread.

$14 Bone Marrow, Roasted Veal Bone Marrow, Grilled Levain, Parsley Caper Salad:
Two halves of a bone were plated on a cutting bread. The server briefly instructed us to scoop some marrow on the bread and top it off with the parsley salad and eat it together. The marrow was rich like butter, and a crispy crust almost formed on top. The parsley added a lot of bitter flavor that helped cut through the richness, and came together nicely on the toasty levain.
Between Mr. Joy & I, the bone marrow felt pretty heavy. Then we began to chat with the very friendly owner and he pointed out one of his patrons, who goes for a double order of bone marrow on the regular. Just then, a server brought out 2 orders of bone marrow over to a table for one. Wow, I'm impressed.

$17.50 Carbonara w/ Pancetta, Pecorino, Egg:
Carbonara is one of my favorite pastas. I was pleased to see that they make theirs without cream or butter, not that I have anything against either of those awesome ingredients. I have dabbled a bit in amateur Italian cooking and I've learned that you can get a super creamy sauce with an egg & enough parmesan and/or pecorino. This was definitely super rich and creamy with a ton of cubed pancetta and cracked black pepper. The fettuccine noodles were cooked al dente. I was starting to get full from all the rich, heavy food, but I finished it because I couldn't stop eating it.
We also ordered a seafood pasta with mussels, clams, calamari, and a couple of scallops in a tomato sauce. That was very delicious too. 

We were a little too full for dessert, but they brought us a complimentary panna cotta with sliced strawberries and blackberries, in some kind of strawberry sauce. Though gelatinous in form, the texture was super smooth and creamy, almost in a melt-in-your-mouth kind of way. The cold, sweet dessert was actually very refreshing after all the rich food.
author: Joy W.

description:
Italian food is one of my least favorite foods.. but I am giving this place a FIVE STARS. We had dinner reservations this evening to celebrate Mother's Day a little early. Quite difficult finding parking as it always is in this area. I was lucky to snag a spot two blocks away. The place itself is very tiny, but very cozy. I would recommend making a reservation since the seating is very limited.

We started off with bread and sun dried tomatoes in olive oil. The bread was soft, mm. We started off with the bruschetta as an appetizer. It had basil, olive oil, mozzarella and tomatoes. It was delish. Now, for entrees. I ordered the frutt' e' mar which was squid ink spaghetti, prawns, calamari, mussles, and manila clams in tomato sughetto. I felt adventurous tonight.. I don't think I would've tried something that had 'squid ink' in the description otherwise, but I don't regret it! It was AMAZING. Very unique how the noodles were black in color from the squid ink. The seafood was fantastic and full of flavor. The sauce wasn't heavy (which is usually the reason why I hate eating pasta) - it was flavorful and light. This is now my favorite pasta... but I never had a favorite to begin with, lol. 

Other things my family ordered were the pasta norcina, and some sort of seafood stew which was like the frutt' e' mar that I ordered, but without the noodles. The pasta norcina was pretty basic and the sauce was too heavy.

I would come here again and again for that squid ink pasta....I seriously loved it! My tummy was very satisfied :)
author: Sydney C.

description:
Walk into a fabulous aroma, lovely sparkling tables, low light and charming service. Came for the gluten-free gnocchi, 
 pleased to get two choices. Had the Verdi and was very satisfied. BF had the pork ragu with wide house made pasta, as a lasagna lover he was pleased. Panana Cotta for the finish of a lovely meal.
author: Kristian M.

description: The Best bruschetta I have ever had. Everything here was delicious, authentic and flavorful.. best Italian in the city! The ambiance is also perfect. Great lighting, big bar, pool table, and they accommodated us with a double stroller! Highly recommend it !!
author: Allison C.

description: This place was great! From their appetizers to their entrees and dessert...yum! It would be better if you have reservations, as it is a small place that was packed with people.  I also really loved their bread with olive oil and sun dried tomatoes
author: jeannette h.

description: Anybody who reviewed this place and said anything positive is simply not telling the truth. The food is just average, the place is just ok, the service is normal, and the menu is simply written to make it look like expensive place menu. The kids didn't eat their food and we had to get Mcdonalds for them.
author: OJ J.

description:
Enjoyed my birthday dinner here when my boyfriend treated me out.

We asked for complimentary bread because we read about it on Yelp, but they don't seem to give it to you unless you ask. Make sure you ask if you want it! The bread was soft, and I loved the sun-dried tomato dipping oil. Just wished that the bread was warm because it was cold when we got it :( Still good, but could've been great if they warmed up the bread.

I love bone marrow, so we ordered that as an appetizer. The bone marrow by itself was on the salty side a little more so than the usual, but eaten with the bread and parsley salad, it was great. Super rich and buttery like good bone marrow shouldbe.

At this point, our server randomly gave us two pieces of bruschetta on the house. Nothing spectacular, but hey it was free! An unexpected small treat.

For entrees, we ordered the smoked salmon tagliolini with black caviar (Tagliolini Salmone) and the squid ink spaghetti with seafood (Frutti Mar). I LOVED the squid ink spaghetti. Great amount of seafood, PERFECTLY cooked al dente pasta, and the tomato sauce was so good that I started eating it by the spoonful by itself towards the end. 

The smoked salmon pasta was more subtle. The pasta sauce was a little bland by itself, unless you got a bite with the smoked salmon or caviar. It was good, but I ended up wishing that there was more smoked salmon (even though they didn't necessarily skimp), just to make every bite as good as the ones with the salmon.

We ordered the panna cotta for dessert, as per Yelper recommendation. They put a little candle in it for my birthday and also gave us two mini glasses of dessert wine to go with it--Another unexpected treat on the house. The panna cotta was creamy yet light, and it went well with the tartness of the berries. Didn't think it was as amazing as others made it to be, but still good.

Overall, the stars of our meal were the bone marrow and squid ink spaghetti with seafood, plus the great service with unexpected items on the house. Well-deserving of 4 stars.
author: Sara L.

description: This place was great ! The service was amazing. Felt super welcomed and got treated very nicely and respectfully. I would totally recommend this place to anyone that comes to Sf or anyone that's from the area!
author: Daisy G.

description: Went to this place out on a limb as a last minute plan and was blown away. I called ahead of time to try and make a reservation, and while they were booked up, a worker still squeezed in a quick, last minute reservation for us. It is a small, quaint place. All of the staff seems fresh out of Italy, and being an Italian by blood, I was incredibly impressed. We split the gnocchi and it was jaw dropping delicious. Incredibly rich, best gnocchi I have ever had. Still mind blown at how amazing it was! Unparalleled.
author: Maria M.

description: Delicious, amazing, wonderful find for anyone with celiac disease looking for gluten free pasta. I tried the gnocchi with sausage and found love. But really, excellent selection, great service.
author: B J.

description:
Update after the reply from the restaurant owner: I just had to now minus from 3 to 2 star because first of all since you know your place is small you shouldn't squeeze people in giving short dining experience if you care so much about customer service. You coordinate each reservations giving customers at lease 2hrs of dinning experience. 2hrs at lease gap between each RSVP. You should tell all your customers there is an 1 1/2 gap for dinning before the next group needs your table and you can not be late or you will loose your table than I would reserve it at a later time to insure my party serve to your restaurant rule. Oh by the way other restaurants with great customer service can accommodate customers with minimum of 2hrs dinning and yes I have been to restaurants that tell you a 2hrs dinning or lose of table but still was so good to still accommodate longer than 2hrs dinning and finding a table for those that are late. I'm honest and still recommend the restaurants to others that must be on time, 1 1/2hr dinning, no kids and small party of 4 or less since the place is small. 


Let's start with customer service. I did not appreciate the host telling me they have a large party waiting for our table at 9pm when our reservation was at 7:30pm. Minimum should be 2hrs especially for a party of 10 and 2 toddler overall large party. I know our party was late but we already started ordering which by the time food arrived my party arrived and ready to eat. Since it was almost 9p,  we rush to eat and order our dessert even though not everyone finish their main dish. Last we ask for the check at 9:15p is when the host came back and said we found another table for the 9pm party so we can stay. WTF, Now you tell us after we rush through eating and drinking because we are better people and considerate to considered their business even though it's wrong and rude on their part. I wanted to give them no stars which I can't, so I guess one star. I change it because the skinny waiter was so nice and friendly to us and the kids that I added an extra star. I hope they promote him and give him a raise. Last another  star was for the food. Food is ok but not the best compare to the restaurants at little Italy next to Chinatown. Now would I recommend this to others? Yes only if you don't have a large party no more than 4, no kids and must be on time since you only have an hour and half to order, eat and pay.
author: Christy V.

description: Ohhhh the pasta is amazing. So succulent and filled with creamy texture. I loved my visit here. The restaurant is beautiful and the staff are friendly. Definitely recommend!!
author: Jimmy G.

description:
I don't often make it out to Italian restaurants because I'm not a fan of pasta and meatballs, but my coworkers were craving Italian food, so I decided to give it a shot. We made a reservation for 5:30pm on Wednesday and arrived at 5:25pm to the restaurant doors closed. This was very unusual, as the Yelp opening time said 5:15pm. We stood by the door and the employees inside could see that we were just a bit confused, so one of the employees came to open the door and acted somewhat shocked that we were surprised that they hadn't been open. He started telling us that they generally open by 5:30pm, but we notified him that they should adjust their Yelp so customers don't get confused when they arrive earlier. Nevertheless, we were the first ones there and were given the choice to sit wherever we pleased. Once we were seated, we were given the menus and served cold water and fresh bread with olive oil and sun dried tomatoes. 

We proceeded to order two appetizers:

1. Bruschetta Ca' Pummarola -- Crispy bread with olive oil with some freshly diced tomatoes and basil, topped with fresh mozzarella cheese. This was definitely a favorite of ours because it was extremely fresh and had you wanting more.
2. Purpett' Della Mamma --Grilled meatballs in Eggplant-Tomato Caponata. This dish had great flavor and could definitely be ordered as a main course. There were a decent amount of meatballs, somewhere between 5-8. The veggies and sauce paired very well with the meatballs and the overall flavors were superb. 

Main Courses: 
2 of us ordered the La Vera Carbonara; which was hands down some of the best pasta that I've tried. It's really hard to impress me with a pasta dish, but I have to say, this dish did just that. It was really hard to believe that there was no butter or cream in this pasta, because it was VERY creamy and tasty. I'm not sure how it's prepared to taste this way, but it's definitely a must try.
My other friend had the Maccarun Ca Salsiccia, which was rigatoni pasta, with tomato cream sugo and Italian sausage with green peas. This pasta dish was overall tasty as well, but I wasn't as impressed as with the La Vera Carbonara, because I felt like there was too much of the tomato sauce, which I'm personally not a fan of. 

Once we finished with our dinner, our server was nice enough to bring us Panna Cotta on the house. The Panna Cotta was very light and served with fresh cut fruits, making it very refreshing after our dinner. This was definitely a nice gesture after the initial encounter with the restaurant being closed when we arrived. I have to say that I was quite impressed with the entire meal. It very much felt as if it were home-cooked and made with love. 

I'll be coming back to try some more of their food items. Hopefully next time they will have bone marrow and the Papparedelle Ragu!
author: Julia K.

description:
I've eaten a lot of food all over the world. This was by far one of the most complex and well built meals I have ever eaten! 

The staff was hustling, yet took all the time I needed to find just the right wine pairing for my gorgonzola & mushroom gnocchi. Which was a knock your socks off comfort food if I've EVER had one. Well done, Chef! 

The meal was too rich to finish all by myself... But damn if I didn't try! 

The Tiramisu, perfection! Delicately soaked ladyfingers, no goop. Delicate cream and lightness... I will be eating here as frequently as my wallet and waistline will allow!
author: Yolanda F.

description: Perfect place to eat a good pasta and drink a  glass of wine. Staff helped us very well, prices aren`t very attractive but it is worth it. Selections of food is amazing.
author: Emily T.

description:
Italian is my favorite cuisine and it shouldn't be a surprise that I have searched high and low for a restaurant that satisfies my appetite for great quality pasta and bruschetta. Bella Trattoria is found on the busy street of Geary Blvd in San Francisco, where there are a number of businesses ranging from restaurants, retail shops, and even car dealerships.

Bella Trattoria is a quaint space that has an ambiance for the PERFECT first date. It is usually packed during the weekends, so I would suggest making reservations before arriving here - depending on the day that you come, of course. My experiences here have always been positive. With or without a reservation, the host in the front of the restuarant immediately greets our party the minute we step into the restaurant. After being poured a nice glass of wine by our waiter, we are offered an appetizer "on the house" by the chef. While enjoying our free appetizer, I have the opportunity to look over the menu. The food menu is just as extensive as the wine list they offer at Bella. With the variety of pasta dishes, they offer a number of Italian dishes such as gnocchi, lasagnas, and carpaccio.

My favorite dish would be Tagliatelle Ragu made with Salmon and Caviar. With the pasta handmade in their kitchen, the craft and time put into the dish is noticeable as you take your first bite. A second favorite I would recommend on trying would be their gnocchi. Again, their gnocchi is also handmade in their very own kitchen, which brings out the great quality taste. The softness of the dough and the house made sauce complements the two ingredients remarkably. 

Though with the glass of wine, appetizer, and your main dish may be filling, please try to save room for some dessert! Bella Trattoria serves an arrangement of desserts that delectable and a perfect way to end your meal. My all-time favorite dessert from Bella Trattoria would be their Panna Cotta, which at our first visit to the restaurant, was given to us for free as compliments from the chef. 

Bella Trattoria is easily one of my favorite Italian restaurants in the Bay Area.
author: Victoria K.

description: Dined here for Mother's Day and the service was below average as the entrees did not come out for 2 hours and the waitress did not check on our table once. We had to flag her down to ask why the food was taking so long and she offered no solution or explanation as to why and just apologized. We weren't the only table waiting as there were other tables complaining as well. When the food finally came out, half of the entrees were cold and the food was subpar. Huge disappointment especially on a special day like Mother's Day. Will not be returning.
author: Jill P.

description: It just baffles me how this place has such high reviews. My best friend and I came here for a girls night out. We didn't have reservations but we were promptly seated as we got in. Service was amiable and ambiance was romantic with the lights dimly lit. We were presented with focaccia bread with olive oil. Best part of the dinner by far. Delicious and light. My best friend got the daily special, which was the lasagna, and I got the tagliolini salmone. I was fairly disappointed in my dish. Salmon was over cooked and the sauce did not blend well with the dish. I love pasta but this dish did not stand out for me at all. My friend did not seem too impressed either by the way she was eating her lasagna. For the price tag, I'd rather eat at mescalenza up the block on 2nd and Geary.
author: Ada H.

description:
Cute place, but cheap food with steep markup.  Ordered the pasta with vegetables and olive oil; it was heavy and cloying, noodles were chewy, and my stomach feels like I ate too much 2am takeout pizza by the slice.  Girlfriend didn't fare much better with the gnocchi.


Service was excellent!
author: Ryan O.

description: Amazing food and excellent service.  We've eaten in some 5 star italian restaurants that were nowhere near as good as this one.  From start to finish the food was beyond our expectations.  The portions were exactly correct and the presentation was good. We ordered the special which was a light pappardelle with light bolognese- it was beyond delicious.  I just can't begin to say what a great dining experience we had!
author: Maribeth L.

description: An amazing date night spot. The service is great. Atmosphere is a little dark and squishy, but the food makes up for any negatives. The risotto balls are amazing! We really enjoyed our night out at Bella!
author: Mrs. S.

description: Wonderful Italian restaurant. Service was great and food was tasty. For appetizers we ordered both the Eggplant Parmesan and the Burrata cheese. Both were delicious. I had the seafood squid ink spaghetti as an entree. It was light but filling, and topped with a generous amount of seafood. Our waitress suggested a good white and red wine for table. The tiramisu was one of the best I've had in awhile, topped with crunchy crumbles that gave the dessert a good texture. Someone from the kitchen came around twice during our meal. The first time they brought complimentary bruschetta and when we ordered dessert they brought everyone a complimentary glass of port. Everyone at my table loved the food, ambience, and service. Definitely will be returning soon.
author: Yvonne S.

description: This is my local pasta spot. You can tell their gnocchi is hand made and the flavors are always rich & decadent. It's very small and intimate, would definitely recommend for date night. Also, they have a very extensive wine collection which I think everyone can get behind.
author: Alyssa O.

description: I came for lunch, and I ordered Squid Ink Spaghetti. They charged me 29 dollars for it. The food was good, and the server was nice, but It's not worth the pasta price. The menu should be updated since it still showing the wrong price, which shows 21 dollars. Price range for this restaurant is not  $$, more closer to $$$.
author: Mina K.

description: Treated like royalty!! Amazing food & amazing service!!! 1000% would recommend! The Six Hour Pork Ragu was delicious
author: Savanna T.

description:
Make sure you lay down a reservation if you plan on eating here! I came in with my cousins and felt guilty when she asked us if we had a reservation and tried to squeeze us in when we said no.

Aside from that, this place was great! I thought it was really cool how there menu changes dependent on what they have and at the chef's discretion. The food was awesome by the way. We all felt that if we were at an Italian restaurant then we had to test their pasta dishes. All around we had a vegetarian, a seafood, and a gnocchi dish at our table, along with a bruschetta for an appetizer. I felt that the bruschetta could have used some sort of balsamic to help balance the olive oil used and keep the palate cleaned for the next dish. I also felt that the calamari in my seafood linguine dish was a little tough and lacking in flavor, although the mussels were wonderful and bursting with flavor. I think that the dish I had to tip my hat off too was the green gnocchi with mushrooms and parmesan flakes. My goodness! I have never had gnocchi like there's! They truly were like pillows; literally falling apart once you pushed them against the roof of your mouth. I'm quite picky of mushrooms as well and ended up being quite fond of them this time around, sliced to perfect thickness and hugging the pasta and providing a wonderful transition of consistency when you bite down.

Overall, Bella Trattoria is a small, quiet place perfect for a date or just to sit down and talk... and enjoy the food of course.
author: Ian B.

description: I really enjoy the small Italian cafe esque atmosphere of Bella Trattoria. They have some fine aged wine and great servers. The pasta options are all very good and the carbonara is on point. It is also convenient to a Scoot scooter station and parking close by. The entrees are also very worth it. I would consider this a quite authentic and value based Italian experience.
author: Han S.

description:
Came here on a Monday for a GNO. We arrived at 6pm to beat the dinner rush and very glad we did. By the time we left the restaurant was packed so do come early if you don't want to wait. 

We started with bruschetta and the burratta with arugula and toast. Both antipastis were soooo good. The bruschetta had toasted garlic bread and was so fresh. And need I say more about burratta? So good with anything! 

For my main dish, I got the La Vera Carbonara and it was divine. The culmination of pancetta and non cream pasta made me happy with every bite. 

Our server was also very attentive and helpful. I would highly recommend this place if you wanna check out an Italian place in the Richmond district.
author: Yvonne T.

description: Amazing special that night we went on a double date! Their house made lasagna was phenomenal as well as the other dishes we ordered there! Great service and just overall enjoyed my time there on my vacation
author: Keanu W.

description: What I love is the flavor this places creates without simply smothering things with cream and butter.  So great food.  They simply seem a little disorganized, forgot one of our orders so one person ate after the others were all done.
author: Boater B.

description: Fantastic neighborhood Italian joint. Our server Hailey was enthusiastic about our orders, had recommendations, and our food was fantastic. Found out later that the owner was running the door (also saw him pour wine, bring out plates, drinks, etc). Was comfortable and accommodating. Enjoyed ourselves thoroughly.
author: Alex S.

description: The best Italian food we have had in a long time! Seriously high quality ingredients and a talented chefs. Every element was so good. The flavoring of sauces, the choice of meats for salami misti, the beautiful pasta and the silky panna cotta. Definitely going to return to try more dishes. The prices are not cheap but it was so worth it.
author: Kate M.

description: It was a nice Friday when I went. The food was really good and the waitress was really nice. The experience was pretty awesome. Would definitely go again
author: Rukito M.

description:
Holy crap is this place rad. We semi happened upon it and I'm so glad we did. Get the gnocchi!! I don't know how I'll ever be able to order gnocchi again after having it here. It literally melts in your damn mouth. 

Also!! Their specialty for drinks is vermouth and prosecco. Sounds odd but good grief were they awesome! 

We started off with bruschetta and drinks. I had the gnocchi Verdi and I feel like this might be a specialty item and may not always be on the menu. If you're there and it is, you must try it. It really is that good! 

They also just opened up a bar right next door to the restaurant so we were able to wait there while our table was getting ready. 

We did have a reservation for 8:30 p.m. and had to wait about 20 minutes, but Morgan whipped us up some drinks and that made it all worth it! We dined, laughed, ate and drank. It was a spectacular end to a great day visiting this awesome city.
author: Meghan L.

description:
Pasta is amazing. We got the ragu and the truffle butter one. Tagliatelle had very delicate texture, pasta extremely fresh and made daily. Flavor from the truffle butter pasta was incredible.

Service 10/10 - waitress extremely helpful and friendly, quick service (seated Saturday night with no reservations), they let us stay significantly after closing time without complaint and were gonna serve us dessert even after closing

Ambiance 9/10 - lighting is very cute / low / the candles are nice. Great ambiance. Music was a little clubby when we came

Overall you should come here. This place is amazing and not too expensive considering food quality and SF.
author: Kevin C.

description: Haven't had such good Italian food since I went to Italy! Yummy food, good selection of wine and cozy, intimate ambiance. We ordered: Burrata, Smoked Salmon Crostini, Puttanesca, Tagliata Al Gorgonzola, Frutt 'E Mar, and Tiramisu
author: Ro N.

description: I had a beautiful experience here. Very nice staff they pay attention to detail here. Super chill enviroment. I Had a mushroom and pasta dish and it was thee best pasta iv had in a while. Also the desert was really good and fresh. If you like candels and a dim lighted place to eat at this is it... But its pricey, but worth it if you want a nice night out.
author: Ajncristal M.

description: Excellent Carbonara and Rigatoni dishes. Carbonara was creamy, rich and pancetta was tender and flavorful. Our waiter Marco was from Rome and had a great passion for food, was on top of his game and had excellent wine recommendations he let us taste. Perfect for a Sunday dinner, not expensive for SF. We will be coming back.
author: Aaron C.

description: Great dinner. I ordered the hearts of romaine salad. It was fresh, crunchy, and the dressing nice. The best dish was the Gnocchi Verdi, a spinach, rice flour gnocchi. It was tender and fresh, and melted in your mouth. The mushroom sauce was delicious. I have been eating at this restaurant since it opened and think it keeps getting better. The staff was very friendly and helpful, parking was fairly easy, the noise level not loud, and just a nice experience. We will return.
author: Adia L.

description: I can't say it enough- the food was so GOOD! We had the Brussels sprouts with pancetta- AMAZING! Our entrees were delicious. They had gluten free pasta that had a great flavor with carbonara dish. And the Panna cotta was life changing. So good!
author: Ana-Lisa T.

description: Wandered in here the first night I moved to San Francisco, and I have loved it ever since! The three ingredient carbonara is unreal and the gnocchi is the best I've ever had. They also have a great wine selection that pairs well with their pastas. Love the dark the ambiance and super friendly staff. Would highly recommend this place to anyone who loves Italian!
author: Patrick W.

description: Food was excellent, perfectly portioned. Staff was incredibly attentive and went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed our dinner. They even gave us little snacks like bruschetta & dessert on the house! If you're in the area, it's a must visit!
author: Rehan K.

description:
I had been to Bella Trattoria previously and it was amazing.  This time though- the service and food weren't great.

Our waiters kept changing and our appetizer took forever to arrive.  When we did get the arancini - it was a disappointing risotto.  I don't think the rice balls were served hot enough.

The Aglio E Olio Cu Verdure and red sauce pasta with pancetta where both just ok.  The e olio was not cohesive at all.  The red sauce in the other pasta was quite runny.  Maybe my friend and just ordered the wrong dishes.  

The staff kept changing all night.  And they were slow to follow up.  I felt like my dining there was a burden on them.  Oh well- another one bites the dust.
author: Laura R.

description: This place was so damn good. Very savory and tasty, I actually enjoyed eating the meal and didn't want it to end. David our server had the best customer service ever I'm still in shock
author: Rachel M.

description: This restaurant is the real deal. The waitress let me try multiple wines (without my asking!) to see which one I liked. The antipasto platter was fantastic. The housemade rice gnocchi was to die for. The squid ink pasta was not too salty. We were given complimentary bruschetta, which was perfect, and complimentary panna cotta, which was light and not too sweet. The service here was friendly and attentive. This was my favorite restaurant during our week in San Francisco.
author: Felicia C.

description:
I've lived in the neighborhood for years and have passed by this place loads of times and never went in (maybe because it was on Geary and is near the KFC/Taco Bell?). At the same time, I've not found really good Italian food in SF (sorry North Beach!).
I finally decided to look up reviews of Bella Trattoria on Yelp! and Zagat and was sold.
Bella did not disappoint!
The interior ambiance is nice, the service was great and the food was delicious. I never felt rushed by the staff and has a leisurely 2 hour dinner. Our server was busy (Tues night and it was packed) and always had time to answer questions or talk about the food, preparation, and menu...
Housemade gnocchi were amazing. The minestrone flavorful and satisfying. Such a memorable meal. 
I'll be back!
author: Andrew A.

description: I was just out here in San Francisco and I found Bella. I think their food is delicious the pasta is out of this world and the ambience of the restaurant is also pretty amazing. I'm definitely coming back here next time I visit the day I had a great time with family and their wine selection was fantastic
author: John B.

description: Pasta Norcina was delicious... we also had Brussels sprouts and those were really good too
author: Miriam G.

description:
We walked in on Sunday night, not too cloudy. The servers are super friendly and nice. Explained alot on the meun for us. 

Their bread and pepper oil was sooo yummy to started with. 
We ordered tuna capaccio, sooo yummy. Also tasted like beef and even healther.
Carbonara was super yummy, specially their home make pasta......yummmmm. I will totally order it again.
King Prawn one.was.Good too, my friend ordered it without spice, so i dont know if that changed the taste or not. 

There are many other dishes i want to try so i will totally come back.
author: Mo L.

description: I really enjoyed their food! I had a pasta that had sausage in it and let me tell you, it was really rich! They had a really good wine selection as well and good service. The only problem I had was that we had to speak loud due to the music playing but other than that it was really good overall!
author: Jose C.

description:
Had an awesome lunchtime experience here at the right side of Bella Trattoria (apparently recently opened) with a different, less swanky/more modern vibe than the smaller left side that opens for dinner. There was one front of house worker who seemed to be juggling hosting, bartending and waitressing/food running and somehow still managed to make us feel like the most iimportant guests in the room :D 

La Vera Carbonara: Creamy goodness! I thought it was just the right amount of thickness/saltiness and still can't believe it was only made with 3 ingredients ( Pancetta, Pecorino, Egg). Love the pancetta :q

Tagliolini Salmone: Smoked salmon pasta topped with caviar and marscapone? Say no more fam.

There's a billiards table that looks like it takes change but we were able to play a game free of charge.

In summary, this is a good casual lunchtime spot / nice night time date spot with delicious italian fare. Extra puntos for the tiramisu on the house which was BOMB DOT COM.
author: Michelle N.

description: Absolutely love this place.  The restaurant offers a nice intimate candle-lit vibe.  Very romantic and relaxing.  The chef will come out sometimes and talk to you about the menu.  Super nice guy.  And, the food of course is amazing!! I always get the squid ink pasta - Arrabiata or something.  The carbonara is to die for!!! Also highly recommend.  Oh, and the panna cotta is a MUST!!
author: Julia W.

description: I must have passed by this building a hundred times, yet have never noticed its existence due to its nondescript exterior. Better late than never. Bella Trattoria is a wonderful family-run Italian restaurant offering flavorful dishes at very reasonable prices and excellent service. The interior is small and dark, offering a very romantic setting.
author: Wayne Y.

description: Best gluten free italian options I've ever seen and had. Flavors are out of this world! Shan't be disappointed.
author: Bee V.

description:
The best restaurant experience I've had in a long time. I took my boyfriend out for a nice romantic dinner here and now we vow to come back. When we arrived we were promptly greeted by a friendly hostess and seated right away. While my boyfriend and I were looking over the menu one of the staff members comes out the kitchen with a plate of gnocchi and gives it to us just because! Needless to say that gnocchi was heavenly. I orders the Tagliolini Salmone and my boyfriend got the hanger steak. This food is no joke. The pasta had the perfect bite to it and the flavors were neither over powering nor bland - just right. My boyfriend loved his steak so much he ate slowly to make it last haha. At the end of our meal a server gave us a free panna cotta! I mean first the gnocchi and now this?! Could you ask for a better experience?! 

FOOD: A+++++
SERVICE: A+++++


P.s. I'm ordering the gnocchi next time.
author: Siren L.

description: I went in for late evening dinner service and had the most wonderful experience. Both the food and the service were absolutely outstanding! The gnocchi was absolutely heavenly and melted in my mouth. Our server Hayelei was so attentive and kind. She was very knowledgeable and made excellent food and wine recommendations. She created such an awesome experience for us from the starting wine tastes to a fantastic dessert liquor finish. She even surprised us with some decadent panna cotta! We felt very spoiled and beyond taken care of. On a personal level, very humorous considering I have spent over 8 years in the SoCal service industry and the morning of our visit I was lamenting that I was overall unimpressed with the service I had received in the Bay Area. So happy to bite my tongue on this one! Thank you for making us feel so special Hayelei! We will definitely be back and spread word of this bay area gem.
author: Holly H.

description: Loved the restaurant.  Marcello was the host to seat guests.  Food was good and not too heavy or salty.  Old neighborhood restaurant.
author: Ro A.

description:
I love eggplant--- and when I see it on a menu I'll always order it.  Bella Trattoria serves up a beautiful eggplant parmigiana.  They serve this vegetable unpeeled and covered in a simple but flavorful sauce.  The mozzarella used is quality grade too.  I prefer unpeeled eggplant because there is more flavor and it offers another texture to get through.

Service was just terrific--I felt like family.  What a nice group of people that help to run this restaurant.  What a relief to not have to experience the sometimes jaded and dismissive service that SF has become used to.  I can't wait to come back and practice my Italian again.

Another dish that I'll always order ( if I see it on a menu) is any pasta dish served with a pork ragu.

Their homemade papperdelle covered in pork ragu made me very happy.  Again, the flavors were spot on.

We finished up with two flavors of gelato--pistachio and vanilla.  (pistachio is yet again another go to dish for me).

Peroni was our beer of choice.  The wine list is extensive.

Eggplant parmigiana!
Papperdelle with pork ragu!
Pistachio gelato!

Sono morto e andato in paradiso!
author: Thomas D.

description:
Friends, you don't really need them.  But when you want to check out a restaurant and your friend flakes on you but you don't want to go solo because that would mean ordering very few dishes, you call another friend.  Friends, they're good for something.

Topic of conversation: Boys.  When you're in a good mood and you're presented with good food, you can't help but turn that RBF into a permanent smile.

Complementary Bread and dip - Sooooo good!  I asked the server if it was available to purchase but she said no, its made in house.  The dip is basically--wait, I can't tell you.   If you want to know, plan a visit here!

Squid Ink Pasta w/ clams and mussels -   The mussels were good.  This was my first time having squid ink pasta so I really don't have anything to compare it to.  I want to say it was a bit bland?  

Gnocchi Verdi - I don't really care for gnocchi but I think if the texture was right, it could've been a good dish.  The gnocchi was a bit over cooked

Complementary Panna Cotta - Not a fan of Panna Cotta but this was pretty good

There are a few other dishes I would like to try.  

Service deserves 5 stars on it's own.
author: Linda N.

description: So I feel like something has changed here.  My husband and I loved this spot.  We had gone a few times a while back and we felt like we found a hidden gem.  The service was great, The servers had made great wine suggestions, food suggestions and just seemed to make a real solid effort to make sure you had a great meal.  The food was amazing.    We just went this past weekend and our experience was completely different. Our server seemed to care less.  The music was kind of loud and club like, which is fine, but just not the romantic date spot we remembered and the food was not really that good.  Not sure what happened to this place but I am kind of sad.
author: Kimberly W.

description:
Parking: may need to do a few circles around the block
Line: need to make reservations, and even when you arrive expect to wait 15 minutes to be seated
Service: nice people, can be a little slow

Came here to celebrate gf birthday.  Made reservations easily online using open table.  The place is small, almost no waiting room area, and dim lighting with candles.  

Food service was a bit slow.  You initially get served breed and tomato sauce which was surprisingly delicious.  We had salmon bruschetta for appetizers, gnocchi and squid noodles for meals.  All the food tasted great.  The gnocchi will melt in your mouth.

At the end, they brought the flan with a candle for my gf and sang her happy birthday.  It was very sweet.

Definitely an intimate little spot for dinner date or small group of friends.

Recommend it.
author: Simon L.

description: Loved this place! First of all, I'm from Jersey, so I know good Italian :) And this place is amazing! The food was fantastic, the atmosphere was cozy and lovely, and the server was a delight. Definitely coming back!
author: Ania B.

description:
Came in without reservations and got sat immediately. The restaurant filled up quickly, but the staff was still very attentive and helpful.

Always get their special, but since the menu is always changing, you might find your favorite dish amongst them.

Great environment and highly recommended for an intimate night out.
author: Matthew C.

description: We live a few blocks from this place and it's pretty nondescript from the outside, so we never thought much about it.  We were craving Italian and decided to try Bella out thanks to good Yelp reviews.  The reviews were right on the mark.  We had 2 appetizers--the eggplant parmigiana (deliciously tender, just the right amount of sauce and cheese) and fritto misto (ok, but on the greasy side so prob won't order again).  Many tables around us ordered the bruschetta, so we'll try that next time.  For main courses, we enjoyed pillow-like gnocchi verdi and very tasty clam pasta.  For dessert, we liked the panna cotta--nice and creamy with super delicious blackberries.  The only thing that could be improved was the complementary bread, which was very plain and uninspiring.  Otherwise, the ambience is great (lively, warm and inviting) and the service is great--friendly, attentive (our water glasses were constantly refilled), and helpful.  We'll be back.
author: Amy P.

description: Fantastic atmosphere! Friendly Service! And Quick Meal Preparation!  I went to Bella Trattoria for the first time recently craving Italian ( A crave I am seldom to have).  I was pleasantly surprised by the quick seating for the two of us without a prior reservation. Our Burrata and "Warm Spinach Salad"  were delicious.  I highly recommend the "shrimp fettuccine with red sauce". Anyways great restaurant and hopefully will return soon.
author: Hamid S.

description: At the sudden impulse for carbohydrates, we found ourselves at this cute, intimate restaurant, hungry for pasta and wine. I didn't expect to be blown away by the exceptional service of the staff and the rich flavors infused in each dish! We ordered the Tagliolini Salmone and the Gnocchi Verdi, both had unique tastes and paired nicely with wine. The gnocchi was a spinach, house-made pasta dish with shiitake mushrooms, and the salmon was smoked to utter perfection, both in a creamy white bechamel sauce. They were simple dishes with a lotta zing! The entire staff was kind, and the chef even provided us with complimentary bruschetta. There is a hole in my heart that longs for Italian food on par with this experience.
author: Vicky N.

description: Best Italian in the Bay Area.  It's been difficult finding authentic Italian but this place has been a gem.  The Cotoletta is awesome and every single dish has a different flavor.  Reminds me of Italy so much!
author: A J.

description: The food was great but the service wasn't what u expected. Never came to take our order until I waved them down. Yet still took about another 10 minutes to order. Waitress didn't seem to happy to take care of us. We also asked for recommendations and just completely ignored the question. Besides that I guess the ambiance and food was good...
author: Peter V.

description:
I had seen the multi-star ratings and thought we'd give this restaurant a try. We had high expectations, but the four of us were completely disappointed at the low quality of food and service. Our server was frantic to get us to order. No relaxing pre-dinner wine and menu-reading here! Instead the server rattled off the specials so quickly and indifferently, that we couldn't understand what they were. When our food arrived, it was as disappointing as the customer service. The bread was cold and tasteless, spinach salad was tasteless, the sauce on my pasta tasted like it came out of a can, I had to ASK FOR grated cheese which USUALLY accompanies pasta dishes, or at least is offered. Some guy walks around wearing a hat asking if 'verything is alright'...and the four of us just laughed. We didn't know where to begin to answer him. 
   We're 3rd generation SF natives and are accustomed  to SF's great range of restaurants with various cuisines and prices. This restaurant is definitely not one of those restaurants, and we won't be returning. Way over-priced for the low-quality, mundane food. inferior customer service and lack of hospitality.
author: Carolyn M.

description:
Hanger steak. Get it. It's so good.

Service here is very, very good. The food is great.
author: irene f.

description: Excellent! I've been here twice with my boyfriend and it's been great both times. Menu has a good selection of gluten free options, and the waiter was attentive to the allergy. Very reasonably priced, spectacular wine options, cozy romantic atmosphere, and of course amazing Italian food. My boyfriend lived in Rome for a year and a half and says this is just as good.
author: Lindsey G.

description:
Overall, a very good experience! It is an unassuming building to be sure... a yellow building on the corner. No idea what kind of goodness awaits as you enter... a very cumbersome entrance with the restaurant seating POS directly in front of the door.

My wife and I shared a burrata appetizer which consisted of burrata, arugula, crostini and topped with a balsamic vinaigrette.

I had the daily special, a very nice pork a sambuco,  served with fettuccine pasta (handmade daily) and a really rich sauce. A winner for sure. The pork was not too much to chew and was perfectly sized. 

My wife had the albacore tuna dish with what appeared to be spaghetti noodles, again, handmade.She ate every bite which is uncharacteristic for her. Awesome stuff. 

Dessert was a very uncommon zabaione. It had a nice cognac flavor to the custard and had deliciously portioned strawberries and blackberries on the bottom. Very very good.

The only reason this won't get 5 stars is simple. I don't do it often but that night I ordered a Diet Coke. Sometimes I just crave the fizz. I know it's heretical to do so at a nice restaurant... but there it is, my Achilles heel. My wife noticed it was a polar bear Coke can. So she looked at the expiration date. Woops! It had expired in February of 2017.

The host was kind enough to remove it from the tab. 

I assume it's because they don't have as many weird people as me. No harm, no foul...So far anyway. 

Thanks for reading and as always, have fun!
author: Anthony H.

description:
Our party of 5 had reservations and ate here for the first time after seeing so many raving reviews. We were a bit disappointed overall at the price we had to pay for what we got. Service was definitely lacking. Took at least a half hour to order our entrees. I had to ask for refills on water, had to ask for to go boxes, waitress forgot our dessert (Although she eventually remembered it when we asked for the check and comp'd it). Overall I had to constantly ask for things. Restaurant was busy and felt like there was a shortage on waiters that night. 

Some items we ordered:

Alligator carpaccio - 3/5. It was ok. Nothing special. Don't think I would order it again. Meat was a bit tough than what we had before at other restaurants. 

Tarjarin Al Burro - 3/5. It was ok. Barely tasted any truffle in the sauce if any. 

Papparelle Ragu - 2.5/5. Meat tasted a bit dry, not enough sauce, noodles tasted over cooked? Not sure if it's supposed to taste like this but I've had this at other restaurants where the noodles tasted much fresher (softer) and meat was more tender. 

Aglio E Olio Con Verdure - 4/5. Tasty

Orecchiette Coi Friarielli - 5/5. Tasty
author: Anthony H.

description:
I was wary of eating Italian because those restaurants tend to have heavy food. Stuff that's drowned in sauce and cheese. I was proven wrong here. All of the pasta dishes we ordered were really good, and none were drowned in sauce or over cheesed. I particularly liked the seafood pasta, which was unexpected. The house panna cotta was very tasty, light and fruity. The chocolate gelato, while bitter, did hit the spot.

Parking is an issue, although that's not surprising in SF. It's very small, very intimate space.
author: Henry T.

description: This is one of the best Italian restaurant I have ever been to. Their pasta is extremely fresh and unlike anything I have ever had before. I would definitely recommend their ragu (it's a special) and La Vera Carbonara.
author: Reilly C.

description: t was our first full day in San Francisco, and we decided to cap off our great day at Golden Gate Bridge at a local restaurant. Fate steered us to Bella. Server Hayelei treated us like we we're faithful regulars. We enjoyed the Amatriciana and Puttanesca accompanied by a bottle of their house red. We struck up a conversation fascinating with a young couple seated next to us, and proceeded to exchange experiences as travelers.
author: Ray C.

description: The food was amazing, the service was dissapointing. Our server deny us the cocktail menu and told us he didn't have one even though another server gave it to the table next to us. Later when we asked again he told us he didn't want to give it to us because he was really busy and didn't want to go to the other side to get our drinks if we decide to order. We were celebrating a late valentines and drove all the way from Napa just to go to this restaurant, but unfortunately it wasn't worth it, just because of the horrible service we got. He didn't even checked if we were doing ok or if we wanted to order anything else. Literally we just order and he dropped the food and the check and never saw him again for anything else. Probably not going there again is not worth the trouble. The 3 stars are for the food because it is amazing, I just wish they care for the customers as much as they do for the food.
author: Nena A.

description: Found this place on Yelp after visiting the Golden Gate bridge.  We couldnt get a seat at the restaurant but were seated at the next door bar.  We had Zoe serve us and she was great.  Started with a bottle of wine and some calamari and burrata appetizers.  Finally we got the ragu pasta.  We loved how light the pasta was.  It was a great meal and can't wait to go back the next time we visit
author: Dave l.

description:
Bella Trattoria was amazing - one of the best Italian meals we've had in the city at a good price. The staff are lovely and attentive and the food was all around delicious, from the salad and brussel sprouts to the generous pasta. We had the house wine so we could splurge on the food and it was pretty stellar also. 

They got my message that it was my boyfriend's birthday and surprised him with a free dessert and candle!

We will definitely come back! :)

Sabri
author: Sabrina B.

description: The food was absolutely amazing, the atmosphere excellent, and the service was so awesome! This place has been consistently high quality, both in service and in cooking!
author: Kalani S.

description: My fiancé took me to this restaurant for dinner we were both craving pasta after a walk in the city. As we were on our way to the restaurant I called made reservations and we arrived 10 min before our reservation but they sat us right away it was so nice romantic candle light dinner, we had the meatballs as appetizer they were delicious and the bread with dried tomatoes that they give for appetizer were really good the pasta we both had were delicious
author: Carina T.

description:
What a gem! 

My extended family is from southern Italy and this place is legit. Come and eat all the pasta and enjoy Italian wines with perfect service. 

We called Friday for a Saturday reservation for 8 people and they were very accommodating. Even with a spaghetti-only-three-year-old in tow. 

Highly recommend!
author: Alison C.

description:
I've been on an Italian kick lately and my friends suggested I try Bella. They insisted I get the gnocchi. 

Okay, one plate of the green gnocchi with mushrooms in cream sauce, please! The gnocchi hands down was the best I've had. I am pretty sure there was shaved black truffle on top too. Flavor wise, the dish was rich, mushroom flavored, and perfect balance of cream. My friend ordered the gnocchi as well, but in a red sauce with sausage. I tried some of his and preferred the red to the green, but nonetheless, both were a worthy choice!  My only gripe is that the gnocchi could stand to be cooked a little bit less. They were a little too soft for me. 

The ambience is dim and relaxed. It's a great spot for a date night. The service is friendly and attentive. Bella is definitely a restaurant I can see myself frequenting more often.
author: Josh S.

description:
Good atmosphere with Brazilian bossa nova playing.

Excellent service since we were the only ones in the restaurant.

The complimentary bread and tomato aioli are worth paying for, in my opinion. We went through 3 baskets easily.

Sorrentina (potato gnocchi with tomato-based meat sauce) was delicious, with the mozzarella, suga, and tender gnocchi creating a delight for the tastebuds.

A+, would come again.
author: Ananya M.

description: Amazing service. They were fast and knowledgeable about the food. The gnocchi was the best I've ever had. The atmosphere was perfect for date night. Easily worth the price and plenty more
author: Joseph G.

description: The level of disappointment with this restaurant runs very deep. The problems started rolling in the moment we walked through the door. Were we treated w a smile? A scowl would have been more welcoming.  Were the wait staff providing good service? Well not sure I would call what transpired service. We were so happy to be celebrating the beginning of our new college life in NorCal but never expected to be dismissed at every turn. Let's start w the bread which they told us over the course of 30 min was in the oven. At a minimum we expected it to be warm. Nope, ours was pulled out of the .99 store bag and bypassed the oven entirely. Really? My friend and I are vegetarian so we ordered the eggplant veggie burgers. By this point all of us were starving. When our food came out oh I don't know like 45 min later, someone had sliced up some eggplant and each of the listed ingredients and slapped them on the cold .99 store dinner rolls and called that lunch. Our other friend got what looked like the lasagna from the sample menu and was charged $20. And not only were we dismissed and overlooked the entire time, we couldn't get anyone's attention if we'd stood on the table. Oh and is it a San Francisco thing to have your waitress walk out while you're mid-wait wo saying a word other than SEE YA! She was just miserable. I will say that they did take off the 2 farm to table burgers that missed the table part entirely. I'm hoping that we weren't dismissed for being young or diverse. Bc that doesn't feel right. So I'll give them the benefit of the doubt. This brought them up from zero to 1-Star. I'm very disappointed in your lack of customer service and total disregard for our desire to have chosen you for a special celebratory experience. Shame on you. Not ok on any level. And I'll leave it at that. I don't like writing negative reviews but everything about this experience was unacceptable.
author: Clara L.

description:
Went here last night, made reservations just in case. I have to say this is one of my favorite Italian places in the city. We had their polenta and antipasto Della Casa. The cheese and vegetables on the antipasto were perfectly fit. The hubby ate the cold cuts they were pretty decent. 

For our main course we had the spinach gnocchi. I have to say this is the first place where the gnocchi is a perfect size and it's light. That never happens! The mushroom sauce was lightly drizzled though the gnocchi. 

Parking can a little rough in the Clement/Geary area, but easily this is a little gem to keep coming back to. Prices are reasonable and the service is great.
author: Carolina S.

description: food is great! portions are relatively small. the service was quite slow probably due to a busy friday night but our server gave us complimentary bruschetta and panna cotta for dessert! very thoughtful.
author: Julia K.

description:
I've paid a visit to Bella Trattoria a couple of times with my most recent time being the day after Valentine's Day. Fortunately, the restaurant had available tables the day of and I conveniently made reservations via Open Table. 

What better way to keep a HANGRY (a term used to describe one who is angry and hungry) customer happy by giving complimentary appetizers. These "on the house" antipasto vary each time! On my first visit, my BF and I received bruschetta and on my most recent visit, they were croquettes. Both of which were delicious and satisfied the hunger pains. 

Now on to the main dishes--Gnocchi, Squid Ink Pasta, and Cioppino. The star of the show are the home made noodles. OH YES! Bella Trattoria offers some tasty carb strings. L O V E!

Now on to the good stuff-- Customer Service. In general, each time i dine in at restaurants this could be a "make it or break it" type of deal. You can see where I am going with this. It's story time! My party of 4 each ordered a pasta dish, but only 3 were served to us. As we patiently waited and thought the order just took longer than expected we didn't flag down our server until 15 minutes later. At that point, it just seemed like they forgot to place our order or our order was given away to another table. With that being said, I talked to the server and inquired about the last pasta dish. He checked the kitchen and investigated. Within one minute, he came back with the pasta dish and was SOOO apologetic. There was miscommunication in the kitchen with the server and the chef. The dish was made, but it was just sitting on the counter top ready to be picked up.

Last but not least, dessert. To our surprise, the server presented us a complimentary dessert to compensate for the delay of our order. It was such a sweet gesture (pun intended) and showed extraordinary service! The Panna Cotta was deliciously amazing and I highly recommend ordering this! It is a creamy pudding with strawberries and blackberries! Super light and not too sweet which makes this a great dessert to end a fantastic meal at Bella Trattoria!
author: Briana H.

description: My boyfriend and I were really craving pasta tonight and saw that this place had the highest ratings for Italian food in our area so we decided to check it out. We walked into the restaurant to an empty hostess stand and waited awkwardly by the door for a few minutes before the busboy noticed us and seated us in the corner by the door after asking if we had a reservation (the restaurant was half empty it really didn't seem too hard to seat us quickly). We sit down and take in the ambiance, cute place and cool lighting, but got bored after almost 10 minutes of sitting there secluded from the rest of the people in the restaurant without menu's in front of us to browse at. I still couldn't get the attention of a waiter so the busboy, again, brought us menu's and we sat there for another 10 minutes before deciding to walk out and go down the street to the neighboring Italian restaurant Mescolanza and were immediately greeted and treated with the polar opposite level of service.
author: Melanie M.

description: The food was great, almost more importantly the service may have been the best I have ever had. Hayelei (probably spelled wrong) killed it. She's awesome. I hope she is treated well by the owners & management.
author: Dan H.

description: Visited this place for the first time a few months ago for celebration dinner with a girlfriend. Easy to make reservations online and there was amble parking nearby. The room is a little dim which makes a good atmosphere for taking your dates! I remember their great and attentive service. I ordered their squid in pasta and it was mouth watering! Will return the next time I'm in town to try other dishes!
author: Kerry K.

description: Way above my expectations. They need to get a better PR firm because the food is so good but no one outside of the Richmond knows they exist.
author: Mae B.

description: One star for the ambiance, one star for how nice the waiters are. The other three starts are for food, which is the main part of a restaurant. The food took ages to come out, and it wasn't as good as expected. The majority of my party ended up not liking the food and with stomach issues at the end. This one probably just one of those exception. Everyone else seems to have had a great time.
author: Paulo R.

description: Delicious food, amazing service. Literally felt like I was back in Italy. Next time I'm in San Francisco, I will be coming back. Thank you so much.
author: Danielle A.

description: Highly recommend! I made a reservation for 6 which they had no problem accommodating. We had the house antipasto and bruschetta to start. Then all 6 of us ordered different things, and each raved about all of them. The bread was soft, the gnocchi was like little pillows and the shrimp fettuccini was so flavorful. We even stuck around for some dessert (I had the gelato and biscotti). The service was excellent, the food was delicious, and we will be back again.
author: Erin S.

description:
Bella has been in the inner richmond forever...and they consistently serve very good Italian food.

The dining atmosphere is really comfy, dark, and romantic. Service is efficient and friendly.

The food is always good. The gnocchi is light fluffy pillows of pasta from heaven. Their pasta dishes were all spot on. The Trout was delish as was the pork chop. Their homemade bread with the sun-dried tomato dipping sauce was also additively awesome.

The pan a cotta  dessert, with berries, was also delicious. Wine list is small but varied and prices were decent.

If you want a nice romantic dinner in the inner Richmond this is the spot!
author: David G.

description:
Two words. Gnocchi verde. Some of the best gnocchi I've ever had, including Italy. Covered in creamy flavorful bechamel sauce, it practically melts in your mouth. Food here is excellent. They give you free bread with a sun dried tomato olive oil! I really enjoyed my dish but also had food envy with all the tables next to me. I'm not sure if it's the norm, but the restaurant smelled like roasted garlic. Sadly, they wouldn't sell me any.

Don't judge a book by it's cover. The outside is very misleading and probably the reason why I never came here earlier. It seems like it may be diner-like but once you step inside the ambiance is great. Service was really good as well.
author: Tanya Y.

description: Wasn't greeted when I walked in which wasn't not a big deal.  I got take out.  They didn't have any place setting for to go food, Weird. I end up getting spicy pork pasta.  Pasta wasn't spicy at all. Didn't have meat in the sauce either,  weird. Also the pasta extra greasy and bland. I ended up getting sick from how greasy it was.
author: Precious B.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night with a group of 5 and thoroughly enjoyed it. We arrived about half an hour early for our reservation, so they led us to the bar and helped us choose a bottle of wine to share while we waited. As soon as we sat down, I knew it would be good, because the staff are actually Italian. And Italians don't mess around when it comes to their cuisine.

When we got to our table, they brought out some yummy house-made bread (great texture, would have been even better if it had been warm, but still very good) with a SERIOUSLY DELICIOUS dip of oil with chopped sun-dried tomatoes. Multiple people in our group (myself included) remarked that we're usually not huge fans of sun-dried tomatoes, but this dip was the bomb. We got like 3 or 4 plates of it, and could have happily eaten more! Honestly, if that was all I had eaten, I still would have given this place 5 stars. I will dream about that oil.

The whole menu looked so delicious that we had a really tough time deciding what to order. We ended up sharing some appetizers:

1) BURRATA: I pretty much always order this when I see it on a menu, and theirs was particularly creamy and delicious.

2) BONE MARROW: two people in our group are huge bone marrow fans who usually get judged for their habits of cracking open bones like cavemen to suck out the delicious interior, so they felt vindicated to see it on such a classy menu, and obviously we ordered it. They gave us a pretty generous portion, served in the bone with some crostini and a parsley salad on the side. It was great!

3) POLENTA: Not much to say here, other than it was very yummy!

We each ordered our own main dishes, but I tried some of all of them, including:

 1) SORRENTINA GNOCCI: This is what I ordered. It was wonderful. I love gnocchi, and I keep hearing that this place has some of the best gnocchi in the city, so I had to try it, and I gotta say, I'd believe that superlative! It melted in my mouth. 

2) RAGU SPECIAL: I can't remember the name of the pasta, but I think it was either tagliatelle or pappardelle. The sauce wasn't as good as I had hoped (a bit on the salty side) but overall pretty good.

3) FRUTT' 'E MAR: Very good! I only tried the pasta itself and the calamari in the bites I took (so I can't judge the shrimp or mussels), but both were great. You could definitely taste a hint of squid in the squid-ink pasta. The sauce was also very good.

Next time I want to get the gnocchi verdi!

For dessert we shared the following:

1) VANILLA AFFOGATO: So. Good. If you like coffee ice cream, get this. It's like what coffee ice cream dreams of being.

2) PANNA COTTA: I loved the balsamic glaze. It added just a touch of tartness to the smooth and creamy dish.

3) SPUMONI: Wonderful. Ice cream at its classiest.

Not that many places do house-made pasta around here, and certainly not with the variety of this menu. If you're craving pasta in the city, this is a great spot!
author: Liz F.

description:
Unbelivable, best Italian food ever!
We began with bruschetta & warm spinach salad, and chose for entrees:  papardelle with a beef & pork ragu, ameraticiano (sp?), gnocchi verde with gorgonzola cream sauce, and a side of special meatballs. We chose a Barbera, a bright tangy red wine that was just delicious. The wait staff were responsive and upon request furnished interesting background information on the wine and good suggestions. My traditional complaint about Bella is that the chairs are not very comfortable, but the chairs have been replaced with passably comfortable chairs, and the velvet curtain around the doorway keeps out most of the cool night air (but could be doubled for more insulation). Last night we were extra lucky -- when we arrived at 9 pm the cozy booth was available in the front.
Fabulous. You won't be disappointed with this restaurant. The food is superior to that which is available at a much higher price in the union Square area. 
Hats off to the chef!
author: Amy D.

description:
This place... what a disappointment. Don't think I'll ever step foot into this place again. 

The first time... we ordered for take out. And it took almost two hours to get our food... really??! You guys weren't even that busy... the only reason you get two stars from me is because your squid ink pasta was good.

Second time.. hubby and I dined in because we wanted to give them a second chance. Boy was it a shitty idea to choose this place to celebrate our anniversary. The service was absolutely horrible. Our waiter never came to check on us, we never got any refills, and we had to ask another waiter for our check after waiting over half an hour. All this bs for some mediocre italian food? The gnocchi was cold and way overcooked... 


No, thanks. There's so many waaaaaay better places around! Never again.
author: Ann T.

description: Friendly staff, amazing food, still thinking about all the fresh pasta dishes that we enjoyed.  The lasagna and gnocchi were outstanding!  Save room for the tiramisu.  Our two-year old kiddo loved it!
author: Jules C.

description:
I am obsessed with Bella, some of the best pasta in the city FOR SURE. And by FAR the best gnocchi (verdi is my gnocchi here of choice). Super fairly priced, the owner is always here and seating people and chatting- occasionally bringing a free apertif or bruschetta. Came here during the playoffs and they have a TV so you won't miss your Bay Area sports (no sound which keeps the ambiance nice).

Definitely come check out Bella- it's a true hidden gem in the city!
author: Sarah A.

description: Tasty and yummy!! Order the gnocchi verdi,  it's made fresh daily and it just melts in your mouth.  Ask for daily specials... Osso Bossa is full of flavor and it runs out fast!!  Salami appetizer is plenty for 3 people. They even let you tasted different wines before you order the bottle! Who does that?Bella Trattoria does!! Nice decor & ambiance, dimmed lighting and great place to enjoy good food w/good company!!
author: Koa M.

description:
We went to Bella trattoria on Friday around 6pm (if you go there early you can get a seat without reservation). We had burrata and pasta (arrabiata or something). The pasta we had was so moist and chewy which is difficult to achieve with dried pasta. This is one of the places in SF that serves an amazing aldente pasta. 
The interior is good with a huge wall with a drawing of Venice.  
Since we had some left over tiramisu at home and we were planning to eat it as desert so we didn't order desert. The best part was that the owner? gave us a small plate of panna cotta (I believe) saying "it's Friday! You should get some desert!"
I really appreciated the service and had an amazing experience. If I want a really good pasta I will come back.
author: Shunsuke T.

description: Not sure about every menu item, but the maccarun ca salsiccia (one of the least expensive entrees on the menu) is special. great flavor, texture and portion size. I crave this dish on the reg. There's a really good mushroom and truffle gnocchi as well. Definitely will return
author: Jeff M.

description: Food is fine.... actually it's quite great. But don't come here if you don't want to wait a half hour for an appetizer, another hour for your main course and another half hour for the check. Step up the service and it'll be. 4/5.
author: Nik B.

description:
I have been here a few times, so I finally am getting around writing a review. This place is a very cozy, little Italian restaurant in the neighborhood. A walking distance from my place, its ambiance makes for an excellent date night place if you don't want to drive, and I would drive to eat here if I lived somewhere else in the city. The food is delicious, it has a small bar where you can enjoy a cocktail or eat at the counter, and the drinks on the menu are very good. I started the meal by ordering a Negroni Sbagliato, then switched to a bottle of very good prosecco ($44). In the past I had the clams pasta, and it was very good. Saturday night, we ordered the Cavoletti appetizer (Brussels sprouts with bacon bits), and I had the Gnocchi Verdi - in a mushroom cream sauce, and I was very happy with it.

This was not a special occasion, and although we have been here a few times before, I would not call us regulars, and the service was attentive and very friendly with a positive twist: they brought us Bruschetta (pls pronounce it broo-ske-ttah) and a Panna Cotta dessert to share, both on the house. Both were delicious, and you bet we will go back more often.
author: Massimo M.

description: Came here on Friday night `there were hella people in the front door' i told the host I made a reservation,then she brought me to the next door which is Bella 3848, and it's totally different feeling ,not much people and there were three-four servers working there. Because it was my friend`s birthday, I brought a cake to there. And the host said the waiter will take care me, but I sat at the bar like almost 10mins and no one talks to me and even I put the cake on the table, the waiter saw it but didnt even ask me do I need anything, later he told me he was fixing internet but seriously it wasnt take too long for putting my cake into refrigerator,right? After my friend were here we still waited 30mins to get the table,and actually there were so many empty tables but just no one cleans it and let us sit first. I really don't understand why this restaurant has so high rating!!!Bad service and the food are not good either, I rather go olive garden for Italian food !!
author: Man C.

description:
Super cute restaurant, friendly service, and very comfortable inside, but the food was just okay. 

Our group of four people ordered two appetizers to share- BREAD WITH OIL & SUN-DRIED TOMATOES: fairly large loaf of soft white bread to dip into oil/sun-dried tomatoes mixture; BURRATA with bread, olives, and cured meat: friend said the burrata was good (I didn't have any), the rest I thought was okay; SALAD of field greens and endive: decent, but endive were cut into too tiny pieces, would rather have whole leaves to cut on my own while eating for a bigger bite and more flavor; FRUTT E 'MAR squid ink pasta with prawns, mussels, clams, and calamari: very seafoody flavor which was tasty, but the squid ink pasta was chewy and very sticky... it stuck to my teeth (inside my mouth, on my front teeth, just everywhere on my teeth!) so many times throughout the meal that it was quite annoying... too glutinous, which isn't good! Other dishes that my friends ordered were the linguine with clams and pappardelle with beef ragu. They didn't comment on them.
