We didn't order any dessert, but the waitress brought over panna cotta for us to share. I read Yelpers who had nice things to say about the panna cotta. PANNA COTTA: my favorite item of the night, it was served with berries

I was very disappointed at the squid ink pasta, especially since it is one of the most popular/supposedly most delicious items there. Perhaps other pastas are much better, but I'm not dying to come back. I really wanted to love this place, too :'(
author: Iris H.

description:
im not an italian fans i literally have like one italian review we had to wait outside for about less than 10 minutes staff quickly got us in to the back we had a decent wait but they did everthing to make us feel welcome they even socialized with us we got seated brought us a delicious appetizer bruchetta on the house of course i couldnt decide what i wanted the waiter or chef not sure...he helped me picked even changed the noodles for me accomidated my daughter with a more simple kid friendly plate everything was amazing squash raviolis i had shredded pork pasta there was cabonara and pork gnochi and panecotta this place is just a straight class act. Everything was on point we were the last table we never felt rushed or made to feel like we should wrapp up the staff was beyond kind.

The atmosphere of this restraunt was warm and welcoming.

The food was straight from from Italy.

The staff was on point.
author: Alice B.

description:
A solid place for Italian out in the Richmond!  It's great not to have to go into North Beach to find some good Italian food!  We came in for an early dinner on a weeknight and were able to get seated pretty quick.  It's a cozy place and we started off with meatballs, followed by our pasta.  The staff was friendly and bonus points as they brought us a big portion of some tasty, soft bread.  The meatballs were tasty, mixed in with some veggies.  We'd definitely order them again!

I got the pasta norcina and my wife got the carbonara.  Both dishes were very good- the norcina had really nice mushroom flavor and the no frills carbonara didn't need anything else to be quite tasty!  Portions were good sized as well, we will definitely be back!  One recommendation- make a reservation as it seems like this place can get busy!
author: Jeff C.

description: Absolutely one of my favorite Italian restaurants in San Francisco. Everything I've had here is delicious. But no matter what you order as your main course be sure to try the panna cotta it's devine. The staff is always pleasant and respectful but fun. It's a great place for dates.
author: Monica M.

description:
We can't wait to go back to Bella.  I was looking for a restaurant near the De Young Museum and Yelp helped me find this place.  Even my in-laws were impressed, so I scored some points here.

The five of us all loved our food, and the highlights were the Sorrentina, gnocchi and sausage, and Cotoletta, breaded pork,  which were both amazingly good. The service was very good and friendly.  They even had gluten-free pasta.
author: Dean B.

description: 5 stars for David and the awesome staff at Bella! This place has the best customer service in the area: fun, eclectic, accommodating and entertaining! The food is amazing and the wine flows abundantly! We have had dinner at the trattoria and wine and desserts at the bar on multiple occasions and no matter what day of the week, all experiences were wonderful. I love this place so much I decided to have my birthday dinner in the private dinning room and all I can say is that is it way worth it! The servings are generous, the flavor is phenomenal and the service is even better. I definitely recommend this place if you are in the Inner Richmond area and are in the mood for authentic Italian cuisine.
author: Monica C.

description:
Squid ink pasta.

I was just about to end my review with the sentence above. The squid ink pasta is just amazing, comes with a plethora of baby clams in shells and just made right. I wasn't hungry and I was planning on only eating a little bit, but I ended up leaving the plate clean as if it just came out of the dishwasher. The sauce isn't too heavy or too creamy, seemed just right to me. Everything tasted great and I would definitely get it again. However, it would be nice if they ordered grated Parmesan cheese or pepper when the food comes out.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Bella Trattoria was fantastic. We live a few blocks away and finally decided to try out Bella. The food was great; the servers were attentive; the space was very pleasant and not too noisy. The pasta was very fresh and delicious and the Tiramisu was one of the best I've had.

We happened to be one of the last couples in the restaurant and got talking to the owner (who happened to be our server for the night). David is incredibly nice and passionate about what he does and it shows. He even invited us on a short tour of the space next-door (the old Buckshot bar), which they are renovating and turning into a cafe/wine/beer bar. 

We had a great experience. Bella is now our go to Italian restaurant in our neighborhood and beyond. We'll definitely be back.
author: Pony S.

description:
We found Bella Trattoria about 2 months ago and had an ok dinner, ok service and it was perfectly fine.
Took a friend there last night and it was a different place. The lights weren't as dim and the place looked so divey and so unappealing. They need to paint over that crazy mural which is so dated. 
I don't know their wine menu and the very helpful and friendly staff poured 5 tastes for me none of which were drinkable. Insanely tannic and made my mouth pucker. My friend tasted thinking I was exaggerating but she had the same reaction. Our waiter said because the wine is from Italy and what did I expect, because the soil in Italy produces this low quality wine. WTH??? I've had some amazing and very smooth Italian wines and never heard such a stupid explanation ever. 
My friend tasted the Chardonnay and ordered a bottle of water. She also did not eat her pasta. She tried but it was such a plate of mush. My dinner was mediocre at best. 
Won't be back. Very overpriced for the quality of food, the pitiful wine and atmosphere. 
They need to update the menu. 
I really wanted to like this place.
author: Lanie D.

description: Service was great. Food took a while. But they offered fresh bread with oil and sun dried tomatoes. Food was worth the wait. Dishes were exquisite. And the tiramisu was heavenly. They also gave us complimentary dessert wine since they knew it was our anniversary. We will definitely be coming back to try the rest of their fine dishes.
author: Marie C.

description:
I went here as a special occasion a few months ago and was greeted by who I assumes to be the owner of the restaurant.  The atmosphere is welcoming and has the essence of a traditional Italian restaurant.

We first ordered the beef carpaccio and the salmon crostini which was absolutely delicious.  For the entree I had the Tagliatelle Ragu while my boyfriend had the Frutt' 'E Mar, which were both incredibly rich and hearty, yet the fresh pasta tied it all together.  After the huge and satisfying portion, the owner personally came buy to give us a complimentary panna cotta with fresh berries.

I will definitely be coming here again!
author: Ashley Y.

description: Lasagna. Your welcome. Everything was on point.l and reminded me of living in Florence. I will be back.
author: Tyler W.

description:
Such a hidden gem!! My boyfriend and I went here for NYE dinner and were super impressed. It has a romantic/high end atmosphere and the food was incredible! 

I'd recommend making a reservation. The restaurant is small but has a lot of great tables. When you walk in, it feels as though you've found a little piece of Italy: brick walls, leather chairs, dark, romantic and quiet. It's a great atmosphere for a date, catching up with an old friend, or a nice family dinner! 

The food is real authentic Italian. We had the price fixed menu ($85 for three courses on NYE) and loved how many options we were given. They brought out yummy bread with a tomato olive oil. They also gave us samples of the bruschetta and gnocchi. THE GNOCCHI IS A MUST!! Honestly best gnocchi I've ever had (even compared to in italy). The veal cutlet was extremely good as well. 

We didn't try the wines as we brought our own bottle but the list looked great. Corkage: $20/bottle with a two bottle maximum. The dessert was great as well! I got the vanilla gelato and wanted more. 

The service was also great. Our server was very attentive and knowledgeable about the foods being offered. We never had to ask for anything, they were all very on top of it. 

All in all, we're really glad we gave this spot a try and we plan on going back very soon. One of the best Italian restaurants in the city! And it's even better that you don't have to be in the heart of the city to find it.
author: Kendra W.

description: Ate here for the first time last night.  Very reasonable prices, delicious food and great service!  The Oricchiette Cu Lacinato E Salssiccia pasta dish was divine.  My wife enjoyed a beef lasagna special.  We're definitely coming back!
author: Bill U.

description:
Five stars for food... Bruschetta, Aglio y olio, squid ink pasta, gnocchi... Tiramisu and free(!!!) panacotta... If you order these things, you'll have an excellent meal.

Three stars for wait time. This place was busssssy and ppl don't seem to want to leave... Gotta really enforce the 2 hour seating time! 

And 4 stars for service... Smooth, friendly, and complimentary bites fr ppl at the door (though sitting down on time would have been preferred)

Solid 4 stars!
author: Sam W.

description: I've heard about this Italian restaurant before and finally went when I was in San Francisco. The Frutti Mare squid ink spaghetti and parmigiana was delish! The employees knows their menu and can answer my questions! It was worth the visit and I highly recommend it if you're in San Francisco and looking for a Italian restaurant!
author: Jessica C.

description:
I came into the restaurant today with my boyfriend and sat at a really nice booth. We were immediately greeted by hailee who had a nice smile and made sure we had the greatest service ever! I swear the service was super amazing and hailee explained everything so well to us. Talking to her was as if I had known her for so long, she has such a great personality. The food was amazing and she made sure we were happy with our order! 
I will definitely be back and my boyfriend loved the place too!! Thank you Bella and especially many thanks to hailee for the great experience!
author: Marjorie Elizabeth A.

description: Reasonably priced and delicious pasta. Vongole was on point, as was the beef carpaccio.
author: David S.

description: These folks are amazing - heard they might be expanding into a sister bar too... SCORE
author: Liza F.

description:
We tried Bella for my boyfriend's birthday just yesterday. Our reservation was made through OpenTable and we were seated right when we arrived. 

To start, we had their fluffy bread, bruschetta, and polenta. We were also served a plate of garbanzo beans with some light seasoning and sauce, which was refreshing. 

For our entrees, we ordered the gnocchi and hangar steak. Everything was great and we ended up leaving about a third of our main dishes because we were so full. Unfortunately, when we requested our food to be boxed up, the leftovers were accidentally tossed out in the kitchen. Our server was nice enough to offer us a fresh order of gnocchi to go, but now I am left yearning for that amazing steak. I'm no gnocchi expert, but it just seemed too soft - even with the sausage - to the point where I couldn't tell the difference between the mozzarella and gnocchi since they were so similar in texture. 

For dessert, we had the panna cotta and afogato, which were both excellent. The birthday celeb also got complimentary panna cotta, which was nice. 

Bella is a very cute, intimate place, though I wouldn't quite call it romantic. It is a small restaurant, so be sure to make those reservations. Something I do want to mention though is that the bench seating along the wall was a bit uncomfortable. The seat of the bench wasn't wide enough and I felt like I couldn't sit back comfortably.

In general, I enjoyed my first visit to Bella, and will definitely be coming back for that steak. I want to give their squid ink risotto when it's available as well.
author: Camille B.

description:
Wow, wow, wow! We just got home from an amazing meal at Bella Trattoria. We were there early evening and were treated like old friends by the entire staff. We were given the menu and noticed there were no bone marrow for appetizers, which we were looking forward to having. When we asked about it, our waiter went to the kitchen and came back and said they would fix them for us! OMG, they were so good and so rich! My hubby had the special of lasagne, which is something of his specialty whenever he makes it at home and it was chock full of meat and so delicious! Equal to my husband's version. I ordered the Gnocchi verde with spinach gnocchi and a gorgonzola cremini mushroom sauce. Oh dear god, it was so rich, and the gnocchi melted on your tongue,not some chewy, tough gnocchi you usually get at lesser Italian restaurants. They really should charge the same and make it an appetizer. Brought half of it home.We asked for a wine suggestion and the Barbera our waiter chose was perfect.
The panna cotta they serve complimentary at the end of the meal is quite delicious as well. I'm so happy we've found a nice neighborhood Italian restaurant again, although we live in Daly City, but will happily make the easy trip to get there. I had to give our waiter a hug when we left, it was such a nice meal.
author: Mary D.

description:
Come back again - tried squid ink spaghetti with spicy pork this time, seems this is the favorite dish of my group. 

Also got bone marrow and bruschetta. Decent appetizer.

Finished dinner with panna cotta, the highlight of my dinner!
author: Yuhuan T.

description:
Definitely try and get a reservation beforehand. The waiting area is incredibly small as you are literally standing in front of other diners when there's already hardly any space for the host area. We walked into a full restaurant with two couples without reservation already waiting when a lady tried to do a walk in for 11. We all know that's not happening at 7pm on a weekend. 

Dinner starts off with their bread and sun-dried tomato dip which is satisfyingly sweet and tangy. The pasta here is fresh and slightly on the thin side so it does not have the chewiness (or gumminess) one might get at other restaurants.

Service here is excellent. Quick, not overbearing and welcoming. We look forward to going again to try out their other fantastic sounding options.
author: Esther A.

description:
Always wanted to try Bella, but had some hesitations.  Come Saturday, my friend and I decided on having a dinner catch up here.  Making reservations was easy on Opentable.

The place is on the smaller side and seems like a local favorite, so reservations are recommended.  Her and I ended up getting a cute booth table by the door which allowed us to sit side by side..and more room for our handbags, score!  

The menu has a lot of attractive items, so it was a hard choice, but we shared: the bone marrow, carbonara and the squid ink amatricana pasta. The bone marrow was served with a parsley and caper salad with toasted crostinis.  This was my least favorite dish as it tasted flat.  It needed lots of garlic or more seasoning of some other sort.  My pick the carbonara was so good, even with just three ingredients (no cream no butter).  Served perfectly al dente and the pancetta was not overly salty at all like a lot of restaurants serve it.  I am not a squid person, but decided to give the black squid ink pasta a try, and I really enjoyed it.  It was a chunky spicy tomato sauce with the spicy n'duja sausage ground up in the sauce.  The pasta had a a toothsome bite to it and didn't taste "seafoody" at all which I was scared of.  I would definitely get this again.  And an added bonus, we didn't leave with black on our teeth!  All dishes were under $20.  

Service got better after we decided on what we wanted, and it partially could have done with us chatting to each other so much and them wanting to turn the table over.  I was honestly surprised at this cute place!  It's perfect for date night or friend date night. Although, I still have a few Italian spots that I prefer over Bella, I'm so glad that there's a place closer to home that serves up good comforting Italian food.  I will bring hubby here to try them out too.
author: Cat C.

description: Super cute and romantic date spot. Came here on a whim and per yelp's suggestion and was not disappointed. although we had no reservation we were seated immediately. Food was very fresh and hot. Service was immaculate throughout the dinner-even down to the bus boys.  They even gave us dessert on the house. The place was full by the time we left. Definitely check out
author: Betty D.

description: It was delicious. You have to visit this place... especially if you get a craving for Italian food.
author: Alex G.

description: Loved the atmosphere! Their food is good in general but a little too sauce-y. The caesar salad had too much dressing on it, the gnocchi was good but had too much sauce and mushrooms that overpowered the flavor profile, but their pappardelle was delicious. I'd that dish over and over again.
author: Sharon C.

description:
Bella Trattoria just became my new neighborhood Italian restaurant! It's very convenient to get to and street parking is a cinch. The restaurant itself is super laid back and cozy. You can come here on a date, or meet up with a friend.

A few must-haves:

Meatball appetizer - some of the most memorable meatballs I've ever had. Bite-sized meatballs drowning in a gooey, cheesy, tomato and eggplant caponata. The meatballs aren't chewy or dry. They're very moist and soft. So much flavor packed into such a small bowl!

Squid ink pasta - it's basically fruitti di mare with squid ink pasta. Huge portion. Lots of fresh seafood. Pasta is cooked perfectly.

Panna cotta - with a splash of balsamic. YUM.
author: Sherry L.

description:
I find it hard to go out for Italian food much these days because I feel like pasta is not super hard to make and unless I want to overload on carbs and gorge myself (it's great comfort food!), it's not super appealing. But then I came here...and Bella has made me excited for good Italian food again! I've forgotten how good it can be.

Came here on a double date last night after watching Book of Mormon in the city. (No, it's not close to the theater, sorry!) My boyfriend's friends recommended this place--one of their absolute favorites. And I can totally see why! Very romantic ambiance (a beautiful floor to ceiling painting of a night in Italy by the water) and dim-ish lighting with clear hanging lightbulbs. The restaurant is not big and not a looker from the outside, but the inside is cozy and cute! Reservations recommended. There were groups and couples and I can see how you might be pressed for space if u were a couple seated between other groups or couples, but the four of us got a table separate from everyone else. 

Unlimited bread and sundried tomato sauce (different from the usual sauces)! The bread is soft and goes great with the sauce, but I do wish it were a little warmed up. We started with appetizers: polentun a bella, guazetto, and salumi. 

The polenta was baked polenta ($9.50) with gorgonzola and cremini mushrooms..be careful that it's really hot when it comes out! A good hearty appetizer that can hit the spot. But I'd say you'd have to like polenta. I'm not the BIGGEST fan of polenta because I tend to get sick of the texture or flavor or something after too much, but this was made well and I think the fact that there were mushrooms made it that much better. I may not order this again but try it!

Guazetto ($16) was a yummy tomato bisque with zucchini, mussels, clams, calamari, and ours also had a fried tilapia on top..super DELISH with the sauce! I lovedddd this. And the bread does well in soaking up the soup. Would totally order this again!! Salami was okay but honestly I'm not good at critiquing cured meats so I'm gonna defer on that. I personally wouldn't order it on my own, but our friends say they always order it. 

I think our friends frequent so much that the owners know them and they sent over complimentary bruschetta! Quite yummy, lots of fresh basil and tomatoes soaked in vinegar topped with fresh mozzarella slices..and more sundried tomatoes. I think they really like sundried tomatoes here...haha

For Entrees, I got the butternut squash ravioli ($16) and my bf got the linguine with tiger prawns ($19). Our friends ordered sorrentino (gnocchi with sausage and mozzarella) and the lasagna. I loveddd the butter nut squash ravioli! It's kind of more sweet though...tastes like Thanksgiving candied yams wrapped in the dough and soaked in an olive oil, topped with browned butter fried sage and sundried tomatoes. The flavors form a real good mouthgasm. But...be warned, this only comes with 6 pieces. I wouldn't order this as your only entree. Luckily I was already really stuffed from all of our appetizers, that even finishing 6 raviolis was difficult for me...

The gnocchi were little pillows of goodness and the lasagna was not your typical doused in tomato sauce lasagna. The meat was clearly soaked in some kind of tomato essence though and I really liked the hearty flavors that didn't feel too rich at the same time. Nicely done! My bf was happy with his linguine with multiple giant shrimps. I thought it was decent, but honestly I think the only I didn't like from the night was his saffron bechamel sauce that seemed to have too much shrimpy flavors to it. Aside from that though, everything else was amazing!

We shared a panna cotta for dessert--fluffy and light yet rich and creamy. Not sure how THAT happens, but it was delicious. Even my super stuffed tummy had to make space for a few bites. It's not a big portion at $8, I have to say...but I think it was just right for the 4 of us. Oh, that and they also gave us complimentary spumoni. I'm not a huge spumoni fan, but I'll take free stuff! :P It was good, but I'd order the panna cotta over spumoni any day :D 

Wonderful service and dining experience; great ambiance; delicious food! I would so come back again :)
author: Jasmine C.

description:
everything was wonderful--the service, the food and ambiance were all so cozy. 

the food isn't overly pretentious, something about it is very right. not too light, not too heavy. the bread!

i agree with Cat M's review: no gimmicks!
author: Vanessa S.

description:
I rarely eat Italian food but I'm glad my friend convinced me to try this.

Bread with tomato aioli (complementary) - warm bread and tasty sauce = no complaints

La Vera Carbonara (3 ingredients - pancetta, egg, and pecorino) - this dish was well balanced. I don't normally eat Italian food just because I always think there's always too much of something. I like that the sauce was light and not too creamy. 

Panna cotta - my friend loves this dessert and I thought it was decent. It's definitely better than other places if you like panna cotta.

Service was attentive. Atmosphere is very romantic.. it was almost unfitting that our tête-à-tête was mostly about work stuff.
author: Pansy L.

description:
If you're craving Italian food, this place gives you an authentic dining experience. I ordered the antipasto platter (half order) which came with salami, a small salad, fresh mozzarella, sautéed sweet peppers, an olive mix and a sliced baguette. A delicious and fun little starter. We both ordered the Arrabiata sauce; him over spaghetti noodles and I had the gnocchi (gluten free gnocchi). The sauce was amazing. 

They have a good wine selection and delicious desserts/after dinner drinks. 

Most of the staff spoke Italian. The restaurant is small, intimate and dimly lit. 

Great space for a date.
author: Robin Ann Z.

description: Hi-end Italiano in an easy-going family style setting. Not the usual carbon copy menu, plus a nice selection of Italian wines by the glass.  Not necessarily a destination  restaurant, but a great local choice. The seafood stew (essentially a cioppino, but they called it something different) was fantastico. My only constructive criticism is a lack of fresh fish entrees. Branzino, Salmon, Halibut would be nice. Also, I think $$$$ is a mistake -  very reasonable $$$ prices.
author: Dr. B.

description: Food is quite good. But ambience and service of adjoining "Osteria" is lacking; ensure you get seated in the main restaurant.
author: Michael H.

description: This is one of the best Italian restaurants. And here is the most delicious pasta and pizza. The price is certainly not too expensive, but we get service and food, you have to pay.
author: Rebecca B.

description: The restaurant is small and dark. Perfect for a date spot so definitely come with a reservation. Servers were very attentive and friendly and the vibe all around was pretty romantic. That aside, our meal took a really long time to come out. The pasta tasted fresh so maybe that's why it took so long. However, I thought the Pork Ragu special was very bland. I wouldn't write this restaurant off just yet. I'll likely come back to give them another try.
author: Thao T.

description: I've always wanted to try this place and I'm so happy I did! I went with a friend on a Tuesday around 7:30 and we were seated right away. The waitress was great, and they even brought us over complementary bruschetta and dessert! Both of our pasta dishes were amazing and they even made mine vegetarian upon request! Will definitely be back!
author: Sinead G.

description: If you're looking for an authentic Italian restaurant-here you go! Food is excellent and the staff is super nice and welcoming. My favorite place in the city!
author: Theresa B.

description: The gnocchi was mushy and was over powered with mushrooms, overall the worst Italian food I have ever eaten. We were the only two people in the restaurant and now I know why.
author: Jessica D.

description: This is by far my favorite restaurant in SF. Not only was the food amazing ...they had me at gluten free gnocchi (it was like butter), but the service is AMAZING. Loved Hailey. I came in with a friend to celebrate her birthday and she gave us the first class service. I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Ayisha J.

description: Compliments of Yelp reviewers, once again, we tried Bellas.  I'm so glad we did.  The service was wonderful, a young couple next to us made interesting semi-dinner companions. Nice bottle of wine and delicious food completed our busy day.
author: Vicki C.

description: Squid ink pasta, you'll thank me later! Perfect dim lighting for date night. I would recommend making reservations. It's a perfect local Italian spot in Inner Richmond and it saves me a trip to North Beach.
author: Linda L.

description: So happy and full after eating here tonight! Our server Stephen helped us sort through the choices, as there were so many things we wanted to try. We ended up going with the pumpkin gnocchi with oxtail and carbonara for our entrees, and will definitely be back to try more (everything?!) eventually :) The service was so warm, welcoming, and knowledgeable, and the ambiance was perfect for our weekday night out. I really like walking around the neighborhood too, especially with Green Apple Books just a few blocks away - a good way to work off a few calories ;)
author: Tria C.

description:
My cousin and her fiancé (Felicia and Robert of Soap Box fame) are always raving about the food here at Bella, so we jumped on the chance to dine here the last time we were in town. We made reservations at 7:30 on a Wednesday and were seated immediately. I'm sure we may have received special treatment since they're regulars, but every staff member had a warm smile and a charming personality. They made excellent recommendations on dishes and wine pairings, water glasses were promptly filled, and the bread basket was never empty... a feat, considering it was served with that amazing olive oil and sun dried tomato dipping sauce. 

As we were waiting on our permanently-late cousin Kelly, we started the meal with drinks and appetizers. I had a very generous pour of the house red, which was excellent. The bruschetta was one of the best I've ever had; it slightly edges out Postino in Phoenix, which is well known for bruschetta and wine. A well marinated medley of fresh tomatoes and basil sits atop perfectly toasted bread, followed by a thick slice of fresh mozzarella, which is then crowned by a drizzle of olive oil, a touch of sun dried tomatoes, and whole green olives. He also brought out a complimentary appetizer of their carpaccio: paper-thin slices of fresh raw (citrus "cooked") venison with a tasty horseradish/mustard drizzle, topped with baby arugula and shaved pecorino. I didn't even see this dish on the menu, but I would order it again in a heartbeat. 

I had the highly recommended carbonara originale - "3 ingredients: pancetta, pecorino, egg - no cream, no butter." The fettuccini, which is made in-house daily, was perfectly al dente and topped with a good helping of cubed pancetta. I'm baffled as to the lack of cream or butter in the sauce; it was rich and creamy, with a pleasant sharpness from the pecorino romano. The serving size was more than generous, and the server graciously boxed up my leftovers to enjoy at home. I did catch red-handed Felicia licking her spoon; she did look guilty about it, though the sauce is so good that I didn't give her too much crap for it :)

We were all too stuffed to order dessert, but couldn't resist when our server brought out little sampler plates for our party. They came with a sizeable portion of delicious tiramisu (almost as good as Stella pastry), an above average spumoni, and a silky smooth panna cotta with fresh strawberries and blueberries. 

Bottom line: despite all the well known Italian restaurants in North Beach, this is my new go-to place for Italian cuisine. Top notch service, generous pours, and food that is simply "to die for"
author: Justine L.

description:
Gluten free pasta.  Yes, I am one of those people.  Call it what you will: the pasta challenged, glutarded... wheat, barley and rye do bad things to me for a long time after I consume them so I avoid them like the plague.

In my quest to to find a good authentic Italian restaurant I could enjoy a good meal at with friends I found this gem.  It took all of my willpower to keep from licking my plate and I managed to keep it dignified despite my lowered inhibitions from the bottle of wine we consumed.

This place is so authentically Italian they actually care about your food allergies.  In Italy the population is well educated about celiac disease which affects 1 in every 100 people worldwide.  Most restaurants there have gluten free options because there is nothing more important than sitting down with friends and family and sharing a meal together.  Here I felt welcome like I was family and I didn't feel I was an inconvenience when I told them about my food alergies.

http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2015/08/23/433430664/italy-land-of-pizza-and-pasta-is-gluten-free-friendly

This place has become one of my favorite places in the city.  I will be back!
author: Theron L.

description: This is my favorite food I have ever eaten in my entire life. I had to find it on Yelp and review my 2012 experience at this restaurant. I came with a large group of friends celebrating my 20th birthday. I was urged by my friends to order the gnocchi which they all said tasted like "little pillows" at Bella. Flash forward to the single most delectable dish of my life that no meal since has paralleled. The gnocchi was chewy, fresh, and melted in my mouth. I cannot stress enough how deliciously fresh Italian food is! But fresh enough to make this place unforgettable. The meal ended with the restaurant singing me happy birthday and me wishing I could take an order of gnocchi to go! GRAZIE! GRAZIE! GRAZIE!
author: Glory F.

description:
This is my girlfriend and I's favorite Italian place in SF (yeah, I'm sure you know of one that is THE BEST, but for us, this is it).

We've eaten here 3-4 times and have yet to experience anything less than excellence. The food is fantastic, the staff is friendly and helpful and we enjoy the cozy atmosphere.

Definitely worth making a reservation as this place fills up quick for good reason. Give it a shot, you won't be disappointed!
author: Tyler H.

description:
Friday night and wanted to eat out for dinner with my husband but not go to the usual Asian restaurants that the Inner Richmond is so well known for. 

I found this via Yelp reviews (even though I've walked past this unassuming restaurant hundreds of times). 

Pretty cosy inside - you step in and immediately the restaurant is in front of you. My husband and I were smooshed into the corner lounge by the front. Tables are quite close together, but it's a good setting for a date night (cue mood lighting). 

I had an elderflower mocktail, husband had a beer. Mains lasagna (special for the evening) and squid ink spaghetti, with tiramisu and panna cotta for dessert. Very, very filling and all really yummy food. Would eat everything again except the panna cotta - wasn't a fan of balsamic on the dessert, gave it a funky taste. 

Would go back but be sure to go hungry - we were so stuffed at the end of the night!
author: Lisette P.

description:
At a glance, the restaurant and ambiance: cozy, a bit rustic with dim romantic lighting. Lots of families and couples. 

Service: Had a reservation for two and for some odd reason the host had us wait at the bar for a short while even though my party (of 2) was fully present and our table was completely set. 

The servers were warm, quick and attentive enough.

Food:

- Carbonara Originale was very tasty. Super creamy, no lumps, slight tang from the cheese, potent garlic flavor. Portion wasn't overwhelming. I found the dish to be a little salty but my diet is more on the low-sodium side 

- Fettucine with slow cooked pork was so delicious. The bites of ground meat were really tender and flavorful (a bit heavy on salt when eaten alone but fine when eaten with a bite of pasta). The fettucine was a bit soft but was well sauced. The sauce was one of the best I've tried in the Bay Area. The flavor of the tomato was so well balanced with the other ingredients. My one complaint - I love a spicy kick with my food but it was not fun to bite into whole black peppercorns... Not tasty and it sort of messed with my ability to taste for a couple minutes 

- Panna Cotta was rich, creamy and not sweet (which in my book is a plus!). The balsamic glaze and light strawberry sauce went well with the creaminess of the Panna cotta and really brightened up the dessert
author: Jeany K.

description: Came here with my boyfriend for my birthday. Made a reservation day of, was seated. I got the parapalle and he got the macarun, spelling may be off you get the general idea meal was great and had the pana cotta for desert, the problem was after all that when I went home the next morning. I puked it all up and got food poisoning. I stayed home most of the day trying to recover. My boyfriend didn't puke got he got some other form of food poisoning.
author: Linde H.

description:
Amazing and very classically done carbonara! No butter or cream crutches just pure egg and pecorino cheese yum :) The carbonara alone would be a 5 star review!


They also make a wonderful bruschetta that is extremely fresh with great garlicky flavor on a nicely toasted bread! 

However the somewhat lackluster service and decent (but not blow your mind) frutte de mar (seafood squid ink spaghetti) bring it to a still quite respectable 4 stars!  We were sitting at the bar so perhaps that explained the service - everyone was nice however our water was not refilled at all despite both glasses being empty, and we had to always flag them down for anything.

That being said, I would definitely return for the bruschetta and carbonara! And probably plan ahead to make a reservation for Fri/Sat nights as they seem to be pretty booked, so we can get a table with hopefully better service than at the bar.

PS portions are a bit on the small side so plan accordingly!
author: Steph A.

description: Great food, ambiance, prices and service. I liked the green gnocchis w gorgonzola, bruscetta and their grapefruit aperitif and 2011 chianti riserva. Hazelnut ice cream for dessert also recommended
author: Jim M.

description: The service is amazing. I can't say enough how attentive the staff was to our table. The server was very knowledgeable and friendly and the food was delicious too!
author: Allison M.

description:
I was very impressed by this little Italian place. Flavors were delicious! We had the meatball appetizer, and the sauce was amazing. We also tried the puttanesca, baked pasta with chicken, squid ink frutti di mar (not sure of spelling), and carbonara, all of which were good. For dessert, we had the affogato and they even gave us a complimentary panna cotta! Both were delicious.
The atmosphere was lively but relaxing. I felt very comfortable. Staff were all smiles.
author: Elaine H.

description:
3.5/5
There is a certain expectation you get with Italian restaurants - whether it is the ambience, the lighting that sets that ambience, or the rich foods, Bella Trattoria seems to be another one of those restaurants that fit this category.

I was impressed with the small amount of seating inside.  However, the food was something I had expected.  The specials were all very unique and gourmet, but I for some reason did not feel that extra kick to boost this restaurant to a 4/5 business.  

For the starters, the bread didn't come with the standard balsamic vinegar and olive oil.  It came with a sun-dried tomato spread that I was hesitant to try at first, but then devoured by the end of dinner.  The bread was good, but really cold for some reason.  

I ordered the butternut squash ravioli but my goodness, was the portion tiny!  I think all Italian restaurants do that with ravioli... why!?  The butternut squash was very strong, and the brown sugar topping the ravioli was so unique in taste.  I had just finished hiking north of SF, and I was ravenous by the time dinner came.  However, the portion was so tiny!  A baby could have eaten my plate (pics on yelp). Thankfully, my friend ordered the garlic pasta (unsure of the name), and I got to try some of her pasta, which was amazing!  It smelled amazing and tasted amazing.  The portion was more sufficient.

Some improvements that could be made: fair portion sizes!  The pastas were great, but the ravioli was highly lacking.  The bread could also be warm!  It is REALLY cold in SF, and some warm bread would make the tummy happy. 

Overall, a good restaurant to go to on a date or catching up with old friends.  Not one to go to after doing some intense hiking or physically enduring event!  Note to self.

Pro-tip: The waiters are really nice!  Turns out one of them went to SCU for a semester!  Try chatting with them!
author: Jana L.

description:
This place is more 4.5 stars. I was so pleasantly surprised; what a neighborhood gem!!  Great service, excellent wine recommendations and the food..... soooooo good.

You will not be disappointed!  We had the warm spinach salad, the burrata bruschetta, the Maccarune Cu Salsiccia (baked rigatoni with Italian sausage) was a delight!  I also had the special that day which was a multi-hour ragu sauce over papperadelle. Yum.

Great for a girls' night out (quiet enough to talk) or a romantic dinner.

Will definitely be back!
author: Rebecca B.

description:
What can I say! Amazing service, atmosphere and courteous staff. I had the carbonara, which I have tasted across Italy. This is easily one of my top 3 I've ever had.

Veal carpaccio was exquisite.

Staff brought free bruschetta and delicious panna cotta (on the house). What a surprise!I will be back next time I'm in SF. For sure. 

Best part? Entire meal was $34. Wow.
author: Dane H.

description:
Ate it & loved it:
- Burrata.
- Parmigiana (eggplant).
- Gnocchi (Sorrentina).
- Pappardelle. 
- Tiramisu.
- Panna cotta (gratis).

Extremely welcoming host, lovely servers (the right amount of attentive and fast, all from Italy based on the ladies I've met so far) and ambiance.

Please do not bring your loud and misbehaving children to this establishment. Please take your sad and drunken "ladies night" antics to some dive bar instead. Both scenarios have soured my meal various times, but I won't fault Bella for that. However, prepare to pull your hair out looking for parking.

Alla prossima, amici!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Didn't think I'd find freshly made pasta as well executed as one can find in New York City, but this place does a fantastic job. We had the pasta with clams and the Arrabbiata. Both were perfectly al dente and with generous sauces. For appetizers we had the Brussels sprouts with slightly browned, caramelly outer leaves. We also had the carciofi, which was delicious at room temperature. 

The wines were excellent. We had Sangiovese-montepulciano and wish we bought a bottle to take home. 

Service was outstanding, imo best in the Richmond.
author: Kiai K.

description:
I've come here several times and enjoyed it every one. The service is friendly, the food is great, and they have a pretty good wine selection. I'm a sucker for gnocchi, both the sorrentina and the gnocchi Verdi are delicious. I've also done the frutt e mar; if you're a seafood fan,  its not a bad choice, the squid ink pasta has a very different (and very seafoody) flavor. I tend to get one of the two gnocchi options though.

It's a small place, so I'd suggest a reservation. I've never had trouble getting a reservation for 2 to 4 people a day or two ahead of time.
author: Geoff K.

description: I've been meaning to go to this restaurant for a while and was surprisingly brought here over the weekend. I ordered the Gnocchi Verdi and my date had the Sorrentina. We both enjoyed our meals and wine, but weren't completely blown away. Other than that, we experienced attentive service, were given dessert on the house, and the environment is great for small groups!
author: Elyssa C.

description: i've been going here for YEARS!!! David and his staff are Amazing individuals.. If you enjoy late night meals, I suggest Bella! I would come in around 9:30 and leave with great stories and good company. Every dish is unique and flavorful.. If you KNOW and LOVE Italian, you better know about this spot.. IT'S SO GOOOOOOOOOOOD! THE BEST IN SF!
author: Jonathan C.

description:
YUM. This place not only met, but far exceeded my high expectations.

I made a reservation for a special occasion via OpenTable, and we arrived at the exact time of our reservation. We were seated immediately and joyfully, even given a choice of where to sit. Less than a half hour, the place was packed (it's on the small side, so I'd recommend an earlier reservation time if you're dining at dinner). Our host even recognized another table, a sign that patrons return with frequency (always a good hint).

We were promptly given water, and the specials were explained. We started with the burrata, which was divine, and some cocktails. We ordered the chicken piccatta (amazing) and the San Marzano gnocchi (divine). The service wasn't rushed, but wasn't slow. Everyone on staff seems to speak Italian, too! 

We spent our time eating, and talked about how good it was throughout the entire meal! And then it was a nice little surprise when they brought over a complimentary panna cotta for our anniversary.

Highly recommend. It's a gem, the food and ambiance is amazing, and the prices are extremely reasonable, and actually even on the low side considering the fine flavor. We'll definitely be back.
author: Jane D.

description: Bruschetta is great - fresh and tasty and the meat balls are amazing. The sauce they come in is great. But that was where it peaked for me. The ragu was recommended by our server...it was just a bit bland. Needed seasoning for sure and the meat was dry.
author: Zakarya D.

description:
Food - 4 stars
Portion sizes - 3 stars: You need to order appetizers to supplement the smaller entree sizes!

Small, intimate restaurant with a mouthwatering selection of pastas and appetizers. While the ambiance was nicely set with dim lighting and candles, there was not much elbow room. We were luckily seated without a reservation since we made it before Friday night dinner rush. 

The complimentary bread and sundried tomato/olive oil dipping sauce was a nice opening for our meal. We skipped ordering appetizers as it was our first time here, and we were not familiar with the portion sizes. I'm sorry to say that was a mistake. The 3-ingredient carbonara though delicious, flavorful, and rich, was just a little too small for me (a petite female), and the Tagliolini Salmone was certainly not filling enough for my male companion. Our food came fairly quickly.

Service was pleasant and friendly. We got a new basket of bread right before finishing our meals, so this (kind of) made up for the small entrees.

We did not receive the complimentary panna cotta many other Yelp reviewers mentioned.
author: Evelyn C.

description:
Great service and delightful food. Danay, server, gave me an extraordinary service. Thanks so much.
This is must restaurant to try.
author: Dave P.

description: Great home made pasta cooked to perfect al dente. Service was quick and pleasant. Such a gem way from touristy San Fran.
author: Val G.

description:
Got last min reservations here on Saturday.

The fired polenta with mushrooms and gorgonzola was surprisingly pleasant. Wife enjoyed it. Im not much of a gorgonzola person but i thought it went well with the dish.

Brushchetta was nothing out of the ordinary.

Squid ink pasta - I for one do not like squid ink pasta but the wife enjoys it. She really liked her dish. The seafood in the dish was really fresh.

Carbonara - Wasnt too impressed by this dish. I do enjoy the simplicity but it lacked any real flavor.
author: Guess W.

description:
What a gem of a restaurant on an otherwise desolate stretch of Geary Street! I've been here at least four times now and it never disappoints.

Bella Trattoria has become my go-to spot for Italian food in SF. Its great for both intimate dinner dates, and Special Occasion family gatherings. While certainly not cheap, you can still bring the whole fam and not feel cheated/guilty afterward! 

The food is always spot on and oh so tasty! There are no gimmicks, they're not trying to be the most inventive or win prestigious awards; they're just trying to serve you a great meal in a cozy little setting. And on both counts, Bella Trattoria definitely succeeds.
author: Cat M.

description:
I detract 1 star because service is really inconsistent. 

I've been here 3 times since the last 2 months and while the food is superb (Salmon crostini and penne with béchamel), the host or hostess is a hit or a miss.

The waiters have been more or less consistently delivering from good to excellent service.

But I have a bone to pick with the hostesses.
They always seem rather reluctant to seat us and even throughout the meal, there's a negative vibe that takes away from the otherwise pleasant dining experience. 

It's like a hurdle to get to good food and good tableside service. I must fend off the discomforting encounter with the hostesses and then I'll be in food nirvana.

If management (also owner) fixes the rather dismal hostess situation, this would easily be one of my favorite Italian spots in SF.

And trust me, I'm the most friendly and sympathetic diner restaurant businesses could ask for. But some things just cannot be accommodated.
author: Marcella T.

description: Everything about this place is amazing! The ambiance was perfect and the staff was more than friendly and helpful. It does take a while for the food to come out but that wasn't a problem for me.  I ordered the 3 ingredient carbonara which was excellent and for dessert I ordered the Panna Cotta, everything about it was mind blowing. I would highly recommend stopping by for dinner here.
author: Magaly A.

description:
Brought my wife and kids after finding this restaurant on yelp. First, the hostess and service staff were very friendly and attentive. We never had to ask for anything, whether it was a refill on water or bread. We were pretty hungry when we arrive but we all thought the bread and sun dried tomato oil sauce was amazing.

The restaurant environment itself is very warm and relaxed, and although it's a very tiny space the proprietors have done an excellent job utilising the space. It didn't feel cramped at all.
The food was as advertised, my son and I had lasagna, which maintained an excellent balance between pasta, cheese and sauce. My wife and daughter had the Menestra Di Verdure Winter Vegetable Minestrone w/ Lentils, which was very flavourful and chalked full of fresh veggies.

The portions were more than fair and the meal was absolutely worth the price.

I absolutely recommend this restaurant if your looking for classic Italian foodin quaint environment. Also, superb service.
author: Don P.

description:
Really good! I love Italian, this place is great for dates. I saw a lot of couples here having wine and chit chatting away, I also saw group of friends just having a nice meal together. 

The service was kind of off, kept switching off from the lady with the really nice accent, Ramona I think (sorry), to another guy who was really nice with helping us. 

My bf took me here the other night and it was really nice and romantic. Dim lights and a little cute candle in the middle of your table. The food was amazing, the appetizer was on point, the bruschetta! The tomatoes were the right flavor and it all combined perfectly together. 

I got the Sorrentina, wasn't what I expected because I like to look at pictures to know what I'm ordering (that's what yell is for duh) but it was really good anyway! My bf got the salmon dish, I tried it and it was good too. The sauce is delicious but the noodles may have been undercooked for it was a tad bit hard. After we had the flan for dessert and it was so good! I loved it here!
author: Sandy L.

description:
Great place
Warm atmosphere 
Food is better than any other place in SF 
Strongly recommend
author: Mike F.

description:
This is definitely an Italian joint worth checking out. I came here upon an Open Table reservation and figured I'd check it out since it was some place new.  The ratings were decent and my mom was visiting from out of town, so I figured any meal that I didn't prepare was going to taste just fine.

The place is a good size with an awkward waiting area as you enter.  The host(ess) will smile and seat you as you'd like for whatever they have available.  You can tell this place is going to be good by the basics on their menus and accents off their tongues.  I don't think any of us had a bad dish and we surely asked for seconds on the bread.

The wine is cheap so make sure to grab a bottle and enjoy the night as you'll notice the sun setting through the clouds in the "sunset".
author: Kevin J.

description:
(Feb 2015) After a delightful afternoon in Japantown, I called for a table at a highly reviewed Italian place to celebrate daughter's bday, but they were fully booked :-(  Second choice was Bella Trattoria, but having had a disappointing experience at a highly reviewed bib gourmand nominated trattoria the previous week, I was very apprehensive to try another trattoria. It was already 7 pm on a Saturday and they were the nearest to where we were, so I decided to give it a shot. The gentleman on the phone said to come in! We waited for 10 mins while they prepped the table. It was a small and intimate space. Doesn't matter, we were there for the pasta.

We ordered the gnocchi verdi which was good and the gnocchi were as light and fluffy as pillows. The gorgonzola bechamel sauce was a perfect accompaniment. Mind you, I do make ricotta gnocchi at home and I have to say they did a splendid job. We order 3 other pastas dishes and they were all excellent! 

A lady was passing out samples of a broccoli bruschetta as a menu test and we enjoyed them. We ordered the zabaliogne for dessert and the lady heard that we were celebrating my daughter's bday and she brought us a panna cotta with a candle in it. I am not one to do repeat, but if I were I would not hesitate to come back here. Would recommend to others too. (caveat: was two years ago).
author: nikki c.

description: The squid ink seafood pasta was good not great for $26.00 I would have like a little more seafood rather than some tiny squid.
author: Amy H.

description: Additional Bella location, just a few foot steps from the original location(the old buckshot bar). Firstly, wow, what a change from its former incarnation. Secondly, the food, to die for. Baked Pene with chicken in a sauce that is sinfully delicious.
author: Russ E.

description:
Solid 4-star Italian food for the Bay Area. 

They're relatively inexpensive for delicious food if you're hunting around the city for some good stuff. Pillow-y gnocchi and Bolognese sauce deserve a mention. 

It wasn't phenomenal, but the food was tasty, flavorful and hot. Our service was great too, but there wasn't anything that stood out as totally incredible. Music was a little off - it felt like the team had left the top 40 on accidentally and serenaded a lot of dates with it.
author: Andrea D.

description: I had the pasta and the seafood stew.  pasta is ok, but the seafood stew. only has 3 shrimp and small pieces of calamari, a lot of mussel and claim.  my normal seafood has to have fish , or maybe scallop or crab.  for $32.00  is little too much, also $4.00 for a can of cook.???
author: Ed Y.

description: We came here for take-out for the first time and was impressed with the pastas! I had the rigatoni with mushrooms and chicken where I tasted a bit of truffle (LOVE!) and it wasn't too saucey and was the perfect portion. My sister had the maccarune, which was also very tasty! We definitely want to try it here dining in next time! They came with complimentary bread and panna cotta dessert!! Amazing :) Although they dont serve all dishes of their menu through take-out, the two dishes we had were very tasty! :)
author: Amanda C.

description:
What a great find, and very unexpected... We stopped in for a bite to eat, ravenous after all that dancing and cheering for World Cup - Brazil next door at Irelands 32. 

We were one of 3 tables in the restaurant and were treated like queens.. Fresh made cocktails were served continuously..I ordered the seafood pasta, which was bowl licking good. The Panna Cotta... it was the best I have ever had..

Perfect spot on a warm day with a fruity cocktail.
author: Sara F.

description:
Came here over the weekend for my birthday.  Easily made reservations online through OpenTable.  The staff were extremely nice and helpful.  Once they found out we were there for my birthday they put a candle on the panna cotta dessert  =)
The food we ordered was delicious, and their sliced bread went really well with all the sauces in the dishes too!
I definitely plan to come back again  =)
author: Angelica Y.

description:
I've been on a quest. 

Since I've been traveling to and from Italy, I've been on the lookout for authentic, Italian-run establishments with friendly staff in San Francisco. I've finally found what I was looking for with Bella Trattoria. 

With a charming interior, delicious food (hello, burrata!), unique cocktails, great wine and an accommodating service team, Bella is my favorite Italian restaurant in the city. Period. 

Mission: Accomplished.
author: Keane L.

description: Amazing Amazing Amazing! This place is great, all the 5 star reviews don't lie! Great to go with friends, family, dates, anything. Everything was so delicious and very authentic. It's a place one definitely has to try in SF. Will definitely come back.
author: Daniela B.

description:
I admit I had my doubts. I have seen this place since I was kid driving up and down Geary street. Never gave it a second thought.  

Then it was time for my mother in laws birthday party. Cue the search for a local Italian dinner spot to fit 10 hungry Russians. Average hungries need not apply. 

We started with the bruschetta, polenta, and meatballs. Every dish was fresh, hot, and super flavorful. 

I personally had the hangar steak. It was moist. Tender. And I devoured every bite. Even gnarled at my husband when waved his fork at me wanting to try it out. Back up and no one gets hurt. 

Everyone was super happy with their food and we loved that we could bring our own wine for a $15 corkage. Bring your own cake for a 2.5pp fee. 

Service was excellent and observant! 

A+
author: Michelle I.

description:
Really small hole in the wall place. As a vegetarian , the menu had a few dishes. But was surprised to see the Menu stating "Substitution and changes to the Menu are not Accepted". 

The Brushetta was good , other than that all other entree were not worth the price. Can't justify the heavy price tag on them.
author: Karthik G.

description:
2 blocks from my place. Thank goodness I decided to come here for lunch on a friday. it's the only day of the week where they serve lunch! Got the Pesto Gnocchi that everybody is raving about and it totally holds up!!

Next time I come I'm going to try the Squid Ink Pasta. Can't wait!

Mind you- come on an empty stomach cause this is carb-loading at its finest!
author: James L.

description:
Came here for NYE and had the prix fix dinner... Very reasonably priced and very giving on the appetizers and dishes. Brought out an array of options and everything was delicious...

The ~5 appetizers were excellent the pasta dish was fantastic and the main courses were excellent... The desserts were good too and the service was nice. The restaurant itself was small but very homey with a great ambiance. Had a nice feel and definitely a great date spot. Came with my family and everyone loved the food and the experience...

Will definitely come back!
author: A. G.

description: I'm no pasta expert, but I have had my fair share of seafood pastas. This is one of the best, if not the best, that I've had. Just amazing.
author: Jason X.

description:
I had a wonderful dining experience here! The service and food were exceptional! 

The bread they give you comes with a dip of sundried tomatoes in olive oil. But the bread alone was so good you didn't even need the dip! (But the dip didn't hurt, either!) 

I ordered the spaghetti vongole, and the spaghetti is made with squid ink. This dish was so delicious! It was seasoned really nicely, and the bread was essential in sopping up all of the sauce! 

None of the desserts really jumped out at me, so I opted not to get one. However, with service being so exceptional, I got a free mini panna cotta with strawberries. The waiter said something to the effect of, "Your day should always end with something sweet." Very charming, and so true!

I highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Rachel H.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here while in San Francisco on vacation. It is a very cute, beautifully decorated restaurant. We were very impressed with the food and service. The waitstaff all greeted us upon arrival in Italian!

I ordered the gnocchi, which was great, very nicely cooked and sauced up. My boyfriend had the squid ink pasta which they loaded up with fresh seafood. Also, we we given a brushetta appetizer compliments of the chef while we were waiting, along with the sun dried tomato olive oil & regular bread they give while you wait. And it wasn't long of a wait at all.

At the conclusion of our meal we were stuffed so passed when the waiter asked if we wanted any dessert.... But, he arrived back out a few minutes later with a dessert compliments of the chef! Wow. We were blown away. Great food, great service, nice atmosphere. Highly recommend!
author: Jessica H.

description:
Very cute and charming place located in the Richmond. My sister in law found this restaurant last minute and we were able to get a table for 4 without any issues. We ordered a bottle of Italian wine recommended by our server (which was not on the wine list!) and he even probably us a decanter to aerate the wine for better taste! 

We all ordered a pasta dish and everything was extremely delicious. Cannot complain about anything. The food was great - the seafood was on point and the complimentary panna cotta was divine. This place is not a tourist place and is clearly for locals. Would go again anytime!
author: Sandra V.

description: Needed to update this review after 5 years. It was just as great as I remembered if not better. For starters, we had the bruschetta (again) and burrata dishes. Then for entrees: the lasagna (again) and carbonara. Everything was just amazingly good. It's a bit of a hike for us (and parking isn't easy) but it's worth every bite.
author: S R.

description: Delicious food and great service! The place is really cute, perfect for a date night! My husband had the pasta with salmon and I had a special (butternut squash ravioli - the best I ever had). We will be coming back, for sure!
author: Camila F.

description: Quaint and romantic atmosphere. Friendly staff and we actually kinda feel like we were in Italy for a hot second. The food is unreal and my boyfriend and I discovered our fav bottle of wine that we actually drove all the way down to paso Robles to fix our craving!
author: Madison R.

description: Unfortunately, I was unable to take a picture of my food because it was just too damn good to take a moment away from eating the whole plate. This is hands down the BEST BEST pasta I have ever had-- I promise!! I ordered the bruschetta and (oh. My. Goodness.) it was so delicious and the cheese was nice and creamy and fresh! I enjoyed every bite of it. The complementary bread that they offer with the sun dried tomato oil is so soft and warm. Tastes like it was just taken out the oven. For my pasta I ordered the 3 ingredient carbonara... It was honestly the most delicious plate I've ever had. The panna cotta was also great, it was the perfect way to end such a satisfying meal. I cannot wait to return and indulge again! Must try.
author: Reina C.

description: We love this place...it forces us to drive across the city which is the only reason we don't go more often. Great authentic food, crowded but not impossible to get a table, very fair pricing, lot's of good wine, and just a good time. Stop reading and go bozo.
author: Cameron F.

description:
I wish I could give this a higher rating! Wow. I'm a foodie and have gone to many restaurants through out the city and Bella Trattoria is hands down the most delicious I have been to! Not to mention the service there is unlike any place I've been before. They truly care about your experience and make sure to go above and beyond. 

My boyfriend and I went last Friday around 8:30 (make sure to make a reservation!). The ambiance was so romantic and felt like I entered a small restaurant in Italy. I loved the decor! So my style - unique lighting, small but cozy.

We started with a Caesar salad... My boyfriend doesn't even like Caesar salad and he ended up eating half!!! The shaved parmesan literally melted in your mouth. Then we had the bruschetta.... A MUST get to start. Again, melted in your mouth.

For our entrees, I got gnocchi with the Gorgonzola .... You guessed it. Melted in my mouth! I've had my fair share of gnocchi growing up in a big Italian fam and this plate literally blew any gnocchi I've ever had out of the water. FULL of flavor. I didn't even have any leftovers I ate it all :(

Being so far from the city in the Outer Richmond, it's a hike to get to restaurant. Luckily, this place is right around the corner :) I'll be sure to be back to visit and David is an amazing owner! Make sure to say hi, he'll make you feel right at home!

Thanks Bella Trattoria staff! One of the best dates we have been on!!!
author: Alesia V.

description:
Loved this place! 

Atmosphere is great, food is delicious, service was excellent! We had the polenta with gorgonzola and mushrooms, baked pasta with chicken and sun dried tomatoes and gnocchi with italian sausage and mozzarella. Food is wonderful!
author: Is R.

description: Authentic Italian food. Don't go down town to little Italy come here. What a treat to have this in your neighborhood. Sea food pastas excellent. Friendly and attentive staff in a cozy unpretentious setting. Loved the olive oil that you dip your bread into infused with sun dried tomatoes. Fabulous sorbets flown in from Italy. Great wine selection
author: Bridget W.

description:
Update: I did receive call back today only after leaving three msgs and a one star yelp review. The manager called me back to say that he's been on vacay which doesn't make sense. His staff should've known he's been on vacay. Instead they told me that they will have him call me back when he gets in at 4pm. Anyways long story short, I will no longer chase this restaurant to give them my business. Manager states they do not take large party reservations and only takes reservations for groups 8 and more. 

This review is strictly for not returning messages. I have left three messages to this restaurant trying to make a reservation for my rehearsal dinner but never got a response. I even left a message with someone for the manager to call me back and nada. Poor customer service. I guess they are doing so well that they can afford to lose some business...
author: Serena F.

description:
nice little restaurant with amazing food. 

Frutti E Mare (squid ink pasta with seafood) is a must try
author: Hippo T.

description:
After my initial review, I got an immediate response back from management. David acknowledged and explained that there was indeed an issue with one of their wait staff and that the issue was resolved. He apologized and extended an invitation to come back to give another try, and I will go back. 

I just want to say thank you to their management team and actually reaching out to me. It's nice to know that they do value their customers feedback. It shows they do take pride in their business. I still recommend this establishment and I will be coming back.
author: Kev C.

description:
Very very delicious
We had the eggplant Parmesan appetizer 
And I had gnocchi for my main course
Both were exceptional

This was my first time and I will definitely come back. 

Thank you chef!
author: Jason G.

description: The ambiance is nice. The service was attentive and friendly. The food was ok, nothing special. I got the gnocchi; my friend got the seafood linguini. I'd only go back because it's so close to home.
author: Mary H.

description: A very delicious taste of Northern Italy. Usually the title Italian restaurants barely enough to fit are usually the most authentic and best tasting. And this place did no fail. The decor and ambience brings you to a little Italian cafe in Northern Italy. Service was also a plus. The head chef made his way around to make sure the guests were enjoying the food. I ordered the Frutti De Mar with the Squid ink pasta. Definitely in my top 2! The squid ink pasta is officially my favorite type of pasta after having it at Bella Trattoria! Perfect amount of clams and shrimp in the dish as well. Pasta was definitely al dente as all pasta should be! Definitely a new favorite place to eat in the city for me!
author: Erik D.

description:
If you're looking for a romantic evening, this is the spot!! Talk about authentic Italian - even the employees are yelling in Italian all around you. For apps, entrees, and dessert for 4 we spent under $200 even with generous tip. Ask your server to sample some wines - we bought one of the best bottles I've ever tasted. 

Customer service is A+!! Our entrees were taking a little long, and the kitchen sent out some fresh bruschetta. 

Love this place. Can't wait to come back!
author: Becca R.

description:
I'm obsessed with Bella's Carbonara ($17), which is pasta with crispy pancetta, pecorino and egg sugo.  Absolutely divine and delicious.  Bella's owner actually informed me and my boyfriend that instead of cutting corners and using cream and butter in the Carbonara (like many other Italian restaurants), Bella drops a raw egg into the pasta as the pancetta heats up everything in order to create this perfect base.  The owner also said the Carbonara is his personal favorite from the menu! 

On top of the Carbonara, which never disappoints, Bella gifted us a complementary Panna Cotta topped with thin slices of strawberries as dessert.  It was light and just the right amount of sweet.

*love*
author: Christine A.

description: Super friendly, well priced Italian place that's trying hard to get everything right. When the two of us picked a table, the greeter suggested we pick one for four so we'd have more room, which of course is what we secretly wanted. My warm spinach salad was huge, even cooked down a bit. I can't go with five starts at the moment, since I was underwhelmed by my gnocchi entree, but I pledge to go back, try another dish, and update my review accordingly. An asset to the neighborhood. Panna cotta was delish.
author: Nick C.

description:
This place is just as amazing as it can possibly be.
The food is impeccable, the staff is hiper friendly and has amazing desserts.

How could it be better?

Starting to feel as this is my favorite place in SF!!
author: Giulianna P.

description: I'm going to echo the sentiment about the service. I don't think you're ever going to get anything other than the hurried, inattentive staff they have here. You can ask, beg, plead for help but in maybe what is meant to be an authentic Italian experience they will ignore you until you get up and personally walk to the manager. The additional disappointment came from the fact that the food was either watery or dry. What's the deal? Gnocchi, black ink pasta, both terribly disappointing. You're going to be disappointed regardless so try somewhere else.
author: Yev G.

description: Love love love the food here. Everything made to perfection.. especially their gnocchi with mushroom sauce... drool..
author: Jennie C.

description:
I can't believe I have never written a Yelp for this place before. I have probably been here 1- 2x per year for the past 13 years.

Last night I went with some friends who are REAL regulars here (One of them was the one who introduced me to this place). I do love the special treatment of going with a regular - we got a special app, and a special dessert.

We split the gorgonzola gnocchi to share for he table and the carpaccio. That Gnocchi is to die for - but would maybe to rich for an entree, but as an app to share with 3 others it is perfect.

I ordered the Crispy pork cutlet  (with a lemon piccata sauce and arugula) My friend who is the regular was IMPRESSED with my order and wondered why he had never seen or ordered this before and when insane on it ---It is great, really crispy panko crusted thin tender pork with a real taste of capers and lemons in the sauce. Huge too.

Someone else ordered the carbonara - one of the best I've had outside of Italy, and my bf got the bolognese with fresh noodles. My faves were the cutlet and the carbonara for sure.

We were too stuffed for dessert but they brought out a little marsacpone cream thing for dessert, even though I was stuffed it was amazing.

My bf never lets me be a "regular" anywhere since there are so many places I want to eat. But even he had to admit being a regular has its perks!!!!

The bill for 4 of us with one cocktail (for me) and a bottle of wine was about $168 before tip.  

This place really does feel like you are eating in Italy. love it.
author: Amy W.

description: Soooo good, everything about this place is amazing! Especially the most important part, the food!!! Service was attentive and great and the gnocchi literally melts in your mouth. So good. Definitely coming back soon.
author: Jared B.

description: WORST restaurants I've ever been too! my boyfriend and I are visiting San Francisco for our anniversary, we live in Los Angeles (7hours away) so we wanted a nice place to eat. The yelp reviews were rated really well so we said hey why not! We're not familiar with the area so I called, made a reservation for 8pm..we  arrived after 730, was told to wait at the bar and then they send up to the back area to another bar and waited again which was fine. After we got seated we got a menu and never saw anyone again for at least 20mins, we were talking so we didn't noticed at first. A male waiter or maybe manager  (not sure what he was since he was walking outside a lot and texting) came by and took out drinks..waited another 15mins, we ordered our food and that's the last time we saw anyone for 45mins! Literally NO one came back to see how we were doing or anything. I did notice a lot of usuals and they got better service then us, I never leave bad reviews but I was very very upset! Suppose to a nice anniversary dinner and ended up being very frustrating evening..I felt bad for the waitress who ended up taking care of our table and seemed to be doing all the work, she ended up apologizing for all the trouble and gave us free dessert.. who wants free dessert when your that upset? 2 hour dinner (not by choice) and only checked on us 3 times is very upsetting..this is would be good for someone who knows the manger or else your screwed..
author: Amanda L.

description:
Another great experience at Bella Trattoria (Not surprised!).  This place is fantastic.  Got the brussel sprouts with pancetta and the smoked salmon and caviar over a linguini type noodle and white sauce.... (Yummy!).  Finished with some chocolate gelato.  I wish this place was in my neighborhood so I could just walk over for dinner.  And also want to mention the stellar service.  The staff was so nice... again.  

If you haven't been... you are missing out.
author: T. E.

description: Solid - not Locanda but pretty good when you're in the neighborhood and want a good Italian meal! 4 stars because the pasta isn't as al dente as I'd like. I've eaten here several times and keep coming back - squid ink pasta and carbonara are excellent. Also, BYOB!!!
author: Tammy L.

description: HONESTLY--This place is PHENOMENAL. Service was great super nice staff and the FOOD....... this is the best pasta in SF. And I have had a lot of pasta here. And great music. COME HERE IT IS AMAZING.
author: Gabbie Z.

description:
Probably the best Italian meal you'll get in the Richmond. We had:

(1) Spinach salad: Very good, some spinach was cooked, some wasn't. Kind of a nice textural mix. 

(2) Bruschetta: Noticed lots of people ordering this, so we went with it. Fantastic. The tomatoes are so fresh, and the juices soak in to the bread perfectly. Some olives on the side are a nice touch.

(3) Amatriciana: Great pasta dish with tomato sauce and pancetta, traditional dish, was close to the ones I had when I was in Italy. Homemade pasta was nice and al dente. Hit the spot.

(4) Aglio e olio: Simple pasta dish with vegetables. Lots of garlic, which can be great if you like garlic. Again, homemade pasta al dente. Nice touch. 

(5) Tiramisu: Fantastic. Nice and soaked in espresso, the way it should be. Not too heavy, not too light, just right. 

(6) Cappuccino: Was prepared very well by our waiter. The milk was frothed just right. 

(7) Service and ambiance: Our waiter was so nice, and the room just felt relaxing to be in. 

10/10 would recommend to anyone in the area.
author: Noah D.

description:
One of my favorite date night spots. Yes, it's called Bella Trattoria, but there's something about the excellent service that makes me want to sing Bella Notte, because you can really tell they're all about making your night special.

Fresh, handmade pasta. The boyfriend is half-Italian and is terribly proud of it (mainly from a food aspect), and has given his thumbs up for this place. We had ordered salmon from the carpaccio menu. I'm still new to the raw fish/meat game, but was quickly turned when this dish arrived. So, so good. So worth it. They also let us try a little sample of their bruschetta, which was equally delicious. My tastebuds didn't stand a chance.

And then the entrees happened. Squid ink arrabbiata spaghetti is surprisingly delicious. Not that I know what squid ink actually tastes like. Not that it will matter because the lights are dimmed for that perfect ambiance. And I ordered a chicken bake with penne pasta. The boyfriend took a bite of that chicken, which was some of the most succulent chicken I've ever had, and said that this chicken was worth mentioning for people visiting from out of town.

Dessert-wise, we ordered a tiramisu despite being overly stuffed. To our surprise, they also served us their panna cotta on the house. After learning that their beautiful tiramisu was mainly made with custardy egg, which I couldn't have, I resigned myself to the panna cotta...which was so good I nearly cried. I've never had panna cotta before this, I don't think. And I'll certainly be ordering it again.

There was a bit of confusion as we had an online gift card that we hadn't printed (on the gift card it said we didn't need to print it, but then the restaurant did, so...not having a printer, the printing didn't happen). Despite that, the manager went out of his way to figure out what he could do for us. I generally don't like pushing for things like this, so I didn't, but he was kind and even offered to let us print it from their office via WiFi. Not to worry, sir. I'm sorry we had accidentally been "those people". We'll definitely be back, with or without a gift card. I need that panna cotta.
author: Robbin A.

description:
Went last night for the first time. Service was fantastic. Food was amazing and the staff took care of us with some free dessert! 

Great spot for a nice dinner in a relaxing setting. Nice and small so it has a family feel to it. Make reservations to be safe.
author: Drew K.

description:
I've bookmarked this place for a while now so when a friend who was visiting from out of town wanted to go out to dinner, I thought this would be a good spot for us to try.
We started off with the Bruschetta which was delicious. It was fresh and light and probably one of the best I've ever had. 
For our main course, I had the carbonara which was so good. It's made with 3 ingredients- pecorino, pancetta and egg and it was cooked to perfection. 
My friend had the special ragu, which I got a bite of and it was sooo yummy! I wish I had gotten it for myself but now I know what I will be having the next time I come. 
They served us panna cotta on the house and it was amaaaaaazing. I've never had it before and if all panna cottas taste like this one, I've seriously been missing out. I'm not that fond of sweets but this was perfectly sweet and so creamy. 
The restaurant itself is not big and the tables are pretty close to each other. Seems more of a intimate/date type of place. Wouldn't recommend for big groups unless you make reservations ahead of time.
