I liked that they kept the doors closed and asked people to wait outside instead of people hovering over you waiting for their table.
The food and service was amazing and I can't wait to be back!
author: Joanne L.

description: My boyfriend and I have gone multiple times and have tried different dishes - carbonara, squid ink, butternut squash, ossobucco and more. All dishes are wonderful! Bone marrow is a must. Their daily specials are always on point. LOVE IT. Never disappoints. Gooooo!
author: Tina D.

description: Wow such delicious pasta and such excellent service--now wonder this place is so popular!  Highly recommended!
author: Max S.

description:
Like the cute place. Love the friendly guy waiter. I can't believe he remembered my bf and I, we only ate there once before about 6 months ago. 

Were a sucker for bone marrow so we always go for that. Also, the pork cutlet is good. Simple and good. :)

The tuna salad was a little lack luster. Tuna was sliced so paper thin we could barely taste it. But that's ok. Was still a tasty salad.

Tiramisu was perfect. But the panna cotta had too much gelatin for me. But falcons were good. 


Overall, this is a place we will come back to for out casual weeknight dinner out. See you soon. Ciao Bella!
author: mel l.

description:
Came here last week for my roommates birthday on a Wednesday night. We were seated right away with a group of four.

Our waiter came and took our drink orders then brought bread with oil which was delicious. I ordered the house sangria ($10) and it was great. 
We got bruschetta as an appetizer and it was probably the best I've had...even better than my moms and that's saying a lot.
Our main courses were fantastic as well...I got the spinach and mushroom gnocchi. 
Food was good but I had some issues with th place.

1. Small portions for 16-22$ plates 
2. It wasn't too busy but the waiter tended to ignore us...were guessing due to our age (early 20s) that we weren't paid that much attention to which offended us
3. Waiter didn't have the best attitude; we preferred the bus boy more. 

Probably wouldn't  come back although I enjoyed the food. The waiter and his condescending tone killed it for us.
author: Annie C.

description: First time here. The staff was amazing, offering their favorites on the menu. For the price, the food was good but not spectacular. I ordered the Maccarune Cu Salsiccia. It was a Rigatoni pasta in tomato cream sugo with Italian sausage. My plate was deliciously creamy! Ambiance was cozy and romantic. Since it's a small restaurant, the tables are bunched pretty close. I don't mind but I preferentially like more separation because I could clearly hear the other people's conversation lol. Be sure to call ahead and make reservations because it can be packed.
author: Will N.

description: I had the Sorrentina and it was excellent. You can taste the freshness in the quality of the food in every dish. From the appetizer, to the main course following with dessert every dish was tasteful. The waiter and David, the owner, were very inviting and insightful. Best customer service I have ever experienced. I highly recommend this restaurant! Thank you again for the warm welcome to San Francisco!!
author: Jeanette G.

description:
Terrible service. We ordered 5 pieces of bruscetta and they brought out 3 and then took it away and didn't bring the new plate for 10 more minutes. Took 30 minutes to get bread and drinks. Mid way through dinner the lights went dim and I couldnt see my food at all. 

Honestly it seemed authentic Italian enough but it was not tailored at all to someone who didn't know Italian wines and foods extremely well. When I asked for a California wine with my meal the waiter looked at me like I was insane. 

Rude people. Trying too hard to be hip and not successful on any front.
author: Audrey S.

description:
I was having (as per usual) another exceptional dinner here the other night, and realized that the last time I wrote a review for this place, my husband was still my boyfriend.  
My husband proposed to me at this restaurant.  We go to Bella for every special occasion because it is just that good.  Every time we think it couldn't possibly be as good as we remembered it, we go and are blown away every time.  The burrata and the gnocchi are our go to favorites.  The staff is great and super friendly.  It's the perfect small, cozy, romantic, and comfortable neighborhood italian restaurant, with really some of the best italian food we've ever had.  I hope this restaurant is around forever.  We hope to continue coming here for many years to come.  Bella is our happy place!
author: Lili L.

description: Classic but not stuffy. Classy but not pretentious. Great service, good music, perfectly done pasta. Just right.
author: Kevin L.

description:
LEGIT ITALIAN CUISINE!

brought my 2 little cousins here to have them experience some nice Italian food.  let me just say that the customer service is excellent and is very kid friendly.  and they know

Mixed Green Salad 
- very tart and flavorful, a great starter

Polenta 
- moist and one of the highest quality i have had, but cheese on top was very pungent and was not appealing to my little cousins.   it was alright to me however.

Gnocchi Verde 
- tender green starch balls. YUM.  it was creamy and had a very truffly/mushroom flavor.  it was delicious for the first few bites then becomes very filling.  good dish to share

Squid Ink Pasta 
- strong seafood broth flavor however it was the noodles that had the squid ink, not the sauce like I had expected.  this was my favorite savory dish of the night

Ragu 
- a typical meat pasta, very safe choice that all can enjoy

The desserts were the super stars here

Panacotta 
- BEST I'VE EVER HAD.  it's thicker than the Asian version and the balsamic dressing cut through the cheesiness

Tiramisu 
- strong espresso flavor, and yummy toffee chips on top!  

DESSERTS ARE A MUST GET HERE!!  i would come back just for the desserts!
author: Tina A.

description: Quite possibly our favorite Italian restaurant in the city. Terrific service and delicious food (best bruschetta I've had). Very accommodating to everyone, including those with small children.
author: Twee L.

description: Super friendly staff, very accommodating of our group of 7. Food was pretty, tasty, and not very expensive. Would also be really cute for date night!
author: alex j.

description:
Came here around 7:30 on a Thursday evening for dinner without a reservation and ended up waiting around 20-30 minutes for a table. The ambience is dark and romantic, and it's not too noisy so this is perfect for a date - but remember to make a reservation!

We started off with the burrata, which was DELICIOUS - super creamy and rich, but nicely balanced by arugula with a lemony dressing. We also had the grilled meatballs, which were wonderful as well - they were very tender, almost melt in your mouth. The complimentary bread and sun dried tomato in olive oil was great as well. For our entrees we had the sorrentina gnocchi, which were like little pillows of perfection, and frutt e mar, which had a generous amount of seafood (clams, mussels, shrimp, calamari) over squid ink pasta. We declined to order any dessert but were offered a complimentary panna cotta with strawberries and blackberry on top - probably the best I've ever had.

I'm in love! I will DEFINITELY be back here. It's perfect - delicious food, classy ambience, great service, but NOT pretentious at all.
author: J L.

description: My husband took me here for my birthday and the food was SO authentic and amazing! I loved the small restaurant atmosphere and our waiter was extremely friendly and attentive! Great service, great food, great wine.... well definitely be back for the gnocchi!!!!
author: Christina S.

description:
Was very surprised at how the good the food was here, I don't remember what we had but it was the gnocchi and a special of the day. Both of the dishes made my taste buds dance and flavor blasted my mouth!! Also it was our pre anniversary dinner and they gave us champane..but that was it ): I can't remember if we got dessert or not..

Service was also really good! It was a skinny woman but she moved quick ! Although when she was explaining the menu items I did not quite understand what she was saying! Which was why I chose special of the day..but she attended to us with whatever we needed!
author: Christina C.

description:
Great place in Richmond, I was a bit taken a back that their host/reservation stand right at the door, as in, when you take a step in, it's there. But that's what you got to deal with in San Francisco, rent is high and space is valuable. 

Food is delicious. Bread was a bit dense but soft, warm and fresh, I didn't fill up on it, it came with olive oil and sundried tomatos. We got a bruschetta to share, my friend did not like it, so I enjoyed it on her behalf. She thought the ratio wasn't right, too much mozzarella to tomato and bread. And she's a culinary student, but she knows everyone has their own tastes. My friend got the gnocchi verde and the gnocchi is melt in your mouth, I loved it, wish I had ordered it, but she thought the mushrooms were a bit too strong. My boyfriend would have gobbled them up if he were there. My friend liked my pasta because it was cooked alden te, I wish I could remember the spelling of my dish, but I couldn't even pronounce it, but it did have 3 parts to the name and had some damn delicious candied almonds. 

Desserts, oh my gosh that dessert. I could eat their panna cotta with balsamic glaze every day if I could. My friend ordered their Italian imported chocolate gelato, she did regret not trying the melon gelato, but she didn't process it in time, melon...gelato, she almost thought they meant it was sorbet.
author: Kimberly S.

description: Fabulous food!!!!!!!!!! One of the best Italian restaurants I've been too. I only wish the service was as good. Our server was nice enough. He wasn't the friendliest though. There was a woman server who was just not very pleasant though. If you hate your job then you might not want to stick around. It shows. I did give 3 stars because the food is amazing.
author: Erica N.

description: I did not enjoy my meal at this restaurant. I found it overpriced and the food was bland. We ordered the Parmigiana (it was like three piece of eggplant for $12) and the Gnocchi Verdi.
author: Jenn F.

description: Had an amazing birthday dinner here! The gnocchi was so mouth watering. It literally felt like it was melting in my mouth! I had the Pecorino wine with my dinner and wasn't disappointed. They brought a cute dessert out with a candle for me to blow out as well! Super impressed. Loved the ambiance of the place. Would go again!
author: Lauren L.

description:
It was great but not amazing. With so much Italian around, I'm being a bit tougher on this place than most. You've really gotta stack up if you're gonna get 4 stars from me. 

Bella is a great date spot with nice low lighting and an attentive staff. Felt special, and prices for pasta were mostly under $20. Best of the 3 we got was the Carbonara - made with no butter or cream. It was juicy, thick and a hefty portion. The egg was a perfect consistency and made it feel authentic. 

I wanted to try the Gnocchi Verde but it was off the menu the night we went. Will try to go back for it sometime. Looks right up my alley.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Service was great, food was delicious and ambiance was cute & romantic. The server was very nice, gave us bruschetta while we wait for the food and strawberry panna cotta for dessert (which were both really good).

I ordered the squid ink spaghetti with seafood. Pasta was al dente and very flavorful. Seafood tasted fresh. It's very refreshing to have a great Italian restaurant in the Richmond district without having to go all the way across the city to North Beach.
author: Linda L.

description: This is a small place but fantastic for an authentic Italian place......I will come back for sure believe me
author: William C.

description: We tried 5 different dishes and they were all amazing. Was hoping to try the bone marrow but it wasn't available. They gave us some complimentary dessert that was amazing as well. The service was great and the ambiance was nice. Definitely will be returning here more often.
author: Truc L.

description:
Made a reservation for a little friend date on a Saturday. When we got there there was definitely a line so make sure you make a reservation!
Service was very attentive. My friend ordered the special of the night, the beef ragu and I got the butternut squash ravioli.
Both dishes were really good, although the raviolis were too sweet for me. We finished with the panna cotta which were really good.
Will definitely come back here again. Overall, really good homemade italian food.
author: Ngan B.

description: The pasta was delicious, as was the salad and burrata appetizers we had.  We had the frutti de mare and carbona, both were outstanding.  Food comes out pretty quickly, and the space is pretty tiny so I'd suggest getting a reservation.  Service was a little slow to start, but then quite attentive.  Dessert was fine, but nothing out of the world.  We'll definitely come back the next time we have a pasta craving!
author: Michelle C.

description: Delicious food, great service and cozy ambiance. Shared the gnocchi verdi and squid ink spaghetti with pork with my husband. Also shared the bruschetta to start. Such a gem in the Richmond! We will definitely come back.
author: Teresa K.

description:
Great find for dinner courtesy of Yelp!  

This place isn't super big, but we were not stuffed in there on top of one another.  the service is warm and welcoming.  I've got to say that the bread they bring to the table is absolutely life changing!  Nothing fancy about it, but it is soft and complements all of their dishes.

We tried the arancini, meatballs, and large antipasto appetizer.  They were all great, but the meatballs were definitely the one dish we would order again hands down.

Their evening specials all sound delicious and I am sure they are tasty as well.  The minestrone soup is great.  

I will agree with the other reviewers, the panna cotta is a winner.  It is creamy and full of flavor.  The portions are plentiful and this dessert is great to share.  

I would advise making reservations.  There is a bar, but tables seem to be hard to come by.
author: Lauren R.

description:
Skip this one folks. Gnocchi were made with rice flour rendering them more soggy than soft. Damn gluten free Mafia ruining it for the rest of us. The killer is the crappy cheap frozen farmed shrimp they use. For the prices they charge the shrimp should be fresh and wild caught. 
The staff were very sweet. The lack of stars is no reflection on them and is for the poor food.
author: Jamie L.

description: Really disappointed. Got the gnocchi Verdi which was good but we waited until the entire clientele changed at the restaurant and everyone seated after us got their food before we got ours.  On top of that, we were strongly recommended a special + $6 prawns that we ordered and found really bland. We didn't eat it and didn't ask to wrap it so the server took the entire dish back but we were not asked if we wanted to replace it or have it taken off the bill. Pretty bummed. Hefty bill for poor service and food we didn't really even eat.
author: J P.

description: I had been craving pasta all week and this restaurant certainly satisfied that craving! I got the rigatoni sausage and was literally scraping the sauce off the plate it was so good. They brought out bruschetta on the house and our waiter was personable and made us feel like family.
author: Emily W.

description:
I was the first to arrive at a birthday party of 9. I was asked to wait at the bar next door and that the host would direct people there until everyone arrived. It was awkward being the only girl at a bar, but thankfully my other friend showed up pretty quickly. 

Wait wasn't too bad since we made reservations. We were served soft bread with olive oil, which was delicious. I was careful not to eat too much bread since i knew pasta was going to be very filling. I got the carbonara, which was DELICIOUS (I would recommend... very simple, 3 ingredients, but the flavor was so amazing). This is a pricier restaurant were dishes are $17-25/plate before tax + tip, so I would consider this a more high-end, date night/special occasion place. With one entree and one sangria, my bill was almost $40 with tax + tip for myself alone. However, every single person at the table raved about their food, and since we had all gotten different items, I would agree that the price is worth the quality of food. 

My only complaints are the small waiting space, which hey, it is SF right? Small spaces. And that the food took a long time to order. However, we were a big party and the food tasted so fresh, I'm sure everything was prepared carefully. 

Would go back again for a birthday or anniversary, but I can't afford to come here as a weekly dinner.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Arrived for lunch to an empty room on a rainy weekday. The young Italian waiter was easy going and offered us tastings of 3 of his red wines. Lunch is very much an abbreviated menu with mostly soup, salads and pastas. There is one meat  and one fish dish only. None of those great sound veal dishes and the like that you'll find on the dinner menu. We all had a glass of wine with a complimentary  antipasti plate small but enough to keep us going till the food arrived 20 minutes later. Three dishes 1-  daily fish was trout with spinach, de-boned , easy to eat and clean, great for lean meal. 2- Seafood clams, squid, mussels, spaghetti simple, fresh ingredients, cooked just right 3- the hands down winner was the gnocchi in tomato sausage sauce, absolutely silky smooth just melted in your mouth. That alone is worth the visit and the 5 stars.
Dessert was panacotta ringed with berries also excellent as was the spumoni gelato. The interior was on the dark side kind of cozy place, seating maybe 50 or so. Good for a date night. I can imagine it getting pretty busy at dinner on weekends. Bring your parking fairy, as parking in the Clement st. neighborhood is horrendous.
author: Aaron Z.

description: I extremely enjoyed dinner here. I've always had it book marked and the BF and I finally went last night. Who would have thought a cute little Italian restaurant would be located here?!?! We got the cabornera and the lasagna and both were exceptionally delicious. I would have never thought this would even rank up there w my favorite restaurant in north each but it does!!!! Unfortunately the lasagna isn't offered ever night. The server said they try to place it on the menu at least once a week (closer) to the weekends since it takes about 5-6 hours just to cook the meat! For dessert, I tried the penna cotta but this I wasn't such a big fan of. However, this won't prevent me from returning! Great food! I really enjoyed it.
author: Cheryl V.

description: Never disappointed coming here and bringing new people here is a sure thing they will love it.   Cozy, intimate, great service and food....I love this place!
author: CR L.

description: I'm still in shock by how unprofessional the staff is here.  First off, we were enjoying the bread and then one of the servers comes and takes away the plates we were eating the bread off of to make way for the entrees that he said were coming shortly but arrived 15 minutes later.  He failed to ask if we would like to keep the plates and retrieved them at lightening speed.  Then our entrees arrived and all was well until dessert.  We were celebrating a birthday and ordered a Panna Cotta.  They added a candle and sang happy birthday.  Then, we noticed the two tables surrounding us declined dessert and both received COMPLIMENTARY Panna Cottas while we were charged for ours! While I don't at all expect desserts to be complimentary for birthdays, this circumstance was completely ludicrous.  Why would you comp desserts for people who decline it but not for a table celebrating a birthday?  Even if we weren't celebrating anything, it is awfully unprofessional to openly give complimentary items to select tables in front of others who don't receive it. They sure know how to leave a horrible impression on their customers with such simple thoughtless acts. Maybe it's unfair to say this about their entire staff - make sure you don't get the redhead with the tattoos as your waitress.  But who knows, you may get lucky and catch her when she's momentarily feeling sensible.
author: Michele L.

description: A neighborhood treasure...I have eaten here three times and enjoyed the fresh, layered favors of each morsel eaten.  Last night I ordered well.  The Cotteletta with Arugala topping....our family shared the antipasti platter and we topped the dining experience off with Pane cotta and biscotti.  Bravo.  The staff is wonderful...allowing you to enjoy your meal...no rushing...friendly and attentive.
author: Nancy M.

description:
My girlfriend and I were looking for a nice restaurant on a Thursday night at 7pm and we managed to get the very last table at Bella. The table was by the door and it was a cold and windy night, so I was disgruntled, however the hostess made a point of closing the door and curtain every time a new diner entered the restaurant, which was a pleasant surprise.

I ordered the pasta carbonara and my friend ordered the spinach gnocchi both of which were very rich but delicious.  We also shared an appetizer of delightful bruschetta.  We decided to pass on dessert but they brought us a strawberry pannacotta gratis.  The chef and hostess were both charming and attentive and I will definitely be returning!
author: Virginia T.

description:
I can't believe I wanted to go to Emmy's Spaghetti Shack tonight before discovering this place on Yelp...Thanks to my fellow Yelpers and their awesome reviews.

I wanted Italian food in a non-pretentious environment and that's exactly what I got and then a bucket of wangs....I was worried I wasn't dressed appropriately to dine here since I was wearing a red flannel, leggings, knee high boots and the hubby was wearing a white tee, jeans, and vans but they didn't make us feel one bit out of place. 

When you're inside, you forget you're even on Geary Blvd. No joke! Oh, and did I mention they have THEE BEST Italian food I've ever had!! A huge plus was the atmosphere....It's romantic in a casual way, the lighting and the music puts you at ease, it's pretty amazing here. 

Whatever you get, finish off the meal with the panna cotta....trust me.
author: Nicole S.

description:
What a great meal, so why not 5 start, hold on.

We have been wanting to go here for some time. So we are there, early evening on a Sunday night, we place an order for a house wine and sangria, both really, really nice, nothing special, just a nice house fruity red that compliments Italian food like Italian wine should be, and a really good sangria fresh fruit and all.

Next is the antipasto plate, this was very good and also a great deal, roasted veggies, cheese, olives, salami, small salad, and all very well seasoned and in abundance. Went perfect with the wine. Great way to start any meal.

Then comes the why, why, why moment, they bring bread and a dipping sauce to the table, really bad bread, i could care less about a dipping sauce. Being Italian, bread is a religion, need a nice hard crust, crumbs, big holes in the middle, substantial. This was like white bread, soft, uninspiring crust, etc.

Next up was our entrees, I like simple Italian food, real Italian food. I got a linguini plate with sausage, truffle butter/oil, and bread crumbs, it was great, just perfect. Across the table the lady had the papardelle with a pork ragu, sounds simple enough, but when something is made perfect, it is a wonderful thing. OUTSTANDING ENTREES

Desert, we shared a pana cotta with a balsamic glaze and fresh fruit, man was that good, a perfect way to end a meal. (that makes a perfect start and perfect ending)

For me 5 stars is a perfect meal, a simple warm crusty bread and we are at a 5, no bread and we are probably at a 5.

Go here for a great meal and tell them before ordering, please skip the bread. I'm going back and that's what I am doing
author: DJ D.

description: I love this place for a tasty authentic Italian meal and a good value (and cute place). If you find yourself in the inner Richmond and not doing Asian I highly recommend.
author: Janice C.

description: Yeah..this place is great. First time here and will definitely be back with friends for a couples night. Great place for a date. Great service and food. Staff was very friendly and helpful if you aren't sure what to order.
author: Carlos P.

description:
I'm so glad that Nizario's Pizza just a store down was closed because then I would have never walked through the french doors of Bella Trattoria!

The host (who was also our waiter) was friendly, the food was absolutely delicious, and the desserts were awesome!

I ordered the butternut squash ravioli and the panna cotta.. It definitely hit the spot on a cold, rainy San Francisco day.

Oh, and the host was super cool!  After he saw me taking pictures, he wanted to make sure that the panna cotta was photo worthy--the strawberry fell off and he place it back on top!  

l
author: Vira P.

description:
Who knew that such an adorable Italian restaurant was sandwiched between my regular shit-show-eries, Ireland's 32 and Buckshot? Great date spot, for that reason.

I used to live in the neighborhood and had driven past here plenty of times. Maybe even looked it up online once or twice. But had not ventured inside until recently. Well, thank goodness I finally did.

This place is fantastic, from the ambiance, to the staff, to the food itself.

Things we ate:
A burratta appetizer of sorts. I mean, you can't go wrong with cheese.
Brussel sprouts with pancetta. OH LORDY. So good. I shouldn't write this while i'm hungry.
Gnocci. 2 of my dinner mates had the gorgonzola version, while one had a tomato sauce one. All were pleased.
Rigatoni with sausage. Again, so good.

At the end, we were gifted with a dessert, on the house. SO nice, especially since we assumed we had been loud and obnoxious. Apparently, it was more loud and adorable.

I think I'll take my parents here sometime!
author: Nora S.

description:
How does Bella Trattoria manage to stay Italian food's best kept secret in San Francisco? Being in a neighborhood where no one would expect to find a good Italian restaurant certainly helps. But free corkage if you bring your own bottle of wine on a Monday through Wednesday night? I know the Inner Richmond is a venture for some, but come on people... where ya gonna find a place like that in North Beach, huh?

I've been here a handful of times and can vouch for the consistently good food and service. The staff are friendly and encourage slow-paced, leisurely dining. The menu seems very traditionally Italian (with the numerous course thing going on) and incorporates quality local ingredients. Last time I tried the San Marzano tomato soup (*brings fingers of right hand together and smooches them up, all Italian-like*) and the gluten free penne in a sausage cream sauce. The ravioli and gnocchi have also been delicious, and one day I have promised myself to try the risotto.

From what I can recall, the interior of the place has undergone some changes over the years. It used to be a little kitschier, but more recently they've decided to play up a classier, trendier vibe--and the sexy ambiance works for sure! Finally, I'd say the prices are pretty reasonable for a nice Italian restaurant. Really, what more could you ask for?

I'm still a bit surprised whenever I come here and there aren't more customers. Though I'd love to see this place blow up since they do such a great job, I suppose it's sort of nice to avoid the crowd. So now that the secret is out, come here... but please, try to keep it on the down low, eh? Mille grazie!

**Sidenote:  Careful to not confuse with Bella PIZZA, the takeout Italian greasy spoon a couple of blocks further down Geary.**
author: Kate V.

description: This was the best Italian food I can ever remember having. I got the pasta norcina and it was amazing. He got the lasagna which was also delicious - though we liked mine better. Even the bread they served before the meal was great. The service was decent and they brought us a complimentary dessert which was very tasty. It's going to be difficult to eat other Italian food after this - it will be hard for anything else to live up to it.
author: McKenzie H.

description: Taste, service ambiance are all superb if im not wrong i think their noodles are home made and it is just amazingly good i would definitely recommend this place for a nice dinner or lunch date for people who have an appetite for real Italian cooking btw did i mention they serve real gelato from italy i just thought i should put it out there tipppp they're only open for lunch every friday and i recommend to make reservation for dinner for this place get really busy at night time
author: Allan A.

description: Went back, and the parking is just as bad as ever.  Fortunately, I now have a Smartcar, and found a spot (a Cadillac Escalade was trying to park in the spot as I left, with much horn blowing from others). The service is much better, although oddly enough, the server seemed to indicate there was again a typo on the menu. The gnocchi, both varieties, were excellent.  The salmon crostini was superb as well.  My wife had artichokes, which had an off flavor to me, though she enjoyed them.  The experience again falls short of five stars.  This time we were seated cheek by jowl with another couple.  She seemed to be dressed like Minnie Mouse and was up talking at about 95 decibels. We passed on dessert once again, and once again enjoyed the complimentary panne cotta.  Perhaps not the restaurant's fault, but if I had only been a foot farther away, it might have been tolerable.
author: Gene B.

description:
Made a reservation an hour before on a Friday night for date night, was accommodated quickly and greeted by the friendliest servers upon our arrival!

The food was good, but a little pricey for a small amount of food. My boyfriend and I both ordered the carbonara which was so good, it made the price worth it!
author: Jennifer B.

description:
One of my new year's resolutions is to get back on my A-game when it comes to writing reviews. It has been FOREVER AND A DAY since I have. And I miss it.
Thus, this review reaches you weeks, months, but not yet years overdue.

I met my date here on a Friday night. Cute, quaint, dark restaurant that allows you to bring in your own bottle of wine. Little did my date know that I was severely allergic to red wine- but I suppose its the thought that counts...Unless this was an attempt at landing me in the ER. :)

Before seated, we were offered free glasses of sparkling wine while waiting at the bar. The wait staff were extremely friendly and treated us as guests (as opposed to simply customers) and smiled politely while we were indecisive with our ordering. While I enjoyed my meal (Arrabbiata) it didn't stand out as a "clear winner." 

I'd go back for the ambience and the staff, but I'm not sure I'd rush.
author: Annalise F.

description: The food here was fantastic. Very nice, cozy atmosphere and the staff was very pleasant. The only downside is how tiny the place is and the wait for food to come out. If I only had a limited amount of time to be there, I wouldn't have been so happy, but the food made up for it.
author: Hashim J.

description: This is probably one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco, def for Italian food. It's a super small/quaint place, great for date night. The service is always great. The owner always comes by to greet us, even during our first and second visits before they knew us, and always gave us free dessert. Our favorite is their chicken pasta with sun dried tomatoes. Not sure if it's still on the menu but I'm pretty sure they still make it if you ask. Everything else has not been disappointing so you can't go wrong!
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Great little italian spot.
New menu daily (generally has the same stuff but ingredients get mixed around)

Little overpriced but, tasty nonetheless..
Handmade Mozarella makes caprese salad a must

Lasagna if its on the menu - is different(and i say that in a good way) but very good..
Gnocci is delicious.

Make a reservation to spare yourself any wait..

Kind of random location but it's a hidden treat for the italian fix.
author: Naveed B.

description: If you are looking for a authentic Italian restaurant this is the place to try! Easy to make a reservation in a Monday night. We actually were running late so had to call in and change the time. The restaurant was very understanding and was able to accommodate our request. Definitely recommend their meatball appetizer and their red sauce pasta. Gnocchi was a bit softer then how I like it but I must say am absolutely impressed with their service! Super friendly and they checked in with you often during your meal. To top it off they even gave us a flan dessert on the house :) will come back on my next visit for sure!
author: Mimi T.

description:
3 1/2 stars. Cute little place on the corner. Never tried until now. 

Service was pretty slow for the place being pretty empty. Food wasn't bad, but I had way better Italian food elsewhere. 

Grilled Meatballs, Eggplant-Tomato Caponata-these were tiny, but tender. Too many other veges that came with it. 

Roasted Veal Bone Marrow, Grilled Levain, Parsley Caper Salad-not bad. I love the capers it comes with. Not a fan of bone marrow, but this was one of the better ones

Squid Ink Spaghetti, Prawns, Calamari, Mussels, Manila Clams, Tomato Sughetto-my friend ordered this and I thought it was pretty good

I got the special, which was some pork ragu pasta. It was yummy, but I wanted to add mushrooms. They said the specials you aren't allow to change anything. Umm........ok. Was it that hard to add mushrooms to it?
author: Karen H.

description:
Oh the benefits of getting wine spilled all over me.....

My girlfriend and I picked this place as a late night find because it got raving reviews on Yelp and we would get 1,000 points for dining. Seemed like a win-win and I was excited to eat some delicious Italian food.

We ended up getting to the restaurant 30 minutes prior to our reservation and they couldn't seat us, so we went to the bar and ordered a bottle of wine. 

My girlfriend didn't care for the bottle I picked out, so we attempted to try some others and then exchange it. He said he would have to ask his manager...

The bartender then accidently spilled my glass of wine all over me. I used to work in restaurants so I know he was more embarrassed than I was and he profusely apologized. However my shirt was pretty much ruined, but I didn't really care. Cue the free food!

Of course he then exchanged the bottle right away and brought us out free bruschetta and gave me his card for any dry cleaning costs. 

We were then seated shortly after. From the reviews I read on Yelp, I expected more out of the food. We ordered the Brussels sprouts appetizer and it seemed overcooked, yet tasty. The entrees were just okay. Overall the food didn't live up the hype and I was expecting more comp'd stuff after my shirt got ruined, but oh well. It was a fun experience with decent Italian food.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Walked in for dinner on a Saturday after looking for an Italian place with great reviews that wouldn't break the bank. We were asked by the front desk if we had reservations, we did not. He went to the back and said, you know what, that table is finishing up, give me a few minutes and ill seat you. YAY. 

I was with two vegetarians, and they actually had vegetarian dishes. YAY2. They sold us on an appetizer, the brochette, and though I would not pay $13 for 4 tiny pieces of bread again...i don't regret it :) I forgot what my entree was, but it was a little salty for my taste HOWEVER i tried my friend gnocchi and it was THE BEST IVE EVER HAD. Super fluffy. Also, the portions might appear on the smaller side, however they are very filling and will leave you contently full.  The pasta dished were all under $20 YAY3.

Oh and the waiter/host? made small talk with us and it seemed genuinely friendly. Basically this place is great, sort of affordable even for broke college students, delicious (AGAIN TRY THE GNOCCHI) and the ambiance is fantastic; we were casual but you could totally come here on a romantic date and it has a really authentic feel.
author: Jes V.

description: Food is good, but the waiting for dinner is.....price little higher but food is good so no complains.
author: Jiunn C.

description: great service, great food thats reasonably priced, perfect for groups maybe not dates cause it is loud
author: Peter H.

description:
This was a really perfect meal in every regard. The atmosphere is nice, calm, sorta low light and relaxing in a good way.

The owner ? Maitre'd ? was right at the door, welcoming everyone and supervising the service.

We had a truly delicious eggplant parma appetizer, then two pasta dishes, one a meat sauce pasta, and one a carbonara pasta. Both were superb. The house red wine was very good also.

Dessert was panna cotta, sort of a flan, also excellent.

Everything went perfectly and was great. Highly recommended.
author: Richard T.

description: Super frikkin slow. Be prepared to wait eight hours. If you're gluten free, they have some options , but whatever you do, don't order tomato sauce on the side, or you will be charged $3 for two tablespoons of sauce. If you're going on a date, don't expect to kiss for three days , you both will reek of garlic. Yes, food is stinky and full of garlic. I will give one star since I can't give less. The female hostess will stay silent and standoffish the whole time you're there.
author: EatVegetarian F.

description:
I ate dinner there last night after driving by hundreds of times. I had the spinach gnocchi with the creamy sauce.  That gnocchi was the lightest, pillow like gnocchi I've ever had in my life. Amazing flavor and amazing texture.

My dining companion had the butternut squash ravioli, it was absolutely delicious, very sweet and very tender. 

On my must return to list, well worth the hassle of parking, give it a try folks, you won't be disappointed.
author: Jon D.

description:
This place is amazing! I brought one of my close girl friends here for her birthday. The atmosphere was very dark and romantic but my friend and I still had a great time. They even gave us a free dessert because of her birthday! The service was great except it took a while for them to bring us our beer & wine. We already finished our basket of bread so I think our server probably forgot? Oh well.. I would love to come back on a date night sometime :)

P.S. - This place is small so you may want to make a reservation!
author: Stephanie N.

description:
The 5 stars are for the food, the service and the experience. I don't expect a restaurant to make substitutions for me...I go to have the experience they've worked hard to present to the world. Otherwise, it's a bit like buying a book and getting angry that the author won't edit it for you. 

Came here by accident as we were staying in a neighborhood airbnb location. It was on a weekend, even though we didn't have reservations, luckily it was a bit early in the evening and they were able to fit us in. The restaurant has that typically San Francisco feel, longer and a bit narrow with a banquet on one side and tables in the rest. With dark walls, a lovely mural and a small bar in the back, it's the perfect place for either a romantic dinner or a family night (assuming your kids are well behaved). Our waitress seemed italian and was well trained. 

At most restaurants we usually just place our dinner orders and eat...but for some reason, we ended up slowly working our way through the menu starting with their aperitif cocktails - refreshing and a great way to start an evening. We then ordered the Antipasto plate which comes with veggies, meat, cheese and olives. Since then we've tried the warm Spinach salad (I'm not wild about spinach...but this was very tasty) and the meatballs which also were good. 

For dinner I had to laugh at the "La Vera Carbonara" which proudly states "no cream, no butter" because I completely agree - Carbonara is not alfredo with bacon! The "cream" quality is supposed to come from cooking the raw egg with the warmth of the cooked pasta just as it comes out of the pot! So, I had to order it and it tasted great - strong comfort food. They don't make their own pasta, but they do have a place that makes it for them - it has a light, delicate quality to it. That first night my husband tried the Frutt E Mar, which is the squid ink spaghetti - for a foodie, I'm a bit of a wimp - but it was soooo good - tasted like the sea, fresh and a bit salty. We've since tried the Gnocchi and the Arribbiata, which were both very good. I suppose if we were doing a true italian dinner we would have then had a full Piatto Principale - but the pasta is always so good, we have never tried them. 

We've gone back several times and had a lovely time each evening. I recommend reservations.
author: A M.

description:
I left here last night at 9:30 pm and Im writing a review first thing in the morning - probably enough said, right there...

I have eaten here three times now, had different things each time, and loved everything - this place is tops for Italian in SF, in my opinion - only thing that comes close is Albona (Istrian)

last night all 4 diners were soaking up the last drops of jous on our plates w/ bread - after multiple apps and large entrees  - food is that good - my wife hates raw meat and loved the carpaccio - our friend who doesnt like fish polished off a whole trout... I could go on but yall get the point

service was great, too 

total bill for 3 apps bottle of wine 4 mains tax + generous tip was 225 - and you eat like royalty

plus they comped a panna cotta when we declined desert b/c too full - gone in 10 seconds - guess there is a second desert stomach
author: Mark B.

description:
I dined here with my mom and daughter. The appetizer special was a salad caprese & we shared that. The tomatoes were sweet & the balsamic vinegar that they topped it with was a nice compliment. The mozzarella however was nothing to write home about. We also ordered the mixed olives and I found them mushy. 
For entrees my mom had the pork osso bucco special that she said was tender & delicious. My three year old had rigatoni with sausage & peas. She devoured it!  I had the clam dish with their gluten-free pasta. The clams & calamari were sweet & tender with a nice garlicky sauce and the pasta was cooked pretty well too. My only complaint is that the GF pasta was rotini (corkscrew) and not the best choice for the dish. If I'd known I'd likely have chosen something different. 
For dessert we shared the gelato. The taste was good, but there were a few icy bits.   
I'll give this place another try. The food pretty good and I think they have potential.
author: Heather S.

description:
ok. SO...this USED to be good.

I've been here 3 times. 

1st time was for Junior Prom...food was great and service was even better--they served a party of 20 here and this place is SMALL! 

RSVP is highly RECOMMENDED.

2nd time was GIRL's Night with a few besties..I had a 3 sample entree which consisted of 3 different dishes in portions.. it was SOOO GOOD! One of the dish included was a ravioli with a VERY DELICIOUS sauce! I licked every bit of the sauce off that plate.

3rd and last time..went here for an early dinner with a few girlies. I decided to try something new..had Linguine lamberni? somthing like that...NO FLAVOR. it looked and presented really delicious...but NO. I could've made better.

My friend had a squid ink risotto..and the risotto was UNDERCOOKED. The waiter sensed there was something wrong so my friend told him..they re-cooked it..and this time it was soft and "risotto-like". 

service was OK..since it was only my party and another small party that was there. 

not sure if they switched chefs...but yeah..the food was bland. SORRY
author: Sarah F.

description:
We had a wonderful meal here after our reservation at Mescolanza was not honored (due to mescolanza's disorganization).  We (a party of 5) were seated immediately at around 8 pm on a Saturday night. 

The service was just excellent and attentive.  They made a penne and meatball dish off the menu for our 3 year old. The adults enjoyed the gnocchi (exceptional), rigatoni, nightly special (both excellent), and lasagna (so-so). They even gave us a complimentary panna cotta dessert. The entrees were a bit slow to come out but they noted/made up for this by giving us some small appetizers. 

Overall, good food and excellent service = five stars. Thanks Bella restaurant.
author: S. H.

description:
Very charming restaurant. went with the husband, our 2yr old, and his visiting family. Service was timely, extensive wine selection and recommendations, and a warm intimate environment. We all enjoyed our meals although the portions were on the smaller size.  
The food:
-salmon and caviar pasta: very good
-lasagna: very flavorful and didn't cause a "gut punch"
-beef Carpaccio
-Brussels sprouts: a bit disappointing. they were sautéed with pancetta and not very flavorful
-butternut squash pasta: great flavor and a light sauce

All-in-all this is a nice little local joint that I would head back to and recommend to anyone that is looking for relaxing and intimate dinner for a date night or dinner with friends
author: Shayla D.

description: My girlfriend and I went here for her birthday and it was great. There is something about the Italian style ambiance that makes for a great date night. The restaurant was extra nice about giving us a free appetizer and dessert even though we didn't order anything to round out our meal. For our main dishes, I ordered the pasta carbonara and she got a tomato gnocci dish. Both of us enjoyed our meals very much. I especially enjoyed my meal because the sauce was healthier than the typical sauce.
author: Alex A.

description:
I made a reservation here for Boyfriend's dinner since he loves Italian food. It's on the corner of Geary between 4th and 2nd Avenue - it's easy to pass so keep your eyes open. I loved the fact that they have house made pastas - it's always better when the chefs put more effort and love into their dishes. 

We ordered the baked polenta, Pasta Norcina, and Frutt' 'E Mar. I liked the Pasta Norcina the best - it is so filling so unless you're a Starvin' Marvin you'll probably be taking some leftovers home. The Frutt' 'E Mar was a little too seafoody for me, but that's the point of it and it seems to be a favorite after reading Yelp reviews. They serve bread with a delicious red pepper olive oil dip which the boyfriend devoured. 

When I made the reservation I noted that it was the boyfriend's birthday - at the end of the meal our server brought out a panna cotta with fresh fruit and a lit candle on it. It was nice of them to remember and bring out a complimentary dessert.
author: Tina F.

description: The pasta had nice flavors. However, we ordered gnocchi and it came out watery and much too soft. It's not expensive, but the food was pretty mediocre.
author: M B.

description:
Not a fan of italian food, but i enjoyed my meal here! 

bruschetta- loved it
eggplant parmesan- it was good, but pricey. $12 for 3 slices of eggplant
gnocchi verde- not used to this, kind of mushy, kind of cheesey. 
chicken sundried tomato rigatoni (forgot the name of this dish, maybe carbonara [?] idk).- loved it. not too heavy, not too saucy. very tasty.

Took our sweet time for most of the meal cause the restaurant wasn't too packed on a wednesday night. but at the near end of our dinner, we had to rush to leave. The server still gave us a complimentary panna cotta. and i LOVE panna cotta! Thank you bella! 

planning to bring the BF here cause he loves italian. and planning to bring all my loved ones here to give it a try.
author: Tina S.

description:
What a great place!

Very authentic Italian food. Warm, cozy and inviting atmosphere. The service was great, and even the servers were authentic Italian! My friend and I had a great booth seat, but no seat in the house is bad. Plenty of window side seating as well. The service was fast, wine list was good. The only downside was having to ask what items were, as everything is titled in Italian, but the servers are passionate about their food and are delighted to explain. Water glass was always full. Very attentive. Food was very fresh, pasta hand made. Just can't say enough about this place!

Definitely a go!
author: Josefa H.

description:
ok ok 
We asked the waiter what his favorite menu item was. I joked that he would say everything is good. he looked hurt. 

I have to tell you EVERYTHING we ordered was very good .  now I can't say great but really close . 

I wanted bigger portions !!!

the flavors were spot on!  this reminded me of being at my Italian neighbors home out in the burbs.   

I wish it were closer to my house in the mission .. maybe not I cuz I would eat here a lot n my waist would show it!!

GREAT SHOWING tonight folks yumm!
author: patrick d.

description: This restaurant is amazing. The host/waiters are extremely nice and helpful. Their fresh bread comes with sun dried tomatoes with oil and it was so good, me and my bf had three rounds (the last one because the waitress suggested it would go good with the pasta sauce which tasted amazing btw) The waiter told us the chef hooked us up with free bruschetta which was pretty tasty, the bruschetta wasn't hard at all as most of the bruschettas I've had, the bread was way too hard/crunchy. My bf got the Sorrentina and I highly recommend it. The gnocchi was soft, and the sauce was so good. I got the Baked pasta but I was pretty disappointed. The flavor was all eh, and I got kind of sick of it. The chef also hooked us up with free panna cotta and that was good, it was my first time having it. Overall, I didn't like my dish, but the service, the hookups, and my bf pasta made me love it.
author: Amanda B.

description:
I love this place! Delicious Italian food (last time I left with a stomach ache because I couldn't. Stop. Eating.) The atmosphere is warm and romantic. Just be sure to make reservations, it's not a large place and it fills up quickly! 
*also, it's a great place to celebrate! My honey and I came here for dinner the night we got engaged*
author: Lauren B.

description:
A great go to for the neighborhood! Very friendly staff - overall the service is excellent. I ordered just the antipasto (large) and was warned it was very big, so the waiter asked if I wanted the small. Always impressed with suggestions like that! The small was more than enough for a meal.

A bit on the expensive side, but I've never been disappointed. Would be great of there were some more non pasta or meat options. Only one fish dish on the menu. Probably wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but it's perfect for a quiet evening when I just want to stay in the Richmond!
author: Sharon R.

description: I didn't know what I ate, but the server gave us good recommendation and I  ended up having a fantastic meal. Love this place!!!
author: Kitye L.

description: Wow! This place is wonderful! It's obviously date night so we decided to go after reading reviews on Yelp. This is the place you'd wanna go for dates. The wait staff treats you so wonderfully. Not to mention the food! My favorites here are the squid ink spaghetti and we had something of the specials. So yummy you can't go wrong here. On top of that they give you an awesome pana cotta.
author: Julie N.

description:
This place is great - I'm hesitant to write a review as I don't want others to find our wonderful little secret. :-)

Atmosphere is intimate and very romantic with candles. Restaurant is pretty small, which works well here.

It's really extra special if you are gluten-free, they make gluten-free pasta. I took both my fiancée's mom and friend (one who has celiac disease, one who is gluten-free) and both loved it. 

I love the minestrone, gnocchi, Burrata, salads and bread. Everything is reasonably priced too! Service is also very good. Once we came and our table wasn't ready (we had to wait 20+ minutes), but they gave each of the 4 of us half glasses of champagne once we finally sat, which was a nice gesture.
author: Farrah L.

description:
WOW! Anyone who said you have to go to North Beach for GREAT italian food! We went in with a normal expectation of good food. This place was amazing. My husband had a craving for italian food, I'm usually not one to enjoy pasta. 

The service was excellent. We came in early in the service, about 15 minutes after they opened. We were greeted by a nice hostess and seated right away. The server came shortly after and told us the daily specials. We ordered our drinks and reviewed the menu.

We ordered the daily special of mussels, clams, prawns in a red sauce. It was awesome! We would get that again. Entree's I ordered the 3 ingredient carbonara. My husband ordered the Gnocchi Verdi. Both dishes were amazing! Again, I'm not a fan of pasta, but the carbonara could be a dish I would crave for! The Gnocchi was soft and almost melts in your mouth. By far one of the best gnocchi's Ive ever had.

We can't say enough about the service! We will be back again!
author: Pei P.

description:
This is a pretty cozy place tucked in a corner on Geary across from a Burger King. The inside is dimly lit. Classy yet homey. But OMG, that night somebody was really ripping it; the whole restaurant reeked like fart.

Upon our server's recommendation, we ordered their Gnocchi Verdi and Carbonara. Both pasta were delicious; very buttery, creamy, and flavorful. All those pasta are homemade; you can really taste the difference. We liked the Carbonara more because the noodles (fettuccine) were more firm whereas the gnocchi were more like mochi dumplings. The gnocchi paired with the creamy sauce was a little too "rich" for me. Portion was just right and you almost wish you'd had room for more. 

Our server was very friendly and helpful. On top of providing us great service, he also gave us a free dessert. He said, "you can't end a Sunday without dessert." How sweet. The dessert was some kind of citrus-ee custard almost like a flan but firmer and a bit more gelatinous. It was rich and creamy and (of course) delicious.

I can't wait to go back!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
A quaint low-lit romantic Italian Bistro with quite delicious food. 

The Polenta appetizer was really good, more soft and fluffy then most I have had which was a refreshing change. An excellent Tiramisu for dessert, without a overbearing taste of coffee that sometimes shows its dominating presence.

Main course pastas were good, very subtle flavors, nothing that over powered u with cheese or sauce. But on the flip side I felt there was excessive amount of olive oil in most dishes, I suppose in an effort to make up for the absence of gravy/sauce.

On the whole, an enjoyable dining experience, but definitely make reservations and give time to find parking.
author: Srinath L.

description: This place was excellent. We had a reservation for 8 at 10pm (thats what happens when you reserve last minute I guess) but they were able to accommodate. We started with the specialty appetizer of soppressata and burrata on crostini and the bruschetta-both were delicious but I have to say that was the best bruschetta i've ever had. For main course I chose the pasta with fennel sausage, bread crumbs and truffle butter-wow just wow. I don't see it on their menu online so they must have updated their menu but this was out of this world. They have a large variety of choices though and everyone got something different which they all raved about. Highly recommend this Italian spot, great experience
author: B P.

description:
Din. Food: 3/5
Eggplant parmigiana. 4
Tagliatelle with ragu. Too salty but great texture. 3.5
Butternut squash ravioli. Too sweet. Like candy. 2
Elderberry soda. Like cheap candy. 
Panna cotta with strawberries. Rubbery? 3
$100 for 2 post tip
author: Olivia Q.

description:
Cannot say enough about how much we have loved the 2 dining experiences we have had here. It is now on our list to top places to go for a great meal, great atmosphere, great service and a great night. Really fabulous food (the 4 -6 things we have had so far have all been excellent)

We look forward to going again and again.
author: Steve T.

description: We have been traveling in North America for two months, this is the first time we found garbage in the food, a piece  of shrinking (obviously caused by heat)plastic in the squid ink pasta, it's so frustrating that I don't want to eat Italian food even now. Think again if you decide to try this restaurant.
author: Liu G.

description:
Cute and cozy restaurant located in the inner richmond. Dim lighting, dark wood, and delicious italian food. Felt like the perfect atmosphere for date night. You can snag a last minute dinner reservation on Open Table. I recommend doing so.. i saw quite a few couples waiting at the bar for a table to open up as the evening passed by.

Everyone raves about their gnocchi. I found it far too soft and almost gummy in texture. It would stick to my teeth and in combination with the creamy sauce i couldn't eat too much. The polenta, on the other hand, is so good. We ordered the meatball appetizer and the combo felt so hearty and warming. My rigatoni was rich and indulgent. Cleaned that plate easily. 

When we had their attention it was spot on. They were mostly preoccupied the majority of the night though. Felt like the service was on and off but at full capacity i don't really mind.
author: Samantha L.

description:
Loved everything.

The ambiance is date perfect.  The service is excellent.

Then there's the food.  Amazing porkchop dish and best gnocchi I've ever had.  I love gnocchi and order it everywhere I go, including a lot of different upscale restaurants in downtown and in the Fidi.  This was by far the best I've had, they make it themselves.
author: Kay R.

description: Love this place!! The ambiance , the service and of course, the wine and food. I LOVE their eggplant parmigiana!! Try it!:) AND they just brought a surprise dessert!! How good is that??
author: Ruth P.

description:
The food I'd give 4.5 stars. The gnocchi and butternut squash ravioli were very good. They were presented on the plate very appetizing as well. I had the butternut squash--I wished there would've been more because I had to order dessert because I was still hungry. BTW, the tiramisu is great here!

Service was horrible. First off, I asked for a water as it was a surprisingly hot SF summer day. But because my friend and I both asked for waters, our server grimaced, turned his back and muttered loud enough for us to hear "or you could order a beer or something worth my time."

From there, I felt everyone approached us that worked there. I actually felt very smothered and uncomfortable because of it. I understand attentive service will get you a better tip, but having someone ask me how everything is tasting right after another person just asked me how everything is tasting, is a little overkill.

I don't know if they just too many servers on staff that night or if they were just bored, but I wouldn't go back because of the service no matter how good the food is.
author: Mandi W.

description:
Bad experience,

I ordered a pasta and it was delivered with the wrong type of noodle, the waiter explained that they were out of the noodle I ordered but they didn't offer me the option of changing my order, one of my friend's orders was messed up, and, worst of all, the waiter decided not to bring back my change (assumed tip) which cost him a larger tip and his restaurant a star or 2.
author: Spencer R.

description:
Simply Italian.  Great service, Great food. 

Bread and sundried tomato dip 
Spaghetti carbonara 
Butternut Squash ravioli
Slow cooked sparerib. 

Need to try next time Gnocchi
author: Denis K.

description:
Great place for a romantic date! 

We came in for an early dinner right when they opened. They greeted us warmly and seated us right away, then quickly brought out a complimentary bruchetta appetizer, which was yummy. They also brought out freshly baked bread (divine) and olive oil dip (not so much).  

The atmosphere is cozy and intimate. All the servers and assistants were very attentive and super friendly. 

The food was very good. I had the carbonara and my husband had some kind of pasta with Italian sausage (I can't remember). The carbonara was good but a little on the plain side. My husband absolutely devoured his dish. We really enjoyed the red wine they recommended as well.

And as a final bonus, they also gave us a complementary plate of panna cotta with fresh fruit dessert, which was amazing! 

We will definitely come back.
author: Tara M.

description: Very seldomly do you ever find a restaurant that has both great food and genuine exceptional service. This place has clearly taken the gold in both categories, I'm not much of a critic nor do I leave reviews, but believe me when I say you will not be let down at this establishment. The owner David was so genuine and professional in what he suggested and cared for all his customers. The dessert is to die for, must try all.
author: Luis Angel M.

description:
Came here with my lady for the first time last night.  While the food was delicious, I have to give it a 3 instead of a 5 because I experienced an allergic reaction to my food last night.  Our waitress, Denai(sp?) was a darling and was very understanding of my allergy, but somewhere between delivering these instructions to the kitchen and preparing my meal, something was lost/miscommunicated/forgotten.  That being said, the appetizers and main dishes were very well presented and tasty, but my evening was ruined (it is the next day and I am still recovering).  

We are willing to give Bella Trattoria and give them another shot, but hopefully I won't get sick and they will get a 5 the next time.
author: Mike D.

description:
With all the great restaurants in the city, I was glad I came across this place on yelp. It was a perfect fit for me and my friends. When we arrived, everything inside looked super dark so we thought the place was closed. Luckily we tried the door and were surprised to find a small and quaint little place. Lighting is extremely low so it would be a very romantic spot for a date. Tables have soft lighting from the candles. Noise level isn't too loud, although we had a large party next to us. 

Everything I ate here was delicious. I had a bad experience with gnocchi in the past and was glad I took a risk again to try it here. The gnocchi here was really good and was especially delicious since it was cooked in the ragu. I had the special and don't remember what it was called actually, but it was cooked in their slow cooked ragu. My friend had the gnocchi with sausage and the sauce for that dish was actually better. The menu changes all the time so I guess my unspecific review won't be detrimental to yelpers (hopefully). I just think everything here was tasty and you'd be safe ordering anything!

To top it off this wonderful dining experience, we were comped with some really good panna cotta! It was surprisingly light. 

Service was friendly. They were attentive, but left us alone for the most part.  I thought it was so cute that, at the end of the night, the entire staff sits together to have dinner. All this delicious food is laid out on the table and they just share everything with some wine. A very homey and family feel to this small place. You just know that people enjoy working at a place like this. And you always enjoy dining at a place people enjoy working at.
author: Kathy T.

description:
The best pasta you can find in SF. Hands down. Flavorful, rich, and delicious. 

Don't think, just go! 

Great for a date/ double-date!!!!!
author: Kathryn D.

description: Great cozy neighborhood place. Great, attentive staff. Fantastic food, even on New Years Eve prix fixe menu!
author: Jason P.

description: Good food. Good service. Good prices. Free dessert too. I recommend the bone marrow appetizer and salmon pasta.
author: Gilson C.

description:
Tried to come in on a Saturday one night around 6:15 and it was packed already. There were 2 tables left but I'm assuming they were for reservations. So we made reservations on a weekday but to our avail, there were lots of empty tables so we probably didn't even need a reservation. 

The restaurant is really small and cozy. With dim lighting and mini candles on your table.

They give you free bread with Olive oil and sun dried tomatoes dipping sauce. Pass on this because the bread was cold. It wasn't good. 

Once we got seated we ordered some appetizers and our main pasta dish:
-bruschetta was just okay. It looked pretty but it was lacking the special something. Nothing amazing. All you taste was tomatoes and Olive oil. Couldn't taste the cheese on this. 
-romance lettuce salad with anchovy lemon dressing. This tasted like a Caesar salad. Can't taste the anchovy or the lemon. All I tasted was Olive oil again.
-bone marrow. This was hyped up so we got it. This is extremely oily as bone marrow already has oil in it but they put extra oil on top to cook this. Oil was oozing everywhere. Good but the excess oil disgusted me.

I had the smoke salmon with caviar. Small portion sized. Extremely rich and creamy and good but I just wish it had a bigger portion. 

My partner had the linguini with Manila clams and other seafood. Pasta was okay but the sauce was nonexistent. All you can taste again was the Olive oil in it. The portion size for this one was huge though.

At the end we had a complimentary panna cotta. We never had it but will definitely order one next time. This was so good! Absolutely amazing. It was rich and creamy and not too sweet but it hits the spot. Definitely my favorite and will be back for this. 

Overall, this place is a little pricey and too much oil used in their dishes. Will be back to try other items. Will update next time.
author: Jeanne Z.

description:
Came in on Tuesday December 31st, 2013 for the Pre-Fixe Dinner Menu for $75 per person with a group of three at 9 PM. We arrived on-time, however, our table was not ready so we were advised we could go to the Buckshot for a drink until our table was ready around 9:30 PM by the friendly hostess from Italy.

After sitting down --- our first course of the Risotto Cakes were served nearly immediately and were quite delicious.  Next we had the choice of our first course from our server David, who was on point --- which included appetizers, salads, or soup. We chose the Bone Marrow, Butter Nut Squash Ravioli and Caesar Salad to start with --- all three were prepared exceptionally.

Next, for our entrees we got two (2) orders of the Osso Bucco along with the Veal Scallopini. Each entree had an extremely generous portion size --- with plenty to bring home. Followed by a dessert of the Marazpan and Spumoni Gelato which were served just right.

Overall for the three dinners plus a bottle of Vino and one cocktail our bill was $290 plus tip or $350 overall which I thought was an excellent value. The evening even included free sparkling wine plus party favors for a 2014 New Years Countdown.
author: Brian D.

description: I'm so happy to have finally found a good and authentic italian place! Can't wait to come back. The eggplant parmigiana is amazing, and the panna cotta is otherworldly.
author: Chrstn M.

description: This is a great place for a date! Super cozy and warm. Dim lighting and very good service. The food was very fresh and delicious. Will definitely be going back on a date very soon!!!
author: Sam A.

description: Great first time experience . We ordered the smoked salmon appetizer which was light and fresh. Then came a complementary brucetta which was delicious! My pasta was the carbonara with the pancetta, so good and tasty, wasn't heavy at all but still rich in flavor. My BF had the spinach gnocchi in a lovely mushroom sauce, it was cooked to perfection. Light and fluffy. The service was excellent , our waiter was very nice and knowledgable on the food. We didn't have room for dessert but they gave us another comp. It was a yummy custard yogurt type dessert with fresh berries . Hit the spot! The house cocktail is very good as well, I'll be returning , overall it was a pleasure to dine at Bella. Gracias
author: Ladyreyes R.

description:
I'm still buzzed from the wine. 
Had an 8 PM reservation. Didn't get seated until 8:30. Got food a little after 9 PM.
Although the waitstaff was very nice, the service was veryyyy slowwwwww. Food took forever. It was salty, but still pretty good! I couldn't stop stop eating my mom's entree, the frutt e mar (?), squid ink spaghetti with seafood and tomato sauce. 10/10 would order again. My sorrentina  (gnocchi) on the other hand was a more simple, homey, and comforting dish. Our nice waiter gave us an extra pour after we were done with out bottle. Perhaps because we had to wait so long for our dinner. And Panna cotta on the house. Nommms. Probably wouldn't come here again, but it was nice to have not olive garden Italian food for once :)
author: Bianca Y.

description: Great staff number one...very nice quaint  atmosphere. ..excellent  food and service. ..highly recommend. ..
author: Bluescafe P.

description: Best gnocchi i've had. Light pillowy melts in your mouth spinach gnocchi with mushrooms.
author: Allison W.

description: Delicious Italian food in a beautiful, warm setting! The seafood stew, Brussel sprouts and pasta are standouts.
author: Simone E.

description: This place is just wonderful! I came here for a friends birthday early January 2016 (18 very loud people from 25-30yrs) the chef and staff were just amazing in setting everything up for us and putting up with such a large/loud group!! The food is absolutely on par! We had the pleasure to try 3 different appetizers and 5 different entrees and everything was to die for. The spinach Gnocchi literally melted in mouth and its a great vegetarian option, Prices are not ridiculous expensive for the amount they give and if you do go in a big group, They hook you up with family style so you can try a bit of everything. The $30 house Malbec bottle hit the spot with the group. After a belly full of amazing food and good wine it was only $60 per person! Highly recommend this spot!
author: David L.

description:
Sorry. I really wanted to love this local restaurant but just not possible. 
The facility is warm,cozy and comfortable and our waiter knowledgable and attentive. So what's the problem?

1) portions were small - tried the butternut squash ravioli and it looked more like an appetizer. The other two dishes we tried were also on the small side. 

2) two of the 3  items we ordered arrived cold ( not actually cold but not really much above room temperature ).

I am not a ravenous teenager anymore but it has been awhile since I left  a restaurant feeling perhaps a bit unsatisfied.  My dining companions  agreed with my assessment.
author: Bruce K.

description:
Had a great time at Bella Trattoria.  The only bad thing about it is that if you're a party of 2, you can expect to be packed in a bit with other guests.  Originally we had a table that felt like it was basically floating in the center of the restaurant by itself, but we had them relocate us to a booth that was slightly less awkward.  

The food was great.  I had the Carbonara with a salad of fresh greens.  Both were delicious.  My date had the same salad, but with the yam dish.  She seemed like she enjoyed hers equally well.  They brought us some samples of this and that throughout the night.  When we didn't order dessert, they brought us some anyways (no charge).  This was probably better, since it was a smaller portion that we shared, versus ordering a legitimate-sized dessert, which probably would have been too much.  

The decor of the restaurant is excellent.  The waitstaff are all extremely nice and attentive.  It's a good place to have a conversation: cozy, and not too loud.  All in all, an enjoyable experience at the restaurant.

On another note, however, parking in the area is terrible.  Also of note, the service definitely IS pretty slow, but I believe that's by design.  It's a traditional Italian restaurant where your dinner isn't meant to be completed in 20 minutes.  They'll drag out the courses, and leave you time to talk and enjoy your company after your meal is complete.  This is not a bad thing by any means, but it's important to take note of going in, in case you have another engagement to attend following dinner.
author: Brian B.

description: Best Italian food around.  David the head dishwasher/owner is a great guy.   One of my favorite places in the city .
author: Eric C.

description: Love how fresh their pasta's are. My favorite to order here is the gnocchi verde and the lasagna. Order somw wine too it really goes with the pasta. The ambience is nice. This place gave me a little feel of italy.
author: Kristine L.

description:
Went here with a friend and  it was nice. The service was kindof slow or they seemed to ignored us but the food was good. Its. Kindof pricey place but pretty good. My friend had the black ink pasta and it was good! I had this pasta with mushroom that was baked and it was okay. Kindof too oily for my taste. 

Parking was a bitch and the restaurant was small. Would I come again? Maybe, maybe not.

But definitely a cute date place!
author: Michelle N.

description: Food is authentic and delicious here. We ordered the burrata appetizer and the cheese was amazing. Wish there was more bread/cracker to spread the cheese on though because it only came with 4 and we each only have 1. I had the delicious daily special parpadelle in bolognese sauce which was very hearty and filling. I could of definitely share that with someone else so that there was room for dessert. It was a pleasant dining experience with amazing food, and we were surprised by a couple of chef's special on the house.
author: Lily L.

description:
I'm so happy I live in a neighborhood that has delicious Italian food. Everything in their menu is amazing. The service is top-notch. The ambiance is perfect. I always look forward to coming to Bella!

Also, the PANA COTTA OF LIFE is at this restaurant. You have to order it. Have to.
author: Nica M.

description:
She thinks more 3.5 and service was disappointing after reading great reviews

We ordered:

Bone marrow
Brussels sprouts
Gnocchi
Carbonara

Him:
Really solid traditional Italian flavors, carbonara was not overwhelming while the gnocchi was excellent, the potato cakes were really well done, pasta was perfectly cooked. Can't complain about anything except for the fact the Brussels sprouts were just ok. Great hospitality and they gave us a free panna cotta!

Her:  
Bone marrow was decent
Skip the Brussels sprouts, probably one of the worst I've had.
Gnocchi: it was good
Carbonara: it was good not as heavy as other restaurants which I liked.
The panna cotta was yummy!
author: Dennis J.

description:
3.5 Stars.  Cozy Italian restaurant with a nice intimate ambiance.  Although it is a small place and we were a party of 12, the service was pretty good and prompt. Not too loud so you can actually have a decent convo with friends. 

First off the complimentary bread here is to die for.  Don't get me wrong, it's not no fancy bread but rather the simple French baguette bread.  But wow it was so fresh and soft and went perfectly with the sun dried tomatoes & olive oil spread.  I swear I ate a whole loaf and was 80% full by the time we received our entrees.  Don't come here if you are on a low carb diet. 

We started off with the bruschetta, polenta, bone marrow and Caesar salad.  Bruschetta was yummy..a must get. The bone marrow and Caesar were both OK.  Bone Marrow was a good portion but on the salty side and did not care for the side greens that it came with.  Caesar salad had too much cheese and dressing. If modified, it would have been yummy. Skip the polenta...didn't like the texture and for some reason it had a slight gamey taste. 

For the entree I had the Frutt E Mar which is the squid ink spaghetti with mixed seafood-shrimp, mussels, clams, scallops. Not very saucy but rather a seafood broth with tomatoes. After the first bite I was a bit disappointed as I was expecting a strong fresh & sweet seafood taste.  But instead it was very light but still sweet and actually tasted better and better after each bite especially with the broth. Wish it came with more broth. But I very much enjoyed this dish. Something different. :) I would def come back for more carbs action.
author: Cathy M.

description:
EVENT -  1 Year Anniversary

LOCATION - Small, quaint and very romantic, easily a nice place for a special event. We arrived early and they did make us wait until our reservation but the Buckshot is next to the restaurant and we had a drink there. When we got in, we had a bottle of wine with us and they would charge us the $15 corkage fee but if you buy a bottle, they'll waive the fee.

APPETIZERS - Brussels Sprouts and Bruschetta-like appetizer. I personally loved the Brussels Sprouts but the Mozzarella cheese on the Bruschetta was the softest I've ever had. 

ENTREE - My girlfriend got the Meat Rigatoni and I got the Sausage Gnocci. I liked the Rigatoni better but the Sausage was good. The Gnocci was a bit too soft. 

The final bill with a $44 bottle of wine was $109 + Tip.
author: Ryan R.

description: I had a very positive experience with Bella. It was after my college graduation and I had some relatives in from out of town. Everything was closed and we walked into Bella. When the management heard we came from a graduation they sat us even though they were short on time. The food was very fresh and the preparation was top-notch. It's hard to find a restaurant with a well-balanced combination of atmospherics and charm and Bella was very comfortable. I recommend the gnocchi.
author: Kyle S.

description: My wife and I just had the best Italian dinner ever! Everything from the ambiance, to the lighting to the friendliness of the staff was just perfection. We both ordered total home runs of dishes, the Sorrentini gnnochi and the Fruitti Di Marre were SO good! It took us right back to the Amalfi coast. Plus, they brought us bruschetta, which we did not order as an app (complimentary) and a dessert (pana cotta) + port after our meal - all extras, on the house! The service was spectacular, and we will be back. Happy to have a new Italian spot!
author: Alexander M.

description: Love this place.  The food is delicious: way better than what you'll find in North Beach.  Only drawback is that they don't do takeout orders on weekends.
author: Anthony D.

description:
Stopped in here last night for a desperation dinner - took me an hour to get a cab downtown in the financial district - got to be wearing a suit for a cabby to stop and pick you up - even though us bums probably tip more.
