David - the owner / waiter / do everything man welcomed me in, suggested a nice white wine - the gruner - it was delicious, I quickly forgot about standing w/ my hand waving at all of the cars and cabs driving by me. Starting w/ a delicious caesar style salad - he offered and brought me out anchovies all chopped up - makes a heck of a lot more sense - than having to chop them up myself while i sit at the table - even if you don't love the CHOVY - this salad was outstanding - i love the caesar salad.

Then he had recommended the hangar steak and poured me a glass of chianti - not chianti in a basket, but really good and delicious chianti made from sangiovese, beautiful ripe cherry flavors w/ good acidity which makes it go better with food. The Steak was superb and need I not forget his right hand man - Juve - this guy rocks, is gracious, excellent service, you don't even know he's there but he's on top of it. 

I've worked and ran 4 star restaurants and these guys really have it together at this warm inviting italian trattoria - love this place.
author: Rew C.

description:
While the service is commendable, the overpriced dishes seem to leave me parched and unfulfilled.

Note: ALWAYS MAKE A RESERVATION.

If you do not make a reservation, you may be tapping your toes for ages.

The restaurant really does utilize its small space in order to accommodate as many diners as possible. However, when you're a big girl and you need to squeeze between two tables, it sucks when you nearly flatten someone's leftovers with your big ass. I don't blame the hostess, though. She didn't seem to want to seat me where I was -- she commented that this is not the favorite table she wanted to place me.

The complimentary bread they plunk down is barely even passable for an Italian restaurant that makes their pasta homemade. Considering they are in San Francisco, a city of glorious food options and amazing bakeries, I would expect that a place that has a high price on their pastas would serve a bread of better character, wherever they source it from.

The gnocchi itself seemed too salty in addition to the fact that there was a huge amount of cheese on it that had its own salty pungency. Now, I love cheese. I don't mind a lot of cheese, but if I'm visiting a quality restaurant, I don't want them to hide their work behind too much cheese. The mushrooms in my dish also seemed over-seasoned enough to help overpower the dish with, again, too much. I did use the table bread to mop up some of the sauce, but the sauce was still way exceedingly strong. 

The gnocchi I ordered seemed to need something else, texture-wise, to balance out the soft pillows, and the answer was not mushrooms. There needed to be something to add more bite and chew.

The tiramisu is all right, but I've had better at lesser quality restaurants.

Nice Points:
The cocktails are lovely. 
They keep your water filled. 
They always check up on you.
They don't rush you out once they've closed.
author: Cate T.

description: Outstanding, had the lasagna special, one of the best I have had. My wife had the pasta with smoked salmon, it was phenomenal . This place was recommended by a fellow Uber rider, she was right on, host was exceptional . Only issues were the bread was not warm, usually a bad sign, and they did not attend to refilling water, however, it was very busy.
author: Gordon C.

description:
Umm... these great reviews have to have been mostly solicited. Maybe I just went on an off night - and by off night I mean barely edible pasta, with a horrific sauce, and prawns that were so incredibly over-salted...it was really nasty.  We should have realized what we were in for when the spinach salad came out so drenched in garlic,  after a couple of bites I know I'm safe from vampires for at least a year. 

I know we don't have a huge variety of options here in the Inner Richmond, but c'mon we can do better than this.
author: Jaime M.

description: It's a cute, intimate setting.  But both times my wife and I have been here, we've been disappointed.  In San Francisco you can do a lot better for a nice Italian meal and for the price.  First off, the menu is not the most user-friendly one to navigate and has rather small print for such a dark room.  We had to use the flashlight on our iPhones to see what's on the menu.  Had a hard time finding something that looked good to us.  I chose a chicken pasta and my wife chose a seafood dish.  Our son ordered a salad and shared it and that was not bad.  But all of us had the same complaint about the main entrees, that everything was too salty.  My wife and I got very little substance (chicken or seafood) to our meals, and ended up with mostly tasteless noodles that we didn't bother finishing nor did we have any desire to take home.  For what we got, I thought everything was a bit overpriced and the quality lacking.  The one nice touch is that after passing up on dessert, the waiter did bring a little dessert to share along with the check.  That was the high point of the meal.  I would say that the place is long on pretense but short on substance and quality.  We have no desire to go back.
author: Bob S.

description:
I remember loving this place, but it had been a while.

Decided to suddenly remember this location, and headed over for dinner on a random night. A random Tuesday night I believe. It was past 8:00pm and the place was PACKED! Yes, it is quite a small restaurant, but I was still impressed.

There were about 2 empty tables, so we waited for them in a nice little cozy couch while they set up. They gave us the nicer table :) To our left was a big party, celebrating a college graduation. To our left was an extremely cute old couple which appeared to be what I aim to be a part of years down the line. They shared a dessert too ;) 

The service was amazing, just as I remembered. However, I didn't recall being confused between kitchen staff and front of the house staff. Perhaps they downsized, or maybe it's something new. Everyone was in white, and we didn't just have one server come up to us. It seemed as if everyone was doing everything in the restaurant; but by no means did this seem hectic at all. I was very impressed with each and every single person that approached us. There were laughs, jokes, and complimentary food again :)

The brussel sprouts were definitely "not like moms" as the staff joked. It seemed like it had been cooked for forever! Sooooo sooooo sooooo soft! So delicious. Probably one of the best I've ever had.

My spinach gnocchi was flavorful and amazing. My guest enjoyed his food as well, very much. We were too full for dessert, so they brought us some on the house anyway. Oh, hospitality :)

Overall, I really wanted to like this restaurant. I really wanted to have another 5 star experience. And I did =] Well done Bella.
author: Elaine H.

description:
This is the real Italian gem in the city! 
We got asa buco (veal shank) and a pasta dish... Def worth going back to and dec worth the price! Very cozy and romantic setting though very tight. Would def recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a solid Italian food!
author: Cindy C.

description: A great spot in a neighborhood that I don't normally visit but should think about getting to more often.  The place is relatively small and the staff was super welcoming and fun which made the overall experience.  We snared a lot of plates including the antipasto, baked polenta (amazing) and meatballs.  I also had a caesar salad and the Arrabbiata which was great.
author: Blake B.

description:
We had a great meal, and that is what is most important isn't it?  We called them up at 6:30 PM and asked if there was a table open and the waiter just said come on in, so we were off to a great start already.  The place is SMALL and the tables were packed, but it still felt like an intimate, romantic restaurant. The service was impeccable - the waiters and the manager were very quick, attentive and professional.  

The food?  it was fabulous.  This is what Italian food was meant to be.  The pasta was so fresh that I bet it was made in the kitchen after we ordered.  The bruschetta was very tasty (with a healthy slice of Buffalo Mozzarella on top) and the wine was just perfect.

VERY recommended and we ARE going back again.
author: Daniel M.

description:
A very cute restaurant with an amazing staff. We ordered the carbonara and gnocchi. 
For our taste, the food was very heavy and difficult to eat. We might not be used to the authentic heavy pasta but I just did not like it. The 3 stars go for the wonderful service and great complimentary dessert. Either way, I would maybe go back and try different dishes. I am lactose intolerant and therefore had limited options!
author: Payal A.

description:
Very impressive!

Didn't want a home-cooked meal so my girlfriend and I decided to dine out this Friday night.  It was already 4:30PM and we were still contemplating on what were "feeling" for. After  moments of silence and arguing back and forth of how we weren't craving this or that, I suggested why not try Bella Trattoria -- this restaurant has been an eyeful for over a decade now [because I live VERY close by] and since I never dined here, why not?

I made reservations for 8PM and considering it was in less than 3 hours later, I was pretty skeptical. We walked in at 7:30PM (to be on the safe side) and saw that all the tables were taken. However, one of the waiters confirmed my reservation and by 7:55PM sharp, we were seated. 

Appetizer -- 

Complimentary [Italian?] bread with sun dried tomatoes and olive oil: 
- very fresh, soft, and warm slices of bread. I was very hungry and devoured 3 rolls alone..

Manila clams and mussels: 
[http://s3-media4.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/PmZ6ZBPserVWtdbnFI2FAw/l.jpg]
- the clams were delectable. best I've had in a long time! my favorite part of this was the sauce. it soaked amazingly with the bread (now you know why I devoured three rolls..)

Entrée -- 
Pork ragu lasagna: 
[http://s3-media3.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/UCmTjsvvmIHBs5oBhh3GVw/l.jpg]
- Meh. It was good, but not great. A tad on the salty side and.. yeah. That sums it up.

Roasted trout w/ sauteed spinach: 
[http://s3-media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ZIwP441wzgIG42r_l77INQ/l.jpg]
- The skin on the trout was very VERY crispy! It was also cooked very well and the best part was the whole fish was boneless! The spinach was pretty good too; I just wish it came with a side of rice (it's a Chinese thing).

Dessert -- 
Tiramisu:
[http://s3-media4.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/W3P0KU4fhwFs0vSjGnlbXA/l.jpg]
- my all-time favorite dessert so just like Coldstone's motto, I "Gotta Have It!". the tiramisu was very very moist and melted in your mouth. nothing can compared to finishing a meal with tiramisu!

Overall, Bella is a very romantic little restaurant for a quiet dinner for two. It's not too expensive and is not a formal restaurant at all. It was a little nippy however since the window above the entrance was open but we didn't mind too much. What sold me was how abnormally fast they cooked and served us each dish. It literally took only 5-10 minutes per! Along with the last moment reservation -- Amazing. I truly had a great dining experience here and will be back soon. Bella Trattoria bookmarked for life!


PS: They also practice their 3 R's - recycling, reduce, and reuse. It makes tons more sense cause I thought it was reading, writing, and arithmetic.. Doh!
author: Albert L.

description:
After passing it numerous times in our neighborhood, my husband and I decided to try it for a post-valentines celebration and so glad we did! It was a cozy romantic atmosphere, great service and food! I got a creamy shrimp pasta any my husband got a a meat and pork pasta special both were amazing! It may be because I'm expecting and eating for two (my excuse) that I ended up finishing my entire entree, which was a good size portion. Bruschetta is a must, so fresh and flavorful! 

We passed on the dessert menu, we were so full, but the server gave us a complimentary Panna cotta dessert topped with fresh fruits.. he said it was for the "baby" haha!! Nevertheless we finished it :) 

Great Italian restaurant here in the Richmond!
author: J M.

description: This place is the perfect date night! It is very intimate and the waiters are so good and personal. They make sure the food and drinks are to your liking before ordering. The owner is also personal. Our food was a little delayed but he brought us out complimentary bruschetta without us asking or complaining. Amazing! This is a place to check out! Thank you for the great service.
author: Marco B.

description: I went on my first date with my boyfriend here. A mere four years later (Kate Middleton, you're my hero), we celebrated our engagement here. The food was as good as I remembered (I recommend the risotto and pasta puttanesca). The service was warm and genuinely Italian. And once again, we were given a free dessert. In fact, after sharing news of our engagement, we were given a special complimentary dessert of Tiramisu. (I think last time it was panna cotta. I never forget a dessert).
author: Susan S.

description: What a lovely experience.  Brought my girlfriend here for a holiday dinner last weekend and we both have been grinning in reflection or our time at Bella Tratoria.  The customer service was top notch, I believe our waiters name was Eric or Erin - he was informative, kind, and with a few mentions of what we were shooting for he tailored an order that became truly unforgettable.  I went with the carbonara, my girlfriend the gnocchi.  Paired with the suggested Cabernet and we are still salivating at the thought! The service was above and beyond and the amazing food just really ended our weekend on a high note.  I highly recommend this restaurant if you want to see what San Francisco's dining has to showcase.
author: Conor F.

description:
Nice and romantic place. It's nice and dim, and the atmosphere is great! 

Once we sat, we were given bread and sun-dried tomatoes as our appetizer. We were also given a taste of their bruschetta on the house! 

The food was great! We will definitely come back again whenever we're around the area!
author: Vinson Y.

description: This place in wonderful - I've been here 3 times now. The service is always spot on - very attentive, polite, and knowledgeable. They make their own pasta, which is delicious, and each dish I've ordered so far has been beautifully presented and very tasty. I think this is one of the best dining options in the Richmond.
author: Louisa W.

description: Gnocchi verdi is amazing. Everything I've tried here is delicious, atmosphere is elegant and cozy, service is great and free treats from the kitchen are a nice surprise. This will remain one of my favorite spots this side of town!
author: Shelby N.

description: My wife and I had dinner here tonight.  The food was awesome and the service was good as well.  We had the bruschetta and it was about the best I've ever had.  My wife had fruita Del mar and she loved it.  I had the gnocchi and it was really great.  We will definitely be back.  The staff is friendly and nice as well.
author: Don S.

description:
Excellent authentic Italian food. Went with a group and managed to try quite a few dishes. Here's a breakdown of the night:

Appetizers: 5/5 the polenta was unbelievable. It was incredibly light with Gorgonzola cheese and mushrooms. The Vension dish was out of this world as well. Salty, but it just melted in your mouth with arugala on top.


Dinner: 4/5 I had the Frutt E'Mar, which was good, but not incredible. The steak was incredible. The other dishes I tried had great flavors though the veal was a little tougher than it should have been. The Carbonara was the best I have ever tried. Most entree's were $18-24

Dessert: 5/5 almost everything was amazing. The Spumonte had great texture. The lemon tart gelato was right on the spot. I have incredibly high standards for tiramisu and while it did not quite measure up, it had very good flavor and is worth a try if you want a coffee flavor. Then we tried the Pana Cotta. Who ever thought that balsamic vinegar would be a flavor in a dessert? So strange. But it absolutely blew us away. It has a wonderful flavor that was balanced perfectly. 

Service: 5/5. Service was prompt. In a large group there is bound to be a mixup. One of the orders was accidentally changed. They supplied the person with a complimentary dish while he waited for them to make his entree. 

All in all 5/5. Bella is an excellent Italian restaurant with a great atmosphere. The lights are dim and it's a great place to sit and talk. I definitely will be going back for more.
author: Chris H.

description:
Dined there with my bf; the service was really good.
We started out with free bread and the bread was cold, so I asked our server to heat it and he did it right away.
We had a salad with vinegrette dressing and a black ink spaghetti; the portion is big enough to share btween two of us. The wine list there is pretty good a selection. Love it!
author: Joelle K.

description: Bella Trattoria is great. Dimly light and cozy, it's a great spot for a date night. My boyfriend and I shared a bottle of the Barbera (which was excellent) and two pasta dishes which were both delicious. Portions were not huge but definitely filling. We'll definitely be coming back!
author: Matt W.

description:
Great food and excellent service.  5 stars because I loved the feeling I had when I left.  Just a warning: it is a small restaurant so it won't necessarily be a quick in and out dinner, but I loved that they let us take our time eating and didn't rush us out to turn the table.  

FOOD
Apps:
Purpett' A' Mammeta (grilled meatballs, eggplant-tomato caponata) 

 Antipasto Della Cassa (grilled veggies, cold cuts, olives, cheese, and artichoke hearts).  The meatballs were fantastic!! LOVE.

ENTREES:
Tagliolini Salmone: This was my dish and it was so tasty!! It was composed of tagliolini, smoked salmon, black caviar, and a mascarpone bechamel. It was a nice portion, creamy, and very flavorful.

Aglio E Olio: My garlic addicted sister was addicted to this dish.  It was homemade spaghetti, with chili flakes, garlic confit, and Grana Padano (a cheese).  It was lighter than the tagliolini because it was oil based but it was still just as flavorful. 

Cotoletta Piacentina: Breaded pork cutlet, potato puree, and sauteed spinach. This cutlet was huge; it took up probably 75% of the plate.  It was definitely enough for my dad for dinner.

Maccarune Cu Salsiccia: Rigatoni in a tomato cream sugo with italian sausage.  The rigatoni was slightly under al dente but it was still good.  

Frutt' 'E Mar: Squid ink tagliatelle, mussels, clams, calamari, tomato sughetto. This dish smelled great and tasted delicious. 

Service:
I had a reservation for a group of 7 for my grandmother's birthday.  Their credit card machine broke last night and they gave us a call earlier in the day to let us know that they would be cash only.  I definitely appreciated the warning called in advance rather than when we arrived.  

The two servers that were working tonight were so wonderful.  They were friendly and personable.  They talked to us and gave us recommendations as needed.  The Frutt' 'E Mar dish was messed up in the kitchen and took an extra 5-10 minutes to come out after the rest of the entrees.  I loved that the servers didn't try and lie and stall.  They came out, told the truth, and apologized for the delay.  After a couple of minutes, they even brought out my cousin a small portion of the spinach gnocchi to try as he waited for his dish.

Since the server heard us wishing my grandmother a happy birthday, he brought out the panna cotta at the end of the meal with a candle in it.   The dessert was light and creamy.  

Loved this place!  Recommended! (Sorry for the super long review, just wanted everyone to know this place was great!)
author: Nikki L.

description:
Had a reservation for 5 to celebrate one of our friend's birthday. The service was "friendly" but not attentive. They didn't look too happy either, ughh mood killer. They seated us without menus. We had to call them over for everything.

My friends ordered the carbonara and some baked penne pasta with chicken dish. I ordered the squid ink pasta. All of their dishes were alright and I thought my dish was kind of bland. Their portions were pretty small too (just wanted to point that out, not docking them for that). 

I also remember the place being unnecessarily dark. If you drop something on the floor, don't even bother trying to look for it. Anyways, overall I personally do not think the food was worth the price. Nothing was memorable except for the fact that I left the restaurant still hungry. Oh but we did get a complementary panna cotta! Now THAT was amazing.
author: Simon L.

description:
This is one of the best places in terms of service you will ever get. Boyfriend and I came here last night and loved the ambiance and how nice everyone was. 

We came at 8:15 pm and they told us the next table would be available at 9:30 pm - after searching for parking for 20 mins, we were STARVING and extremely disappointed to hear about the long wait. As we were leaving, he server checked the system and found us a table. YAY! 

Great wine menu - I enjoyed the Rossi and boyfriend really liked the Lambrusco. Table bread was good, I just wish it was warmed up. We started off with the bruchetta - probably the best I've had - fresh mozzarella was bomb. 

My main course was the rigatoni - can't go wrong. It was al dente, very flavorful. I also like the peas. Boyfriend got the pork shoulder and really enjoyed it. Fried, so it wasn't my thing, but I had a bite and it was tasteful. 

The food took a while, but the server came by with complimentary refills of our wine due to the wait. It's always a great surprise when servers show their understanding, and small things really make customers really happy.

The best part of the meal was the complimentary panna cotta topped with strawberries. OMFG. I think I'll order this to-go one of these days. I can't even describe it - you must try it for yourself. 

Overall, I love this place. Great date-night restaurant and a place to unwind. 

Another point about the great service - I asked the server where the (unisex) restroom was, he walked me to the door, tried to open the door and let me know it was occupied. When someone came out, the server appeared from nowhere and checked to make sure the restroom was decent before I went in. I was SHOCKED! I've never had anyone do that before... it was so caring! 

The server ended our night by saying "ciao bella," which totally put this place over the top. I highly recommend it!
author: Mimi V.

description:
Fantastic food. I would highly recommend the salmon pasta with caviar. My dad and I went there before taking a trek out of the city and it was a great dinner.  They had a few beers on tap and great appetizers. The free bread and oil are great as well. I would
Highly recommend it.
author: Laura D.

description: Short and to the point: Soooo tasty, great service! The place also looks great and prices are very reasonable. Highly recommend.
author: Tal C.

description:
Fantastic Italian food tucked away here! My boyfriend and I came by for our second anniversary dinner yesterday and were quite impressed with the food and presentation here. The restaurant is very small so parking was a bit tricky, but there are definitely spaces within a couple blocks of the place. Inside, there's not much room and the tables are definitely squished together, but it feels very intimate and romantic - perfect for a special occasion.

We ordered the rusticanza to start (a delicious salad of field greens tossed with asparagus and endives in a truffled dressing) and it was sweet and refreshing. I particularly liked how the dressing was very sweet and tangy, but the truffle flavor still popped. For entrees, we opted for the squid ink spaghetti with shrimp, clams and mussels and the pasta with smoked salmon. I personally thought the salmon pasta was a bit underseasoned at first (boyfriend disagreed) but as I ate more, I realized that the mildness of the cream sauce balanced out the saltiness of the salmon and caviar. The squid ink spaghetti was amazing - cooked perfectly al dente - and the sauce that it was tossed in was perfect. I'm usually not a fan of tomato sauces, but this one was great in that it wasn't overwhelmingly tomato-y so the flavor of the seafood shone through. We finished with the panna cotta and it was SO good. The balsamic glaze added a new flavor dimension to the sweetness and the creaminess and the berries gave the dessert a nice acidic touch. 

Overall, it's a great place cooking up delicious Italian food! We both loved it and would absolutely come back in a heartbeat.
author: Bethany A.

description:
Came here for a much needed GNO! True to other yelp reviews, they gave us free stuff. FREE stuff!! Where do you ever hear of that?! That definitely already had me in a pretty good mood!

We ordered the tuna carpaccio, lobster ravioli, salmon, meatball appetizer and the seafood stew. I loved the lobster ravioli and the stew!! I usually find lobster ravioli to sound better than it taste, but at Bella, I actually couldn't have enough! Best lobster ravioli I've ever had! Everything else was good but not amazing.

The best thing about our meal was our complimentary dessert! We were brought the strawberry panna cotta and everyone looooved it. We even thought about getting one to go!! 

Definitely will be back for the ravioli and panna cotta!
author: Tiffany U.

description:
I went here on a date last night. I had never even heard of this place. It is quaint and a bit of a hole in the wall. It was a last minute decision to come here so we didn't have reservations. They had us sit at the bar which was actually just fine. 
The waitstaff was super friendly and helpful with our questions. As for the food? It was excellent. I had lasagna and it was literally the best lasagna I have ever had. Ground pork and mozzarella cheese and simply divine! My date had the osso bucco and reported that it was excellent as well. This is definitely a place I would come back to. It is a great spot to go for a romantic evening or even just a friend date. 
I will definitely be recommending this place to all my friends looking for a good place to go in San Francisco. The prices are pretty much what you'd expect for an Italian restaurant. The ambience is nice and the food is excellent. What more could you ask for from a restaurant?
author: Tad H.

description:
BEST ITALIAN FOOD IN SF. I ate here last night and have not been able to stop dreaming about the food since. 

HIGHLIGHTS:
- Burrata appetizer: A quivering ball of perfectly moist burrata cheese, accompanied by thin slices of crispy baguette and salami.
- Grilled meatballs with eggplant-tomato caponata: Bite-size meatballs that are so creamy and rich they literally melt on your tongue.
- Bruschetta: The best damn bruschetta I've ever had. Good proportion of (well-seasoned, olive oil-drenched) toppings to bread.
- Baked rigatoni: It comes topped with incredibly tender marinated chicken and mushroom bechamel. Each individual ingredient was so tasty, it really made for a memorable dish.
- Gnocchi: NEED to come back for this. Spotted it on someone else's table on my way out and it looked (and smelled) phenomenal. 

Not really a dessert gal, but my friends who ordered the tiramisu said it was yummy. Our server also gave us panna cotta on the house (did I mention they have excellent service?). Highly recommended! 

Whether you're on a date or with family members, coworkers, whoever, this place is perfect!!
author: Tiffany W.

description:
So, this is a special someone's favorite restaurant and it took me about 4-5 visits to get it, but now I do:

Squid ink risotto +
Chianti

Done. The ink in the risotto is pretty intense, in a good way - like it'll stain your fingers, almost. I've tried the gnocchi, it's good but the sauce is a bit thick for my tastes. The above is beyond better.

Affogato is a good-o. I've tried about 6-7 in this city and this one is #2.
author: Maria A.

description: We came to Bella's because we just moved into the neighborhood and love Italian food... and we were so glad we did.  The service and experience were wonderful  and the food was delicious.  In fact, I can't wait to return and once again order their Tagliata Al Gorgonzola.  Sooooo good!
author: Nancy C.

description:
Had the linguine nere (squid ink linguine with clams, calamari, and eggplant) when I came here for a late lunch with my friends. Simply delicious. 

We probably got the dinner menu because it was so late. Didn't matter though because everything smelled good and we were starving (not to take away the deliciousness of it all). 

The atmosphere is a little romantic. Reminds of me of a quiet balcony looking across the ocean except that it's indoors and there's no view of the ocean. But just imagine. It's relaxed and it definitely has that romantic flair. I almost wished that I was actually on a date that day.
author: Jennie T.

description:
Is it just me?  I don't understand all the high reviews.  I ordered the Carbonara, and it was so salty.  I ate less than 1/3 of the dish cause I just couldn't finish it with the saltiness.  My friend also said her Squid Ink Risotto was salty too, although I think the Squid ink went well with the bread provided.
Service was friendly, but not very attentive.  We needed water, and the table next to ours had waved over a waiter for water also, but he didn't even notice our empty glasses and skipped us.
author: Karen L.

description: Came back again last night and it was delishhh! Ordered new dishes n it was all amazing. Bone marrow was awesome!
author: Rosalynn D.

description: This place is very good.  you can't go wrong with most of the entrees.  I had a slow-cooked pork with fettuccine that was great1
author: Phil B.

description: We had reservations on a Wednesday evening. Was not crowded at 6:30 pm but was filled by the time we finished dinner. Probably would be safe to have reservations. Nice ambiance, good service and food was good. Portions were filling but I wouldn't say they give generous portions!  We shared a Caesar salad which was very good. Entree we had Carbonara and mushroom risotto. Tiramisu for dessert. Recommend you give the restaurant a try but there are lots of better Italian restaurants.
author: Em D.

description: Great service, the beat I have experienced in quit some time. And the food was fantastic. So glad I had a chance to dine here.
author: Mark B.

description:
I came here on a Friday night with reservations. I walked into the door to have one of the waiters standing there in front of the reservations computer messing around. My boyfriend told them we had reservations and the waiter's response was confusion. We gave the name our reservation was under and he looked at us blankly. I glanced at the reservations screen and I did not see our name. We were seated 10 minutes later. 

The bread was mediocre at best. It was not warm or fresh. The dipping sauce was olive oil and and some sun-dried tomatoes. 

We started off with the Wild Salmon Carpaccio, the portion was fairly small. For a $15 appetizer, I had maybe 2 bites of the salmon. 

I ordered the Linguine E Gamberi which was probably the best dish out of our entire experience. It was delicious. There was a decent number of tiger prawns and the saffron bechamel sauce was amazing.

The Frutt' 'E Mar was lacking in flavor. The appeal of the dish was probably the squid ink pasta. It was warm on the outside and a bit cold in the inside.

While I was enjoying my entree, my water was not filled during the entire 25 minutes we had been there. It was not until I was nearly finished with the dish that I had realized all other tables were given water jugs so they could refill their cups themselves. Our waiter never asked us how the food was nor were we ever checked up on. After attempting to flag down a couple of the waitstaff and having been ignored while nearly almost all of them were walking around aimlessly, we waited maybe 10 minutes until someone came by and we were brought some water.

We had the tiramisu for desert and while it was a good, it was flat. The $8 price was unwarranted. 

All in all, the service was absolutely lacking. The waitstaff didn't seem to care much at all. There is absolutely no excuse for this since the restaurant is pretty small and there were not understaffed to say the least. The food was underwhelming, no matter how delicious the linguine e gamberi was. Save your money and go somewhere else.
author: Carol W.

description:
My boyfriend and I set out looking for a romantic restaurant in the city to celebrate our 4 year anniversary and Bella Trattoria really fit the bill. 

Going off of fellow Yelpers' previous reviews, we were not disappointed. Every course was perfection. 

For an appetizer we split the mussels and clams special which was packed full with flavor. Word to the wise though, don't wear a white shirt if you plan on ordering this. I think it's safe to say my boyfriend and I both ruined our tops, we're animals. 

For dinner, we had the hanger steak and the veal, both which were cooked well and had incredibly delicious sauces. The portions were also fairly hefty and we were stuffed after our main course.

But obviously...we couldn't say no to complimentary panna cotta. As an Italian I'm embarrassed to say this was actually my first time trying panna cotta, but Bella Trattoria has set the new standards.

Now, for the reasons I only gave it 4 stars instead of 5:
While the petite restaurant creates an amazing ambiance, because of the size the tables are all fairly close together so that you're almost sitting on top of the parties next to you making it  difficult to have a one on one conversation without feeling like the person next to you is listening in. Definitely make reservations if you plan on coming here, because of the amount of tables available it really fills up quickly! 

Also because of the small size a good portion of the tables are very close to the entrance, you'll catch quite a draft whenever someone opens the door.

Though we loved all the food we ate, time between service was a little lengthy. Between our appetizer and our meal we waited about 30 minutes. 

Overall, was a great experience and would 100% recommend for others to try!
author: Caroline G.

description: Small, romantic and excellent. Actually, the most solid Italian restaurant I've been to in sf. Fantastic.
author: Dana M.

description:
I was looking for good Italian food but needed to entertain out of town guests somewhere in the Richmond District...Seriously, not North Beach or Downtown but the Richmond....

Thanks to the reviews from fellow Yelpers, I found Bella Trattoria...
This is a cute little neighborhood restaurant that has some real Italian moxie! 

It was really cold outside so my guests started off with the house minestrone. Nom, nom, nom. They seemed happy with the warm soup. I had a delightful polenta - two round disks of golden polenta with a layer of melted cheese and sauteed mushroom sauce on top. I offered tastes to all my table-mates but, really, this is a dish that you want to curl up on the sofa eating in front of a roaring fireplace. We're talking serious comfort food.

Each of us had different types of pasta. I had the homemade lasagne which was a decent single portion with layers of al dente pasta, chunks of beef  and cheese. No surprises here. Very tasty.

The other pastas seemed sizeable and I had a taste of the penne with sausage. Also, very tasty.

For dessert, we shared a panna cotta with slices of strawberries. The texture of the panna cotta was perfection. Wish the tiramisu had set earlier otherwise I would have tried that too...yep, I'm a glut for sweets.

The waiters speak Italian and there's a mural of Venice in the front wall of the restaurant. I feel like I'm in Italy :) This place is a little gem and I'm so happy I've found a neighborhood restaurant serving unpretentious Italian food at really resonable prices.
author: Joanna T.

description:
This is my favorite Italian place!!

I've been here 3 times and have recommended this place to my mom for her party of 5. No one has ever been disappointed by the food. I've had the squash ravioli several times and haven't been disappointed once. From the samples I've had off of friend's plates, everything else is amazing as well. Consistently spot on!

Tips:

1. Make a reservation if you're going during peak hours. I have dropped by 2 other times and they've been booked with no room for walk-ins.

2. Complimentary panna cotta. I didn't order dessert once and got this pleasant surprise. It looks like the simplest thing, but trust that it is heaven. I do have to say, you're missing out if you don't try the zabaione.
author: Mimi X.

description:
This was such a lovely little restaurant to dine in. I dined here after an incredibly fun day in the city and on the beach. Not realizing how popular Bella Trattoria is, we ended up here on a Saturday evening without a reservation. It is a small establishment, but the Maitre d' was completely accommodating and seated us in no time at all. 

I was very impressed with the waitstaff. It seemed like most of them actually were Italian-speaking which created a very authentic Italian atmosphere. As far as it goes, the ambiance of the restaurant was also very pleasing. I especially enjoyed the vintage lighting fixtures and the screens they used to minimize the intrusion of the city street. This is a cozy restaurant with romantic lighting, a distinguished bar and atmosphere. The only thing I noted that hindered a completely romantic experience was that it was quite loud, between the music and other diners speaking loudly.

The most important part of any dining experience is the food, and I was not the least bit disappointed. Immediately we were served our own water carafe and hot bread with a plate of sun-dried tomatoes drizzled with olive oil for dipping. Both my dining companion and I ordered a glass of the house red wine which was very good. I ordered the Gnocchi Verdi which is house made spinach gnocchi with crimini mushrooms, radicchio, in a gorgonzola bechamel sauce. It was so rich, creamy, and savory in the most delightful way. The Gnocchi were cooked to perfection. My dining companion ordered the Cotoletta Alla Piccata which is the breaded pork cutlet with baby arugula, capers, and cacciocavalo. I managed to sneak a small bite and was impressed with his choice too. 

Talk about attentive, our server brought us wonderful morsels of house-made fried polenta to try. The only way I can describe it is heavenly! And even after we declined the dessert menu as we already splurged on chocolate truffles earlier, our server brought us two tiny glasses of that lovely Italian lemon liqueur, limoncello, and almond biscotti for dessert. All of this was completely on the house. 

I always make a point to try new places when I drive into the city, but I dare say, I will return here. Five stars!
author: Ava H.

description: I had an exceptional experience here. The small, warm setting added even more to the dining experience. The food was great and the service was amazing. I was given complimentary bruschetta and dessert and the waiter was charismatic. I definitely want to come back!
author: Grace H.

description: Everyone was extremely friendly and the food was delicious! I had the squid ink pasta and my husband had chicken mushroom penne with truffle bechamel sauce. We shared the panna cotta with balsamic berries. Fantastic from start to finish. Made our reservation in advance on open table.
author: Alyssa H.

description: I loved this place!  Fantastic service--fantastic food.  The tops baby! I just loved it and I have now been three times!
author: Cathy L.

description: LOVE this restaurant. Nice people, great service, great authentic Italian food. Has a really nice small neighborhood bistro feel.
author: Lauren M.

description: Tucked away and doesn't look like much from the outside, but pleasantly surprised upon entering. Love the atmosphere and intimacy. I'm vegan and they were super accommodating and made some modifications to a dish I requested. :)  Food and service were both wonderful - you can tell it's really housemade Italian and good sized portions - the chef even came out to check in and see how the food was which I didn't expect!
author: Deb M.

description:
I don't know what to say...We had eaten here last summer and were really excited to come back after a long day at the California Academy of Sciences. I mean, I had been craving their food! I couldn't wait to come in.

We arrived pretty early, around 5:30, and were the first ones there. We got our choice of any seats, and sat by a window. We ordered our drinks and excitedly chattered about the menu.

Then, a family with a little kid and a baby walk in. They have their choice of any seats in the place, and sit RIGHT next to us. 

First off, this is NOT a child/baby-friendly restuarant by any means (see my last review). White tablecloths, cozy date-night ambience... NOT for babies!

And what I can't get past is that they had to sit RIGHT next to us! What's that about? You can see a couple having a nice date night, talking quietly, and you sit right next to them? I was hoping the waitress would direct them to the farthest table from us, like that big table in the front, but no, she told them to sit wherever.

We would have gotten up to move, but they were right in the middle so there wasn't really anywhere to go. So instead of enjoying fantastic Italian food in a nice restaurant, we spend the next hour listening to a baby beat the table, scream and cry. I mean, how rude can you get??

We kept giving them the LOOK, and they didn't really get it. I mean, if your baby is screaming, freaking take it outside.

Instead of spending plenty of time there, ordering more wine and dessert, we got the heck out of there. The food was great as always but the evening was just totally ruined.

The last time we ate there had to have been at about 8pm, and a couple walked in with a crying baby then, too. So I'm not sure if Bella just attracts families and babies, or if San Francisco is just super baby-friendly and welcomes babies to  all their nice restaurants. Either way, I'm not sure that I'll go back. When you pay for dinner, you're also paying for ambience. Too bad because their butternut squash ravioli is about the best thing ever.
author: Jenny S.

description:
I've been looking for a go-to neighborhood Italian place -- this is it. The interior is casual but very stylish (think Edison bulbs and ebony wood floors), and just spacious enough that they can accommodate a couple of larger groups as well as the usual 2 and 4 tops. The crowd was a real mix: couples on dates, multi-generational families, young ladies doing a girls' nite out, etc. Service is warm and very friendly. The complimentary house-made bread and tomato-y olive oil for dipping were delish. We had the burrata appetizer and a very fresh fennel salad -- both were divine. They also brought out an amuse bouche that was a crispy cracker topped off with an olive and tuna tapenade -- it was savory heaven.

The incredible pasta was the star of the show -- house-made with just the right springy texture.  Husband, son, and I had tonight's special, which was papardelle con sugo and it was to DIE for.  My daughter had the butternut squash ravioli with brown butter, which I tried and didn't want to give back to her, it was so flavorful and rich.  I'd describe the portions as "just right"...it was more than enough to fill us all up and then some. Dessert is a must. The panna cotta was silky and creamy, tiramisu was perfection, and they even bring you HOT milk with your coffee. I appreciated all of their great attention to detail. This was a wonderful experience and we'll definitely be back!
author: SfMom O.

description:
Let's play a game.  I say adjectives, you say nouns:

Romantic yet relaxing and cozy (ambiance)

Light and elegant (appetizers)

Rich and hearty (house-made pastas) 

Small variety but perfectly cooked and worthy (entrees)

Sweet and memorable (desserts)

Friendly and good-looking (servers)

Smart & happy (YOU, cause you got your butt over here to have dinner!)


Now my turn to say some important nouns: 

House red (I'm serious). carbonara pasta. anchovy appetizer. gnocchi. tiramisu.


The verbs?  Fairly obvious by this point I think:
GO, EAT, SMILE, ENJOY
author: Ravena F.

description:
Very mediocre....
- took forever to get menus, sloppy serice
- food was very slow coming out, and it wasnt busy
- portions too small
- very average food.... Nothing to go ack for

Wont be coming ack.
author: Carla D.

description: Love this place.  My pasta dish was perfect.  Dessert was divine. The waitstaff was extremely attentive, if only I could take them everywhere else I dined.
author: Carb Q.

description: I came back again and enjoyed my second visit just as much as my first. The staff here are so friendly and the service is excellent. This time we ordered the bone marrow (delicious!), ragu (also delicious!), squid ink pasta (not my cup of tea, but people enjoyed it), arrabbiata and the linguine e gamberi. The winner for the night for me was the ragu which I loved. For desert we tried the zambaione which was also a big win with our group. Just because they are so awesome, our waiter also brought us a complementary panna cotta as well.
author: Alice H.

description:
We went here for my friends birthday dinner, and it was a mistake. First of all, the place is super small so it's not a good place for groups. There is no place to wait inside, so we had to go to Burger King across the street while waiting for our table. Secondly, the food we ordered was so-so. From the reviews, I thought it was going to be amazing, but it was more average than anything. Maybe it was just what I got, which was the special for the day. Also, the place is so quiet! We felt extremely awkward singing happy birthday when the place was packed with people, yet completely silent. Server was great until we got the check. He didn't want to initially split the check, and gave us attitude about it, but eventually did. 

I think this place is better if you are on a date, or with a group no larger than 4. Would like to try this place again and maybe order something different this time.
author: Jenna F.

description:
I had my birthday dinner here last month.  Great ambiance, service, food and overall experience = four stars!

Since the reservation was for 8:00 p.m. and everyone got seated around 8:45 p.m. or so, we ended up being the only party in the restaurant (it's not that big).  This was great since we got three people (manager, waiter and another waitress) to ourselves and every need was met in a record time.  Plates and glasses were bussed quickly to our table, every glass had wine, cheese grated on pasta and all the orders were correct (including who they handed it to - I was impressed).  I couldn't have asked for better service.  

The place is very cute and clean (see pictures).  And the food is pretty good.  First, you have to order the combo antipasti dish.  It is THE mother lode of antipasti - olives, eggplant, zucchini, peppers, salami, and italian sandwich meat (what is that called again?).  It was huge.  The meatballs were not bad either.  See pictures of both that I posted!

We had three bottles of wine, but I only tried the chardonnay that was recommended by the manager.  It was very good, crispy and fresh.  Not too much of a lingering taste like I usually get and it was not overwhelming.  Hm, too bad I don't remember what it was called.

My 3 kinds of pasta dish was clean and the flavors weren't all "mushed" together as I expected it to taste.  I had spinach ravioli, gnocchi, and marinara penne.  All were great.  My bf had the bouillabaisse style pasta that had four clams and lots of fish as it should.  The sole gnocchi dishes looked a bit plain, but the spaghetti carbonara tasted good.  

The manager, I forgot his name, but he was very nice and sweet.  He was obliging to take pictures (always a plus! - especially when you're the last ones in the restaurant, it's late and he probably wants to go home).  I had a great time there and would definitely go back.  

Beware:  The parking sucked as it normally does in this area.  Fortunately, everyone got there.  Also, since it was gay pride weekend and on a Saturday night, we could not grab taxis in this area either (or get a taxi to come pick us up!).
author: Chris L.

description:
Came for the 5 star reviews, left with a "meh".

The place feels nice, but the first warning flag was the blank look the host gave me when I said I had a reservation.  He looked around and said.."ok, 10 minutes".  Did he forget about my reservation?  

Fortunately we were seated in 10, and then things kicked off with bread.  Unfortunately the bottom was burnt, so it felt like eating a marshmallow wedged between two pieces of cardboard.  Soft inside, hard / tasteless outside.

For main meal I had the gnocchi, but unfortunately it was just ok.  The sausage was flavorful, but the gnocchi was mushy and the cheese had no taste.

As I was eating, I noticed I wasn't the only reservation the host forgot about.  We were sitting near front, and overheard the host reacting the same way to each person who said they have a reservation.  

I honestly think the host didn't take down the reservations, just thinking there'd be enough free tables. Then the front filled up with no tables open, and people started grumbling about how they had a reservation but no table.

Lastly, our waitress was about as talkative as a librarian: I had to start our conversation and get her to say anything.  I don't mind starting conversation, but when it's your job to do that, you're failing.
author: Charlie B.

description:
My actual rating is 4.8 stars

A year ago we walked by this restaurant and decided at some point we were going to try it. It was busy which is usually a good sign, small, not pretentious and the menu looked sound. We were slightly late for our reservation so we had to wait outside for a few mins, no problem, parking in this area can be slightly tricky and set us behind a bit. My group of four decided to order family style, in order to ensure a large variety of dishes. 
We ordered the following:
brussel sprouts
butternut squash ravioli
carbonera
meatballs with eggplant sauce
gnocchi
veal scaloppine
hanger steak
affogato
panna cotta
paired with 2010 Clos Pegase Hommage Cabernet Sauvignon from home

Appetizers:
One of the guests in our party is a vegetarian, they made the brussel sprouts without meat per request. The butternut squash ravioli was superb, delicate and sweet on the palate and very fresh. The carbonera is also fantastic, not heavy, just as described on the menu. The meatballs with eggplant sauce were also amazing, I somehow missed this dish on the menu but i'm very glad someone ordered it!

Entrees:
The gnocchi was probably the softest I've ever eaten, a must order for sure. The veal was cooked to perfection and the béchamel sauce was a nice touch, also highly recommended. The hanger steaks were enjoyed by the people who ordered them, personally I found the steaks just okay, maybe I just wasn't in a steak mood.

Dessert:
The affogoto was good, a nice touch to the end of the dinner. The panna cotta is worth the raving reviews found elsewhere on this site, even though I was very full I kept trying to eat it.

Service: Extremely friendly, personable, quick to laugh and almost had a "you're family" feel. At times our table felt slightly abandoned; I had to pour water and wine for the table twice, but that's me being VERY picky. The overall kindness, generosity and personality of the staff still won me over.

In conclusion: Exceptional dinner, will return, friendly service and I'm very surprised this restaurant doesn't have a michelin star behind it's name. 
However, I like the fact it's not well known or discussed in the popular food articles. keep it local, keep it friendly, and keep up the great work
author: R J.

description:
One of the best Italian restaurants in the City.

Loved the sun-dried tomatoes in olive oil for the soft, slightly sweet bread. Fried polenta (on the house) was delicious! Meatballs were juicy and well-seasoned, especially enjoyed the eggplant-tomato caponata accompaniment.

Stars of the night, however, were the pasta dishes. My butternut squash ravioli was divine. Only complaint was I didn't have enough. My bf's gnocchi with sausage was equally amazing. Light and fluffy gnocchi with flavorful sausage tossed in a delicious tomato sauce. Yum.

Finished the night off with a couple of great desserts- the tiramisu and panna cotta. My bf couldn't decide which one he loved more.

Flawless meal. Reasonable prices. Extremely nice staff. Definite repeat.
author: Sophia B.

description:
This place is absolutely amazing.

I made reservations online for six people for 6:15 the evening of prom, but the plans changed and I ended up having to make them for eight people at 6:30. We arrived early and they already had a nice table set up for us. It's a small, cozy-feeling place that didn't feel too fancy.

The waitress was really nice, and she brought us fried polenta as a free appetizer. It was absolutely delicious.

I ordered the Cotelleta Napolentana. Yeah, I don't speak Italian, so for those of you like me, it's a breaded pork cutlet topped with mozzarella and a tomato sauce. It was really flavorful. My date had the Tagliata al Gorgonzola, which was grilled steak with spinach and mushrooms. I tried it and really liked it.

The waitress also brought out some panna cotta for dessert, which was delicious too.

My friends still keep thanking me for picking this place because they all really loved it. I'm definitely coming back.
author: Beatrice C.

description: The food was very good. I wish there was more scallop than shrimp on my dish. I was allergic to shrimp so wish that I could had replaced it with scallops instead. I tried the squid ink pasta and it was a little tough for my liking. Wish that they had a black ink sauce to accommodate that pasta dish.
author: Jenny L.

description: Great little place for a casual date night.  Took the baby and they were really accommodating.  Great service.
author: Edgar C.

description: Location is perfect because it's only a block away from my house haha but the food isn't anything special, (not saying that it's bad either, it's just not anything I couldn't get at another Italian restaurant). I do love that if you spend a good amount of money on food they always give you a free dessert and it's really yummy :) definitely worth checking out if you live in the neighborhood!
author: Star B.

description:
Came here for dinner as part of my friend's bachelorette weekend.  We wanted something nice, intimate but with reasonable prices.  I'm usually around this neighborhood and you don't really notice this place.  Thanks Yelp for taking us here.  
It's a cute little neighborhood place.  The inside is dim and small, but you don't feel crowded.  Our server was great and engaging.  He made sure we had a great experience. 
We didn't get any appetizer coz we knew carbs from pasta will fill us up.  They gave complimentary bread and flavored olive oil dipping and that was good.  I ordered the squid ink pasta with seafood because I wanted to try their homemade pasta and their seafood stew.  It was good, but not great.  I think it was lacking a layer of flavor which I can't exactly pinpoint.  My friends got the pasta norcina and gnocchi and those were great!  Other pasta that was ordered were A-ok.  
We were so stuffed so we decided to not get dessert.  However, they give you complimentary panna cotta that we all shared.  It was good, but you can't complain with free food.  Oh yea they had this sweet cocktail that my friend and I ordered which we loved.  It was a creeper so beware or maybe we just have low tolerance.  

My friends talked about coming back here.  As for me, well it's a nice option to consider especially if you're around the area.
author: Claire J.

description: The manager contacted me the very next day after my review, and was extremely cordial and apologetic. I appreciate his concern, and will make sure to give Bella Tratoria another chance.
author: Marty E.

description:
I can't believe it's taken me this long to write a review about Bella. My hubby and I have been coming here for two years and absolutely love it. It's our little neighborhood spot. 

The staff is super friendly. The food is excellent. The wine list is awesome (and they always change up the list, which is great). It's the perfect place for a date night or to grab a bite to eat on the way home from work. 

Definitely worth the trek if you don't live in the Richmond and if you do live in the Richmond and haven't tried it yet...what are you waiting for??
author: Bridget M.

description: Restaurant is cute and cozy, and the staffs very nice. They asked us to relocate tables and, as a thank you, they gave us a free panna cotta dessert.  The gnocchi was pretty good, but I didn't care for my amatriciana spaghetti.  The pasta was a little overcooked and the sauce tasted like something out of a jar and had no spice. Bummer- I wanted to like this place but it's probably not a repeat for me.
author: M D.

description: Hungry?  Come on down.  Lots of sold, traditional Italian food.  We found it to be a little on the heavy side but good (for a food coma!).
author: Glenn S.

description: Bella was kind enough to host our end of the year teacher appreciation dinner last night.  The service was excellent from start to finish, David and his team were warm and welcoming and made us feel special throughout the night.  The food was delicious, the antipasto, rusticanza salad, meatballs, polenta and pasta norcina were my personal highlights.  Thanks again Bella!
author: Kelly D.

description:
BEST. GNOCCHI. EVER.

It's been two years since my husband and I stumbled upon this little gem, but the gnocchi was so unbelievably good that every time I order gnocchi at a restaurant I catch myself reminiscing about the spinach gnocchi that I had here. 

The roasted trout and panna cotta were also amazing but the gnocchi stole the show.
author: Jennifer S.

description: I must admit, I've never been accidentally elbowed in the back of the head by a male waiter before.  This happened Friday 9/18 around 9pm. The Pasta Norcina took ages to arrive and was pretty terrible.  Girlfriend was shocked by the elbow. We won't be back. Ever.
author: Pete W.

description: Excellent Italian food, with perfectly attentive service.  Two of us were able to walk in and be seated at 8:30pm on a Thursday.  Everything we had was simply prepared (olive oil + salt) but delicious.  They know how to make the most out of a few flavorful ingredients without throwing in too many layers of flavor. The pasta was perfectly al dente.  I'll be going back.
author: James B.

description: Cam here while visiting SF. We had a nice dinner. Antipasto and bruschetta were great apps. I ordered their special which was lasagna that night. I absolutely loved it. Their homemade pasta was  cooked perfectly with the beef and pork sauce. Besides waiting for 10 minutes until we were greeted by our waitress, the service was good.
author: Amanda W.

description:
Wonderful restaurant!!   Found this on Yelp and went with my cousin, her hubby and mine. No reservations but the super nice guy said we could have a table for an hour which should be fine. We thought that was kind of weird but they were very busy, we were hungry and it looked really good so what the heck. 

Well, we were there for more than 1 hour and they were the best!! The service was 10 stars. We had salads, my cousin had the butternut squash ravioli, I had the orichette (excuse spelling), hubby had the pasta with salmon and everything was super yummy !  My dish was fairly spicy - quite a bit of pepper or something. But it was good and i could not finish it. They brought out little crostinis with a delicious topping - compliments as well as a lovely panda cotta (compliments again!). The bread was heavenly too. 

The restaurant is quite loud so it's not a place for a romantic dinner for 2 unless you go off hours I suppose. The only thing I found that could use improvement was the restroom. It was pretty dirty and there was only 1. 

When we left they were so nice!  Several of the people thanked us and were just so gracious. What a pleasure!!  We will be back!
author: Debi S.

description: I love this place. The servers are knowledgeable and helpful, the food is fantastic and I love the coziness of it.  My husband and I ate there last night and we do often because they rarely disappoint.  My warm spinach salad and pasta bolognese was delicious, as usual.   And I don't have to go to North Beach, I get to stay in my 'hood.  It's a hidden gem.
author: Melissa M.

description: The food was amazing! The ragu was possibly one of the best things I have ever eaten. It was so rich and it tasted like they cooked it for hours. So so good!  The gnocchi was amazing. I loved everything that I ate. The bruschetta was so fresh and good. I loved everything!!! I will be back. And the service was wonderful. They are so friendly and attentive. Go try it!!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I was very impressed by Bella. 

I was surprised to find a huge bowl of red chili peppers at the doorway...seriously sentimental to me given my childhood in New Mexico and my adoration of spice. Had a found my spicy Italian spot? In my very own neighborhood? Yes.

Adoration continues as we enjoyed their ostrich carpaccio. The textures, spice and flavor were all on point. 

I wish Bella stayed open a little later, the atmosphere suits an intimate late night dinner. We were out by 10:15 but I would have liked to stay and leisurely enjoy desert and tea.
author: Jocelyn B.

description:
This place is beyond amazing for all the reasons we dine out!  Fabulous food--rigatoni with sausage to die for--simply could not stop eating.  Fresh beyond fresh bread. Gnocchi heavenly puffs of flavor and eggplant bursting with pzazz.  Oh and the recommended Chianti--and like the food--we couldn't stop drinking!  And impeccable service from each and everyone--the owner/manager who seated us despite the large party who occupied most of the restaurant, the bartender who graciously filled our glasses over and over again and the staff who brought our plates, more bread and stayed right on it without being intrusive.  All around a great end to a graduation that ended later than expected and rivaled for the best celebration of the day ( and night!)

Considering we just stumbled on the place as many restaurants had already closed tho Friday nite in SF@!#--we are a very grateful family to this "family" who so graciously agreed to serve us despite the hour, despite a more than adequate number of seated customers, and yet provided stellar food, drink and impeccable service.  I would give more than 5 stars and I have never rated a dining experience so high--including many of the best rated establishments.  This place beats 'em all--seriously on all counts important to those of us who want truly "fine dining"--the food, the wine, the service--the whole package.  And this appears to be their "norm!"

Go see 'em.  Support 'em.  Enjoy this neighborhood gem- one of a kind!
author: Mary S.

description: This place is a hole in the wall on horrible Geary Street. The antipasto della casa was just OK. But the pasta dishes we both ordered were among the best we have had outside of Italy. The panna cotta was also incredible.
author: Morris R.

description: The veal was overcooked and tough, the gnocchi was too watery, the squid ink spaghetti was good, but the seafood accompanying it was overcooked. The service was a bit slow, but they tried. Maybe we ordered the wrong stuff? The bone marrow was good, eggplant was ok.
author: Tela C.

description: I came in for lunch,  great service and ambiance.  Relaxed and nice music. Gnocci was so good I almost cried.  I have been back a few times. Consistently great!
author: Nikki W.

description:
The waiter brought us warm bread and it was delish. We ordered the bruschetta, frutte e mar(squid ink spaghetti), and homemade gnocchi. The bruschetta was so fresh and wonderful. The mozzarella was a generous portion and not a thin slice. I loved the squid ink spaghetti. My boyfriend decided the color of the spaghetti wasn't for him, but he enjoyed the seafood that came with the dish. He loved the gnocchi with the sausage and chunky tomato sauce.  They even gave us complimentary panna cotta! I'm not huge on desserts and sweets, but the pana cotta wasn't too sweet and had amazing texture. The restaurant is a tad bit pricey, but it was overall delish. 

Will definitely be coming back again!
author: Grace C.

description:
Took my girlfriend here for her birthday based on the reviews here. I'm not particularly fond of Italian myself, but was really pleased.

 From being seated to being served the staff was really friendly and knowledgeable about the menu (a lot I was unfamiliar with) and even gave us a couple free samples of a different appetizer.

The price to eat for 2 splurging on app's. ,liquor and dessert was about $60.

Would definitely return.
author: Robert W.

description: Saw this place on "Check Please" Bay Area and could not wait to try.  Parking was difficult as usual in SF, but for this place it is well worth the slight trouble.  No reservations on a Friday but they still sat us down quickly.  Food was outstanding and ambiance was romantic.  Wife had the chicken shell pasta and I has the rigatoni. Excellently prepared and presented. Chef came out to our table and thanked us for coming.  Offered an additional app to try. Lovely wait staff and we are looking forward to coming back. There are some great beers here that are differ from most of SF restaurants.   You must eat here.  I mean now!
author: Dante G.

description: Is it possible to give them more than 5 stars? Amazing food, check. Great service, check! Food is delicious, fresh and served with a smile. It's obvious that the staff take pride in the food they present. Very knowledgable and experienced. My boyfriend and I ordered a salad and the burrata caprese to start - they did not rush us through our starters even though people were waiting to be seated. It's clear that the customers' experience is just as important as the taste of the food. I've been here a handful of times and each visit has been amazing. The most underrated restaurant in SF!
author: Kate S.

description: Delicious. Great waitstaff, helpful recommendations, we received free extra courses (appetizer and dessert) with our meals, and the ambiance was lovely - the noise level was perfect for conversation but not quiet. Would definitely recommend.
author: Cam T.

description:
Went here for mine and my bfs 6 month (haha yeah I know)
OH MY GOD this place should get six stars. We got there super early for our reservation (like 20 minutes) but they luckily had a table available that they let us take (it was SUPER windy outside) . We only had to park two blocks away and this was on a Friday at 8PM.
The entryway is a doorway which makes sense as the place is pretty small (15ish tables and like 2 seats at the bar) but it was warm inside and very cozy. We got water right away- small glasses but they give you a carafe for the table, bread with oil and a half carafe of house red - very tasty and inexpensive!
For an appetizer we had the Bone Marrow which was surprisingly tasty. It was really rich and buttery tasting and served on toast with Italian parsley. The bone was really clean cut. We also shared a house salad which was a decent sized regular salad.
For my bfs main, he had Rigatoni Salsiccia which was in a tomato cream sauce with sausage. He said it was very good and practically inhaled the whole plate.
I had the Tagliolini Salmon E Caviale which was with salmon and caviar in a beschamel sauce, and was literally, THE BEST pasta I had every had in my entire life might I add. I was full near the end up I kept shoveling it in cause it was amazing. I almost ordered the Oso Buco which was on special but knew I would probably never finish it. Seriously though, this pasta was amazing. If you like salmon and don't mind a rich sauce- order this dish. The caviar adds a great crunch to the dish.
After licking our plates clean, we ended with the night with Panna Cotta (almost the Zabaione) and all desserts were $2.50 for a pretty decent size of sweetness. Perfect to share with your sweetness (see what I did there...?) And OF COURSE the Panna Cotta was really great. It was topped with macerated berries and some balsamic.
Whole bill came out to $107 before tip which was a really great deal considering the quality.  Would definitely recommend to all my friends and revisit soon!
Also it was pretty busy so definitely have a reservation for date nights!
author: Kajal G.

description:
Hands down the best Italian restaurant in SF.  Quaint and charming, the ambience sets just the right mood for a memorable night.  You are greeted with a staff that is welcoming and accomodating. The owner wants to personally ensure you have a delectable experience.  The menu satisfies your traditional desires, but go out of your comfort zone and order something a little avant-garde.  Your taste buds will be dancing as you are guaranteed to find a new Italian favorite.  Save room for dessert...the gelato is to die for!  I am certain to visit Bella's on my next trip to SF and tell all my friends about this hidden gem. 

Our group ordered Bruschetta, Parmigiana, Polentun a' Bella, Bone Marrow, Sorrentina, Burro E Salvia, Carbonara Originale, Cotoletta Alla Piccata, Tiramisu, Panna Cotta, and Gelato.
author: Jessica H.

description:
My husband and I tried this restaurant on a Friday night. We got there a few minutes early, but we didn't experience the long waits as indicated by other reviewers, despite it being a Friday night. We were seated within 5 minutes of getting there. 

Bella is a good size restaurant, and has a soft, and relaxed atmosphere. While nothing in the restaurant screams Italian, the place was comfortable enough for us to enjoy our meal. 

They started us with the sun dried tomato olive oil and bread. The oil was delicious, but I found the bread to be a bit doughy for my liking. We then ordered the Bone Marrow and it was served with slightly burnt bread, although it did not deter us from loving the dish. My husband had their risotto; it was hearty and very good; I would have added a little bit less salt and not so much water, but that may just be a personal preference on how risotto should be cooked. I ordered the squid ink pasta... which MADE the meal. It is everything as delicious as everyone describes in their reviews. I would come back just for this dish! The clam to shrimp to pasta ratio was perfect. My husband was quite jealous he didn't order my dish. (Yes I shared a bit). We finished off with the tiramisu (no, we did not get the complimentary panna cotta), Dessert was fine, but nothing I would go back for.  

All in all, I would recommend this place, especially if you live in the area. While I wouldn't rush back to find parking in Inner Richmond just for Bella, I would definitely go back if i'm in the neighborhood.
author: Winny F.

description:
Just got home from Bella and I am certainly impressed.  I have been looking for a good local Italian restaurant.  The service and the food were fantastic.  We had the Bruschetta and lasagna which were made fresh with ingredients from local bay area farms.

Avoid the tourists in north beach and go where you can have homemade pasta like your friends' east coast grandmother would make.

We will be back!
author: Doug T.

description: I've had a really good meal here before. The next time I had a mediocre meal that I had to keep salting. And I am not a salty person. I gave them three stars for having gluten free pastas. I would go back, but it will be awhile.
author: Ashley F.

description:
Had dinner there last week and WOW what a great experience.  The service and the food was outstanding.  We had the squid ink pasta and the spaghetti carbonara with bruschetta as an appetizer.  The bruschetta as amazing and wished we had more.  The squid ink pasta had a hint of brinyness and lots of delicious mussels.  The spaghetti carbonara had very generous portions of pancetta and was very creamy without butter and cream.  

We were pleasantly surprised when the waiter offered a complimentary panna cotta to share.  The panna cotta was just right amount of sweetness.  Overall, we had a fantastic dining experience and would recommend Bella Trattoria especially for a date night.
author: Christian W.

description:
I arrived late for my reservation while significant other tried to find parking around the area. Parking was difficult to find so I would try to get there pretty early in scavenge for spots. 

I was greeted warmly and quickly moved to the bar area where I was offered water while I waited. They prepared our table and I sat by myself until my SO found parking. The staff were all so nice and once it came out, the FOOD WAS DELICIOUS. We ordered the veal main dish and carbonara pasta on the side, both turned out to be excellent. At the end they gave us a complimentary desert and wished us a happy anniversary, all nice little gestures that I truly appreciate.
author: Ingrid M.

description: The staff here is really friendly and personable! The food is delectable, and the ambience is very soothing and relaxing. I love it here! It's an intimate little Italian restaurant on Geary, a little pricey but worth the money!
author: Chelsea R.

description:
Food was average. Service was less than average. Free dessert was a plus.

I came here on a Friday night at 7pm and surprisingly, we were seated immediately because the restaurant was half empty. Despite the high waiter-to-customer ratio (4 waiters, 5 tables), it took forever for our waiter to stop gossiping in the corner, meander by, introduce himself, and take our order. Don't get me wrong, all the waiters are really nice, but suck at their jobs.

As with any semi-nice Italian restaurant, we got free bread and olive oil with this tomato paste in it. While I thought the tomato olive oil was good, the bread tasted like those cold dinner rolls from Costco (ok I lie, because I would never eat Costco dinner rolls, but I can imagine that's what it would taste like), and Bella Tratoria has taken Black Angus' crown for the worst free bread ever.

For dinner, I got the Smoked Salmon Caviar pasta. The smoked salmon and caviar was the only highlight of my dish. The pasta wasn't my thing - it was too thick, dry, and quite flavorless. Still, I finished everything because the portions were pretty small. If a barely 5 ft. tall asian girl thinks the portions are small, I can only imagine what a normal size human being would think. 

I would've given this place 2 stars, except another waiter brought us free panna cotta with strawberries for dessert. That dessert was probably the best thing we ate that night...but its just not enough to get me to come back here.
author: Kate Y.

description:
It was my wife's birthday, we found a babysitter and our original dining location was completely booked up! Along with the rain, it doesn't seem like we have a bright chance of a quiet dinner without the baby. We hopped from one location to other with stomachs grumbling and protesting when I made an executive decision to pick the final choice. Bella Trattoria came on top of our list and when we arrive, it almost felt like another fruitless choice. Thankfully, they were warmer than the cold rain and made arrangements to have a table ready for us.

Bella is quite a cozy little spot and definitely has a warm and romantic setting! Everything looked perfect for a birthday dinner!

We ordered the Minestrone (because hot soup tastes great in cold weather!) and the Baked Polenta for appetizers and the Squid Ink Pasta and Grilled Hanger Steak for entrees. The Minestrone had quite a flavorful broth and was soothing after being out in the rain! Good stuff! The Baked Polenta was good, but the gorgonzola that it had was really strong for me. 

The Squid Ink pasta was my first ever and I've always wanted to try it! Honestly, I don't think the ink did much in flavor, but it was definitely cool to see a dish of black pasta! This wouldn't be something that I would stay away! The Grilled Hanger Steak was delicious too, but it had gorgonzola too! Now I have nothing against this amazing cheese! Just not something that I eat all the time. 

As I mentioned, the staff was friendly, accommodating and warm! Maybe it's the Italian hospitality, but I would think that's a quality that everyone would have. Either way, my wife and I really appreciate it under our wet circumstances. Even so, we'll remember to make reservations next time we wish to dine here! Great job, Bella!
author: Jeremy L.

description:
Hubby and I must have hit Bella Tratorria on a perfect night.  We were so delighted.

As as soon as we walked in, we were warmly welcomed and picked a table of our choice.  We had a 6:00 reservation and shortly after that the place was packed.  As busy as they were, we received outstanding service from Robert, a friend of the owner.  If you like pasta, Bella has a very good selection.   We immediately received our drinks and homemade bread with a tomato base spread.  We liked the bread so much, we got more to go.

We started with a small size anti pasta, which was ample.  It consisted of very nicely prepared veggies, cheeses, meats, olives, and a little salad.  Very good.  We ordered a dish of Penne Pasta with smoked chicken, cremini mushrooms, and sundried tomatoes. Delicious.  The Papadarelle ribbon pasta, pork, beef, and tomato base was wonderful.  The dishes are so generous we both took food to go and enjoyed a delicious lunch the next day.

For dessert we shared the Panna Cotta (a Italian type flan) simply delicious.  An apple warm tort with ice cream (from Italy), was also terrific.  For all the work that goes into make fresh pasta and delicious sauces we thought the prices were fair.
Five stars for great food, great service, and casual elegant ambiance.

Ciao!
author: Rose J.

description:
I have to say I love this place . I went because the food no matter what was out of this world an amazing. They also had a particular server direct from Italy who was so sweet, it made everything absolutely perfect.
Never could have been better although it was a little bit pricy.
author: Stef M.

description:
Went back again (third time now?)..

Squid ink risotto - still very good but not as good as the first time.  It wasn't as flavorful as the first time and the ratio of risotto to seafood was smaller than I preferred.  It's rare, but I actually felt like there was too much seafood on the plate, breaking up the risotto.  The risotto is already slightly on the runnier side because of the squid ink and if you have too much seafood, you can only get a few grains at a time...
