Whole trout - delicious.  Perfectly fried and DEBONED (such a nice change compared to chinese restaurants).  Head and tail still present (if that's not your thing).  Skin perfectly crispy and the flesh flaky and tender.  

Spinach gnocchi - Very good.  Very soft and fluffy, chewier than others that I've tried.  

Service here is always superb.  This place still makes me want to come back.
author: Lisa L.

description: My boyfriend and I came across Bella Trattoria and figured we would try it out.  From the moment we walked in until we stepped in the door it was a truly phenomenal experience.  The food, atmosphere, and service were all top notch.  Each server seemed genuinely happy to be there and could not have been more friendly and accommodating.  The food was exquisite and our server even took a minute to tell us the chef's trick to making it just right.  Topped off with a complimentary dessert, this was hands down one of the best meal experiences I have had.  I have not written a Yelp review in over a year but felt compelled to spread the good word about Bella Trattoria.
author: Emilie B.

description:
I really feel compelled to write this one...most of the time I write yelp reviews because I'm feeling especially bored or clever, but this place...it's just so good.

I'm feeling safe to write this because I already have a reservation for tonight. I don't need to wait until after because I know it will be great, as always. But I hope Bella stays small, cozy, and kept secret despite the incredible accolades bestowed by my five star review.

The house wine is great. Really, it is. The appetizers are spot on, the entrées are super authentic and perfectly portioned. I'm always too full to order dessert, but they must think it's hilarious to bring me to the brink of food coma, because they bring out a delicious panna cotta anyways - free of charge. Don't take advantage of this.

Personal favorites are the tagliotelle, the carbonara, and the squid ink pasta. But it's all about the ultra-friendly service and low-key but upscale atmosphere.

Keep it up, guys.
author: Brian G.

description:
Bella has become a go to date spot for my boyfriend and me. We love the food and the service. Even with reservations, you have to wait a good 15-20 minutes, but it's because it's an intimate restaurant so people generally want to talk and drag out dinner. Last time, we had to wait about 45 minutes after our reservation time. A server offered us two complimentary glasses of the most delicious moscato which was nice.

We love the bread and sun dried tomato oil here. So delish!

I've tried two appetizers and they were both sooo good. The baked polenta was extremely flavorful. But then again, I love polenta, mushrooms, and cheese so it's the perfect appetizer for me. My boyfriend didn't care too much for it. The grilled meatballs were SUPER tender. Seriously the best meatballs I've ever had. Boyfriend loved them.

Next, the Sorrentina was okay. It was gnocchi with Italian sausage with tomato sauce. It wasn't mind blowing but it was still okay. I probably wouldn't order it again. However, the carbonara was nuts!! Soooo creamy and rich. I loved it. I would definitely get that again. My boyfriend gets the pasta norcina every time. I love the sauce and mushrooms, but I don't like rigatoni. I want to try the gnocchi Verdi and mushroom risotto!

The zabaione was okay, I honestly like their panna cotta more!
author: Bianca W.

description: Incredible food and stellar customer service.  Beautiful ambiance.  Perfect place for a date night or dinner with friends.  Would totally come back here again and again!
author: Kim O.

description:
Perfect last meal in SF. Bella is perfectly nestled in a small space, making it feel intimate and homey. We didn't have a reservation but were assured a spot would open at the bar soon. We were sent to the bar next door for a drink until seats came open. The host/manager/owner? Personally came over to tell us they were ready. 
And that isn't even saying anything about the food, which was outstanding. We started with polenta and ordered Burro e Salvio and Pork Osso Buco (the special) for our main courses. The crimini mushrooms in the polenta were seasoned expertly, allowing the earthy flavor to mix with the Gorgonzola. The Burro e Salvio was over butternut squash raviolis with just the right amount of sweetness. My guest greatly enjoyed the simplicity of the Osso Buco - the pork melted in his mouth and there wasn't a drop of extra, unnecessary sauce that is so often the case at other Italian restaurants. 
My only regret is that we're not lucky enough to live nearby to try more dishes.
author: Adriane L.

description:
AMAZING!! Simply amazing!!

The husband and I had the most amazing experience here. The food is to die for, literally to die for. The customer service is on point. And the atmosphere is super romantic. I absolutely love this place!! 

Must try ( sorry, I can't remember the correct names for the dishes) you won't regret it!!!

-deep friend risotto balls
-meat balls with eggplant
-the short ribs with mashed potatoes
-spinach gnocchi 
-pana cotta
-tiramisu
author: Minie J.

description:
Food - Had dinner here on a Friday and had the following:
1) Brussels sprouts - 4 stars (cooked just right and had good flavor from the pancetta)
2) Polenta with mushrooms and gorgonzola- 4 stars (great appetizer for sharing since the gorgonzola can be a bit rich)
3) Lasagna - 4 stars (pasta cooked perfectly with the right amount of sauce and seasoned perfectly)
4) Spinach Gnocchi - 1 star (gnocchi was very gummy)
5) Panna cotta - 3 stars 

Service: 4 stars
author: Em D.

description:
I freaking love this place. 

They make home made gluten free pasta. I love their house blend of wine - you can get a liter for $32 and its delish. We always come here when we can, its a great date night place.
author: Rachel W.

description:
Amazing place for Italian cuisine. I am no expert, but the food seemed authentic and didnt have the American influence that you find in other restaurants. Intimate, cozy atmosphere inside. It's amazing how the noise from the sports bar next door does not leak into this place. Make reservations ahead of time.

I would recommend the following:
Frutt 'E Mar- squid ink spaghetti with prawns and mussels 
Gnocchi Verde
Tagliolini Salmone
Butternut Squash Ravioli

Service is exceptional and prices are reasonable. They have quality wines by the glass or bottle.
author: Alfred L.

description: Hidden gem and the best Italian I have had outside of Italy. Most pasta homemade. They always remember you. I have brought countless people here and everyone raves
author: Caitlin T.

description: I had a great experience at Bella and would recommend. Do as the Romans and eat around 9:30 or so, get a liter of house wine, burratta, carbonara and the squid ink. Everything is fantastically prepared.
author: Claude M.

description:
Decent Italian food (especially for the Inner Richmond), not so great service.

Had an 8PM reservation, was sat at the bar at 7:55-8:05. That is fine, but the seats they gave us at the bar had menus scattered about on the seats and bar, plus their water pitcher. We had to move all the stuff so we could actually sit there (staff did nothing). Upon sitting no one asked us if we would like a drink/appetizer, so we were really just waiting for our table. After about 10 minutes (past 8PM), they sat us at a table.

The table they gave us was near the door, certainly some better tables open. A couple without reservations was given one of those tables soon after we sat. Okay, not great service, but that is alright.

Upon sitting, we waited about 8 minutes for any amount of service. Finally they brought us water (told him we were ready to order, he blew me off). About 5 minutes after they brought us water the waiter finally comes over to take our order. We ordered four plates of food.

In general, portions are small and not so filling. Luckily there was free bread that helped to fill the void... Although no bread served with the meal (pasta dishes), waiter did not ask if we'd like more.

Apt/Dinner:
- Eggplant Parm - Decent, not very crispy too much cheese, only comes with two pieces of eggplant for $9, seems like they could have done a bit more, presentation absolutely lacking.
- Marinara Pizza - Not very large for the the price (doesn't even have cheese), toppings were seriously lacking, mostly looked like bread with sauce on it
- Smoked Salmon Pasta - Not bad, the caviar didn't really mix well with the smoked salmon (too salty), absolutely too much use of cream just for cream sake. Seemed like a lack of effort to make a flavorful dish (small portion as well)
- Butternut Squash Ravioli - Pretty good, but missing some flavor, comes with just small medium sized ravioli. Asked to see if they could add sausage to the dish (do a side or something), the waiter was kind of rude and said no way.

Dessert:
- Tiramisu - Nothing thrilling about this whatsoever
- Complimentary fruit/yogurt dish - Wasn't very good, fruit looked kind of old, said he gave it to us because of the wait... Oh, but the table next to us got one as well, not sure how that works out.

Overall, the food isn't terrible, honestly I'd almost give them another shot, but the waiter that we had seemed like he simply didn't care about our table. Service at this type of restaurant should be a given, was very disappointed with the experience.
author: Ninja R.

description:
My fiance and I came here for our anniversary recently, and we weren't totally blown away, but we still had a great time. The food was delicious- I had the Tagliolini Al Salmone and it was totally awesome. My fiance had the Osso Buco which he liked but didn't love. We had the meatball appetizer and it was out of this world. The free panna cotta dessert was super tasty as well. All in all, good food. 

The reason it doesn't get five stars is because we were both kind of weirded out by the service! Right off the bat our waiter scolded my fiance for ordering before me, like... Trust me waiter, our relationship is just fine. He also had kind of a creepy salesman vibe, like he was going to try to sell me a cell phone at the end of the meal. 

It's a really cute place and the food is awesome, but yeah, strange service.
author: Nina B.

description: I had the spinach gnocchi and it was delectable. I had to add a bit more salt but overall it really hit the spot. The atmosphere is romantic and intimate so bring someone special!
author: Maey P.

description: The restaurant is a delightful surprise.  It is intimate, romantic and lively.  The food was delicious.  Has a  lovely neighborhood-esque feel to it... you could just as easily be going over to a friend's house.   The owner David was extremely nice and wrestled us a table when we didn't even have a reservation.  We will definitely be going back again and again.
author: Shannon M.

description: Homey feeling and waitress and waitresses were very friendly! Their squid ink risotto is to die for!! And pannacota for dessert is surely the ultimate choice! Definitely a place to consider if you want to satisfy your taste buds with italian!
author: Valerie H.

description:
Butternut Squash ravioli was appetizer size. Gnochi was very good but once again was on the skimpy side.

Overall I'm not coming back here and not recommending this place due to lackluster customer service and portion size.
author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.

description: I was so excited to try this place because of its reviews and how close it is to my house. I was entirely overwhelmed. The gnocchi was well prepared, but I wasn't a fan of the sauce. Or the bread. Try somewhere else.
author: Emily K.

description: Amazing! Came here with a group of six and we all shared. I got to try two different gnocchi and three different pasta dishes. All extraordinarily good! Pasta was obviously fresh and made in house, sauces flavorful, but not heavy. Just thinking about it makes me hungry to go back.
author: Sarah S.

description: Great service, and we received a complimentary panna cotta!
author: Benjamin A.

description: Overall, the sauces they used were extremely salty and my girlfriend and I had to drink a lot of water for a while. Just a mediocre Italian I gotta say.
author: Kodai K.

description:
Went here on a date with my husband to celebrate my new job. It was great in terms of ambiance, food, and service.

This place has the kind of ambiance I expect from an Italian restaurant. It is small, dark, and intimate, and stands in contrast to some other SF Italian joints in the more tourist-y areas like North Beach and Fisherman's Wharf. The paintings of Venice on the walls and bare Thomas Edison-style light bulbs add just the right touch. 

We started off with drinks. My Prosecco was smooth, yet tart, while the taste of my husband's cocktail was too sweet for me. However, he seemed to enjoy it very much. As for appetizers, I had a Roman Salad - which was something I'd never tried before. It seemed like an Italian Caesar salad, with its tart, anchovy-containing dressing, romaine heart, shaved pecorino romano cheese, and croutons - which I removed, since I have celiac disease - they were not mentioned on the menu, but I know for next time. I had no bad reaction, thanks to the croutons not being crushed into the dressing at all. My husband ordered venison carpaccio, which came topped with arugula and croutons, and bathed in olive oil. The slice I had was deliciously game-y,  rich, and made me wish I was eating bread with it.

My main dish was Puttanesca served with gluten-free corn spaghetti. It was fittingly fishy, with albacore tuna and real green olives, served with shredded cheese. I usually wolf down my plate of food but I really tried to take my time with this one, to savor every moment. My husband ordered a ragu dish with wide egg noodles and Bolognese sauce, and a topping of shredded cheese as well. I did not get to try his for obvious reasons but he reported it being delicious as well. We were both so full when we finished our plates that we declined dessert, but we were brought a dish of panna cotta served with strawberries on the house, and wow, was it delicious as well.

The service was prompt, friendly, and there was a young woman with an Italian accent who I assume was the proprietor - she was very good at explaining the dishes we had never heard of before, and made sure we were enjoying our food. All in all, as I said as we left, "We'll be back!"
author: Jamie G.

description:
Bella Trattoria was a great overall experience - delicious food and a welcoming atmosphere that resulted in a great night out with some close friends from college.

I booked a Saturday night reservation for a large group of 8 the day before. The restaurant made sure to call Saturday early evening to confirm the reservation and make sure that they had all the correct information.

When we arrived, we had to wait for our table to clear. We hung out at Buckshot, the bar next door. Once our table was ready, the host walked over and got us.

Our waiter was friendly and accommodating, recommending us a good bottle of wine for the table and checking in with us often. He asked us the occasion and seemed genuinely interested in making sure we had the best possible evening. All of us were comfortably seated and able to enjoy the meal. They let us share gnocchi as an appetizer - and it was unanimously declared to be the best gnocchi we had ever eaten. They were fine with a few sets of guests sharing entrees. We ordered everything from the risotto to the frutt' e mar and it was all delicious. The affogato was mindblowingly good...it tasted well-mixed and the ice cream tasted almost as if it were whipped into the espresso. I'm concerned that I'll never be able to properly enjoy another affogato again in comparison!

The atmosphere felt jovial. Throughout the night, there were many large tables of people catching up, celebrating, and just having a good time over a delicious meal. It feels like the restaurant thrives on these big get-togethers, and the staff feeds off the energy. 

My one criticism would be that the service (however welcoming), was relatively slow. I understand that we were a very large group, but the general service did seem much slower than ordinary, even for a table of our size. We also had to wait a bit for our table to clear, although we arrived on time.

Nonetheless, I'm glad that we decided to have our dinner at Bella Trattoria. I could not have asked for a better evening to catch up with some dear friends.
author: Alyssa W.

description: Great italian restaurant. Food was delicious, but don't go here super hungry because even with a reservation it took a fair amount of time to get seated and eat. All in all I would still recommend highly.
author: Sean D.

description:
Best dinning experience I have ever endured! I felt like a queen eating here pampered with great service.

The staff were so nice and attentive. The food was delightfully amazing and the plates were beautiful and filling. I want to come back here every night for dinner:)
author: Jacqueline b.

description:
I can honestly say there was nothing about this place I didn't love.  The atmosphere was great, sultry and low light with a great mix of jazz in the background.  The host and waiter were attentive and open to explaining the menu (as well as the Napoli Diego Maradona homage) and the food was... unreal.  The Gnocchi Verdi was verging on cheesegasmic.  Never have I had pasta so soft and perfectly complimented by such a creamy mushroom sauce.  My accompaniment for the evening quite enjoyed her gluten free red cream sauce pasta as well, which is difficult in itself to find!

Wine selection by the waiter was perfect, especially since my date and had contrasting meals and desert, but he selected two and had us taste before deciding... I loved the smokey oak taste of the first, but we opted for the smoother, sweeter taste for the lady.  I don't recall the names unfortunately.

Desert.  The gelato was like eating a light lemon cloud.  It melted the instant it touched my mouth, and much like the gnocchi, I could swear the whole experience was a dream!

If we're in this part of the bay again, you can bet that I'll be sure to stop by again, and I recommend you do too.
author: Benjamin H.

description: Nothing bad to say about this restaurant, but perhaps that's a low bar. Everything was good. We enjoyed all the dishes. But nothing was very good to great. No "you have to try this one!" moments.  Gnocchi were probably the biggest letdown as we've recently found a place that makes the most incredible gnocchi - gnocchi worth waiting in line for (which by the way, we were forced to do here.  We showed up 20 minutes early for our reservation. Our table was ready 20 minutes late.)  These were bland and mushy, smothered in cream. The Burrata, which I've had exquisitely prepared with nothing but olive oil and sea salt, was a bore. There were no hints of spice anywhere - well, maybe a stray bay leaf or the occasional olive, caper, or parsley, but that's all. Brushetta with tomatoes was standard. Wine was good.  Perhaps the highlight of the meal was the not al dente, but still very yummy Pappardelle & very rich meaty Ragu. All in all, better than pizza. We won't be back.
author: Alex M.

description:
Hidden neighborhood gem.

This place has a great ambiance, with muted lighting and dark wood interior. The staff is mostly native Italian, which is mainly a plus.  Service is warm and friendly, but can be a little disorganized. I find it helps to grab a table nearer the kitchen if possible so you stay on their radar.

I have tried several different plates here, and have not been disappointed, which I cannot say about a lot of other Italian restaurants in SF. Also, they have a reasonable corkage fee  (~$15) if you want to bring a bottle from home.

Useless addendum : I assume this place has southern Italian roots, given the various FC Napoli memorabilia on the walls. Napoli was Maradona's team during the 80s, and he really put them on the map. It was great to see homage paid to the little chubby genius...I found myself constantly staring at the posters & photos on the walls.
author: Tom M.

description: A close to authentic Italian restaurant with a touch of Napoli tucked away in the Richmond District. What I really like is that this restaurant is so different from all the tourist traps in North Beach. The food is actually pretty legit and delicious. They know their pastas, and antipasti, and their wine selection is just wonderful. I've passed by so many times, and finally got the chance to sit down and dine, and it felt right. It's hard to miss as it's right on Geary Boulevard.
author: Rika P.

description:
Tucked into an unexpected corner of the Inner Richmond, you might miss this little gem of a restaurant.

They offer a compact menu of very traditional Italian recipes and a nice assortment of wines to go with it. Atmosphere and service are warm and homey.
author: Rick S.

description: Excellent food and service.  We had squid ink spahetti arrabiata, beef carpaccio, artichoke hearts, and shrimp taglioni.  All of it was really great.  The squid ink pasta probably would be better as a fetuccini.  And they don't serve limoncello.  Best to sit deep indoors to avoid drafty door and make sure you have a reservation because there isn't room to wait indoors,  Also diner spotted wearing random french maid outfit so dress as you are!
author: Norman P.

description:
My favorite Italian restaurant. Try the carbonara and polenta because they're both amazing.

The service is usually great as well.
author: C B.

description:
When I lived in the neighborhood, this was my go to Italian restaurant.  Food is very fresh and they have always delivered on the quality scale.  My absolute favorite dish here is the Carbonara and I can honestly say that I haven't had better in San Francisco.  

The staff is almost always helpful and kind, although I have gone in a couple times and felt that the girls that work there could use some brushing up on manners or at the very least should listen a little more carefully to their customers.  

Their wine selection is pretty decent, definitely heavy on the Italian wines (which should be expected in my opinion) and I have typically found a good bottle at a reasonable price.  Do note that it is not a full bar, but they do have some aperitifs that are quite nice just the same.
author: Luke W.

description:
What a local GEM!!!! Cute on the outside, and super cute on the inside. Relaxed vibe, but with a trendy feel. Small and intimate setting--good for dates and/or small groups.

The food is delicious and each time I've been here, I've been given free appetizers and/or desserts! Love that :)

Pleasant servers and a lovely ambiance. Love Bella!
author: Joanna M.

description:
Went here last night with 3 friends.  Had made online reservation (easy) and we were 10 minutes late but they saved our table.  Ordered a very good and well-priced bottle of a Spanish Sauvignon Blanc to share with our antipasti appetizer (excellent and nicely presented).  Then came the pastas.  I had the Carbonara (wow!), and my friends had the Frutt de Mar, the Puttanesca, and the Gnocchi Verdi.  We all thought our dishes were among the best we'd ever had, and they arrived piping hot.

Desserts were good, though small and not particularly a value for the 8 bucks they charge.  Still, the Zabaglione was light and not too sweet.  Good service, nice atmosphere.  So why only 4 stars?  Because any good Italian restaurant should serve good Artisan bread to sop up sauces and pair with appetizers.  Where did they get this Wonder Bread stuff?  These people are better than that, but overall I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Chris C.

description: A wonderful Italian outpost, Perfect For a romantic dinner. Every dish a lovingly prepared. Every  Pasta dish in particular is very well executed. I am not a fan of overly self aware and self promoting  Italian eateries , so I love the understated but still generous and loving approach to food that I see at Bella.
author: Umair K.

description: Cozy little restaurant. The food was okay and the service was good. I had the veal and thought it was kinda bland, the hanger steak was good, the 2 gnocchi dishes were okay. The tiramisu i had 4 dessert was a little disappointing but the panna cotta saved it.
author: Jenny N.

description:
EDIT: 
I came here 2 more times in the past few months and I have to say I am deeply disappointed. There's definitely been a noticeable change in the cooking and in the service. I ordered the same dish as last time (Tagliolini Salmone e Caviale) because it was that delicious and my friend also ordered that dish the second time I was here. When the food arrived the portions were obviously different: mine was half the size of my friend's dish even though we ordered the same thing. Also, the dish was tasteless: no flavor and had a strong fishy aftertaste that shouldn't be there. 

The service was very disappointing. It took forever for the food to come out. One of our drinks never came and they only gave us the drink when we asked for it again. Last time we were here, my friends and I were very impressed and really appreciated how much time and effort the waiter took to explain the menu to us and present in detail the specials. The 2nd and 3rd times I was here, the presentation was lackluster and brief, it did not make me want to have whatever they were talking about. As a frequent restaurant goer, I appreciate the description of the food on the menu and personal interaction is extremely important. 

I would hesitate to come here again.

Still, I would give Bella Trattoria 3 stars because the ambiance is cute and cozy. It's still a good spot for groups of friends to gather. 

-------------------------------------------------

One word: Charming. 

What makes all the difference here is that the wait staff is amazing! All of them are friendly, welcoming and have an engaging sense of humor. Throughout the night they would check on us to make sure we're having a good time and a good laugh and even strike up some conversations. One of them even made a fruity little cocktail for my friend on the house just for fun :) (and Cinco de Mayo) 

Food is tasty, fresh and beautifully presented. I tried: Tagliolini Salmone e Caviale (smoked salmon and caviar in a white sauce) 
Also tried: Gnochhi Verdi (Spinach Gnocchi, Gorgonzola-Portabello Veschmel) so  soft and fresh!

Decor simple yet elegant. Love the hanging lights and high ceiling and since they're on the corner they have large windows looking outside.

It was my friend's birthday and they surprised her by turning up the music, having the whole restaurant sing "Happy Birthday" to her and gave her some delicious panna cotta (so creamy and smooth) topped with fresh strawberries. 

We felt like we were transported to charming Italy for an evening. We'll definitely be making a second, third, fourth etc. trip here :)
author: Evangeline W.

description:
My boyfriend took me here for my birthday several months ago. It is VERY cozy, fitting maybe 20-30 people. We were slightly late for our reservation, and it seemed that our table had unfortunately been given away. The waitress escorted us to the 4-stool bar where the staff was very friendly and offered us a complimentary glass of Prosecco (my favorite) and a delicious appetizer while we waited for a table. 

Once seated, the atmosphere really sank in around us. It is very romantic and feels genuinely Italian, as parties spend as long as they like at dinner, savoring each bite and enjoying intimate conversation.

I typically spot one or two items I like on any given menu, but Bella Trattoria had so many items speak to me, it was really difficult to chose! I eventually landed on the gnocci, absolutely divine. 

Really wonderful place for a date night!
author: Ashley P.

description:
Wow! This place makes the best Italian food I have had. Everything is hot, tasty, and amazing. Must stop of you are in San Francisco.
The owner is in the front of the restaurant waiting tables and greeting the customers. He is also the chef. 
Great food! Great restaurant! You have gotta stop by.
author: Erica L.

description: This restaurant is a gem! Yummy authentic Italian food, intimate atmosphere, and great service. We love the appetizer meatballs and all of their pasta dishes. They've given us a complimentary panna cotta every time we've dined here. The last time we were here, our 1 year old fell asleep in the car so we really couldn't dine in their restaurant. They were very accommodating in taking our to go order (as they don't always accept take out orders) and letting us know which menu items would not do best as take out.
author: Benisse R.

description: The dim, romantic lighting at Bella immediately entrances you when you walk in. The service is fantastic, the food delicately made and delicious. I never found myself with a dirty table or empty glass. Best of all: when I said no to dessert, they brought a cute little treat anyway. It was light and creamy, something I dreamed about for days after. Sometimes it's the little things!
author: Eva R.

description:
Came here with the gf twice already
very nice ambience, very intimate dining experience
great service, staff is really friendly
i like the painting on the wall of the water and gondala

gf had the gnocchi once, she said it was "fluffy clouds"
another time she had the risotto, which she couldnt finish. not because it wasnt tasty, it was just too big in portion and too heavy

i order the same thing twice, which was the norcina, tube pasta with sausage
overall was great, just a little oily for my taste. there was alot of oil left over when i finished the plate.

dessert, we were comp panna cotta once for some reason. first time i had it before. pretty damn good
also tried the tiramisu, one of gf's favorite for dessert

real good eating experience
would likely come back, after we venture off to other italian places around the city
author: Andi I.

description:
Nice atmosphere... Great service and delicious food. Can't go wrong.

Best gnocchi I've ever had... srsly perfectly cooked. Don't think I knew it could be that good.

Will be back here again.
author: Opal G.

description: Good attention and beautiful crew. Excellent food although a little bit overpriced specially if you are from a Mediterranean country. Should improve wine list with more USA wines. Un saludo.
author: Xose Luis P.

description:
Good atmosphere and wine list with terrific service to boot. Portions were fairly small but tasty, with the exception of the carpaccio which we found underwhelming. 

One tip -- the door seems to sometimes stick open. If you sit near it, prepare to either be cold or regularly have to get up to close the door!
author: andrew m.

description:
Was recommended this place by some friends of a friend who'd made a reservation for the group on opentable. Got in, got our table, and went for an appetizer of bruschetta which also came with mozzarella. Best I've ever had. Usually I dread bruschetta and dread half slices of baby tomatoes too, but these were the best tomatoes I've ever had. Flavor was wondering (seriously, I really dislike tomatoes). Only minus is that they don't even out appetizers for the number in the group...as a result, we had to endure the awkward moments of not wanting to be rude and really insisting the other party members eat the remaining piece of bruschetta.

There was an order of butternut squash ravioli, portabello ravioli, carbonara pancetta, and I had a portabello chicken pasta of some sort. 
I tried the two types of ravioli and my pasta...I'd say, the butternut squash ravioli was the best and I really wish I'd gotten that. My pasta was great and lasted a couple meals, but the unique flavor of the ravioli was drool worthy.  Tiramisu looked great and it was quite painful to have to skip trying it. They do local ingredients, vegetarian, (maybe vegan), and meat dishes, price to food and quality ratio is right on par, and their drink selection was alright. Would definitely come back...especially for that butternut squash ravioli and the good lookin' desserts.
author: Lily K.

description:
I've been waiting tables in San Francisco for 7 years & I have to say I really enjoyed the service here. 
Made a reservation online and since our table wasn't ready exactly when we arrived we sat on the couches and were very comfortable and offered a drink while we waited.

The vibe is mellow and relaxed, mostly large parties of families or couples. I liked the decor and it wasn't extremely loud in there. It seemed like there was a main server and then another person helping him out who brings over the drinks and food. 

We had a really good time, the food isn't stellar but it is good, great wine selection & friendly people working there. We went on a weeknight but  I can see that it would probably get pretty busy on the weekends. Patience is key because they are running on a small staff but if you are looking for a nice mellow dinner with a few friends I definitely recommend this place.
author: Jess R.

description: Came here with a group of 4 for an early dinner.  I don't regret coming here, but I highly doubt I'll be coming back. It's a very cute and charming little restaurant on Geary. I was actually surprised to find that it was in this neighborhood with all of its Asian influence. Our meal started off wonderful with the bruschetta. Fresh cherry tomatoes with big slices of fresh mozzarella. I loved how the bread was nice and toasty and didn't get soggy. We should have just stopped there because the rest of our meal was mediocre. I ordered the black ink squid Fruti d' Mare. It was good, but nothing great. My gf ordered the black ink risotto...came out undercooked. The waiter was aware of this and offered to recook it. It was better. My other friend had the mushroom gnocchi...way too creamy. Unfortunately, the food didn't quite work out. Wasn't bad, but then again....wasn't great.
author: Lynn V.

description:
This place is a-mazing. After a long, tiring week - all we wanted was a good, relaxing date night. Bella treated us just right. 

The ambience is part classy, part casual - and although pretty full, the service was great. The house wine we ordered was really good! 

The food is where this place truly shines - we got the Frutt'e'Mar (the squid ink spaghetti with fresh seafood), and the sausage gnocchi. Both were delectable, the gnocchi especially being perfect little pillows. The seafood was fresh!! The side of spinach is a must here - and try the anchovies with capers, a salty coastal euro treat. 

They were gracious enough to offer us some complimentary pana cotta for dessert!
author: Apurva P.

description:
A cozy restaurant with nice ambiance and solid service.

Try the Tonno Alalonga, Cotelleta Napolentana, and Pasta Norcina.

Good wine selection and topped off the dinner with a Panna Cotta.
author: Francis M.

description: After years of coming to Bella and recommending it to everyone, I had to update my review to 5 stars. Love this restaurant and the guys who work there!
author: Gina R.

description: Went here for a Sunday night with parents because they saw a very compelling episode of Check Please! Dinner was fabulous, I had the squid ink pasta which was amazing. The staff was extremely friendly and service was quick!
author: Allison S.

description:
Deteriorating, Unfriendly Service & Mediocre Food:  This place is hugely overrated.  We used to enjoy it once in a while until our favorite woman server left a few years ago. She made the evenings special, welcoming us when we arrived and providing excellent service. Since then, it has deteriorated to today's cold, UNFRIENDLY, terrible service -- from the surly older man who handles the door, to waiters you have to chase to get their attention, to long waits from appetizer to entree. 

Those aren't the only reasons we won't go back. The menu has remained stagnant and unchanging with the same old rotating mediocre entrees, limited lackluster desserts, and too-dry Italian wines that bite the tongue. My pasta the last time was not al dente but undercooked and chewy like old shoelaces.  

People who have given this place 5 or even 4 stars must not know any better.  Perhaps they've never been to a truly spectacular Italian restaurant such as Seven Hills, Acquarello or La Ciccia that offer impeccable service, outstanding cuisine and wonderful wines, well worth the extra $s. All of them deserve their stars -- this Trattoria does not.
author: Ashley A.

description: Delightful.  My husband and I were in San Francisco for the day and we found Bella Trattoria for dinner.  We were lucky they had space at the bar since we didn't have a reservation.  The staff was all very friendly and professional.  The food was delicious.  I had the Aglio e olio du verdura and my husband had the puttanesca and we were both so very very happy with the quality of our meals.
author: Sally M.

description:
Had an excellent dining experience at Bella Trattoria. Despite the somewhat sketchy neighborhood, they did an outstanding job with the decor. Blinds block the light from the neon lights of nearby building signs, the lighting is elegant, and the restaurant feels very comfortable. The wait staff checked on us several times and were very courteous.

But enough about the ambiance --- how was the food? The bread came chilled, with olive oil and sundried tomatoes. An interesting mix, quite tasty. The house red wine was great. For dinner, we tried the pasta arrabbiata and the gnocchi verde. Both were fresh and delicious. The gnocchi in particular was super soft, unlike any I've had before. We had high expectations because of the other excellent Italian restaurants we've been to in the city, and we were not disappointed. The waiter even brought us complementary dessert!
author: Laurent L.

description:
Bella is one of the best Italian restaurants in the Richmond. They have a great spinach salad and the best butternut squash raviolis I have ever had. 

A very friendly staff makes this restaurant very welcoming.
author: Nicolas M.

description:
I'm a little late in my review.. Okay a lot late, but still. I had to write one.

I came here on Italy's Women's Day on March 8th and had a three course meal prepared by the female chef. It was one of the best Italian dinners I've had in a longggg time.

Had the polenta with mushrooms and gorgonzola cheese. I can't even begin to describe how wonderful this was. Had the spinach gnocchi for my entree, and it was cooked so perfectly, with an amazing sauce that complemented the dish wonderfully.

Had the panna cotta for dessert and I only have one word to describe it - heavenly. The perfect way to end a magnificent dinner. Our waiter was fantastic! He was so sweet and attentive. I'm definitely coming back here.

The ambiance is very romantic for dinner, with dimmed lighting and candles, but you can easily bring a group of girlfriends and have a lovely girls night.
author: Sarah H.

description: A great dining experience.  The food, specials, squid ink pasta, and flank steak was fantastic! Service was awesome as well.
author: Charles A.

description:
3.5 stars

It's a really cute small restaurant on the corner (kind of easy to miss because the word BELLA blends in with the building) It's dimly lit so gives an intimate and romantic feeling, perfect for the reason why my friends and I were dining there in the first place - CONGRATS again sabby and mike!

We got a pitcher of sangria for most of the table to share. Aside from the slice of orange in our glass, it did not come with any other fruit nor did it have the fruity taste. It tasted like watered down wine. It did not give me a headache the next morning like some other places that use cheap wine, but I was not satisfied with the taste of the sangria here.

For appetizers, we all tried the tuna and beef carpaccio. They were sliced soooo thin that I could not really taste the flavor of the meat itself. I tasted more of the lemons, capers, cheese, and lettuce instead.

The two entrees I tried were my gnocchi and the BF's lasagna. I had never had gnocchi before but I had always wanted to try these potato dumplings. I imagined it to be a little starchier but the gnocchi at Bella was veryy soft, too soft.. it was like a savory marshmallow. I did not really like the lumps of mozzarella either. I'm very familiar with the texture of mozzarella  but for some reason this time it was very hard for me to chew. I did like the sausages though and overall it's a pretty filling dish.

I did like the lasagna a lot. The meat sauce wasn't too tomatoey (just the way I like it) and the lasagna skin was cooked perfectly. I can surely speak on behalf of the BF that his only complaint was that there was not enough.

I did not try, but I was told that the housemade spaghetti, pork chop entree, and squid ink linguine were all good too.

It was really nice of Bella to treat us to sampler of their desserts. I can't remember exactly each one, but I remember the tiramisu, panna cotta, and mascarpone pudding type dessert was really good.

I don't really go out to eat Italian food, but I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who's looking to go on a nice dinner date at a Italian restaurant with reasonable price and great service.
author: Katherine C.

description: Bella's has become a favorite go to restaurant. It's close to dining at a family friend's home. The main courses are excellent. What sets Bella's apart though is the olive service, and the salads, and the bread, and the first course antipastos, and the wine list. All quite good. So....if you're visiting San Franciso, come down Geary to the Richmond. And if you live here.....stay away....it's tough enough to get a reservation let alone a drop in.
author: Walter C.

description:
I wanted Bella to be a neighborhood go to and I actually don't think I need to go back for awhile.

Ambiance : Overall, it's great. The lighting is a little dim but, we really liked it.  Lots of dark wood with specials written on the board.  Although, we really weren't sure the last time they had been updated.

Service : Well, it was not spot on.  Our busboy was wonderful.  He kept our water glasses filled and hot water coming to the table for tea.  Our server on the other hand we had to flag down to take our order.  He checked in on us to see how our meals were only after were practically done with our meals.  Then we had to flag him down for the check.  On the bright side, he did seem to be paying attention to every other table except ours.

Food : I went with the recommendation from Check Please and many other reviewers by ordering the gnocchi.  The gnocchi was light but, why was it gummy?  While it was edible, I found it to be very sticky.  We also ordered the carbonara which boasts no cream. This was a miss also.  They did bring a complimentary blackberry panna cotta at the end of our meal which was delicious.

I may give it another try, just not right away.
author: Denise G.

description:
Hidden gem on Geary. 

Service was impeccable - our table was not ready when we arrived, which wasn't a big deal to us, but they gave us each a glass of champagne while we waited and authentically apologized for the wait. Our server (may have been the owner?) genuinely cared about our experience. Very knowledgeable about the food and asked us questions to ensure we would get meals that we enjoyed.

The food was delicious as well. We had the bruschetta, Arrabbiata, and the Pasta Norcina. I'd highly recommend all. Prices were on point for portion size too.

As for the atmosphere, it was very relaxing and romantic- low lighting and aesthetically pleasing decor. My significant other took me here for my birthday and I can say it was one of my favorite birthday dinners I've had. Looking forward to returning!
author: Sara D.

description:
First time there and I had a great time!

Came here on a Wednesday's night around 6pm.  There was only table there, we got the table right the way.

The decor of the restaurant was very nice.  The ambiance is cozy, warm and intimate.  The service was very good too.  Very efficient, welcome and friendly.

They started off with a free appetizer (don't know what that is) but it was good.  The complimentary bread was so good.  Fresh and warm.  I especially like the Olive oil with the sun-dried tomato.  Good combination.  

We got the  Bruschetta as the appetizer.  It was toasted bread with chopped tomato, garlic, basil and olive oil.  It was so good.  The bread toasted so perfect, not too crunchy.  

My friend ordered a Smoke Salmon pasta and I got a chicken and mushroom pasta.  Both pasta were cream sauce.  The sauce was very creamy and flavorful.    Out of the two pasta, I like mine more.  The chicken was tender.  But the only thing was my pasta was slightly overcooked.  Overall, still very delicious.

Actually I wanted to try their dessert but too full.  And they were so nice to give us free dessert.  It was Panna Cotta topped with strawberries and blackberries.  The Panna Cotta was good.  Very smooth and creamy but not too sweet.  

Overall, I had a wonderful at Bella.  I will go back there for sure.
author: Liza T.

description: I am not sure why people rave about this place so much. Besides the service being good the food was only okay. The gnocchi was horrible. If you like eating a lackluster texture gnocchi you should come here. The moment I took a bite I was so disappointed. It was like eating nasty baby food.
author: Will C.

description:
This place is a nice place in Inner Richmond to get your fix with Italian food.  I came over here with my g/f to celebrate my birthday.  It was a little rowdy and noisy inside as far as the ambiance went.

I ordered the spinach and cranberry salad and squid ink risotto, and my g/f had the chicken rigatoni.  Everything was really great except the squid ink risotto.  Had to wait 25+ minutes for it only to find out that it was a bit undercooked (it was a little hard and rough in texture), but I just ate it anyway because I didn't want to wait out another 25 minutes for another portion.  I will say however, the taste profile was spot on for the risotto and was actually tasty.

The upsides were they did give us free fried polenta, polenta with mushrooms, and even free dessert!  Based on previous reviews, this seemed like a pretty common theme amongst a lot of guests, so I can only say positive things about their service.

Overall, this is a nice italian restaurant that has good flavor profiles and does give a lot of great customer service.  I think it is well worth a try if you are in the area.
author: Lawrence E.

description:
Even though I'm a new Yelp reviewer, I've utilized Yelp for years to find the best, the cheapest and the most convenient. Two months before my graduation, I sought a restaurant that had parking, accepted reservations and provided a decent atmosphere for 10 people. By decent atmosphere, I mean I didn't want my group to seem too loud amongst other patrons, but also wanted it to be fairly quiet that I could converse with my guests. San Francisco is a hard place to find restaurants that meet all criteria, mainly due to the parking issue. 

Bella Trattoria is on Geary, which offers somewhat more parking than a restaurant downtown. My ceremony ended at 7:30, so I made the reservation for 8:15. Even though the restaurant was basically one giant hill away, I wanted to give my guests (coming in 3 different cars) enough time to find the place and find parking (which is tricky on a Friday night because of things happening on Geary and Clement, respectively). We all showed up on time, but the restaurant wasn't ready. I was a little irked because it was cold, raining and small (meaning some of my family had to stand outside while waiting). Finally three tables were vacated and they seated us. I will say the server was patient and originally very attentive. He quickly asked what the occasion was and provided me a free glass of champagne.

The bread was cold, drinks took a while (no hard liquor, just wine) and the food took a while as well. I ate the squid puttanesca. I think the Sir had veal osso buco (delicious!). Most of my family members thought the portions were very small, but the food was good. They also provided free panna cotta and I mean free. Not skimpy free, but three plates-worth so everyone in my party could have a try. I think this was a peace offering for the wait time and it was much appreciated and not expected. 

Overall, the atmosphere was exactly what I was looking for. I don't think my party was loud, don't think anyone was even too annoyed by my party and the service was ok. I do think I may have went on a night where the entire restaurant was comprised of 3 large parties, but that just worked to our favor. Another thing I liked was that instead of tacking on the expected 18% gratuity for large parties, they provide a recommendation and let you write in your choice. I clearly appreciate the small things and eventually would go back.
author: Mae M.

description: I have lived near Bella for 5 years and have never stopped in. What a fool I am! The ambiance was charming, the wit staff delightful and the food superb. I highly recommend it.
author: H S.

description:
Went here for a romantic dinner with my girlfriend and it was pretty cool.  Made reservations just because of other reviews saying how crowded it gets.  The restaurant is on a corner so easy to spot....parking not so easy.  I actually spent 30 min finding parking on a Saturday at like 6pm so I guess it should of been expected.  

We got an appetizer of a beef carpaccio I believe?  For us we thought it was good but for the price and the amount of food it was, it just didn't do it for us.

My gf got the verde gnocchi which she just loved! Of course I had a bite and it was delicious, for me I could of used some meat but still really good.

I myself got the hyped squid ink pasta because nowadays I always look at yelp to get an idea of what to get.  Looks really weird...tastes really good!  Definitely would get it again!

For dessert we ended up getting the panna cotta and that was just delicious as well.  Nice and thick and creamy.

Overall the restaurant was awesome and the food was amazing except for the carpaccio. Just got to look out for traffic and parking especially on a weekend in SF.
author: Jeremy M.

description:
My girlfriend and I went to Bella Trattoria Jan 31 2015 and had a great experience.  Things did not start great however as the hostess was not receptive at all when we walked in the door 5 minutes early for our reservation.  She was on the phone for a good 3-4 minutes before another employee noticed she hadn't said a word to us and came to greet us and let us know they were preparing our table.

From there it turned into an amazing experience.  Jube was our waiter and was incredibly friendly.  He made us feel very welcome and made great wine recommendations to go with our dinners.

I had the squid ink pasta and my girlfriend had rigatoni with sausage.  We also split a brussel sprout appetizer.  The food was really tasty and well seasoned (not too salty).  The rigatoni especially was cooked perfectly. 

The good food and incredible service from Jube really made for an awesome meal.  We will definitely be going back!
author: Todd K.

description: I love it here!  They make the best Tiramisu I have ever had!  I've been everywhere in SF trying to find the best Tiramisu and this place beats any place in North Beach!  They're Panna Cotta is fabulous too!
author: Cece L.

description:
This place is such a dainty restaurant filled with friendly waiters and an amazing ambience. 

I went here with two girlfriends and ordered the bruschetta and carbonara. Never expected this place to be so good! My two other friends ordered garlic bread, gnocchi, and carpaccio. 

I highly recommend this place for a date!
author: Tessa A.

description: Great little spot with friendly environment and very good food.  Price is also reasonable for the quality of the food.  It's nice to have a place like this outside of North Beach and other more crowded parts of the city.
author: Josh P.

description: This is one of the best Italian restaurants we've been, and it was almost by chance. This is the perfect example of a successful restaurant that is not part of a chain. A little entrance, really cozy, all the personal is very attentive and the food is amazing as well as the coffee. Super good job you guys, I love this place, definitely coming back.
author: Eduardo R.

description: I don't usually eat pasta, because I don't find it very interesting at most places. At most restaurants, the pasts itself is okay, but really just a vehicle for the sauces or other ingredients. After reading several of the reviews my girlfriend and split a couple of their pasta dishes (I don't remember what they were called) and they were both worlds better than even the pasta I had in Italy. I will definitely come here again!
author: Jeremy G.

description:
Amazing little Italian place out in the Inner Richmond.  Went here with my mom and my roommates and, let me tell you, sooooo delicious! Between the four of us, we each had a salad, and then 4 different pasta dishes - Gnocchi with sausage, tagliatelle with 6hour pork ragu, zuppe de pesce, and an amazingly simple, and sweet spicy amatriciana pasta.  Honestly, homemade pasta makes the biggest difference, this pasta just melts in your mouth! 

We came in looking for rustic, homestyle, italian cuisine and what we received was everything and more! Will be coming back soon for sure! Very happy this is soo close to our apartment. :)
author: Camille D.

description: The food is ok, very rich but rather plain. The service is also just ok. Nothing impresive about this place. I will not come back again.
author: Lydia L.

description: For and service was great. I took my boyfriend on a romantic date and this was the perfect spot. It was small inside, the lights were dim, it was just a intimate setting. Loved it. My waiter was named Yubey sorry if I spelled it wrong but he was very helpful when suggesting dishes that was similar to what I wanted.
author: Michelle G.

description: Bella has become our new Italian "family" meal spot.  We recently moved into SF from the 'burbs and needed a good, solid sport for high quality, high value dining.  Bella is it!  After just a few meals, the staff recognizes us, surely that is unique.  The meals have been wonderful, tasty, well-prepared and thoughtful.  Something for everyone, kids, meat-eaters, veggie lovers, adults, etc.
author: Peter S.

description: I'm in SF to visit my cousin and her two little kids and we went here for dinner. We made reservations at 6:30 and no one was at the door to greet us or tell us what to do. My cousin was trying to find parking so I brought the kids into the restaurant and it was already 6:30. It was a very small restaurant with no space by the entrance. With no one telling us where our table was, the kids and I had to stand around for about 10 minutes before someone realized we were standing by small entrance by the door. Then it took them another 5 minutes to set up a table for us. There were already open seats but their seating process just took forever. We ordered a Gnocchi Verdi, Pasta Norcina, and a Frutt' 'E Mar. The food was decent. I didn't like the gnocchi verdi as much because the wine taste was very strong in that dish. The kids didn't enjoy it either. The Pasta Norcina was my favorite! We also asked for a 500 ml wine and they forgot about our wine order so we had to ask for it again. The waiter apologized for the misplacing our order. He was the best waiter that waited our table because he was responsive and apologetic when he forgot what we had ordered. There were at least 4 waiters/waitresses bussing our table. It just seemed very chaotic. If I were to visit SF again, I would most likely not come back or take people here unless I had a lot of time. It was a cute italian restarunt though.
author: Kailin C.

description:
1. Good Classic Italian (More Italian Italian than American Italian). 
2. Nice clean but cosy atmosphere 
3. Friendly knowledgeable wait staff 
4. good wine choices

If I like in the area, I would probably go more often. but I have too many great Italian choices walking distance in my hood...
author: Chie J.

description:
I think there's 2 types of Italian...the mom and pop types (you know, like you could probably try and make a lot of the dishes at home, and it's comforting), and the high end (you know, the type where you have no idea how they made it).  This is the former, and it's done just right. 

The tuna app was great...super thin, with a drizzle of oil and melt in your mouth.  yum!  We also got the eggplant parm app, and it was good, but not anything to hit home about.

Off to the mains...a smoked salmon pasta and a simple arrabiata.  First off the pasta was fresh, and fantastic...this is simple simple thing most places can't do right.  I could have actually eaten the pasta without the salmon and not complained at all.  The sidekick raved about her dish too, said it was spicy as balls, and perfect.  

Closed off with a tiramisu (what better way to judge an Italian place?)...probably one of the best I've had.

OK the service:  Gordan Ramsey would probably scream at the owner to either stay in the kitchen or work outside, I think he's doing both with staff helping.  No issues really, but we were there for almost 2 hours.  We don't take 2 hours to eat, but since the food was good it's worth it...just dont plan on meeting your friends afterwards.

For 3 drinks, 2 apps, 2 mains, and a desert, the $100 price tag was dead on.  This will be a go to for home made simple tasty Italian.
author: A A.

description:
Excellent place. Was even treated to a short bird-bath by the fellow bringing us water - no matter, they obviously care about what they are doing here. Everything was first-rate and reasonable. I want to go back for the pizza, which is uniformly awful in the Bay Area, to see if maybe they can make a decent pie.

All in all the very best Italian I've had so far in SF.

I'd like to take a minute to thank the Board of Supervisors of the City of San Francisco for taking away free Sunday parking meters. Yet one more jackass regressive tax. Well done!
author: George S.

description: I'm glad we finally made it here - it's a real gem! It was super easy (and surprising) to make a quick reservation for a party of 4 on a Saturday night. As everyone else mentioned, the squid ink pasta and gnocchi were delicious - almost everyone cleaned their plates. We had a great time and tried as much as we could on the menu. I enjoyed the bone marrow, brussel sprouts, ahi tuna carpaccio and affogato in particular. The only reason it wasn't a 5-star experience was the service, unfortunately. Although we were promptly seated, our entrees came out slowly. In fact, the main course was luke warm and not hot. I would definitely love to come back, but maybe not on such a busy night.
author: Soph H.

description:
Their not much words that can describe how happy i cant wait to go back.

 this place was a quick find on Yelp by the way 

are appetizer was the the not so classics to Bridgette that was quite a beautiful this to see fresh got mozzarella  on there with amazing olive olive and cherry tomatoes a very tasting opener 

i got the green gnocchi an it was so incredible to eat an soft in texture.

my boyfriend had the red one an he said it was the pasta Italian dishes he has had in along time an he Italiano.  

an last my grandmother had the squash ravioli's sense she cant eat hard textures anymore, the smile on her face when she ate this amazing raviolis that had a hit of cinnamon that was quite delicious   as a note blew my flavor to says oh, my god .
author: Seaera T.

description:
I was super excited to get some GLUTEN-FREE PASTA in the city! This place had great reviews so I thought I was in for a treat. Me thinks not. They offered Gluten-Free pasta made from CORN and you can basically take a handful of other dishes and replace it with the GF pasta. So far so good. I made the switch, asked for the spicy arrabiata with the GF pasta, done and done. The pasta came back in ONE BIG CLUMP. I had to just take some of the strings that were lose on top and give up on the rest. On the positive, the SAUCE was AMAZING, fresh, spicy, flavorful. I thought it was just the life of a GF girl but my friend ordered REGULAR PASTA and it was ALSO CLUMPY. My other friend ordered the pasta with chicken and mushrooms and there was HARDLY any CHICKEN. When they asked how the meal was, I showed them my clump and they said "well that's what happens with Gluten-Free pasta". Um no. I buy brown rice pasta from the grocery store and it never clumps up, I said in my own head. I just smiled and they took the plates away. They came back with some free desserts, PANNA COTTA and LEMON SORBET both of which were GLUTEN-FREE and amazing. 

Overall, I'm not impressed. This is a pretty high end place with homemade pasta... they should have a bit more pride in what they are serving. If you cannot execute the dish, don't serve it. I would have been fine with a chicken dish or something non-pasta than eat a clump of corn pasta. Sad.

#Gluten-Free
author: Natalie L.

description:
I'm so happy we decided to try out Bella Trattoria.  I live in the Richmond District and what a great neighborhood find. The restaurant is small but comfortable, Unlike many restaurants in the city we were able to converse without being force into shouts.

Service was friendly and attentive.  Had the warm spinach salad and butter nut squash ravioli both were good...the pasta was off the hook. For dessert tiramisu very nice.  Plan to return soon.
author: alison g.

description: food was delicious, but the service was even better. the waiting staff was so attentive and provided us with complimentary bruschetta and pana cotta. the actual restaurant is very cramped, but makes it seem even more like you are part of a tight-knit italian family. recommend making a reservation ahead of time!
author: Jeanne J.

description:
Adventured into the city with the BF for an anniversary dinner and decided to try Bella as it was recommended by a friend and near the CAL Academy. I immediately knew I wanted to get the Carbonara based on all the yelp reviews...and boy did I not regret it! Every bite was so flavorful and bursting with flavor my boyfriend wanted to eat mine! He got the linguini with tomato sauce and tiger prawns. Everything was really fresh and even the bread tasted home made.

The service was really great - the waitress helped us pick a wine to pair with our pasta choices and suggested an appetizer to start. We got the Parmigiana, which was roasted eggplant with tomato sauce and lots of mozzarella. The skin was still on the eggplant, which I usually wouldn't mind, but with the first bite of both our pieces the skin was a little stiff/chewy. Otherwise, very tasty. Also got to sample some of the baked polenta and a panna cotta for dessert compliments of the chef! 

All the waiters were really wonderful and it was a very authentic romantic place to have dinner. Would definitely recommend it to others and come back again to try some of the other dishes.
author: Tracy F.

description: I love the panna cotta it was so creamy just how I like it. I would say that the prices are pretty pricey, but it is worth it.
author: Krystal S.

description: The service was quite slow. They were friendly when they checked on you but its pretty much greet you, bring you your food and check. The food was good. The gnocchi was pretty light and flavorful. The meatballs were quite.tender. It was busy for a weekday. I don't think I will be making the drive back.
author: Eve C.

description:
I'm glad I picked this place for date night. 
The crostini and parmigiana were really good.
The butternut squash ravioli was a tad bit too sweet.
But the tiramisu made up for it all! It was the best I've ever had. Hands down!

Why did they lose one star? I wanted to only take away half because of the wine. Since I went with a glass, the taste made it obvious that it was a bottle that had been open for a long time. It was a downer on an otherwise great evening.

Service was really good. Friendly waiter that made the experience great.
author: Paolo B.

description:
Sometimes in life you get surprised! I had one of the most amazing nights at Bella with a very special person! The restaurant itself small, quaint and homey with a very classy but down to earth feel to it. Dimmed lights, not too loud, very romantic setting. The ambience and atmosphere is perfectly conducive to the beginning of a very romantic evening. 

I don't even know how to get started on the food. Before appetizers, we got the bread and olive oil. We inhaled it. The oil was probably the best olive oil I've ever had! Then we got the bruschetta and OMG. Food-gasm. Absolutely the best best best I've ever had in my life. And believe me I've tried a lot of different bruschettas! Every ingredient was so fresh and made with so my TLC that it was absolutely incredible! I had just a simple spaghetti for my main meal and my special person had the seafood platter. I didn't try the seafood platter but he said it was YUM! Now my dish -- I'm not usually a fan of spaghetti, but for personal purposes I was vegetarian this day (thus the reason I didn't try the seafood platter) and the server suggested that I just pick something on the menu rather than customizing any dishes. So I settled for the simple spaghetti and to my surprise it was the absolute most incredible pasta I have ever had!!!!! The spaghetti was handmade by the chef and all the ingredients used were so incredibly fresh. It was also the perfect flavor!!! I was really full and had to take it home and ate it cold the next day and it was stilllll incredibly delicious. 

I can go on and on about this place. 5 stars is definitely not enough! The service there was also just amazing. When we got there we didn't have any reservations but they made a setting at the bar and made it very intimate and it turned out better than sitting at a table. Also every person there was so nice and very attentive to what we needed. At the end of our meal, they gave us a dessert on the house! We topped the meal off with an expresso and called it a night. 

This place seriously did no wrong. And it did incredible amounts of right. I almost don't want to go back to preserve that perfection in my mind, but I'm pretty sure that even if I go back, I will have a great experience. I can confidently say this is my most favorite Italian restaurant until date. 

Bon appétit!!!
author: Aditi U.

description: This place was excellent! So glad we came here. Great staff, wonderful ambience, extensive wine collection, and the food was amazing! The kind of food you crave! I will definitely come again!!
author: Meghan D.

description:
Above average Italian fare. 

The olive oil dip is to die for (exhibit 1). 

Amuse Bouche of warm polenta and cheese melt-in-the-mouth lovely. 

Our pasta were fresh and of the well-prepared variety.

Moist tiramisu was delightful.
author: M Y.

description:
I would not say their food is the best of the world, nor very unique or special, but there's really nothing to complain here, everything is just really good!!

What I love the most here? I have to say it's the BREAD!!--yes, the bread! It's really one of the best I have had ever!!!

My pasta was good--though the sauce is a bit heavy for me, but it's still really nicely down. The grilled trout was nice and the pork chop was delicious too!:) 

And, I didn't forget my favorite dessert--panna cotta!!! Yummmmy yummmmmy!!! Can't leave without that!!

I will definitely go back sometime...but next time will not be for business, so I can eat more, hahaha!
author: Chloé N.

description:
Bella Trattoria is a somewhat small restaurant with a nice dark candle light-like atmosphere going on inside. The waitress and waiters are really friendly in this place. It's a nice place to bring a date to.

Their menu seem to change once in a while and there's a special that they have also. The food is pretty alright in taste and authenticity. Pasta is one of their main sellers in this place. The taste is differently different from your commonly found pasta dishes consisting of marinara, Alfredo, or presto. My own gripe is the food came out kind of slow and only warm since they serve all the dishes at once. The bread appetizer with olive oil is pretty good and a great tie over until the food comes.
author: Steven B.

description:
I really wanted this place to be good. 

My boyfriend and spent last Saturday in the city and found this place using Yelp. It was a very busy evening and they informed us that the soonest they could seat us was 8:15, about two hours after our arrival. Being that we were not in a rush and read all the rave reviews on Yelp, we thought thought this was a reasonable wait. 

We arrived at in time for our reservation and were promptly seated. However, it took about 10 minutes to get our bread and at some point before we had ordered the servers rearranged our seats and we were sitting at a four top instead of the nice romantic two person table. 

I ordered the butternut squash ravioli. It was a little too sweet for my tastes and I was not remotely a fan of the nutmeg sprinkled on top. My boyfriend ordered the frutt e' mar. It was so incredibly spicy, but to make matters worse when he mentioned as much to our server, our server gasped that it was not supposed to be spicy and insisted, over my boyfriend's protestations, that he take it back to the kitchen and have it re-made. If only this ended there: the head chef personally came out with the "remade dish" and informed us that the it was meant to be spicy and they added something to make it less so since my boyfriend just couldn't handle it. Neither my boyfriend and I knew how to respond to this, not only did the wait staff not know an integral component of the dish, but we were also insulted by the chef. 

This eating experience was not worth the two hour wait. The second star is for the complimentary desert. It was the most delicious part of the meal.
author: Leanna N.

description: The burro e salvia (butternut squash ravioli) is to die for... But the portions are soo tiny. I could have eaten three of these plates. Other than ravioli portion size (and maybe parking), I highly recommend this place!
author: Teresa N.

description:
My little sister was in town visiting and we were looking for local Italian restaurants-
we hit the jackpot. Not just an excellent meal but an excellent dining experience!

We started with the Guazzetto, sauteed clams and mussels in a garlic, tomato sauce.  The clams and mussels were the freshest I have ever had and were expertly cooked.  The sauce was so good that we asked for plenty more bread to soak up every last drop.

I ordered the squid ink pasta with seafood.  It was delicious, a perfect compliment of flavors and textures.  My sister ordered a delicious Pasta Norcina, full of flavorful sausages and covered in a light, creamy mushroom bechemel sauce.

We finished with their Panna Cotta and it is every bit as good as the reviews here give it credit for.  Soft, creamy and pleasing to the palate.

The food here is not just cooked and bussed to tables, it really is crafted and delivered.  The atmosphere is warm and inviting.  We were seated next to friendly regulars and the staff was attentive and efficient.

This is a smaller restaurant, and I could see where there would be a temptation to move people through, making tables available.  This was not the case at all.  Our meal was paced just so that we would derive maximum enjoyment.

I will definitely be going back and will make Bella Trattoria a destination to treat my out of town visitors.

Excellent.
author: Michael M.

description:
The food Is VERY good! I would highly recommend this restaurant for a romantic date night. The dramatic, small cozy atmosphere gives the restaurant a very intimate feel. I will definitely be going back.

however, the service was very slow. (it could have just been an off night- be sure to have reservations)
author: Erin A.

description:
Came here for an engagement party so it was a prix-fixe menu with 2 appetizers, 4 entrees, and a dessert plate. It came out to being around $35 a person including tax and tip. The portions were pretty small and each dish had to be shared amongst 3-4 people. These were my highlights:

bruschetta - The pieces of bread were toasted just right and topped with fresh tomatoes and basil with mozzarella on the side. The cheese was really bland but everything else tasted great without it. I had 2 helpings of this! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/msT3LrLB4fhN04HYHuFsew?select=7v3PWQxrYMnD9dryVch5ig)

breaded pork loin - This was pretty much a breaded pork loin covered with tomato sauce and some parmesan cheese. Nothing that special but wasn't dry and tasted good. The size was skimpy though and could have been more substantial. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/msT3LrLB4fhN04HYHuFsew?select=XkUQNcQY5Mi1WuXnIvzjsA)

4 mini desserts - I liked how they provided some variety with this. It included a mousse, ice cream, a mini slice of strawberry cheesecake, and a flan-like strawberry dessert. They weren't that bad nor too sweet  but were difficult to split up to share. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/msT3LrLB4fhN04HYHuFsew?select=rNtFK5p9tsISsqogBTbg3w)

Everything else was mediocre at best and the service wasn't the greatest. We asked one of the servers for a spoon but he kinda gave us a rude look and never came back with one. They also didn't really come by to check up on how we were doing, just to take away empty plates and deal with the bill. Maybe it was because some of us were sitting on the far end of the room and we had a big party.

The ambiance was definitely romantic with the dim lighting and candles on each table. I might consider coming back if I was in the area and craving Italian food.
author: Karen Y.

description:
I made reservations via Opentable but when we got there for lunch, the restaurant wasn't even open yet. The hours were wrong on Opentable and Yelp. Luckily there was someone inside who graciously let us in "early" and told us we could be seen and seated but the cooks haven't all arrived yet. Little did we know they were preparing to have the World Cup on TV with random people waltzing in and out of the restaurant cheering loudly while eating our meal. We came here to celebrate a birthday so it was not the ambiance we were expecting but everything was made up for by the service and food. 

This place serves some legit Italian. You can taste it in the sauces especially. The gnocchi was awesome as gnocchi should be and all plates were licked clean. We were given free dessert at the end of our meal which made everyone's eyes light up. I think they felt bad about what happened with the reservations. The dessert was definitely a nice way to say I'm sorry and thank you. It's the little things that matter and for those reasons this restaurant left a huge impression on me. Thanks Bella Trattoria for taking care of me. I'll take care of you by coming back soon. Promise.
author: Jen Y.

description:
I have never written a review on yelp, but Bella made it worth the effort.

After getting frustrated with parking in north beach, we decided to seek Italian food on the other side of town. We found Bella on Yelp, and I am glad to say it exceeded expectations. 

We were greeted by David immediately on arrival, and shown a great spot to sit and eat.  David's friendly demeanor and great advice made our evening even better. The appetizers and entrées were equally fantastic, and Bella's commitment to locally sourced foods added icing to the cake. 

After a long and treacherous day, an evening at Bella's turned it all around. I look forward to returning soon.
author: Robert N.

description:
I don't know if I came on a bad day, but I had family in town so I made a reservation for 6 at 7p.  

Our table wasnt ready at the time, so we waited a bit, no biggie.

It looked like the waitress was the only server.  The restaurant is small, so maybe there are 12-15 tables.  But it is big enough for at least 2 waiters.  Service was not slow - it was TERRIBLY SLOW.  Took us 45 minutes after being seated to be asked what we wanted to order.

Than the food came out, and it was ok.  For Italian food, it was not great, not even all that good.  The flavors were not seasoned as best they could have been.  

I was really hoping to like this place since I live very close.  The interior is nice and the setting is nice too.  I am hoping it was just a one-time deal.  I came to this restaurant because of the way it was rated, but I was disappointed.
author: Jorge C.

description:
Made reservations here for myself and my girlfriend and it lived up to the other reviews. Main things to know about the place: very romantic, delicious bruschetta, and the little dessert at the end (a flan style dish with fresh cut strawberries and ice cream) was the perfect ending to the meal.

Only downside it took a while to get seated (even though I had a reservation) and the place is a bit understaffed. Other than that we had an incredible night, it's easy on the wallet, and the food is phenomenal and filling!! It's a great date night spot!
author: Jennifer F.

description: I love Italian food! The pastas here are pretty good. The only disadvantage is that it's pretty far. I came here with a large group of friends and the restaurant was very accommodating even though they had limited space. =) I gave them -1 star because I was charged an extra $10.00 on my credit card than what I had originally written. It might be a misunderstanding due to my messy handwriting =( but none the less, I wasn't too happy to discover the extra charge. Otherwise 4 stars for good food and good service.
author: Annie Z.

description: Small restaurant with big flavor. Servers here seem to like what they do and they do a fantastic job of keeping the vino flowing. Tiny bit on the pricier side considering the area, but solid food nonetheless.
author: John B.

description:
I lived in the outer richmond for 2 years and I always passed by this restaurant on my way to school thinking it was one of those places I won't ever eat at until I'm 30 and settled in my career. 

Then my last night living in the city my boyfriend surprised me and said we were eating here. Of course, I was skeptical about it because it was probably expensive and served small, delicate portions. I was only partially wrong. 

When I entered Bella, the ambiance and decor made me feel like I was in Italy and it's a pretty cozy and intimate setting. My boyfriend and I were seated right away since we got there right when it opened. 

With the help from our waiter, I ordered the sausage & mozzarella  gnocchi while my bf ordered the seafood pasta. Both of which were on point. I think what puts this restaurant at a 5-star rating was the service. The waiters that night were friendly and helpful with the menu. & nothing beats dessert on the house because "a dinner is not complete without dessert."
author: Cydrienne L.

description:
Bella indeed.

Delicious food served by a very friendly waitress in the most warm and welcoming of spaces. Charming all around.
