Sundried tomatoes and warm bread was a nice start. Following that came a house pasta surrounded by all things seafood. Mussels, calamari and clams complemented the squid ink linguini perfectly. Took time to get the goods out of the shell, but the upside to that is your meal lasts longer. Good thing this was a meal I did not want to end anytime soon.

Good to know: Free corkage Monday - Wednesday. Consider it another reason to go.
author: Jason B.

description:
About lunch. Sometimes it difficult, in the neighborhoods, to find a reasonably priced, truly good lunch.  I can go to Delfina, or Farina in my neighborhood, and pay more and MORE, but if you want to wander afterward and find out what's new, the meal can be hit or miss. Bella Trattoria now serves lunch on Friday, and an excellent meal it was. Venison carpaccio was chalked on the board outside, but of course that was intended for dinner diners. Still, I asked, and our excellent waiter said they'd be happy to make it up for me at lunch. Memorable and delicious. More than that really, but I can't find the right superlative. Followed by spinach gnocci with gorgonzola and morels. Just great.  House red. Perfect. "Would you like desert?" "No, thank you. We'll be good boys today." Well, why not share a panacotta on us. No charge." The panacotta is an education. Unbelievable!

Bella Trattoria is a fine neighborhood restaurant. I would recommend it enthusiastically, and look forward to a dinner there soon.
author: David A.

description:
Very nice neighborhood place and you don't have to fight the downtown or North Beach traffic.

I've eaten here three times and never had a bad meal.  The service is very good.

The food is even better.  When I've been here, I've either had the fish special (sea bass) or the gnocchi.  Everything is good.  Bella Trattoria is good enough to bring out of town guests but reasonably priced enough for you to have a quiet night night out with someone.

Get a reservation on Friday or Saturday nights because the secret is starting to get out.
author: Jim K.

description: Hidden Gem!  Romantic Atmosphere!  Authentic Cuisine!  Reasonable prices!  Friendly Staff!
author: Jennifer G.

description:
Matteo is the best, please visit him and all the wonderful people at Bella. I not only loved the food and great staff but the decor and just the vibe of the restaurant.

The pastas are great, we tried the rigatoni, carbonara and gnocchi. The desserts rocked!
author: Ed N.

description: Great cocktails and glute free pasta. Can also make dairy free options for people who can't eat dairy. Yummy and great service.
author: Addie S.

description:
First off, the risotto is to die for!!!You should allow at least a 25min for them to prepare the dish because it's made from scratch.

Service: There was never a moment I felt like I needed to ask for anything.  
Food: Top Quality Starting at the bread.
Price: Very reasonable

A full course dinner for two was under $100!( Including a bottle of wine.)
author: Amanda H.

description:
I had the best table bread of my life here.  My mom, cousin, and I came here for dinner after walking the Golden Gate Bridge.  (My cousin's a San Fran firefighter, so he knows what's up, and all the good places.  This was his doing!)  Our basket was constantly refilled with sourdough bread that emitted steam when you tore it.  And it was so chewy!  Oh, wow.  Best bread experience.  For sure.

The wine selection here is quite extensive-- it didn't seem as if you could really go wrong.  We certainly didn't.

Entrees were amazing.  I ordered spaghetti carbonara, and it was so simple and wonderful!  I must say, though, that my favorite carbonara was on my Tuscany trip last year, but I really can't hold that against them... theirs was a close second.  My cousin got the special of the day (I totally forgot what it was-- some ragu of some sort I think), and my mom got butternut squash ravioli.  All was delicious.  

Of course we got dessert.  (Hey, it was vacation!)  I had some sort of affogato coffee thing, which rivaled my favorite dessert at Manhattan's Otto.  My mom and Steve split tiramisu, and I stole lots of bites.  Solid, all around, fantastic.

Ambiance was perfect, too.  Good for an early-ish afternoon family dinner, but I can see that it would be a nice date spot, as well.

The only reason I am not giving them five stars (and maybe this is far too picky because I loved everything about this mean) is due to the olive oil for the bread.  I just wish it were a stronger olive oil!  Of course, the bread is so dang good that you don't really notice... but that is the one thing I would have changed about the meal.
author: J. K.

description:
Went here on a Saturday night. Wait staff and front end personnel are tops. Food quality and portion size are good for the price....for the price. If you're looking to be blown away by haute cuisine, this ain't it. My personal feeling, this place is a neighborhood spot. A place to go when you don't want to cook tonight, but I don't think it's a destination or special occasion restaurant, and that's just fine with me!

Drinks/Bar:  Bellini made with something akin to Welch's peach juice and prosecco served in a glass filled with ice...WTF? Modest house wine selections that complement the menu choices, but nothing special.

I would go back again if I were in the neighborhood and wanted a bite to eat, but I can't see going out of my way from the East Bay to this place as a destination spot.
author: Fozzie D.

description: Maybe the best gnocchi I have ever had.  They are perfect delicate pillows!
author: Courtney C.

description: Cannot say enough great things about this restaurant! They hosted my birthday dinner for 12 on a Thursday. The owner worked closely with me to chose the food in advance. As mentioned by others, the food and ambiance are perfect! We LOVE this place for intimate dinners and special occasions with friends!
author: Jenise C.

description: I got seated almost right away upon arrival without a reservation in place-- which is always a great + ! My server was attentive and the ambiance is just what I like when looking to dine in a restaurant. Cozy, romantic and clean. My boyfriend and I shared two antipasti dishes, the bruschetta and the meatballs. The bruschetta was very delicious, cheese wasn't too overwhelming and the tomatoes give it this light and fresh taste. The meatballs were seasoned perfectly and the sauce was full of flavor. I had the Macaroni with ragu (tomato cream sauce) as my main and he had the infamous carbonara. Both were good dishes but he expected more from the carbonara. The reason why I didn't give this place 5 stars is because the antipasti selection was mostly vegetarian dishes (wish we had more selections with meat). Would also have liked to have the option to request for extra items (meat/seafood) to add to the pastas. With that being said, I would still definitely revisit this place again and again. I'll live with whatever they've got on their menu for now.
author: Jingi A.

description: Amazing service and even better dishes. Romantic ambiance yet very comfortable for any occasion. First time was great and will definitely be returning.
author: Alexander G.

description:
Fresh made pasta!

Complementary bruschetta and  panna cotta! 
My dinner company was blugging that it was because she is cute. I am glad to find that everyone else gets this.
Zabaione was good. 
Only a few places has squid ink pasta in SF. But, the pasta was stuck together and was very difficult to eat... I think this is deadly for pasta dish.... My friend seemed to like the pasta dish.
author: Mika G.

description:
Yeah, the soft bread with the olive oil and sun dried tomato killed the meal for me. It was SO GOOD (and oh so very, very filling, too). Incredible!

Everything we had was really good, including the gnocchi and squid-ink linguini.

My first impression of the place was that it is true to its name (quite lovely!). And the service was so kind and amazing at every turn.

Will definitely be back for wonderful Italian food!
author: Chung N.

description: This review is long overdue. Love this cozy, yummy place with amazing service. Food is outstanding. They often bring extra bites in between your courses. Ambiance is great too.
author: Nina B.

description:
quaint neighborhood italian restaurant that is upscale enough to be trendy without being stuffy. fantastic food if a bit on the pricey side.

came here on a saturday a bit before the dinner rush, but it fills up quickly so make a reservation. if you have to wait, prepare to wait outside because there is no room inside - the service stand is right when you open the door...it's very odd, but space efficient!

buffalo carpaccio - perfect proportions of all ingredients, which i find really important in carpaccio preparations

bone marrow - delicious but the salad that accompanied it was incredibly vinegary (not sure why it was even there)

bruschetta - remember having it, remember there was something odd about it like a lot of olives that didn't belong there, remember thinking it was good but i probably wouldn't order it again

osso bucco - i actually enjoyed the dish, but it was a tad salty and the texture ends up being mushy meat on the mushy polenta. i like salty and mushy stuff so that was fine by me.

papardelle - freshly prepared wide but thin pasta, cooked perfectly, with an incredible pork ragu. this was by far the highlight of the evening

panna cotta - yum

affogatto - espresso was pulled expertly, and with the ice cream, even better

service is a bit hit-and-miss. while everyone was friendly, waiters seemed a bit rushed for no reason and they seemed to check on you at the wrong times and forget about you whenever you need a drink refill (be that water or wine!).

side story - towards the end of our meal, our waiter asked us to rearrange our seat and could probably have been more thoughtful as he did so after moving the table next to us, but we really didn't mind. however, he apologized and thanked us a couple of times, comped us one of our desserts, and offered a free pour of port. the moral of the story? all is forgiven with free booze.
author: Sherman L.

description: I have DREAMS about this place, and we've only been twice. One of the most romantic locations in SF! The food is amazing and the hospitality is unbeatable. And, reasonable prices on food and wine! So happy to have found this little gem!
author: Amanda E.

description:
"Restaurants are worse than banks; $20 corkage fee and now a 2.50 for a cake cutting fee!!!!  I'll cut the freaking cake for free!"

Bella Trattoria is one of those places that has been around a while.  I have been here a lot of times.  I haven't gone in a year or so because I felt the quality was slipping a bit.  So I gave it another try. 

I think the pasta's are very good for the most part.  Nothing spectacular; but good value.  Where they make their money is on all of the other courses. 

RIGATONI SALSICCIA was my favorite dish.  It was really good.  Rich, creamy and the sausage was fantastic. 

We also had the Tagliolini Salmon E Caviale; just ok; shocked it was so salty, especially with the caviar.

The minestrone soup was good. 

We had the large antipasti tray and it was good, but not a large portion at all.   The warm spinach salad is fantastic. 

I've been in the restaurant business but I'm still ticked at the newest way to gouge customers; the cake cutting fee.  It takes 15 seconds to cut a cake.  $2.50 for a fee?  

Lets make it easy and say you made a cake for $10.   Lets give 8 servings in the cake.  Add the $7/pc of cake, to the $2.50/cake cutting fee.  

That means a cake that costs $10 to make, is being sold to diners for $76!!!!!  Maybe I'm missing something.

Service was good.  it was a nice place to dine but I've had better.

Pro's:
-minestrone
-antipasti platter
-really good staff
-decor
-warm spinach salad was fantastic

Con's:
-food is pretty good but some dishes miss the mark; too salty.
-appetizers and desserts expensive for what you get/portions small
-outrageous cake cutting fee which is becoming norm for almost all restaurants so it's hard to beat on them for it.  


Nice place; good staff; great food at times, so so at other times.  I'll give it one more chance.
author: JMark P.

description:
Been to Bella Trattoria about 5 times and am always satisfied. All the food is great, the staff friendly but not overbearing and the complementary strawberry flan/custard dessert is delicious!
The ANTIPASTO DELLA CASA is a great starter and the gnocchi is amazing!
author: Daniel J.

description:
Every time I hear about this place, it angers me. Seriously ANGERS me. It reminds me of that story, The Emperor's New Clothes. It seems like every other person thinks this place is great except me.

It tries desperately but fails miserably to be a fancy respectable restaurant. But then again, I might be the idiot here who chose to wait an hour and 17 minutes for a silver dollar-size portion of undercooked Tragliolini Salmone that I finished in two bites. I guess their idea of fancy is to serve a bite size portion on a large plate and charge $18 for it, while making you wait, and wait, and wait. In addition to the Tragliolini, I ordered a cup of Minestrone soup. I'd pass if I were you. - Bland would be an understatement. I still can't get over how long the wait was for our food to come out. If you have an appetite for bullshit, then this place will definitely satisfy you with a big hot smelly plate of it. No one ever came out to apologize for the delay or bothered giving an explanation as to what was keeping the food from coming out. All I kept getting was that it would be coming out in 15 minutes. When the waiter says "15 more minutes" three different times after you've already waited 32, I believe that qualifies as getting the runaround. Instead of owning up to their mistake, they tried to appease us by serving us some disgusting excuse for cake. First of all, why would anyone want cake before their pasta and after their soup? Also, when they came out with the cake, they served it to us with such arrogance, as if they were doing us such a huge favor. The cake was basically the size of two pieces of See's candies stuck together. 

What puzzled me was that the restaurant wasn't even busy that night. There were two other parties, but more empty chairs than occupied. I guess that should've been a sign to stay away since it was a Saturday evening. The second sign to cut our losses and just leave was when a couple came in after and left before us. Their food never made it out to their table. I don't know if they had a change of heart or just got sick of waiting. I will never go back to this place. I feel like a fool for putting up with them.
author: John S.

description:
Right off the bat, the most memorable part of Bella Trattoria is the customer service. The whole waiting staff is so friendly and offered honest suggestions/opinions of their food if you ever have trouble deciding what to get.  I brought my girl here in hopes of finding a decent Italian recent to show her.  We had a reservation at 7:30 but we got there at 6:00 and it was no problem, seated right away and served their fresh house bread with sun dried tomato olive oil. Nice touch.

I already had the Gnocchi Alle Sorrentina(Gnocchi, ground sausage, fresh mozarella)  in mind while my girl ordered the Tagliolini Al Salmone, a Bechamel based pasta with salmon.  As we waited for our food, the host brought out complimentary fried Polenta for us to try, another nice touch.  
The handmade gnocchi was delicious and had the right consistency and I appreciated the fresh mozzarella that topped the meal with the italian sausage.  The fresh handmade linguine with the salmon dish also tasty with the caviar that topped the whole dish.  Near the end of the meal, we were brought another complimentary strawberry panna cotta for dessert which was so creamy. Seriously, the customer service is amazing, two servers even followed us out of the restaurant making sure we had a good time.  

Although the we both had a good time at this place with the food and service, I wasn't totally blown away by the execution.  It was indeed very good, but I can't bring myself to give it a 5.  Maybe a 4.5, but there's just a little something missing to get me there.  Maybe another visit will earn that star.
author: Justin L.

description: This is a MUST when visiting San Francisco! The service was excellent, and the food was to die for. It was the perfect blend between home cooked comfort food with a sexy ambiance. You can definitely taste the love put into each dish. Very authentic and flavorful! If you're craving Italian, this is your place!
author: Britt B.

description:
Came here for Valentines Day with the bf. There was a special Valentines Day menu so he and I shared the appetizers which was an array of olives, cheese, meat. We also shared the gnocchi in pork ragu, pork belly and fish. I really loved the gnocchi and fish! The gnocchi was so light and delicious. I normally don't like gnocchi, but I was thoroughly impressed. The fish was also very tasty and crisp. I was disappointed with the pork belly as I thought it would be the star of our meal, but it was just ok. For dessert they give you 3 mini desserts - spumoni, cheesecake, and panna cotta. Panna cotta is my favorite, but here it was just okay... I still enjoyed it overall.

What also really surprised me about this place is the interior! It's really well done. One wall is a mural of Venice boats and the other are all really dark while the place is dimly lit. It's definitely a nice date spot you would be surprised to venture to in the Richmond.
author: Jackie M.

description:
Came here the other night after a full day of not eating. My girlfriend and I were very hungry seeing as to how this was the first meal of the day and we thought that an italian restaurant would be the most fitting since... ya know, pasta. 

we made reservations on yelp for 8:30, and we arrived at 8:45. we were greeted by a wonderful hostess; she was warm friendly and helpful. 5 stars to her. 

anyways, upon entering we immediately noticed that this place is unlike any regular restaurant. the decor was very romantic, and the lighting was quite sexy. candlelight makes for the perfect date. when we were seated, we quickly found out that this was a nicer, more formal type of restaurant.

we ordered 3 things from the menu. the mushroom sausage spaghetti, the pork cutlet, and this portobello cheezy appetizer. i forget what it was called.

before our food came, we got bread and a side of sundried tomato virgin oil to dip. the bread was very good.. but it may be because we were starving.

the 2nd item that came to our table was this new creation of the kitchen. it came complimentary from the chef. it was basically a grilled piece of provolone with some green onions on top -it was grilled very nicely and it tasted very good in small bits (we cut it up ourselves). the chef then came out and asked us how we liked it. we liked it very much.

the next item that came was the portobello cheezy appetizer. there were 2 of them, one for me and one for my girlfriend. the first bite was... interesting. i liked the first bite. it was different to say the least. it was savory, creamy, yet.. also sweet in its own unique way. it worked very well with the cheese and portobello. however, after taking.. id say.. 3 bites? it became quite overwhelming, and i could not finish the entirety of it (nor could my gf). 

then, our entrees came. my girlfriends cheezy mushroom sausage spaghetti (~$14) was really really good. I really enjoyed having 2 bites of her dish.. however it also became overwhelming after a few more bites. i had the pork cutlet ($19.00) and it came as only a large piece of breaded pork topped with melted cheese on marinara sauce. it was really good as well.. but also became extremely overwhelming upon further bites. neither of us were able to finish our entrees even though both dishes werent much in portion. with more than half of our food left.. we got the check. 

the decor is really romantic, and the hostess and chefs are really nice, friendly folks. its quiet in there and a good place to wine and dine. however, i wouldnt say that the food is THE BEST ive ever tasted. it was way too overwhelming for everything. perhaps i am unfamiliar with the norms of italian food and my bias has overcome this yelp review, but i felt the food was too strong.. each bite felt like a meal in itself... i couldnt handle it, nor could my girlfriend.. too cheesy, too buttery, and too overwhelming! just my 2cents. other than that, wonderful place. i would suggest a glass of wine to help with the food.. perhaps it would have made the entrees better. to conclude this post: great first bites, but overwhelming 4th, 5th, 6th... etc bites.

-wifive-
author: simon k.

description:
Cute Italian place (surrounded by chinese restaurants of the Inner Richmond lol)
Antipasta: fried rissoto stuffed with mozzarella - so-so
Main: Got the lasagna and bone marrow soup.  
Lasagna was good - beefy and cheesy. but pretty small portion.
Bone barrow soup - was ok.

Service was great! - on the house antipasta: fried polenta
and they gave us our desert tiramisu on the house as well since they took a little longer on making our food.
author: Kent T.

description:
Fabulous place.  Terrific food.  Friendly staff. Ability to make reservations. And affordable.  What else could you ask for!?!?!

For starters, the fact that you can make reservations on Open Table is always a plus.  This place is kinda small, probably seat 20-30 so plan ahead.

Service was terrific.  Water would always be filled.  Did not hesitate to give more bread and the waiters / waitresses always had a smiles on their faces.  Just an upbeat, happy, lively, and fairly romantic place.

Decor is elegant and fairly romantic, but this area aint my forte.

As for FOOD.  BREAD = DRUGS, because it is so addicting.  Fresh bread that is soft which compliments well with the olive oil and sun dried tomatoes.  The bread was honestly my favorite.  As for the pasta, everything was fresh and delicious, just as equivalent or even better than places where u may pay 20+ a plate.  As for the desserts, they are adequate.  Good but nothing special.

Basically....A MUST TRY!!
author: Ryan G.

description:
Thank you 'Yelp Monocle' for helping my friends and I find this place after a very long Bay to Breakers morning. We were definitely at different levels of 'hangry' by the time we got here, but the staff was very very nice and they kept the warm-toasted bread coming with the olive oil & sun-dried tomato. As we ate the bread, one of the owners(?) was watching the soccer game cheering on Napoli, which just added to the authenticity of the food.

For a very good price of $15, we had the special which came with either a garden salad (with a very good vinaigrette) or tomato soup, the daily pasta (which fortunately was the carbonara), and a scoop of gelato (which was cherry napoletano. All were very good and well seasoned. We were amazed to leave this place spending less than $20 while being full but not stuffed. Check it out... it's worth it.
author: Rhoi C.

description:
This was my second time at Bella. My first time was with a large group of friends. I'm sure the service and food were great since I wanted bring my friend here for her birthday.

We made reservations in advance since it was for a special occasion.

The server was a little slow to seat us, but after a short wait we were shown to our table.

After deciding what to order, we looked around for our server but he was no where to be found. We asked another server to find him for us but she instead said that she would help us (the best thing that happened to us that night). She was very friendly and made great suggestions for our appetizers.

For our menu:

Appetizers - polenta w/ gorgonzola, brussels sprouts w/ panchetta and lemon zest

Very delicious. Polenta was crispy yet very soft on the inside. It was even tastier since it was given to us on the house. =) The brussels sprouts were cooked very well and you could taste a hint of the lemon at the end.

Main entrees - gnocchi w/ italian sausage, squid ink risotto, and fish special of the night (trout with spinach)

Gnocchi was nice a soft and the sauce was rich and delicious. The squid ink risotto was slightly too salty for my taste and the dark ink made it hard to see what I was eating, but the dish had a lot of fresh mussels and clams. The trout was very meaty and succulent. The skin on the outside was nice and crispy which gave it a nice balance. The spinach had great flavor as well.

Since it was my friend's birthday, the servers brought a special dessert which was a platter with tiramisu, fresh strawberries, and panna cotta. The tiramisu was very moist and delicious. The panna cotta was smooth and creamy. The strawberries were a nice touch as well.

All in all, the food was great. The service was excellent (minus the hiccup in the beginning). I would come here again for the good, but the service made the meal that much better. Plus, I was in good company.
author: Hannah C.

description:
I am a responsible yelper, I swear on a stack. There's no reason to tear a place apart after one bad experience, I have a lot of empathy for small business owners, especially restaurants. 

In fact I was not going to review Bella Trattoria at all, until as a parting gesture,  the manager blamed all of the mishaps first on "a new waiter", then when pressed further (because the missteps and poorly prepared food were obviously not the waiters fault) "the kitchen was really slammed tonight", and "but we gave you free dessert to make up for it".

So, the "free dessert to make up for it" was an extremely runny Zabaglione with 3 spoons for us to share. Nothing custard like about it, so you're eating....raw eggs? Or, not eating. blech.  And from reading other reviews, you get Zabaglione whether you're being made up to or not.

A manager throwing his staff under the bus, second guessing the waiter and screwing up the sequence of our food, and not knowing how to suck it up and just apologize when he had whisked 3 dishes away to be re-done in the kitchen....nope, I would never go back.
author: Gwynnie P.

description: I had the pleasure of enjoying a fabulous experience at Bella Trattoria, San Fran. The food was fabulous: refined and elegant in preparation, presentation, quality and flavor. I strongly recommend the Aqua Pazza.  Wine: Go with the owner's wine recommendations: knowledgeable, pleasant and appropriate to the menu choices. Bon apetit!
author: Ken L.

description:
Ate here with friends last Saturday and had a pretty mediocre experience.

The hostess was terrible. We showed up on time for our reservation, and she told us our table would be ready in "two minutes" and shooed us out the door. We ended up waiting 20, and when we finally sat down, she started to take away our wine glasses because she assumed we were underage. I guess it could've been flattering since we're all well over 21, but she did it without asking and was kind of rude when we stopped her. We ordered the house white, which came in a carafe, and the same hostess later tried to take the wine from our table when it was still 1/3 full because she "thought it was water."

Service was slow. Took a while for us to get water, to order, and for our appetizer to come. The bruschetta was pretty good, but the gnocchi verdi I ordered for my entree was overcooked, lukewarm and incredibly salty. They seemed kind of understaffed that night, but I don't think that excuses the hostess's attitude or serving pasta that tastes like it came from a TV dinner.
author: C L.

description: Great place, came here on Wednesday and place wasn't crowded, super nice staff and vibe!  Food was amazing! We really liked the meatball antipasto and thought the gnocchi was melt in your mouth good. Will totally be back again!
author: christopher h.

description:
I'll be honest, this place probably deserves a 3 star at best, but I gave it a two star to help adjust the weighted average.  I think because it has 4 stars, our group decided to try it.

Let me reiterate what some others have posted, this place is over rated big time.

The food was so-so at best, and they were out of a lot. Secondly, they sold out of every red bottle of wine under $35, and told us, the kitchen was slammed so we might want to order an appetizer to hold us over.  We didnt, but our food literally came 10 minutes later. 

Speed wasnt the problem.  THe gnocchi was too soft and salty, was a 1 star dish.  The Ragu was a 2 star dish, not to be mean, but it kind of tasted as if they used Ragu... and i had the sausage and portabella mushroom pasta. Mine was the best, but a 3.5 star at best.  Each of these dishes was $16.95.

The only nice thing they did was provide us with a free (tiny) appetizer and a small dessert to share.  Nice gesture, i will give them that.

STaff was friendly, i had no problem with that either.


I really am just being genuine in that the food just wasnt good.  In this economy, you dont like "testing" new restaurants at this price point and finding out they are terrible.

Anyway, there are many other italian restaurants to go to, this isnt one of them.
author: Adam J.

description: I've lived in the neighborhood for three years, and I got to Bella Trattoria at least once every three months.  The staff is absolutely fantastic and super helpful.  The food is consistently delicious, fresh and very fairly priced.   The gnocchi is always light and fluffy but my favorite is the carbonara!  Seriously, the carbonara is ridiculously good and not as heavy as it is at other restaurants.  Oh, and the fresh bread and red pepper dip is fantastic.
author: Joe G.

description:
Long story short, inside is wayy more appealing then you would think by just looking on the outside. I'm in retail myself so i'm all about customer service and theirs was on point to the maxxx. Super friendly even though my friend tried to change tables a couple times. All we did was talk and take our time, they were super patient with us. Food was delish!!! We even got complimentary drinks for my birthday! Music was good, even the other customers were friendly inside. Maybe I just caught them on a good night...
but I AM super excited to go back there which will be any one of these days now. What can i say? Everything was absolutely marvelous.
author: Sandra T.

description:
Let me begin by saying the service was outstanding! Couldn't have been more attentive to our needs... However on the other hand our food was a hit or miss... We ordered the following:

ENTREE: 
*Butternut Squash Ravioli
*Carbonara- Pasta of the day with crispy Pancetta
*Acqua Pazza-Pan seared Tilapia
*Squid ink Risotto di Seppia - it does take a while as they forewarn 

DESSERT:
Ricotta Tart with Strawberries
Tiramisu
Zabaione- custard with berries topped with amaretti cookies

The Ravioli was definitely full of flavor...  However one thing that we couldn't deal with was the oily texture of the ravioli...

The Carbonara was a bit on the chewy side for my friend however I enjoyed it a bit more than they did so I suppose it's a hit or miss based on personal taste.

The Acqua Pazza was by far our favorite dish and thankfully the entree ordered by our birthday girl! Everyone gave it rave reviews however could have been that much better if it had some pasta my friend recommended but definitely still great! 

The Squid ink Risotto di Seppia was ok at best but a bit on the salty side for my friend... We understand it's part of the deal you get with squid ink but I've had this before and it wasn't as salty.

The dessert was a nice touch for our birthday girl as each had their own good (not amazing) qualities except for the tiramisu... Now that was delicious! 

Overall I'd have to rate this place a 3.5 stars but seeing that my only options are between  3 or 4 stars I would then have to choose 3 stars... Definitely great ambiance and service but food needs a bit more UUUMMMFFF!!!
author: Juan P.

description:
I've lived in the City for 15 years and frequented this solid Italian establishment many many times. So many that I assumed that I'd Yelped it already. But somehow, it slipped through the cracks, so here goes:

Dark and cozy, the dining room accommodates small and large parties alike, despite it's small interior. I was able to book a table for 9 on Open Table; do you know how difficult that is to do? Most restaurants this size won't let you book anything larger than 6. 

Service is always attentive and pleasant. When we first started coming here, they weren't that kid friendly. We had to make do with a stack of tablecloths for a high chair. These days, I don't need a high chair, but they broke out the crayons and activity sheets which I was surprised to see. They also offer pasta with marinara sauce or butter to appeal to kids' simpler tastes, along with stuffed pasta selections on their bambini menu. And there's always their solid spaghetti and meatballs. 

On this last visit, we were celebrating a special occasion, so the fam was out en masse. Hands down the most outstanding, must-have dishes were the braised pork (cooked for hours) red sauce (I apologize that I don't remember the exact name) and the squid ink risotto or linguini offerings. So beautiful and flavorful...mmmmmm :D 

The desserts are fine...nothing to write home about. I just like coming here, because it's comfortable, unassuming, and relaxing. The pasta dishes are solid with a nod towards different Italian dishes other than the usual lasagne and spaghetti and meatballs (though not to be scoffed at...it's darn good too.)
author: Virg Y.

description: Always have been a fan of this little intimate location - outstanding food and service - homemade pastas are all worthy of trying - big fan of the squid ink pasta along with anything they do with their entrees - have been here numerous times and will be coming back as long as they are there.
author: Richard D.

description:
I decided to be the most awesome girlfriend ever and take my boyfriend out to a semi-nice dinner. We decided to stay away from old favorites like PPQ or Tofu House, so we went a completely different route - Italian it was!

Unfortunately, this place was not good. Let me soften the blow by saying the service was excellent. I had such a friendly server who was personable and attentive - it's just a shame that the pasta did not measure up to the service.

First, the bread - it's not warm and crusty. It's cold, white, and reminded me a lot of Iron Kids with a thicker crust.

I got some kind of sampler pasta type thing, that included the gnocchi (which I typically love) and two other types. First, the portions were TINY. Probably 3-4 pieces of each kind of pasta. The gnocchi was so mushy and doughy that it wasn't edible. I left hungry.

My boyfriend got the seafood linguine, which was moderately better - but I prefer the clam linguine I make myself at home. Sorry Bella Trattoria, I wanted so badly to like you, but alas.
author: Genevieve W.

description: The bf and I made reservations for this place at 8pm on a Friday night. We were greeted by friendly staff on our way in, but our table was not ready. There was barely any room to stand, so we were sent to the grungy bar next door for over 20 minutes (when we were told 10) to wait until they came over to get us. I was not too thrilled about this part, but we did get to play some skee ball in there while we waited. That was fun. Anyway, when the server finally brought us back in, we waited a bit more at a tiny bar in the back until we were finally seated. The waiting was a bit annoying, but the service was excellent otherwise. While looking through the menu, we were given complimentary cheese-stuffed mushrooms, which were delicious. Then we had bread with sundried tomato oil (SO GOOD) while waiting for our dishes. For the appetizer, we had the parmigiana (eggplant with melted mozzarella and tomato sauce), since they were not serving the bruschetta, but it was still very good. For the main dishes we ordered the carbonara and funghi risotto-- both were delicious. I think that risotto might just have been the best risotto I've ever had. The extra 25 minute wait was worth it! We were too full for dessert, but they gave us a complimentary blueberry panna cotta, which was the perfect amount for us and it was really yummy. This was a very nice date spot-- dim lighting, candlelit tables, excellent service, great food. The only complaint I have, which I also noticed in other reviews, is that they need better time management with their reservations. I definitely recommend this place though!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
I've been here twice now and it seems like not only did my experiences differ from each other, but from everyone else's as well.

My first trip, everything went uneventfully fine - nothing spectacular but nothing to complain about.  We had a party of about 12-15, so certain expectations were naturally lowered.  The food was clean and tasty, and service was perfectly adequate for our experience.  Towards the end, it did feel like we were getting rushed a bit, but it was understandable since, with another large party in the back, they probably wanted to turn over the tables.

The second time I was here though went significantly worse than the first.  Since we only had a party of six, I thought their service would have been better given our party was half the size as before.  However, it was a total miss.  After we had ordered, it took what seemed like an eternity for the first few plates to show up.  We then waited another 5-10 minutes before asking where the rest of the dishes were.  The waiter promptly disappeared into the kitchen to check on them, and reappeared with plates in hand....for the table right next to us.  We were then informed that they had already been served to us...which was news to the half of us that were now chewing on our napkins in starvation.  Sadly, when our dishes were finally brought out, the plates were barely warm.  It's unfortunate that the service was a miss on this night, since the food portion didn't disappoint.

Seeing all of those more positive reviews makes me feel like it just might have been an off night and that I should give them another chance.  If I ever do, they shouldn't expect a long leash...
author: Mike L.

description: We had a wonderful time The staff was extremely attentive and the food was terrific. We had the squid ink pasta with seafood which was tasty and unique.
author: CHARLES N.

description: Wonderful service! My boyfriend and I made reservations for our 1 year anniversary at Bella Trattoria only going off of what Yelp reviews and it's rating. I can honestly say that we were not disappointed. The moment we got there we were greeted and directed towards our table. Our waitress (I wish I knew her name!) was wonderful. She was very sweet and attentive. Once we placed our orders, it took a while to actually get the food but it was an understandable wait time since it was pretty busy. While we waited for our food the waitress as well as a man, who I assume to be the owner, kept checking on us and letting us known that our food would be out shortly. Once we got the food, it was everything we hoped it would be. It was delicious! I had the Aqgua Pazza and my boyfriend had the Tagliata Al Gorgonzola which we highly recommend to everyone!  At the end of our meal we ordered dessert. We had a tiramisu and Spumoni. When they brought it out they had a candle on it and wished us a happy anniversary. It was sweet of them and unexpected. I thought that the side notes added when making reservations would be ignored but the owner made sure that he stopped by and made sure we enjoyed our dinner. Thank you!!!
author: Alyssa M.

description: This restaurant is one of the best in the City regardless of price.  Their menu and the food they serve is simply outstanding and delicious.  Their wine list is excellent and reasonable.  Everything is good and the tiramisu is the best in the city.  The carbonara is superb.  You can spend more money elsewhere, but you are not likely to get better food.  Davide, the owner, really cares about what comes out of the kitchen.  Service can sometimes be slow.  Shoot, but it's still fantastic.
author: Ralph B.

description: Came in one night before a movie.  Small place with ambient lighting.  Good service with knowledgable waiters.  The food was great.  Would definitely go back.
author: Sara Z.

description:
My fiancee and I got last minute dinner  plans, and on 31st of December we realized how nice would it be to get some great Italian, and how lucky we were to find this place on Yelp!

First when we got there, we decided to go somewhere else, because of NYE prefix menu, and just we stepped out of the restaurant their manager, I think, run after us and asked what was the problem, and then immediately offered us regular menu, just we won't be able to get everything but few limitations, but we liked it!

Check it out -- they WORKED with us :)  Me likey :)

Then our waitress was super awesome, great wine recommendations!

Our dinner was spectacular, and I was blown away with special gelato. 

5 Stars!
author: Anelya S.

description: Delicious food, amazing wine and friendly staff. Be sure to get a reservation as you want the full experience without having to wait. Also, if they're serving meatballs, make sure you order them.
author: Colleen P.

description: I tried the squid ink pasta as well as the sausage Rigatoni. Rigatoni was excellent, and the squid ink was solid. I also tried the brussell sprouts and I thought they were a bit bland. Overall, great meal and would definitely go back.
author: Rohan S.

description:
This is a really nice place, but a bit pricey for Italian food.  Plus, when we walked in they told us it was reservations only, and the next available seat was at 8pm... it was 5pm.  We looked around and the restaurant was half empty.

HOWEVER, as we were about to leave, the chef or head waiter came up to us and offered us a seat if we could leave in an hour.  Since we were in a rush anyway, and knew that this was one of the few Italian places in SF with a gluten-free menu, we were taken in!

We ordered the tagliolini salmon with caviar, and a rigatonni with salsicca, both with the gluten free substitution.  To be honest, I was disappointed at how small the portions were for pasta, and also how often I kept thinking throughout the meal that Bella Roma in LA was so much better!  It was decent, though.

There was a corkage fee of $15, which was a suuuuuuper bummer. 

I don't know if I would be back here someday in the future if im in SF again, just because I hate corkage fees, and also the portions were minimal while the sauce was OK.  And also the crazy reservation requirements.  It was a fun way to explore the city, though!  The neighborhood is really cute :)
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Yah!  I'm a fan!

Yelpsters hit the nail on the head again!

I was looking for an non-Asian restaurant in the Richmond and Bella came up.  Reviews were great so I booked a table for 10 (6 adults and 4 kids) on opentable.com.  Tuesday night, a bit crowded but not too noisy.

Appetizers of Manila clams with tomato sauce were good.  Antipasti was great - spread of grilled veggies, cold cuts and olives.  Waitress recommended this for a party of our size and it worked out perfectly!  It was something we were considering so she was great to suggest this.

We ordered 5 pasta dishes, grilled pork and risotto.  Everything was delicious!  I would order these again:  pasta cabonara, penne with tomato-cream sauce, risotto with mushrooms, grilled pork and gnocchi.  I thought the squid ink linguine was just okay.

Service was a bit slow for us since we had 4 kids between the age 2 - 8.  If it was just the adults, it would have been fine.

They were attentive but not hovering.  Water glasses and bread baskets were refilled quickly.

Desserts were really good.  I'm not a fan of spumoni but profiterole and panna cotta were AWESOME!

Price is what you'd expect for this kind of neighborhood restaurant.  Pasta dishes were between $15-$20.  We brought our own wine (no corkage, thanks for the tip yelp!).

Can't wait to go back!
author: Susan C.

description:
Went there tonight with my BF, we both really liked our food.
We shared the Chef's Antipasti Plate, mortadella, salami, grilled eggplant, and zucchini, some sun dried tomatoes, and a bit of blue cheese. Yum!
i had the fish trio, (i can't remember exactly what it was called) It consisted of: salmon, tilapia, and a prawn, in lemon butter sauce, and a few roasted potatoes. I highly recommend this to any fish lover! I wasn't wild about the prawn, it was a bit too bitter for me, but the rest was perfect!
We shared the tiramisu, which was also very enjoyable! 
My guy liked his alot too, but it was a very small portion. I guess you're supposed to order like authentic Italians do. (Pasta, and a meat dish.)
The service was a little slow at the beginning.It seemed like we waited awhile for them to take our order.Although, it picked up after, and they were very quick to give refills.

I don't think they have a liquor license, but there is a good, (and cheap!) wine selection, and a few beers as well.
I should also mention, this restaurant is in an area of the city that you wouldn't go to unless you had a specific destination in mind. Not a bad neighborhood, just not alot going on. 
Seek it out, it's worth the trip!

****Update: Have been there quite a few more times, and have become a major fan! The staff remembers you , and are incredibly cool! The food is consistently great too! They have become an SF fave of mine!
author: Amanda G.

description: Located right by my house, this was a place i always wanted to try and finally did. They sat my girlfriend and I in a wonderful spot right by the window. When you sit down, they give you some of their fresh made bread (amazing!) with olive oil and sundried tomatoes. Their wine and beer selection is pretty good, so we also had a few beverages. If you are a beer person, they have a few fun/random ones that are a little expensive, but very good. We shared bruschetta, which was truly great. As for our entrees, we both ordered pasta dishes. I had this trio dish, which had a raviolis in a cream sauce, a rigitoni in a red sauce and gnocchi. The gnocchi was by far the best. I will definitely be back
author: Tyler L.

description:
This restaurant is awesome and is currently featured on Scoutmob!  In addition to the dishes ordered below, we were also presented with a free sampling of fried polenta and the panna cotta with strawberry sauce.  Both were delicious and left me wanting more!  I'll definitely be back.

Housemade Bread w/ Sun-Dried Tomato Olive Oil - my only complaint is that too much bread was served to two people

Kalamata Olives - standard kalamata olives without the pits

Spinach Gnocchi - this dish was the only one I wouldn't order again; the gnocchi was too pillowy for my taste and the texture reminded me of mochi (I love mochi, but not in my Italian mushroom cream sauce)

Roasted Eggplant - beautifully roasted with a bright tomato sauce and melted mozzarella
author: Jessica P.

description:
This place was perfect!  Took my girlfriend here for her birthday dinner and she loved it.  Small and quiet atmosphere, great food, and very reasonable prices.  The service was great also.

Definitely going back.
author: Brian T.

description: I came here for dinner with my girlfriends based on one of their recommendations from a local TV show "check Please". We started out with their version of a "negroni" and it was tart and refreshing. We shared the beef carpaccio, warm spinach salad and mushroom and polenta with gorgonzola. They were all delicious and on point. The spinach salad had a nice balance of citrus and olive oil and was my fav. For dinner we had the special, pappardelle with pesto and shrimp and it was yum. We also had the pork osso bucco and it was served over fettuccine. It was creamy and good. The other girls had gnocchi and rigatoni with San marzano sauce and sausage. All dishes were tasty, and the pesto dish was my fav. We end our dinner with fresh brewed coffee and biscotti and vanilla affogato (not sure if I spelled it right but it was tasty). The service was perfect. This is a small neighborhood type venue. My only negative comment is that after we paid our bill we felt rushed and it did not appear that anyone was waiting for our table. We did stay for a couple of hours,  we did spend $200 so I am not sure what the hurry was.
author: Margo J.

description: Celebrated my birthday here a couple years ago. I was less than enthused with the service and the food. Never coming back!!
author: Bianca B.

description:
I'm not a big fan of Italian pasata because I prefer nice fresh home made noodle. Bella Trattoria is the Italian restaurant that provide delicious home made fresh pasta dishes.
Bread with nice sun-dried tomato are good
Nero di Seppia, the squid ink risotto is superb! I feel I'm in the ocean. 

I will definitely come back here for more yummy home made italian dishes.
author: JustinE Y.

description:
I've only been in the SF area for about a month now, and have literally been eating Thai, Vietnamese, and poor student meals for the duration of my time here. It was a great break to get some good Italian food. I had the tomato cream sauce rigatoni with italian sausage, and the sauce was absolutely perfect. Not too heavy, and perfectly tomato-y, like a thicker creamy tomato basil soup. My friend had the gruyere polenta, but the cheese flavor was a little bit too empowering for me. If you're all for the gruyere, then it's a good choice because it comes with a mushroom sauce, which was pretty complimentary. The pork ragu with gnocchi was a bit sweet, and the mushroom/chicken rigatoni was a bit too oily. My plate was my favorite. =) 

To top things off, the service was GREAT, and dessert was divine. The panna cotta was so light (tasted like a realllly light, rich creme brulee), and the strawberry syrup was tangy and sweet. YUM. I'd go back just for the dessert. 

The sundried tomato/olive oil/bread service is also delicious - the softest bread ever. I will definitely be back.
author: Lillian K.

description: Needed a relatively quiet place for dinner with my 94 YO Mom, a tough thing to find in most cities these days. We had a party of 7 and were made to feel at home in this cozy little neighborhood spot. The service was extremely hospitable and friendly. Excellent  appetizers and entrees alike. Butternut ravioli was awesome as were the other pasta dishes. I'll definitely go back, Mom loved it but parking is a *itch!!
author: Bill V.

description:
Hmm... based on all the positive yelp reviews, I was really looking forward to trying this Italian restaurant. I don't know if we went on an off day, but all the food fell short of the mark.

The place has a cozy, romantic feel to it, and the complimentary bread is soft and buttery... but sadly, that about summarizes all the positives.

Wow, where to start? I don't want to bash the place, but I have to be honest about my experience. Service was friendly enough, but the pacing of the food was horribly off. A 20 minute wait in between our appetizers and entrees, as well as between entrees and presentation of dessert menu is unforgivable.

But, onto the food itself:
- La polenta di bella (shitake mushroom and gorgonzola over polenta): overly salty and mushy to the point where all textures were lost.
- Eggplant parmiggiana: solid, but overly salty.
- a wheat spaghetti dish with mushrooms: very average and forgettable; overly salty.
- a tomato sauce-based penne pasta dish with sausage: tasty, but salty; this dish came out cold.
- veal dish with cheese, mushrooms, and wine sauce: the sauce was pretty nice, but the veal itself was dry (how do you dry out veal, especially a thin slice like what was served to us??)
- Sugo di Abbacchio (spinach gnocchi with lamb ragu sauce): I am a HUGE gnocchi fan, and was very disappointed with the dish I had. The ragu was flavorful (but like everything else, overly salty) and rich, but the gnocchi was overcooked to mushiness - very unappetizing!

They offered our table (and a few others around us) free dessert for our inconvenience, which was a nice touch. The desserts were nice, and more enjoyable than the actual meal itself.

With so many other choices for Italian, even in the Richmond district, I can't see myself returning to this place...
author: Steve L.

description: Everytime I come to San Francisco, my family and I always and I mean always, make a point to have dinner. Great food.
author: Olivia R.

description:
I just wanted to put it out there that I'm not a big fan of Italian restaurants. In fact I despise them. I just feel like i can make everything way better at home from my own garden, my own kitchen, and from scratch. 

This place definitely changed my perspective on life . I ordered the Salmon pasta (fancy menu name-TAGLIOLINI SALMON E CAVIALE). This was the most amazing pasta dish ever! The smoked salmon was great. Clearly wild caught as opposed to farm raised. The caviar was not just beautiful garnish on top, it was a great addition to the dish. I love crunching on those little balls. 

They were really nice and gave us complimentary appetizers and deserts!
author: Alex L.

description:
Came here for a small friends dinner on a Wednesday night after high praise from Anelya S. and elusive no corkage fee special (there is a liquor store right across the street! All of us forgot about wine until getting to the restaurant)

We started off with beef carpaccio, brought 2 bottles of wine: merlot and tempranillo, and all of us had home-made pasta for dinner. I had the butternut square ravioli and sampled the gnocchi alle sorrentina. For dessert we tried panna cotta with fresh strawberries and had I not been pretty full from the dinner, I'd have gotten one for just myself - it was so good!

Other than the great food, our waiter was outstanding and we could hear each other talk without having to raise our voices - great ambiance.
author: Tatyana K.

description:
Been here two times.  The first time was great.  The second time was crap, for the prices, and we have not been back since!

Food = okay, it got really boring and mediocre the second time...
Prices = typical for the service
Service = good, attentive, even if it feels understaffed
Seating = small tables, small place
Parking = pain
author: Fannie S.

description: This place is cute and is the perfect place for a chill and intimate date which is what I had.  The food was good but the gnocchi missed the mark big time.  The waitress explained to us that the way they do gnocchi is different than what most people are used to.  I like mine with a springiness and a nice tooth feel which is the way I've always had them.  Theirs is really soft and mushy as if it's overcooked or had too high a potato:flour ratio.  Since we both ordered the gnocchi, we were both disappointed.  Can't win them all, right?  At the end of our meal, the chef came out and gave us some panna cotta on the house which was very thoughtful and sweet of him.  All in all, a good experience.  I would come back and this time order something else on the menu.
author: P.J. D.

description: Very nice place.  My family found Bella via Yelp as we were headed home from the Academy of Science.  Great service, lovely and cozy atmosphere.  We ordered 3 dishes and served up family style.  We had a chicken/mushroom/pasta, shrimp/pasta/ and sausage/pasta and all 3 were amazing.  the sauces were just right for my taste, not too heavy.  the pana cotta at the end was delicious!!!
author: D R.

description:
I work down the street from this place and passed by it all of this time wondering how good it was.  I was looking for a place for my husband and I to go eat for our anniversary sans kids.  My friend here at work told me "Go to Bella!!  They are WONDERFUL!"  She wasn't lying!  The food was amazing!!  I had the lobster stuffed ravioli and hubby had the lasagna.  We also had the tuna puttanesca and tiramisu for dessert - all awesome!  The sommelier let me do some wine tasting and I ended up with her recommendation of the Sangiovese, which was to die for (had 2 glasses, should've bought the bottle!)

I found out from the owner they have panninis for lunch, I'm trying to find the time to go out for a long lunch at work so I can try them, I'm sure they're wonderful!
author: Kathy H.

description: I was quite surprised by the quality of the food they serve here.  Great Italian pasta in an Asian stretch of Geary? The place was packed and it was definitely hard to get a table! Reservations are necessary on a Friday night.  The pastas was fresh and cooked to perfection.  I'll be coming back for more.
author: Koalie W.

description: Good place for Italian Food. Pasta selection is well put together. Good ambiance.
author: Antonio I.

description: This is the perfect spot for a romantic dinner. I went on a first date here and it was great. It is a very small place, but we came at a good time because we got seating right away and the service was good. It is street parking so it can be hard to find parking. The gnocci was delicious. I would definitely recommend this as a great date spot
author: Lindsey V.

description:
When my husband and I moved to the Bay area, we were still deciding if we wanted to live in the East Bay (cheaper rents) or if we wanted to endure the noise and mess of the city. We decided to talk about it over dinner, we checked yelp and stop at Bella. After our meal there, we decided we would endure the no-parking, small apartment situation just to be able to enjoy meals like this. So yes, we are now in San Francisco because of this restaurant. It is that good!

It's not only the food, which is amazing, but it's the attention of Davide and his staff, what makes the difference, most speak fluent Italian and are happy to let you practice yours with them. Davide, a native from LA, lived in Italy and not only he learned the passion about food, but he perfected the warm Italian hospitality. He has no hesitation in sharing with you other Italian restaurants that offer different cucina styles.

They bathed you with dishes, always giving you a bite of a dish that they are experimenting with and want to see your reaction. From complimentary polenta bites, to the second complimentary dessert, they really strive to make you happy.

It's intimate, but friendly; classy, but not pretentious It is without a doubt our favorite italian place, not only in San Francisco but possibly ever.
author: Gabriela P.

description:
A cozy, romantic Italian restaurant, Bella hides out in the Richmond where only true food connoisseurs know of its existence. Dining around older couples and even families with newborns made it feel quite calming and comfortable. From the food to service, the experience at Bella was warm and memorable.  

The wait was a little long even though we made reservations and the food also took some time but the manager, knowing this, apologized and treated us to a very refreshing bruschetta. This along with the bread and sun-dried tomato olive oil did the trick until the entrees. The handmade pastas were quite a hit. The butternut squash ravioli tasted like a savory pumpkin pie with great kick of sage butter. My pasta Carbonara was eggy and velvetty with tad bits of salty fat in the Pancetta. I also tried the veal cutlet which was covered in a mushroom cream sauce. The veal meat itself was a little overcooked and a little tough but the sauce was awesome. 

To wrap up the manager gave us a mini portion of the Tiramisu and again reiterated his apologies for the delay. With this level of service and cuisine, everyone in Richmond should definitely give it a shot.
author: Ed L.

description:
I'm gonna give this place a good rating because of the good price, excellent atmosphere, congenial service, and very creative food.

I met an old friend who I hadn't seen in ages and we had lots of fun.

This place is dimly lit and the service goes at a comfortably timed pace without ever feeling too slow or too rushed.

For appetizers, we tried a very unique dish: sword fish carpaccio.  It was super delicious.  I don't really like sword fish but when prepared carpaccio style, it was spectacular.

For the main course, I had their specialty which is a soft, light gnocchi.  Any of their gnocchi specialties are quite good.

Dessert was also out of this world.   All in all, I had great food and a fun dining experience with old friends.  

When a dinner night seems perfect, other than the horribly bad parking, you have to give the place a perfect rating.

Cannot wait to come here again.
author: Tony U.

description:
My brother and I went here for lunch on a weekday, and we were the only ones there.  The food was absolutely delicious, and with our Scoutmob, we felt like we robbed the place, even after leaving a huge tip.

Back to the food:
Albacore carpaccio - If you thought beef carpaccio's good, you really gotta try this one!
Gnocchi verdi - Homemade, creamy.
Seafood linguine - You already can't go wrong with this dish, but the homemade pasta made this exceptional.
author: Amy F.

description:
I came here last week rather early (around 6). The place was pretty empty which was nice. The restaurant itself is on the small side but very intimate. There is a lounge area with huge comfy leather couches and a huge plasma playing old italian movies. 


We were given some complimentary fried polenta which was pretty good with the olive oil and sun dried tomatoes. The bread is a little on the sweet side for me... 

I started with a mixed green salad which was soo yummy. The dressing was amazing. I then had the butternut squash raviolis which was not what I was expecting. It had a very warm cinnamon and butter flavor but wasn't too overpowering. My friend ordered the assagini de bella which was a plate of gnocchi, rigatoni and spinach raviolis. I tried a bite of all three- very rich and delicious- they complimented each other well. Although the food was great the portions were extremely small. 

They're starting to make some new infused cocktails and gave a sample on the house. I had the espana which all I can say was it was a very sweet liquor and coke but after two I was def. a little buzzed!

Staff and service is great here. Food is amazing I am looking forward to coming back again!
author: Amanda S.

description: Food was good, staff was friendly, place was packed, and you had the feeling that the chefs took their craft seriously. They forgot our juice and charged us for it, though, and they seemed a little disappointed that we didn't spend more money. I'd visit again and spend more; the place is worth it.
author: Robert B.

description:
S and B had their engagement dinner here for 35 people.  We had a set menu for $30/person.  It came with two appetizers, four entrees, and a plate of dessert.

Each plate was shared with a table full of people, so needless to say no one got full that night.  We took over 75% of the restaurant, so hopefully the others did not get annoyed of us.

Still one of my fave restaurants in the city.  Still have hottie waiters, too!
author: Jenny L.

description:
So delicious, the homemade pasta is incredible!! The servers are knowledgeable and friendly and really go above and beyond. Ask them for their wine suggestions if you are unsure of what to order.

The gnocchi is amazing!
author: Annah D.

description:
My new go-to for Italian, and not just because it's very close to home. You can just taste the difference homemade pasta and carefully constructed sauces make. 

After spending a bit of time in Rome (study abroad) I have become a sometimes insufferable Italian food snob. I acknowledge it. But it also means my standards are very high, and Bella has yet to disappoint. The service is also much better than I'm used to associating with both Italian and San Franciscan restaurants.  

Bella satisfies my cravings for Italian done right: fresh ingredients prepared simply and an always-solid house red to accompany.  Also, their panna cotta may be the best I've had, well, ever.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Came here for my birthday dinner since I was in the mood for Italian food. Easily located on the corner of Geary and 3rd, it was surprisingly next to Buckshot which I used to frequent when I was in the mood for cheap PBR and greasy fried bar food. Before even entering, the kind host opened the door and greeted the boyfriend and myself. We were seated immediately which made it seem reservations may have been unnecessary considering it was a Monday night. 

Together the bf and I had ordered the house red and white wine, the bone marrow appetizer, the prawn linguine and the gnocchi with sausage. Because our bone marrow would take a while, the waiter generously gave us some bruschetta to nibble on. When we received the bone marrow, we found it perfectly seasoned and incredibly delectable. If I were to have an appetizer before I die, this would be it. Creamy, fatty and perfectly seasoned. It was accompanied with toast and a parsley and caper salad. Yum. When we got our entrees soon after we found that the gnocchi was as soft as pillows that melted in your mouth, and my linguine had a wonderfully mild sauce that I wasn't used to having for a seafood pasta. Too bad we were already filled up by the time our entrees came. We thought we were going to pass on dessert, but the waiter ended up bringing us a complimentary panna cotta. Perfectly creamy and sweet. 

All in all, the service was incredibly friendly, considerate and accommodating, while the food was definitely worth the price. Had a great experience and would definitely return.
author: Darline D.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco!! The food is delicious and reasonably priced. Every time I eat there, I order something different and am so impressed with the taste, presentation and service! Despite how much you order, they still bring out complimentary anitpasta and dessert to ensure your experience is completely satisfying. The atmosphere is very quiet and intimate.

I never would have eaten here if I didn't live close by at the time, but now I come from wherever I am in the city when I want a great, Italian meal!
author: Blake M.

description:
This place was AWESOME.
The service was excellent, and the dishes were all amazing. I would suggest trying the Carbonara or the Rigatoni Salsiccia... although I get the impression everything here is good.
author: Will J.

description: I just had this last night and it was amazing...I should've came here earlier! Right in my neighborhood. Great food and great wine.  I love the service here.  Everyone is so nice. Chef David went to every table to introduce himself. I felt really appreciated and special! Thanks for the wonderful service!
author: Cindy C.

description: The gnocchi is amazing! The meatballs were also delicious (antipasti). A great little, romantic place in the inner Richmond. The service was on point & he even recommended a great red wine. We will be back for another date night!
author: Jackie K.

description:
this is totally a neighborhood restaurant... cute location, friendly service, and good food (homemade pasta! yum!).  i can't say it'll be my to go place for italian, but if i was in the proximity, it definitely would be an option for dinner...

I had dinner here with my boyfriend and we started with the ostrich carpaccio.  ostrich is a lean meet, but i never had the carpaccio style... so of course i had to try it!  it was good... but i this creamy sauce that they topped it with was too much... i probably would tell them to go light on the sauce if i were to order it.

for entree, i had the seafood macaroni (rigatoni) special... there's nothing special about it... pasta was okay... it was way too tart because the sauce was made with green tomatoes... i wouldn't order it... but lg ordered the squid ink pasta and that was good... pasta is home made so it was good!  hate it when i didn't order the better dish... oh well... but i would suggest getting that!  

since they sat us late, they complimented us with a free panna cotta... and the panna cotta was good! creamy, not too thick... i think if you're a panna cotta fan, you'll like it!
author: Kelly H.

description:
The food is phenomenal and the service was the best I've had in a long time. The server offered us great suggestions and was very knowledgeable about the menu and provided great suggestions that made the meal even better. 

The pancetta and tuna carpacio appetizers were amazingly good. The house white wine was definitely the way to go. I enjoyed every part of my meal. This restaurant is exceptional.
author: Katie D.

description:
AMAZING AMAZING!

This place has become a favorite of my boyfriend and I!
 
Homemade pastas, perfectly cooked tiramasu, and amazing service. 

The servers actually are knowledgeable about what they are serving!
author: Megan C.

description:
The best overlooked Italian *lunch* and dinner in San Francisco.

This teeny trattoria, on Geary at 3rd Ave., is a bit forbidding, what with shiny white linen tablecloths and no menu posted in the window. But it's an amazing lunch find! Great food, great ambiance, awesome staff, and great food (you said "great food" twice).

More down-to-earth than Osteria, my other ristorante Italiano favorite, and a completely different style of food. Don't miss this!
author: Michael S.

description:
Bella is a neighborhood gem! 

Awesome food! Excellent service. It's very family friendly, and it's always crowded. Reservations are highly recommended. 

Lasagna is out of this world, and their bread/pastas are homemade. 

Oh yeah, even the house wine is pretty good (those are always bonus points). 

Having trouble deciding what wine to get? David (the owner) is very helpful on that department. Lastly, if you want to bring your own bottle, they will wave corkage fee if you buy one of theirs.

Highly recommended!
author: J. C.

description: Awesome Italian food, small romantic atmosphere. Easy parking, and friendly staff. I enjoy dining here!
author: Ashley B.

description: I gave this 3 stars only because they ruin my taste of risotto. And I LOVE risotto! What kind of Italian restaurant can't make good risotto?! Ridiculous. The dish was too salty. However, I give them props for the incredible gnocchi. Melts in your mouth. And we got free pa'ina cotta. Yeeee
author: Tu N.

description: love this place, totally cute little romantic italian restaurant with very professional and sweet staff. Must try the gnocchi!
author: Kayla C.

description: Small and intimate, with friendly wait staff and a great vibe. The food was good with large portions at surprisingly moderate prices.  I don't generally head up to this part of the city often, but I could imagine doing so again for Bella Trattoria.
author: Miles S.

description: Excellent Service wonderful friendly people and staff. Also excellent dishes and great recommendations from the owner. As. first timer I will definitely come back and recommend to others. I loved the Gnocchi and the Tiramisu. the wine selection was great as well, went through 4 bottles !
author: Max O.

description:
It's all about the food.
And that is what is best about this place - the food.  Everything we had was superb.  Bruschetta - Carpaccio - Gnocci - Squid Ink Linguini w/mussells & clams.  Sangria.  Cappacino.  Desserts.  You couldn't ask for better dishes -- the gnocci was incredible - can't even describe the beauty of it except to say it was like little pillows of goodness sent straight from heaven.  The cappacino - - perfection.  The service - super friendly, although the turn around on the actual orders was a bit on the slow side.  We were there for a Sunday lunch - place was 1/2-to-3/4 full.  The entire experience was pretty nice.  The atmosphere was nice although could use a little sprucing up.  Prices are on the high side.  However, overall, a really great meal - they care about the food.
author: Rita D.

description: OUTSTANDING.  So many good reviews on here, not much for me to add.  Just that the dinner we had Friday night in big group (7) was superb; everyone from the picky eater to the experienced Italian cook who hates restaurants was very happy with the attentive service, healthy portions, and delicious flavors.  Good assortment of Italian wines that fit the menu (especially the Falanghina, Inzolia whites). Don't let the exterior decor in slightly dingy block of Geary fool ya --- this restaurant does the trick.  Si puo' anche parlare italiano ed assicuratevi, qui si mangia abbastanza bene.
author: Michael G.

description: I love this place. Came here wife to be on a whim. Ate like a true Italian with excellent service to match. Steak with Gorgonzola sauce is unreal. I am gonna have dreams of that ensemble until it hits my lips again.   Ready to go back ASAP. Buonissimo.
author: Tom M.

description:
After living in the area for the past two years, I finally got a chance to make my way to this restaurant (a couple times now) a few blocks away.  It's a cute, dimly lit place and very quiet too.  Both times I came in within the last couple of months, the restaurant was fairly empty...so I don't think there's ever a problem trying to get a table.  

The service has been very friendly and and efficient, but the main draw to this place is the food, of course.  I've personally ordered the Norcina and Gnocci Alle Sorentina and both dishes were delicious.  I've also had my hand in trying the Butternut Squash Ravioli and Lobster Ravioli.  They were both really good too!  The butternut squash was surprisingly sweet, almost like a dessert and there's really nothing else I can say about the Lobster besides, just do it.  We ended the night by ordering a tiramisu, and they were nice enough to give us a sample of two other desserts there were on the menu for the night.  Awesome!

Great recommendations with the wine to go with our dishes and consistently good food.  I'll definitely be back again.
author: Tom Y.

description:
So I have a lot of non life threatening allergies that can be a pain. My allergies are to gluten, dairy, eggs, and soy. No fun for eating out. Especially Italian food!! 
 I found out Bella Trattoria had gluten free pasta and I felt like I might have a chance! I looked online at their menu and found they had a tuna puttanesca. Perfect! My husband and I quickly made a reservation and headed over. When we looked at the menu it turns out that the puttanesca was not on the menu anymore and all of the other options contained dairy. So I had to be a pain and ask for another option. No one made me feel like a jerk. They just made the puttanesca for me and it was SUPER! Thanks guys! 
Now I just have to see if they put it back on their menu for next time... hint, hint.
author: c s.

description:
The staff at Bella make you feel like you are visiting family for dinner. I was new to neighborhood and decided to head in on a whim. The antipasta was great, carbamkra was great and the panna cota was great finish. 

All the flavors were balanced but not too subtle. Also any place that offers to keep pouring wine after closing the check is good in my book.
author: Ahmad W.

description: Cute quaint place to eat.  Food was very good.  Definitely would revisit this place to try other dishes.  We had a party of 6 and everyone loved their food and they had the variety to satisfy our palates.  The appetizers were a great beginning.
author: j. l.

description:
I love this place!! Spectacular service, cozy and quiet ambience. Simple but delicious menu. And the best of all, super reasonable price!!

If you still have doubts, bring your own bottle of wine and stop by Mon - Wed for dinner. (No corkage fee)

The mozzarella that came with our bruschetta was super fresh - it tasted like whipped cream but very fluffy in texture, highly recommended. 

Their house made pasta was cooked to perfection (al dente). 

The squid ink risotto was a bit salty (as other yelpers have mentioned) but the flavors were all there. 

Since I wasn't completely satisfied with my dish, our sweet waitress offered a replacement but I was determined to finish it. She had also given us a free desert. 

I will be back with a bottle of wine next time!!
author: Maggie C.

description: Wow.  A neighborhood eatery that is over the top.  We had a chance to try the beef carpaccio, fried polenta, seafood stew, breaded pork loin, and gnocchi with italian sausage.  The Osso bucco looked hmm good.  Bella has a nice wine selection and on some nights, there's no corkage.  The only drawback was that it was like a dinner evening in Europe.  With some wine and lots of conversation, it's fine but we came down from Sac for the day and wanted to head home.  If when you go you expect a leisure dining experience, you'll be very happy because they give you plenty of time between courses and the dishes are great.   We say give it a go.  Service is excellent but a little slooow.
author: Wayne K.

description: The ambiance is very nice.  It's perfect for a date night or to take visiting family to.  The  staff is very friendly and helpful.  Everything tasted fresh and the portions weren't too large (sometimes a complaint of mine when I go to other Italian restaurants).  The prices are also very reasonable- you are paying for quality food.
author: Jessica L.

description: By far the best secret in Inner Richmond, the food was to die for and the service was great. I do recommend getting there early and trust your servers recommendations.
author: Juston R.

description: This place has everything--ambiance, attentive service, and contemporary, delicious food at prices that are very reasonable. We've been to Italy several times and this place is like being there. Yum, just loved it. The staff were friendly and helpful and checked in with every course. We shared two appetizers marinated white anchovies and a hearts of romaine salad--both were perfect. My husband ordered the squid ink pasta with seafood and I had the eggplant parmesan (which is actually an appetizer) and a side of sauteed spinach. I know eggplant sounds pretty boring but I'm vegetarian and love it. Everything was seasoned carefully. We even were given an amuse bouche at no charge. We shared a bottle of the Italian house white, also lovely. Dessert was a flawless panna cotta. I would recommend this place  to anyone who cares about having a five star meal at a price that will allow you to go back often. Well done Bella Trattoria!
author: Chris V.

description: We just ate at Bella and had an exceptional experience!  Great food, service and ambiance!  We look forward to visiting Bella again.  Great salads, Brussels sprouts, Bruschetta, and memorable pastas!  We will definitely visit this fun neighborhood spot again!
author: Richard L.

description:
Lovely! A couple months back we had not made reservations for a different place and ended up here as a plan B on my boyfriend's birthday. On my last visit it was most definitely intentional and it was my birthday! 

Our server was great! Very knowledgeable and seemed to have that natural Italian hospitality.  
The carbonara and panchetta dishes are delicious!
Definitely happy with everything I've tried here!
author: Shayna Y.
