description: Gee, I'm surprised I haven't written a review on this place yet.  We came in super hungry.  Everything we had was so delicious.  Just wished the portions were bigger.  My fave for the night was the squid ink gnocchi, it was absolutely delicious.  The perfect ending was their panna cotta with strawberries, mmm.  Our only gripe was that it was pretty cold in the restaurant, but that didn't stop us from enjoying our meal.
author: Emy B.

description: My hubs and I decided to make the trek out here after seeing them on Check Please! We enjoyed ourselves, but probably wouldn't be making another trek out there just to have a meal at Bella Trattoria. But i do have to agree that the gnocchi was pretty amazing! The service was very, very slow but nice and we weren't in a rush anyway and the complimentary dessert at the end was really nice.
author: Nancy C.

description:
My boyfriend and I were looking for a romantic italian dinner for our last night visiting San Francisco and Bella was the perfect spot! 

The setting was quiet and dim-lit, and the staff was friendly. 

He got the squid ink pasta and I got the squash ravioli. Both were good, but I couldn't stop eating his! The pasta tasted very fresh and authentic. After finishing all the bread and cleaning our plates, one of the servers brought us out a complementary panna cotta with strawberries for dessert! SO GOOD! We were both stuffed, but managed to find room. Will definitely visit again!
author: Maggie B.

description: I came here on Mother's Day with a party of 10 of us. I am a local so I took a chance with this restaurant based on the reviews. We were beyond happy!!! The food is absolutely delicious, and different than any other Italian place I've been to. I am vegan and we have 2 other vegetarians in our group and we were well accommodated. We will definitely be back!!!
author: Emily C.

description: I came here with a group of 6.  The waiter was very nice and accommodating.  It is a very small place and it reminds me of some of the restaurants in Italy when I was there.  The restaurant is a bit on the dimmer side so it sets up the intimate & romantic moods for the night.  Dessert.  Must check that menu out.
author: Wilson K.

description: Super good Italian food.  Not a lot of the normal Italian staples- most of the items are more trendy. Very classy for the neighborhood.  A little high in price but not terrible. We live in the area and will make it a regular stop.
author: v n.

description: Delicious home made pastas and the best panna cotta I've ever had!!! Love the light and fluffy gnocchi... Probably one of my favorite places to eat gnocchi too! I've been back and had a different pasta and it was equally tasty! Will be back!
author: Cookee L.

description:
Personable service with a great recommendation for a glass of wine.

Amuse bouche? Yes! Beautiful bite of fried polenta cube with parmesan and parsley.

Sumptuous unctuous roasted bone marrow.

Fluffy marshmallow pillows of gnocchi with mozzarella cushions and a blanket of tomato sausage sauce.

Bisque-y lobster ravioli.

Hard panna cotta? Left unfinished. Beautiful delicious dinner with a sad ending. (no star for you, stone solid lump)

Great ambiance, delicious food, mostly meh dessert.

I want to hug that food....the best (and only) Italian place I've been to in years.
author: Jade L.

description: I absolutely fell in love with this place. The setting was dim lighting and great for dates or small groups. The place is loud with conversation, but not too loud to hear your own table guests. The service is on top of their game, friendly, and humorous. I am pretty persnickety about the quality of food, but have nothing to critique. I especially loved the gnocci and polenta dish. The Gnocci melted into my mouth, the cream was just right, and there was a hint of peppercorn with each bite. The Butternut Squash had the perfect balance between sweet and savory, which was perfected when you topped your bite with sun dried tomatoes. Bella Trattoria buys locally and organic products. Also, their male staff members are nice on the eyes.I highly recommend this Trattoria. See http://foodiesf.tumblr.com/#47347839371 for more information and photos.
author: Ashley B.

description:
Why we ate (here):
Took a friend's recommendation about this place for din for two.  Glad we did.  

What we ate:
After we ordered our appetizers, we were served this most amazing bite I've ever tasted; Fried Polenta cube!  The parmesan sprinkled atop infused  wonderfully into the piping hot crispy fried crust.
The Tomato Soup was good and the Antipasto dish was ok.
The real star of the evening was the Squid Ink Risotto (due to the amount of time it takes to prepare, it's only served Sunday through Thursday).  For the other dish, we had the Gnocchi and Sausage with Tomato Sauce (they have a spinach one in a cream-based sauce).  To my disappointment, the gnocchi was rather mush and overdone (probably b/c they worked to bring out the two dishes at the same time, but to the detriment of the gnocchi dish).
Although we were too full and passed on dessert, they brought out the strawberry panna cotta which was light & fluffy and a great ending to the meal.
Good wine selections.

Where we ate (well, yeah, at the restaurant, but...):
From the light-yellow painted exterior to the small entrance, this cute corner restaurant invites those seeking a cozy environment.  The dimly lit and quiet ambiance makes for a worthy choice place to enjoy a set selection of food.  Perfect for dates, good for smaller gathering, and apparently they host group dinner as well...
I simply adore the vibe and setting of this restaurant!

Regrettably, the gnocchi experience was disappointing.  But overall, this visit made me want to go back; especially to try the popular Butternut Squash Ravioli and maybe give the gnocchi another chance.
author: Carol K.

description: Amazing!  Service was really good.  They hooked us up with some appetizer on the house after we ordered our food.  Good food with lots of flavor.  Not to heavy.  I'll be back!
author: Firas A.

description: We ate here recently and while my husband felt that his special Risotto was overly salted, we loved this place. My food was great. The atmosphere is really nice for a date and the service is excellent .
author: Eileen R.

description:
After eating here, my sister and I remarked on why we both like living in San Francisco: even in a densely Asian neighborhood like the Inner Richmond, some crazy person is going to try to open a slightly rustic, slightly casual, slightly nice Italian joint that has all the makings of a regular weekend dinner spot. It's not exactly tucked away, but Bella Trattoria is definitely not what you expect when you go down Geary into the avenues for food.

Now, this isn't the BEST Italian food out there. But it's pretty darn good. Our meal started with bread and their house-made olive oil, infused with sun dried tomatoes. The bread was a little starchy and too similar to white bread for my liking, but my sister is a carb-o-maniac so it suited her just fine. I wasn't crazy about the oil either, but I did appreciate somebody trying to make bread and oil a little more special than it usually is. Miniature fried polenta bites followed and while interesting exercises in texture, they weren't anything remarkable. Our veal carpaccio was sliced superbly thin (I could actually see the plate underneath!) and the seasoning was just right.

Entree-wise, this place tends towards the homey sort of Italian food that, every now and then, you just simply crave. Let's get one thing straight: this is no Incanto or Delfina. But that wasn't what we came here for anyway, so it hardly mattered. My spinach gnocchi were wonderfully light and in a rich (but not overly heavy) béchamel while my sister's risotto was a little drier than she or I like it, but that did little to make it less delicious or enjoyable. A particular highlight for me was the vermouth cocktails that the house treats as their specialty drinks. I got the "Il Ginger" (dry vermouth, a touch of sugar, ginger ale, and a muddled lime) that was delicious, refreshing, and was great in cutting the creaminess of my gnocchi.

But if there's one thing I like about this place, it's the service. Too often, we're used to either having our waiters slavishly wait over us or go the do-it-yourself route. However, I can say that I never felt like my needs were left unattended or that someone wasn't making sure that we didn't have enough parmigiana on our plates or water in our glasses. The service with a smile and the copious free appetizers and desserts were more than enough to win me over. Eating well doesn't necessarily mean spending money, you know. Sometimes it's just about a tasty plate of pasta and a person smiling while they pour you a cocktail.
author: Marcus L.

description:
Went on a Monday night around 8:00 and we were only one of maybe 3 customers in the place.  There are only about 20 tables to begin with.  The lights are low and the ambiance is very nice and cozy.  The wait staff were very nice and friendly.  Possibly, because it was not that busy.  The food was decent.  Nothing that I would run off and rave about but nothing I would complain about either.
Two glasses of wine, a bowl of soup, a salad and two entrees came to $90 after tax and tip.
After the meal they gave us a free desert on the house.  :-)
Also... I think it was a nice escape for my friend who is a new mother of twins.
author: Cap P.

description:
I found Bella Trattoria while doing a yelp search for Gluten Free dining options and boy, am I glad I took a chance on them! Our meal was booked for a Saturday evening using OpenTable and when we arrived, our table was ready. The food was so great! Here's what we had: 

Minestrone Soup (no noodles = gf! Lentils and garbanzo beans instead!)
GF Pasta with zesty tomato sauce and sausage 
Squid Ink Risotto w/ mussels, calamari, clams and zucchini
Penne Carbonara 
Fresh trout with sauteed spinach 

My risotto was so tasty and FULL of seafood and very flavorful. My fiance's pasta was great -- the GF pasta was al dente and light. It didn't even really taste like a substitute! 

I didn't taste the other foods, both plates went back clean! 

The kitchen even sent out a free panna cotta to our table...and man, that was super yum! 


If I had any complaints about my meal, it would have been that the restaurant was pretty loud -- diners were loud, but the place was packed, but they also had their music up rather loud for such an intimate space. Also, the setting was a little dark. The waiters raised the lights a little when they saw my in-law's using their cell phones as flashlights in order to read the menu. I managed just fine, so that's a little mark on an overall wonderful meal! 

It was so nice to eat at an Italian restaurant and not feel out of place! Thanks for being so inclusive, Bella Trattoria!
author: Amy J.

description:
Just fabulous food.  Honestly, the gnocchi was just spectacular.  It was perfection.  I was an exchange student in Northern Italy when I was 18 (which was a billion years ago), which makes me quite an Italian food know-it-all, but I really do know gnocchi, and this dish was fabulous.  They  tasted like pillows of potato!  I couldn't keep my husband away from my food. 

My husband got the pasta carbonara, which was also phenomenal.

 Our entire dinner conversation was about how much we liked our food, and how important it was that we write a review about this place as soon as we get home.. It was pretty funny. 

Funny, I didn't even realize that we got a free panna cotta (which was delicious, incidentally) till after we got home.  How nice is that?

But this review is really to give everyone a heads up that the gnocchi verdi (with the portabello  sauce) is freakin delicious.  You should try it.
author: Melinda A.

description:
I have to say that I was impressed.

Looking for a nice cozy restaurant for a Saturday evening, I chose this place because two of my friends had recommended it based on their last visit.  I needed the place to be quiet enough to talk, but the food had to be good, too.

I was impressed.

The restaurant itself is quite lovely.  Dimly lit, it is the perfect date restaurant.  The location leaves a bit to be desired as it's neither here nor there - and parking was a nightmare here if you absolutely do not like walking, like me - but other than that - no biggie.

We had brought our own wine, and I believe corkage was a reasonable $15 or $20 dollars.  They do, however, serve wine glasses made of glass, not crystal... bit of a downer when it comes to great wine.

The bread was good, and on this evening, we ordered the baked polenta w/ gorgonzola cheese and shitake mushrooms as an appetizer to share.  

THAT WAS ONE FINE DISH.
Thoughts of canceling my entree and ordering two more of these entered my mind.
No joke, I could eat at least three orders of this!  I tend to like polenta, but dare I say it - it was the best polenta I have had to date, with the perfect mixture of the cheese, and the mushrooms steered the dish straight into "BEST EVER" category.

For our entrees, we ordered lasagna and the tagliatelle w/ chicken and mushroom, accompanied by a nice creamy sauce.  The lasagna was underwhelming - something about it just wasn't hitting high notes with me, but the tagliatelle was VERY good.

To my understanding - I truly missed out on this last visit because everyone has been telling me that I should have ordered the gnocchi here.  Not being a huge fan of gnocchi (probably because I never find a place that makes good gnocchi) - I am not determined to go back and try it.

We scanned the dessert menu but decided to pass.  Our server took our menus away and then brought us a dessert on the house anyway - a panna cotta!

Service was friendly - and bordered on a bit too attentive where our conversation was repeatedly interrupted.  Better that, though, than bad service.

Once I go back for Gnocchi - I'll update...perhaps to five stars!
author: Grace K.

description:
I love Bella! Just went for the second time and it was better than the first. We started with the polenta, excellent taste. Then we both had pasta dishes that were very flavorful. Try a couple different ones so you can share. We decided to trade dishes, they were both so good. 

The only thing I would like them to change is the bread. I think this could be improved. It seemed like a very simple bread and their dishes are far from simple tasting. 

I highly recommend making a reservation for the weekends. It's a small but very quaint place, perfect for an intimate date or celebrating a special occasion with family or friends. 

The best part is the service is excellent. Everyone helps each other out so you are never left waiting for anything. 

We have made this one of our favorite finds in the city, I can't wait to go back.
author: Helen M.

description: We have had the loveliest time and the best food so far this trip to SF at Bella Trattoria.  I will come again all the way from Portland!  Order the the pork!
author: Emily B.

description:
What can I say about Bella Trattoria that hasn't been said? 

Well I was on the search for a great moderately priced romantic resturant to go to for Valentine's Day.  Since I am from out of town, I searched on yelp for such a restaurant with the criteria I wanted and out comes Bella Trattoria! After reading the reviews, I decided that I would order their Taglioni Salmon E Caviale.  

As we drove looking for the place, we found it but the bad part was having to go find street parking.  Since it was Valentines Day, street parking near the restaurant was not so easy to find.  My poor feet! I had high heels on and it took us about 2-3 blocks to walk from our car to the restaurant.  Was it worth it? YES! I indeed order the Salmon and I did not regret it! It was perfect and creamy and suprisingly, it made me change my mind about caviar! I wouldn't think I would like black caviar but after having this dish, I loved it!  The atmosphere was intimate and romantic which impressed my boyfriend because he coudldn't believe I found such a place that had that kind of atmosphere and that had food that cost less than $20! Thank goodness for yelp ;)  

As for the staff, they were very nice.  We came in a little earlier than my reservation time but they still accomodated us without us having to wait until our reservation time.

Overall, I would definetly recommend this place especially for a romantic date!
author: Hazel D.

description:
The food is great, but the service does not make up for the less than average service. 

Both times I've been, I have had a party of about 8 and you'd think they would be a little more attentive... But BOTH times they've disappointed on the service end:
- Our whole party was sitting in waiting area, and although we could see our table was clearly ready, they didn't even ACKNOWLEDGE us for at least 10 minutes
- Staff was un-attentive (with 6 people drinking, we had 1 bottle of wine and even though our glasses were empty before mid meal, they never asked us if we wanted more wine or any thing else to drink. Their response when I commented on this was "you could have asked"). And no one really came by to see if we needed anything else. 
- I asked for more crushed red pepper and the server took the red pepper that someone else in my party was currently using and put it in front of me - umm... We just wanted MORE. 
- this is the second time (different servers) and the service was the same so not going to bring groups here anymore, which is unfortunate because I live around the corner an the food is great! 
- they aren't rude, but given a choice of where I would spend my dollars, their service is why I wouldn't recommend this to friends or neighbors. 

Food wise, everything I've had is great and I love the changing menu. Here are a couple favorites:
- spinach salad (it's been a little different both times, but super yummy both times)
- pappardelle with braised duck
- frutt 'e mare with squid ink spaghetti
- carbonara

Food great - service... needs improvement before I return.
author: annie p.

description:
I would give this place 3.75 stars... but I had to round up. Anyways, went with a girlfriend last night and enjoyed the atmosphere, company and food. 

+1 - they take reservations. It wasn't too crowded but it is always a gamble. 

+1 - No, corkage fee on M-W, and that includes as many bottles as you want. Heck that should be +2 stars. 

+1 - Friendly staff. My friend and I were talking nonstop, and they actually closed without us even noticing. However, they let us finish our conversation and did not rush us out. 

+.75 - Food. The food was not bad in any means. It just wasn't anything to rave about. The salad was good, the lobster ravioli was good too. I just didn't love it. 

All in all... I would definitely come back. The place is cute, not too crowded, and no corkage fee... HELLO!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
The service is great. Ordered the bone marrow which was on special.They do need to tone down the olive oil on their pasta dish,it came out  a bit too oily.
Again the service makes up for it.
author: S C.

description: Great food, great service, great atmosphere! One of the best places in Richmond! I had a great time and they gave us desert on the house! Everything was amazing and delicious!
author: Jeannette C.

description: The appetizer was half cold and half hot, so we couldn't tell what the actual temperature was supposed to be. Seated in front of the kitchen doorway and saw everything disgusting I shouldn't have seen... Broken cabinet holding the utensils/ semi-descent plated pasta/ really cramped seating - all covered by dim light. If it was lit properly, it'd look and feel like a over priced taqueria from the mission. (At least the taqueria food is fresh!)
author: k k.

description: Everything we ordered was amazing and everyone in our party left happy! Definitely the best gnocchi I've ever had and I order it at every Italian place that has it on the menu. The bruschetta is also a must! The service was amazing too.
author: Britney R.

description: Took my boyfriend here for his birthday. It was exactly what I was looking for. It was romantic and delicious. We found parking close by. It was a Wednesday night and wasn't very crowded. The home made gnocchi was awesome. I ordered the spinach gnocchi with mushroom and my boyfriend ordered the gnocchi with sausage and tomato sauce. We also ordered the burrata appetizer, yummy soft cheese with grilled bread. It wasn't too expensive for a nice Italian meal. The service was good. They gave us a complimentary panna cotta with fruit (:
author: Brianna N.

description:
For our third anniversary, the BF and I didn't want a lot of fanfare....just a quiet evening with good food and good wine. Bella Trattoria fit the bill perfectly: somewhat hidden despite the Geary St location, full of locals and families, not too loud...very low key on a Wednesday evening. 

Overall, it was a good experience. Monday-Wednesday, they offer free corkage, which is AWESOME and we definitely took advantage of it. We also tried the steamed Manila clams, which were tasty. He ordered the gnocchi with pork sauce, while I ordered the spinach gnocchi with gorgonzola sauce....super rich and decadent. Finally we finished with the zabione for dessert.....very tasty.
author: Jenn G.

description: this is my favorite Italian in SF. I love love love their butternut squash ravioli with sage. it is to die for. also, going here beats the tourists and parking issues of North Beach, so, there you go.
author: J R.

description:
I am not much of an Italian cuisine connoisseur (why? carbs), but once in awhile I love to carb-splurge on fine Italian food.  This place provided one of the better dining experiences I have had in San Fran (and that says alot in the fine dining capital of the west)

Ahh Bella, the carpaccio (tenato vernatto?) had just the right mix of flavor and aesthetic appeal - like a Fellini film, haha.  I had the salmon with gluten-free penne pasta - a tasty dish without the gluten-guilt, a win-win!

The service was excellent, but to be fair, we got there early (7pm) on a Monday night, so the place wasn't very busy.  But I will give the Bella staff the benefit of the doubt and note that our table was constantly monitored by the staff (multiple refills on drinks, etc.) and they seemed genuinely concerned about our patronage - excellent work!

I will definitely return to Bella, I just hope that things don't change during my return visit!
author: M P.

description:
This is definitely not your typical Olive Garden like restaurant. The most notable differences: the price, the quantity, and the quality. 

My uncle was in the bay area, so we decided to take him here for authentic Italian food. I made the reservation on yelp at 7 PM, and when we got there, the place was full and had a line going out the door. The place, at first glance, is at the corner of Geary and 3rd and is quite easy to miss if it wasn't for the yellow walls outside, since it had no clear sign in the front. The interior was cozy and intimate, despite the servers rushing around everywhere. We were seated as soon as our whole party arrived (they won't give you a table until everyone is present). And if you don't know your food terms, you're gonna have a hard time navigating through the menu, but if you ask the waiter, they'll explain to you how they make each dish. 

To start off, we were served some bread and oil to dip it in, and man, that was the best bruschetta I've ever tasted! The sundried tomatoes in the oil was so flavorful and tangy, and the bread was light and soaked the oil right up. I ended up getting the Butter Nut Squash Ravioli as my entree, which was a sweet dish. Even though the dishes are pricey (the cheapest started at 14 dollars and went up to 28), it's totally worth it, considering the taste and the artsmanship of the dish. The butter nut squash ravioli had the perfect blend of flavors: the caramelized sugar went perfectly with the smooth texture of the pasta used to fill the creamy yet light butter squash filling, with the sundries tomatoes adding a slight tang of acidity. I would definitely recommend that dish, because everytime I think of that dish, I start to feel hungry again! I also got to taste the squid ink risotto, the Gorgonzola steak, and the spaghetti with the spicy meat (forgot the name of it) and they were all on point and delicious! It also doesn't hurt that they gave us free dessert at the end! I think they switch up their desserts, because we got the Panna Cotta, which was oh-so-light and creamy and delicious! 

I would definitely recommend this place for a date or any special occasion, since it is more expensive than typical Italian restaurants. The only reason why I gave this place four stars was because the service was definitely lacking. I'm not sure if they're understaffed or just too busy, but I felt like the slow service distracted me from truly enjoying my dining experience. Several times, I had to persistently flag down the waiter, and when they finally came, they were impatient and terse.
author: Kristi L.

description:
I went to have dinner at Bella tonight and they really made an effort to earn another star!

Service was very friendly as usual, attentive and also a lot quicker, let's just say, my glass was always full of water.  

Today, we got to try their new fried polenta, which was okay, but I definitely prefer the other one with the bell pepper.  It was just a little too oily.

I got the salad (as usual) and it was good (as usual) but they gave so much I just couldn't finish it all (not that I'm complaining)!!  I tried the rigatoni pasta with tomato, Italian sausage and cream sugo (unfortunately I can't remember the Italian name for it).  It was really good.  The sauce was light, but really tasty!  My friend had the steak, which he also said was really good and cooked to perfection.  

Once again, they gave us the fried polenta and panna cotta on the house and this time they also gave us a drink to enjoy.  I'm not sure what it was, but I could have drank wayyy more of that stuff!

In total, my friend and I had three courses each and our bill was only $60. Not bad!

I will definitely be back in the near future!!
author: Marisa R.

description: This restaurant never disappoints. The staff is friendly, warm, and very attentive (but never in an overbearing way). Their food is utterly delicious and I can't wait to try one of everything! The atmosphere is romantic, the space allows for groups, and there always seems to be room for those who wander in from the Inner Richmond evening chill. This will be my go-to date night restaurant from now on.
author: Suzi G.

description:
Vday.
I wanted to cry afterward.
The first time we wanted to come here for a bday, but it was closed on Tuesdays.  We were SO looking forward to trying their pastas and lobster ravioli, so we decided to try it for valentines day.

I thought I had everything planned out, it was going to be perfect.
After looking at their online menu, which said that there was going to be a prix fixe menu for valentines day, but it did not say it was the only thing we could order.  So i still wanted to go, but order from the regular menu that sounded way more appetizing than the fixed meal.  Which said it was $70/couple.  ONLINE it did, and i just thought it wasnt worth it.

So i made reservations.  They needed my creditcard number so that we wouldnt just not show up. They were going to charge you a fee if you didnt show.

We got there, and the waiting section of this place was outside, in the cold on these couches..When we were seated, we were sitting WAY too close to the other tables to even feel comfortable talking.  So when one table left, we moved our table over, and it became wobbly!

All that aside, we DID have to order from the prix fix menu.......which did not have anything we liked, and now it says its $70/PERSON.  I went online on my iphone, knowing it said $70/couple before, but the menu was taken down from their site already..

So, do we leave? But they have my creditcard down..were they going to charge me?  Do we leave? Or eat food we dont want to order? Shit.  Already a bad start.  So we stayed.

We started out with some wine on the house, because he said it was Chinese New Year, and that we should start out our meal with something sweet..that was pretty good.  Like grape soda with a hint of wine.  

Bread and olive oil with sun dried tomatoes, was the best thing we had here all night.

Next a "little treat from the kitchen" polenta with some kind of ricotta and swiss cheese over it.  it was okay.

Gazpacho soup shots, OMGGGGG these were horrible.  Ive had gazpacho before and i liked it, but these...blah.  Tomato was way too salty, while the asparagus just tasted weird.  I forced hon to down the rest, because they were costing us at least $20.  Thank the lord they were only shots.

Oh, did i mention, even though it is prix fixe you cannot mix and match, there were choices, but we both must get the same thing and share it.

Calamari salad was next.  Sounds simple and good, but nope.  Calamaris were soggy and mushy in texture.....wtheck mixed in a weird salty, soury sauce with oranges and olives..not my cup of mushy sauce drowned salad.

Main course, Surf and Turf.  Skirt steak and "prawns" no.......those were shrimps...dont call them prawns when theyre not.  At least this item was fairly good.  The steak was raw and tender, and the amount of sauce was perfect.  The shrimp was okay.  We would have liked a little bit more of this please. Skip the rest.

Dessert, panna cotta, which cant be bad, and this other rum custard which had TOO much rum to be good, it was so bitter.  A bitter dessert?!

Took the check an hour to come, when we desperately wanted to leave..i was seriously thinking about just leaving if it didnt come, but again, they had my creditcard number down. UGH. prior to this, we were going to pick up a wii to play with at home for the rest of valentines day, but the meal took all of our money to buy one that night.  We didnt feel like it anymore.

$153 + tip, you do the math.  When I couldve ordered their Lobster ravioli, and been happy for $20. I dont mind spending the money, but lets be fair, was that really worth $70/person?  I couldve dined at Ruth Chris, or HOPR or fly to visit my friend in Michigan with that.. i will go cry now.
author: kim w.

description: Bella Trattoria is a gem in the Richmond district. Had absolutely wonderful service and food everytime i came here. The ambiance is relaxing and intimate too. By no means, i am an expert on Italian food, but all i can say is that everything i ordered were delizioso!! Also, all the staffs speak Italian over here, so it adds up to the authenticity of the restaurant.
author: Anu O.

description: Great food. Better Sangria. Portions a little small but a really nice place to go in the inner-Richmond
author: Tricia B.

description: Not usually a fan of Italian pasta places, kind of always tastes the same but wowzers. Best spaghetti ever. Perfect noodles, perfect moistness, and perfect heartiness. The bruschetta too, definitely the best I've ever had. Not really a fan of gnocchi in general, I'd say go with the spaghettis.
author: Andrea L.

description: OMG so GOOD! Cute little restaurant with a small bar in back, perfect size for a small party and romantic enough for a date ;) Get suggestions from the waiter- we got the Sorrentina and it was the best gnocchi dish I've had! melts in your mouth yumminess! Everything is fresh and the pasta is made in-house! It really does remind me of the dishes we had when we visited Italy!
author: Karen L.

description:
We made a reservation on a Tuesday for 8pm and arrived ~8:15 and were seated cheerily and promptly.     I liked that there was space between the tables - it seems a lot of places pack you in and then you spend the rest of dinner ducking and moving your chair - not an issue at all.   Complimentary bread and oil with sundried tomatoes - BF loved the bread, but I kinda wished it was warmed up and maybe a little crustier or rustic.    
We started with a salad (a version of a Caesar, but called something else...) and BF had the minestrone soup.  We shared a bit, but mostly hoarded our own tasty dishes.    BF had the gnocchi and I had the trout special with sauteed spinach.    I was very satisfied - I was able to mostly stick to my food plan and BF was able to indulge - he left feeling stuffed, something I try to avoid.  Again, we shared a bit, but stood greedily by our choices. 

The service was great - attentive but not lingering.   They offered us dessert and we declined, but were treated to a mascarpone and strawberry dessert that let us know that next time, we need to leave room. 

A good spot for either a group of people or a romantic date place.
author: Maria C.

description: bruschetta so delicious, wine selection great, awesome service, and their steak dish with blue cheese might be  my favorite dish I have had in a long long time...
author: Tighe O.

description: A little piece of Italy buried in the richmond! I found this place in July after just having moved to the city in April. The staff is very welcoming and the atmosphere is warm and inviting. The wine list is delightful please be sure to ask for David and take his recommendations. He has yet to disappoint. The location is ideal for a romantic evening out or a night out with friends.  Children are also accommodated in the restaurant. I've brought my sister, best friends, and co-workers all to sample simplicity perfected.  I would highly recommend if you have visitors from out of town.
author: Anita C.

description: Delicious food! Let me start by saying how great the service is. The waiters really go out of their way to give extensive descriptions of the dishes and make good suggestions. It is a truly cozy restaurant to dine in. The good was very good. I tried the ostrich Carpaccio which was the first for and it was succulent, the aioli sauce on top of it gave it a great kick.  I tried three different pastas and they all had a special touch. The veal was succulent. I strongly recommend this restaurant. Just make reservations, this place is always packed.
author: Alan M.

description:
Bella is quickly becoming one of my favorite places to dine at for nice Italian comfort food. After reading all the good reviews on Yelp for this place, we decided to give this place a try and have since been their twice now.

First experience, we came in on a Saturday evening round 6 and were surprised to see the place deserted. The staff was super nice and friendly and they got us started with complimentary bruschetta, which was delicious and in addition to their standard complimentary warm bread and olive oil and sundried tomato. 

I gave their  Norcina pasta a go (Italian sausage, portabello, porcini cream sugo, and pecorini romano). The bf had some veal deal that came with a side of fried potato sticks and sauteed spinach. Everything was amazingly delicious and the portions were super hardy (had to pack half of pasta to go, even as left overs it was yummy!). http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/msT3LrLB4fhN04HYHuFsew?select=uqDQ0ymGDwUj1wSK71RZxw

After stuffing our selves silly with the oh-so-good Italian grub, we had to decline the waiter's offer for desert (although we were seriously tempted after having a look at the desert menu). Although we declined and looked like we were aboutt o pass out from food coma, the waiter brought us their panna cotta di marscapone topped with fresh strawberries on the freakin house! Two complimentary dishes in one sitting? OUTRAGEOUS, but totally OUTSTANDING, free shit? Hell yeah, can I give them a bonus star? 

Ok, second experience tonight was just as fantastic. We came in round 7, place was getting pretty packed (very happy to see that since they were deserted the first time) , we didnt have reservations, but that was no problem, they got some things sorted out and seated us within 5 minutes. Here's what we ordered tonight:

1. For refreshments: Bellini- prosecco with peach purée- tasted like alcoholic Oringina! My god, if they served this up at bars, I'd be getting myself into much trouble.
2. For starters: Nzalata romana with garlic anchovy dressing (caeser salad which was ok) and  Venato tonnato ( venison with tuna alioli sweet roasted peppers and pecorino) The venison was delicious but almost over powered by lemon flavor in the sauce on top.
3. For main course: Agnolotti (pork shoulder ravioli pancetta green peas pork brodo)- delicious! Very fresh light pasta perfectly cooked  flavored really well by the pork brodo. The bf ordered the Valdostana (baked veal cutlet with  fontina and wild mushroom sugo with a side of   fried potato sticks and sauteed spinach)- oh my god, so fucking yummy, that's all I gotta say.
4. To hit the sweet spot: Panna cotta- cooked mascapone topped with strawberries. This was complimentary from a Yelp Check In offer they had, just checked in on my new iPhone, and a coupon popped up  (again free shit, hell yeah, sign me up). Haha, I don't know if it was the manager or what, but one of the staffers came to our table to congratulate us on our check in, we were the first ones to use the coupon, we were all very excited!

All in all, one of the best places to come for free shit.... I mean, their fantastic customer service and super yummy Italian fare.
author: Pauline T.

description:
Came here to celebrate with my bf one night... however, we were kind of pushing it because we came pretty close to closing. We felt terrible for doing that but we really wanted to try this place out. 

We were told the kitchen was going to close in about 10 minutes so we should try and get our orders in ASAP. Jenny K. told me there was a pasta with sausage that was really good. So I looked for the pasta with sausage and turns out to be the norcina. Bf had some kind of ravioli. I don't remember what it was called. We also each got a glass of sangria. 

There were 2 or 3 couples who came in after us, so we didn't feel so bad in the end. We were given some bread and the dip was olive oil with sundried tomatoes. I liked it, but bf prefers to have olive oil with balsamic vinegar. Our entrees-- mine was absolutely delicious! Bf's ravioli was also really good! We tried to eat quickly and when we asked for the bill, we were also given panna cotta on the house. That was really nice of them! 

I would most definitely come back here in the future :)
author: Eugenia G.

description: Came here Friday night for dinner. It was great! The food was delicious - we had the polenta di bella to start as well as complimentary stuffed mushrooms. I had the butternut squash ravioli which I just can't say enough good things about! It was amazinggg! My boyfriend had the lasagna which was also super tasty. For dessert we each had the lemon sorbetto as well as some complimentary lemonciella. The service was wonderful. Everyone was very attentive. We talked with the owner for awhile. He was really nice and really knowledgeable with the wine list.  To top it all off, the prices are super reasonable. I can't wait to come back!
author: Danielle P.

description:
Another overated Italian restaurant. 

I made a reservation through opentable so there is no mistake there. We(me, my girlfriend and two of our friends) were greeted right away when we get there. The restaurant was half way empty. 

We start looking through the menu. We decided that we have to try brushetta and carpaccio since my girl loves beef capaccio. We waited about 10 minutes for the server to come to our table. In the mean time a busser arrive with water. While he is akwardly smiling at my girlfriend and staring her breasts but I said to my self "come on he wouldn't do that". I didn't say anything, but our friend start to laugh because she saw exactly what I saw. 

I said to my self, "calm down and just enjoy your meal". Because I want to get up and do things to him that he can only see in his wildest nightmares. 

Finally our server arrives. We gave our appetizer orders which are bruschetta, beef carpaccio, tuna carpaccio and two more things that I can't remember. Also we gave our main course orders as well.

I kid you not, after two glasses of wine, a 45 minutes wait I got up from my seat to ask him for an another glass of wine and if our appetizers are coming. His respond was "yeah". Yeah? 45 minutes of wait and your answer is "yeah"? By the way there is only 8 tables dining  at the restaurant. 

Anway after another 15 minutes our "fried something" appitizer came to the table which was cold. I don't know if that was supposed to be cold, the way it was but it was so small and no taste what so ever. We had no sharing plates. He said he'll be back with the plates but by the time he came back appetizer was finished. He brought the plates then bruschetta, carpaccio's arrive. We fininsh them the last appetizer comes on the table after a another 15 minutes wait. So far we spent 1 hour and 30 minutes. My friend tells him just fire our main courses. Literally, 5 minutes later he says that our main courses were on the table. Oh wait, where is my main course? I waited another 5 minutes for my food. This absoulty nightmare. 

Here comes the best part. After he lays my plate, he says sorry for the little delay!!!!!! Little delay? I got my main course in 1 hour and 45 minutes. 

By the way the table next to us arrive 15 minutes after us when we were having our desserts he was still waiting his meal even though his party finish their meals.

I don't know what's going on at that restaurant but either fire all your staff or closed down your business because that was the worst $ I spent ever at a restaurant.

Some of the dishes were good but I don't bother to go into this because there is absouletly no way I can this torture one more time.
DO NOT GO TO THIS RESTAURANT!!!
author: Refet T.

description: Love this neighborhood jewel. The food and the romantic ambiance is perfecto.
author: Wendy F.

description:
The wonder bread bread they give you to start with needs to go, I was a bit taken back when I got this.

Thankfully the rest of the meal was delicious (Hanger Steak) and the service was exceptional. There was a small mess up with our order, and the manager comped us wine and desert, even though it wasn't necessary.

Great atmosphere, it really feels like you are in Europe.
author: Luis B.

description:
I came here with my family (7 of us) last May for my graduation dinner, and I must say I LOVED this place!! Our waitress was a total sweetheart, very energetic and always smiling! 

It's a tiny restaurant, but it feels very comfortable and cozy. Definitely good for groups or for intimate dinner between couples. Food was really good as well! I forgot what we ordered, but loooved it all!
author: Sarah Kate T.

description:
I'll always remember this place as my first date in the city with a special friend. :D My man friend had a reservation and we were seated; I immediately took in the intimate, low light setting and the casual yet chic décor. 

Our waiter was helpful in deciding what to order. The complimentary bread was delicious, but I didn't want to stuff myself too much before. I had the Norcina, because I love Italian sausage, cream sauces, and portabello muchrooms. Although the portions are not enormous, I was happy. I'm not a big eater at all, so I can't speak for everyone, but it was just right. I forgot what my gentleman friend had ordered, but we shared bites of our foods (as we usually do), and his was just as delicious.

For dessert, there was a custard with a raspberry (or was it strawberry?) topping. Superb! 

The price may be a bit pricey, but this is definitely a great place to take a special guy or girl on a date. It's a hidden little treasure on Geary, with great service and fantastic food. Well done, Bella!
author: Sabrina C.

description: Terrific food, great atmosphere, wonderful service...a sweet little neighborhood bistro and if I lived in the Richmond I would go there all the time.   The gnocchi were TO DIE FOR and worth a special trip.  The wine selection was simple yet very good and reasonably priced... the simple reds were great.  Try not to get seated in line with the door.... it is a small entryway and there is a ferocious draft.  It's a little on the loud side but not nearly as bad as some places.  I highly recommend for a midweek dinner.
author: Nanette K.

description:
Bella Bella Bella where do I even begin? Ah, I know, no restrooms! The bathroom had a sign on it to use the bar's next door. Uhmmm what if there was a kid that needed it?
Moving on to the service...what service? Do people work there? It took the guy 30 minutes just to come up and ask us what we wanted to drink. Once he got an order from 3 people he walked away without asking the rest of the table! OH FYI this place is NOT good for big groups...Actually it's apparently not good for small groups either! One customer threw a glass on the ground then yelled at a staff member " you are an a$$hole!! If someone has a reservation you serve them!" hehhe if you've been to Bella you would know that something like that does not go unnoticed. I think the music even turned off at that moment! I tried to start the slow clap but nobody was on board. Didn't know dinner came with entertainment!
Ok, back to the food. The appetizers were good. The ostrich carpaccio was delicious. The brussels sprouts were tasty but the bacon in it was burnt. Nothing like a little carcinogen on top...BAM!
I got the squid ink linguini which was pretty bland. The mussels weren't fresh either. I also tried the gnocchi which was more like mochi. It was all flour and no potato.
Wow longest review ever but you're in it for the long haul! Last but not least the yelp free surprise for checking in was ....wait for it...surprise, they didn't know either! 
Won't be going back to Bella Ella Ella anymore.
author: Janu A.

description:
Bella is a great place. For the price, the food was great. If you go there you will be able to eat 'real' Italian pasta. I especially recommend the gnocchi that are fresh and taste delicious.
Every time i have been there,the owner has always been really friendly.
I will definitively recommend Bella for an enjoyable moment.
author: Alex M.

description:
Came here for dinner before our company holiday party on Saturday. We picked this place because it was close to the Academy of Science where our company party was held. 

It's a pretty cute restaurant to come with a date or a midsized group. It has nice ambiance with dim lighting and seemed pretty romantic.

Although I didn't get a chance to try the antipasti dishes, the pasta I had was delicious!

I ordered the linguine nere which was squid ink linguine with clams, calamari, mussels and eggplant. The pasta was black which can be kinda jarring and "squid ink" might not sound too appetizing. But honestly once you get past that, the dish is delicious. It has awesome flavor and is a great entree to munch on. Beware of their portion sizes tho! I couldn't even eat half of what they gave me. At least they're not shady about portion sizes. :)

I'd definitely come back here again!

P.S. They have really good sangria! But they don't have a full bar. Minus one star for that.
author: Cynthia C.

description: Glad I relied I yelpers to find the perfect low key spot to celebrate my Anniversary dinner with my hubbs! Great traditional and wholesome food, delicious and fresh, I thought it represented traditional Italian cuisine well! No complicated menu, cute and quaint atmosphere as well. The bonus was the servers are handsome! Not a disappointment at all, gotta check this spot out for a great date note or pow wow with a best friend. Very Italiano.
author: Athena T.

description:
Went to Bella Trattoria last Friday for dinner with the gf.  We arrived for our reservation at 7pm about 10 mins early and was seated by our host right away.  The restaurant is much smaller inside then it seemed from outside and has a nice intimate feel.  

From all the positive reviews, the gf and I was expecting the restaurant to be crowded but thought it was a lil weird that the place was nearly empty when we first arrived.  I'm usually a low carb dieter so it's not often that I go out for pasta but one of the things that I always look forward to most at Italian restaurants is the complimentary bread!  I already knew that coming to an Italian restaurant was basically death for my low carb diet but I pre-emtively  decided that I was going to eat carbs to my hearts desire that night. Muahaha.....time to get fat =)    

Sadly I was disappointed by the bread.  I absolutely love warm, crusty bread with butter or olive oil but the bread at Bella Trattoria is cold and uninspiring.  The olive oil they provided us was infused with tomato which was interesting but I tend to like the zing that balsamic vinegar adds.  The menu was pretty small, making it easy to choose an entree.  I decided on their Frutti di Mare while the gf got their smoked salmon pasta with black caviar.   The presentation of our plates were nice however I thought the portions were a little small.  I guess I'm used to seeing the portions at Italian places like Buca Di Beppo and was wondering if the pasta was going to be enough for the gf and I.  The Frutti di Mare was decent.  The pasta was nice and al dente and the flavors were nice however they could have been more generous with the seafood.  The smoked salmon pasta was also just okay.  The smoked salmon added a nice salty, smokey flavor to the dish and the black caviar added additional texture to the pasta which was nice.  However the pasta cream sauce was too rich and dense.  

Food - 3 Stars

Service - The service would have been 2 stars because our waiter was never around but they gave us a complimentary dessert so 3 stars for service.  

Overall, I would say this place is okay but I don't think I'll be coming back.  Going to try Delfina next instead.
author: David T.

description:
This place is a fantastic neighborhood Italian place...service is exceptional, food is great, ambiance on point. What's not to like?

Came here on a whim last night, late-night-style. We were welcomed warmly, seated promptly. I ordered the squid-ink seafood linguine, fiance ordered tomato soup and veggie lasagna. Delish! 

They gave us bread with olive oil and sundried tomatoes. I wasn't a huge fan of the bread since it reminded me of overly soft white Wonder bread instead of the nice, crusty stuff you find at Acme. No matter, everything else was great. 

At the end of the meal, we passed on dessert since we were stuffed but they were so sweet and gave us a panna cotta with strawberry puree on the house! I really enjoyed my meal here and felt like the staff treated like us like we'd been going there for 10 years, they were so nice! Highly recommend.
author: Jen P.

description:
One of my favorite carb laden foods (and there are many) are gnocchi. I order it every time I eat at an Italian restaurant. Bella Trattoria on Geary makes THEE BEST gnocchi I have ever eaten. 

I ordered the green spinach gnocchi with mushrooms and a delish, albeit SUPER RICH cream sauce. They also offer a regular gnocchi with a pork sauce that I will be back to try asap. The gnocchi itself was homemade, hot, fresh and omg-- chew-free. Yes. It melted in my mouth. No teeth required. That's how I score all of my food btw ;)

But seriously-- great gnocchi. Wonderfully hot, homemade bread. Homey feel. Good desserts. Within a short walk from my house. No reason not to become a regular.
author: Rachel L.

description:
Eight or nine years ago, I used to eat her literally every week. Then the quality went downhill quickly. I hadn't been back in years and just tried it again recently.

It's okay. I won't say the quality is terrible, but it's also not particularly good, especially for the price. The bread is god-awful. The appetizers okay. The pasta also just good (not amazing). The dessert absolutely delicious.

So if you don't mind paying $17 or $18 for an okay to good pasta plate (as opposed to an amazing plate), go here. Otherwise, you can get much better pasta for cheaper at L'osteria del Forno. Unfortunately, that's in North Beach. Not much great Italian food in the Richmond.
author: Al Y.

description: I actually want to give a 3.5. We like their service and we like the table we were given. We also like its atmosphere and the bruschetta. But we were a little underwhelmed by the pasta dishes. We ordered the squid ink pasta and the clam linguine. We were expecting the squid ink pasta to have a wonderful squid ink sauce, but it turned out to be a black squid-ink pasta in a tomato-based sauce. It was still tasty, but since we love an authentic squid ink sauce so much, and have tried wonderful pasta in a squid-ink sauce, we were disappointed. The clam linguine was good, but nothing spectacular, just like any other good clam linguine I've tried in other lower grade restaurants. So I think it was a little overpriced. We were also expecting a great tiramisu, but it was only so so. I think it wasn't creamy and rich enough, and probably needed a little more sugar.
author: Clara L.

description:
Nice little authentic Italian gem we found using yelp.  Off the beaten path but still
Close enough to major SF attractions to drive.  Had lasagna that was FANTASTIC! Super savory and not too much food. The ceasar salad was nice and tasty but too simple. Ha a nice glass of malbec and enjoyed a perfect meal with friends. Service was solid but when we called to make the res and showed up early they acted like they could barely squeeze us in for Christmas Eve dinner and that we got
Lucky! NOPE.. restaurant was about 75% full and had space the whole evening we were there. I hate being B/S'd like that, this isn't the phony line outside studio54 in Vegas people. Other than that this place was a flawless romantic gem I'd send
Friends to!
author: Kerry W.

description: Great and friendly service, there was a small wait even though we had a reservation.  Food was prepared very well and I ordered something off the menu and they were able to accommodate me even though most restaurants would balk at this.
author: Eli Z.

description:
Oh, my, I said when a destination was chosen.  Coming in from Oakland it seemed pretty distant however the little sweet corner Bella Trattoria has found a new fan in me.  The decor is dark and modest, with a mural on the wall where our family group sat.  The service was silent and perfect, as though we were surrounded by two soft-footed people in Harry Potter's invisibility cloak: they were present but did not make their presences prominent as the party evolved.  Amazing.  No one missed a beat, and the meals were remembered by our server to a person.  We enjoyed a variety of meals, from the Tri pasta, eggplant, and the butternut squash ravioli, caesar salads, spinach salads, bruschetta which was perfect, and squid and mussels.  Desserts included ricotta tart with strawberries, tiramisu and gelato.  Our group, from the ages of 22 up to 89, thoroughly enjoyed the meal.  
Am I raving about the Trattoria? Yes I am.  Even though I am moving to LA and occasionally visit my family in SF, will I return? Oh yes.
Check it out, for you will find it a very delightful experience. I can't recall having such a fabulous smooth and delicious experience in San Francisco yet.
author: Ellen O.

description:
"Yelp! I've eaten and I can't get up!"

So I was like, "Hey honey let's do a date night" 
And he was like, "sure how about Italian" 
Then I'm all, "but I want something new and romantic"
And he was like "......?" 
And I was all, "check this place out on Yelp" 

That was only the beginning. Yes I love food. In fact, I can't go a day without it. Being that I can cook and people will actually swallow with a smile, I want more when I go out to eat.  And when it comes to eating out on date night, there are certain things I expect. 

1) Service: great service! In fact, we called the waiter over to taste our "no corkage fee" wine. (Little did we know our waiter was the owner-Doh!)

2) Atmosphere: Romantic but not intimidating. Nicely lit, good (non elevator or top 40's) music, not crowded (not too small or large). Very relaxing.  Good for dates and dinner parties but we didn't see any children!! +++ (yes, + means good thing) 

3)  Location: VERY close to the bus line, but we actually find parking too around there. (Though who wants to with they ability to drink so much wine!) 

4) Very reasonable for an Italian night out. 

FOOD

Appetizers
1) Beef and Tuna Carpaccio-Incredibly thin slices that melt in your mouth. 

2) Polenta- Soooo I USUALLY don't like polenta. THIS however was SUPER yum yum with the gorgonzola. (See my caps? That was to stress my point) 

3) Bruschetta: Ok so normally I wouldn't bother with adding bread to my meal because even though I may be the size of a bird, I prefer to peck at less expanding foods, BUT (yup, caps again) my husband loves it. We ate it. And then I ate more of it. And more. And now you are starting to see the beginning....

PASTA
Gnocchi -The most melt in your mouth gnocchi I have ever had. At first I was a little weary, but then I couldn't stop eating it. Now I crave that creamy texture in my mouth. (Stop it you perverts!) 

Linguine Nere: "I'm sorry you want to put what in my pasta?" -Squid ink. Sounds weird, but tastes great. On the recommendation of David I gave it a shot and was glad I did. It tasted nothing like the pens that use to explode in my mouth after chewing on the ends. (I said pens people, pens) 

I don't eat beef or pork so you'll be on your own there, BUT, my husband has liked all his dishes. He's just not around for me to remember what. 

DOLCE! 
OK! Here is where it gets fun. I don't normally eat desert simply because I don't like spending the money to stuff myself. (Yup I said it, I am cheap) BUT (There's that but again) most all of these deserts are made in house and they are TO GET FAT FOR.  Yup, I will happily walk out 2 lbs heavier to stick that goodness in my mouth and swallow. Hell! I even ignore the fact that I am scary with dairy and I spoon fight with the hubby even over the ice cream. 

So there you have it. 5 stars for a wonderful night out!
author: Kat M.

description:
Nice place and good atmosphere. Try number 17 on the menu, assagini di bella (3 pasta dish). 

I really like this place because of the food and service. I also like their wine selections. It almost feels like you are in Italy until you see the burger king across the street.
author: Manhav B.

description: Good food. Hole in the wall. Decent prices, probably won't come back though
author: Cesar F.

description:
Once upon a time, this used to be my favorite little restaurant in SF. My roommates and I discovered this place way back in 2000. I distinctly remember the welcoming atmosphere, the attentive service, the delicious home-made pasta (pappardelle with rabbit), and just overall great ambiance. We used to always bring our out-of-town guests here for dinner, all along raving about the food, the service, the ambiance...everything. 

Fast forward to this past weekend...I went to dinner at Bella's with my old roommate. We were so excited to have dinner at our mutually-favorite Italian restaurant. When we walked in, there were several open tables but they asked us to sit at the "bar" in the back of restaurant and wait 5 minutes. I use the term "bar" loosely as it is set up like a bar with 3 barstools but there is no bartender and apparently you can't order drinks there. At least no one ever asked us if we wanted to order. We waited approximately 10 minutes and then the waiter came to seat us at one of the several empty tables. I wonder why we had to wait? The tables were set when we arrived. Okay not a big deal...so far. 

The olive oil/sun-dried tomatoes arrived but no bread or water....until later. Not a big deal as I can easily overlook this but coupled with what happened the rest of the night...

Moving on, we decided to share a salad...some mixed greens with fennel and orange slices. Is it just me but shouldn't orange sections NOT have the skin/membrane still on them? And there shouldn't be seeds in the slices, right? In any case, when the waiter asked what we thought of the salad, my dinner companion said you know there are seeds in the orange slices. The waiter says (and I kid you not), "our oranges are natural" and then he walks away.  Later the waiter comes by and tells us that he's told the chef about the seeds. Um, okay, thanks. 

My dinner companion ordered lasagna and as the waiter puts the plate down on the table, he says "there are no seeds in that dish. haha".  My dinner companion is eating his lasagna when all of a sudden, he gets a funny look on his face and he says, the lasagna is COLD in the middle. COLD! And then he says, "look"...lifts up his plate and there is a bug crawling around on the table. Ugh.

At that point, I am done eating but I still have about a third of my pasta left. The waiter comes by and without asking removes my plate. Rude! What if I wanted to take home the leftovers?

The waiter then asks my friend how his lasagna was and my friend decided to tell him that it was cold. The waiter looked at him like he was lying and says "cold??!" and then walks away. After a few minutes, he comes out and says, the chef is sorry about the cold lasagna. he is going to comp your lasagna". He asks my companion if he would like coffee to which he said no. The waiter walks away without looking at me or asking me if I wanted coffee. 

A minute later, the waiter comes back out to drop off some complimentary panna cotta for dessert. I have no idea how the panna cotta was because I refused to eat it. I have no idea if it was a "special" panna cotta. As we were getting ready to leave, the waiter comes back, points to the panna cotta and says "that should be cold". 

Are you kidding me?! How stupid are you?? You reminded us of your mistakes - twice. And never once did you apologize for anything. Average food coupled with a stupid waiter and bad service equals no more for Bella's for us. We have crossed Bella's off our list forever. There are too many other GREAT restaurants in this city for us to waste money on Bella's. We are pretty sad about this as we seriously loved Bella's! What a shame!
author: Chris K.

description: Excellent food. Great service. Sad to have left Italy.  Nice to know I can still get an authentic Italian dish in SF.  #UnderRated
author: Scott T.

description:
I've tried the black squid ink pasta, and it was a little too salty...
However, I love the robster ravioli, but the portion is so small !
author: francesca s.

description:
Delicious and NOT expensive!!

Good, homemade Italian food in an intimate setting. 

I have been dying to try this place for FIVE YEARS. But I never had a hot enough date to go with :)

My BF and I went - we had the manzo (beef carpaccio) which was very light and good. Also, their thick bread is served with olive oil and a few sundried tomatoes - however, its very, oddly, plain so make sure you ask for balsamic to go with it.

They have all Italians wines (as they should) and 2 beers. 

I couldn't resist and ordered one of the homemade gnocchi dishes - the basic one with a tomato sugo sauce. It was lovely. 

My BF had a seafood linguini died with squid ink (which weirded him out for no reason) but he seemed to love all the clams, calamari etc he got. 

They gave us a free panna cotta for dessert and it was one of the best I have had. $60 later we were VERY happy and on our way.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Went to Bella Trattoria following my graduation from USF. Great friendly staff, gave us champagne while we waited for our table. Every single person at the table enjoyed their meal immensely. This might become a regular stop for me in SF. 

Prices are good and well worth the service and the ambiance.
author: Tyler E.

description:
This was an excellent Yelp find a couple months back.  I was looking for ta little Italian place that had gnocchi for a date night and of course came to Yelp to find something.  I just searched: "best gnocchi" and this is the restaurant that caught my eye.

I think another reviewer referred to them as pillows and maybe another referred to them as clouds.  Either way I was sold -- and they were right, like pillows made of potato clouds.

So my girlfriend and I set out for a little trek to Bella from the Mission. We took the 33, stopped along Haight to check out some vintage shops and then arrived for our reservation.  (They book reservations online, so it's a cinch to make a reservation).

We started with a delicious Anti-pasto plate that included super savory salted cured meats, olives, ingenious rolled and grilled veggies (eggplant and zucchini that was spiced perfectly).

For dinners we had a gnocchi in a vodka-cream sauce -- very decadent but light at the same time -- and a whole cooked white fish that was breaded and fried.  

Both dinners were portioned and plated elegantly and the waitress paired great wines with each (can't remember their names).

The staff was friendly, helpful, and made us both feel comfortable.  Definitely an A+.

I highly recommend Bella for a little get away to the inner Richmond. Perfect after a day in Golden Gate Park, or at the DeYoung, or even vintage shopping on Haight.

The ambiance is perfect to set lil' bit of that romantic mood while not being staunch or intimidating.  I felt like we were definitely dining intimately among friends.
author: Alec D.

description:
I was looking for a small romantic spot to have dinner with the bf, and Bella definitely did the trick. We were the first ones there for dinner, so it was nice and calm. First, I HAVE to mention their bread. It is UH-mazing! My boyfriend (who is usually a stickler about loading up on bread!) couldn't help but ask for a second serving!

To start, we ordered the eggplant parmigiana - such a tease. 3 pieces simply weren't enough! For dinner, I had the linguine nere and he had the ahi tuna and kalamata olive pasta dish. Both dishes had the squid ink pasta, which was very tasty. Can't quite put my finger on the taste, but it's a nice change from the norm. 

After bread + appetizer + dinner + a glass of wine each, we were pretty stuffed and passed on dessert, but our awesome waiter couldn't resist and brought us their panna cotta which was heavenly. Light, not too sweet, hit the spot, and on the house too :D

Will definitely be coming back for more!
author: Rica R.

description:
I loved this place. I loved it so much that I opened up a yelp account and made it my first post! 

Summary: My boyfriend and I stopped in here for dinner after I saw good Yelp reviews. The ambiance is great, romantic, and quiet without feeling pretentious and stuffy. The staff is attentive and friendly, and the food is fantastic. For the detailed review, read on... :)

The staff here are so friendly, and the owner was actually our server! 

My bf and I got the bruschetta (DELICIOUS!) as a starter. I had the trio of pasta (penne in pink sauce, gnocchi in marinara, and ravioli with tomato sauce). The ravioli were fantastic! Very delicate. I'm not a big fan of gnocchi, but there gnocchi is spot on. My bf and I commented that it tasted like eating a cloud. Fabulous. My boyfriend actually ordered the pasta with pink sauce and Italian sausage, but really wanted the lobster ravioli special (which he somehow forgot he wanted when the server asked him). I convinced him to order it anyway, in addition to his entree. When we placed the order, the owner was so concerned that we didn't like the penne, we assured him that it was delicious but that we really wanted to try the lobster ravioli. He told us he could do a half order just for us! (So nice of him!). When the lobster ravioli came out, and my boyfriend took the first bite, I think he transcended into nirvana for a short while. He absolutely loved it! We proceeded on to dessert to try panna cotta with strawberries (perfect!) and zabione (delicious!). The zabione tasted delightful, but was a little sweet by the end eating it by myself. The panna cotta was absolutely delicious though. Perfect balance of sweetness, wonderful texture. The staff was really great, took a picture for us, and let us sit on their couches (very comfortable) for awhile to digest. The staff actually asked us if we needed to call a cab since they saw us sitting on the couches.

My bf and I loved it so much, we went back again for lunch before he flew back to Florida. The owner remembered us and we talked with him for awhile, very nice man. I guess the restaurant has been there for 13 years, 11 with the current owner. My bf ordered the lobster ravioli special again, I had the butternut squash ravioli. We started with the polenta and mushrooms (very tasty, but I preferred the bruschetta) and had the panna cotta again for dessert. 

I think there are new owners now, but we went back and it was still delicious! Great spot in inner richmond!

HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
author: Caroline D.

description: Charming and authentic restaurant with great staff and even better food. Couldn't have asked for a better experience!
author: Michael B.

description:
Several years ago, one of my close friends introduced me to Bella and I have always found myself coming back for more ever since!  The food is fantastic, the ambiance cozy and sweet, and the service has a wonderfully personal touch to it.  It's easily accessible by bus, though parking might not be the easiest thing to find if you happen to be around on a busy night (that said, you'll have an easier time finding parking here than anywhere in North Beach!). 

While I will absolutely say that the chefs are fantastic with all the dishes on the menu, my favorite is absolutely the Burro e Salvia, hands down!  I love the slight touch of sweet w/ the buttery, savory flavor... the pine nuts, the sun-dried tomatoes... mmmmmmmm!!! I also looooooove love love the Manzo (Beef Carpaccio) - sooooooooooo good! 

They're great for catering too (catered my son's Christening), just ask them about it.
author: Genevieve M.

description:
I attended Sherrie P.'s bday celebration and really enjoyed myself. Not only was the food wonderful but the staff let us revelers have fun while anticipating our needs. In fact, they accommodated my late arrival with fresh appetizers and a prompt meal. Jan S. indulged in the spinach gnocchi in Gorgonzola cream sauce awhile I enjoyed the rigatoni with sausage in a carbonara sauce. The Boekenoogen Pinot Noir paired wonderfully with both dishes.

Kudos all around to Bella Trattoria and the staff. Highly recommended.
author: Vada D.

description: Dive Nite....another success. GREAT place for Italian foodies!! We might not remember the Italian pronunciation of the entrée's but we remember the food. The bread was deliscioso!They kept it coming fresh! The asmactic was good and service great and personable. Bellini & Spritz were tasty to say the least. Surprisingly, no dessert interested 2 of the divas; maybe if they had cake. The other diva loved the tiramisu! She says the custard was light & not rich, which is not an easy task. The Gnocchi was really rich; she loved it w/ the chunks of mozzarella cheese! Lasagna was a little salty, but that was because I wanted extra cheese please. Overall we would love to return to Bella. With the waiters being so hospitable who wouldn't. Parking might be hard to find but it's worth the multiple rides around the block. :-)
author: Mia B.

description: Not sure why it took me so long to discover this place but I'm glad I did eventually. It was very good. It's a gem, the staff and owner are great, the food was great, and the price was reasonable, not outrageous. I would definitely come back here, we really enjoyed our meal. The only thing was we ordered the minestrone soup and it was really salty. We didn't say anything because you can't really undo salty soup but the rest of the meal was excellent. Thank you!
author: Vivian L.

description: Bella Trattoria was excellent all the way around!  The service was fantastic (they even gave us parking right in front of the restaurant!) and the food was outstanding!  I was looking for a restaurant that had great food, but also an ambiance where I could take some important people for a quiet dinner (where we could hear ourselves talk!).  My guests enjoyed their meals, as did I, and loved the ambiance, and the service.  Can't say enough good things about this experience!
author: Elaine I.

description:
Decided to take the boyfriend out for a nice dinner to celebrate the new job. I was super excited about the atmosphere and food after reading all of the amazing yelp reviews. Made reservations and looked forward to a great evening for two.

Let me tell you, the food and service did not disappoint!! We started off with our own pasta dishes - I opted for the butternut squash ravioli and he decided on the Carbonara. The ravioli was delicious, but had a sweeter taste than what I was in the mood for that day. It was delicious, but didn't compare to the Carbonara with pancetta and egg! Absoutely satisfying!

To top off our dinner, we decided to try one more dish and shared the breaded veal cutlet. WOW - that sauce must've had a stick of butter in it, but it was SOOOOO good. We literally had to dip some bread in it to capture the yumminess of it all. 

Dinner was needless to say, absoutely fantastic. The atmosphere of the restaurant provided for a romantic mood and the service was spectacular. They even brought out complimentary bruschetta and dessert!! Cannot wait till we go back to Bella Trattoria again :)
author: Angela S.

description: excellent neighborhood spot. finally went when I had some out-of-town friends who wanted to stay in the 'hood. great ambience and great food. good wine selection too. I've been a few times recently with small groups of 4 and there was something for everyone.
author: El T.

description: Bella is one of my favorite places to eat in SF.  The pasta is always as I want it and the staff very attentive and friendly!
author: Jannah M.

description:
My family and I went here for my brother's birthday. We were looking all over yelp for a good Italian restaurant, and thank goodness that yelp pointed me in this direction earlier on (I actually wanted to go here for my birthday, but decided against it because I was feeling American food then lol). So we arrived at around 5ish and noticed that there weren't any people eating inside, so we were kinda skeptical. Was it really as good as yelp made it out to be?

Answer: HECK YES. The decor is sleek, modern, romantic, cozy...it was pure awesomeness. I LOVE decor that is woodsy and all of the adjectives described above, so I was pleasantly surprised. Our waitress was super nice, really personable, and suggested a bunch of things for us to get. We ended up taking her suggestions. I don't remember exactly what the names of the dishes were, but I know we ordered:

Trout with spinach: The trout was super fresh, however I do remember that the menu said it was boneless, but we encountered a bunch of tiny bones. But then again, trout is like one of those fish that really has a ton of bones in em (tee-hee), so the freshness of the trout made up for it. 

Squid ink seafood pasta: I never thought I would like squid ink pasta, ever. But I do now! The noodles were dark/grey, so it was an unusual sight for me (who is used to seeing regular pasta noodles). It was surrounded by a good amount of clams, scallops (I think), and mussels. Overall, good dish.

Salmon with some sort of white sauce: Oh was this one of my FAVORITES. It was a little pricey, but then again it was a salmon dish. There were shreds of salmon over delicate noodles topped with this creamy white sauce that tasted sooooo delishhhhh! It had a very smoky taste to it, something I wasn't used to, but immediately liked. This one rocked!

Gnocchi: Everyone said I just HAD to get the gnocchi. And I did! Yumm-o x10000003934882378849397429asksksdjfd haha!!!!!! I LOVE gnocchi, and before I came here, I still hadn't found my gnocchi spot. They offer a generous serving of gnocchi in creamy white bechamel sauce...sooooo delicious! It was melt in your mouth heavenly. Still not as amazing as Casanova's gnocchi back in Monterey, but it comes a really close second (and I will SO not drive all the way out to Monterey for some gnocchi, so I will be more than happy to settle for this yumminess at Bella Trattoria).

Panna Cotta: We told our waitress that it was my brother's birthday, and she said that they could probably fix something up in the back for him. And they did! I didn't know what Panna Cotta was before they served it...still don't really know what it's made out of (as I'm not a hardcore foodie, but love food nonetheless), but it was AMAZING!!!!! Tasted better cuz it was free, but I would have paid for this dessert. It was sooo creamy, but was almost like jello pudding or something, and was topped with a tart jam that was the perfect topping to this dish. It was also the perfect size for one person. We shared it though and all adored it! (Side note: We went to Candy Bar afterwards, and I will just say that this Panna Cotta rules supreme over Candy Bar's too sweet PBJ dessert/Apple a la Mode dessert any freakin' day!!!!)

Oh, and how can I forget? We got complimentary fried polenta!!! Oh so yummy!!! Thanks Bella Trattoria for a super yummylicious experience!!! ^.^
author: Jaye C.

description:
Jesus Christ.

Service has to be the easiest thing to get right in a restaraunt. It's not like trying to figure out cash flow and profitability in accrual based accounting. Not at all. Ask yourself, "how would I expect my dining experience to be" and then provide that level of service. 

My wife and I have avoided Bella for more than 1 year. One evening, while driving home from Oakland, I asked my wife, "shall we allow redemption?" I mean, if Vick can get a second chance, I can give one of my local economic producers a second chance.

Well, well, well. It was comical. The service at this place is akin to 12 year olds trying to run a business. Planning only takes place in how to get from point A to point B... literally, and there is always something f'ed up with the order. It's like the Italian special olyimpics. 

Jesus Christ.
author: ahern k.

description: Very glad that I made reservations as they weren't able to seat us until right at our reservation time. No biggee as we went next door for a drink and they came there to get us for our table. We both had wonderful pasta dishes that paired well with a Sangiovese recommendation.
author: mickey w.

description:
I love the Bella Trattoria. The pasta dishes are delicious .. not to mention the fried polenta.

wonderful experience!
author: Jippers C.

description:
Went here on a date with my boyfriend. Very affordable, EXCELLENT gnocchi and great selection of homemade pasta. Our bill was only around 40 because we skipped drinks, but the wine list seemed adequate. We loved the service and the ambiance was just as good. 

If I lived in the neighborhood, this would be a regular spot.
author: Alexis C.
