description: Bella is a great casual date night spot and luckily for us, it's less than a block from our house!  We never have a problem getting in, the wait staff is really pleasant and the Sorrentina is delicious!  The complimentary panna cotta is an added bonus!
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
We went here for dinner on Valentine's Day and will never return.  We had the worst dining experience in any food establishment we've ever been to!  The service was just awful!  We had to wait a long time not only to be seated but for every dish to be served, including bread, appetizers, wine and water!

As to the specifics of our dining experience, we waited so long to be seated we were really hungry by the time we were at our table so we ordered bruschetta for an appetizer.  It finally came after half an hour.  Fearing a long wait for dinner, we quickly figured out what we wanted and had to work to get the waiter's attention to place our order.  We waited an hour and 15 minutes for dinner to be served!  Our water was never refilled--we had to ask.  Our wine was never refilled--we helped ourselves.  I don't know why we bothered to take a chance on waiting a long time for dessert as well but we ordered Tiramisu when we were able to get their attention and they were out!!!  Dessert was the one thing we didn't have to wait for the entire evening!

This was about the worst dining experience we've ever had and I'm sorry we went on Valentine's Day!  One thing we noticed was how blatantly friendlier the wait staff seemed to be to large tables with a lot of Italian-looking men and women.  It seems you have to be Italian or look Italian to be served expediently and with courtesy--the usual Italian friendliness as one would expect while in Italy.  Except in Italy, they are friendly to everyone equally.

In summary, and to be fair, the food was good, not stellar, but pretty good and tasty. The portions were indeed small as posted by other Yelpers.  But unlike some of the raving reviews on service, in our experience as with others, the service was just terrible and needs improvement--at least treat everyone equally--not just those that look Italian!

We've been to this restaurant twice.  The first time was an average experience--at least the food was good and the service was average the first time--no real complaints about that experience--good enough that we opted to return a second time.  Unfortunately, this second experience was a deal-breaker.

Providing excellent service to every customer equally is obviously not on their list.  If I owned a restaurant, providing excellent customer service would be at the TOP of my list--that's how you get repeat business and free word-of-mouth business from your own customers.  And it has to be excellent service provided equally to ALL customers.

I certainly will not be giving Bella Trattoria my business again...unless I'm with a group of Italians...and even then, I will have to give it a lot of thought.  On second thought, no, I won't be returning to this establishment, period.  There are plenty of great Italian restaurants in San Francisco with better food and excellent service worth spending your money on.
author: Elle D.

description:
I took my girlfriend here for a date on a Tuesday night, after making reservations on their website. I had requested on their website that I sit next to my girlfriend instead of across the table from her. We showed up a little late and there were only a few people in the restaurant, but it was perfect. The host was very sweet and she sat us down on a nice leather couch while she prepared our table as I requested online. The waiter was also very nice and knowledgeable throughout. Our food didn't take long and was delicious, the wild boar lasagna is super tasty. After our meal I explained we wouldn't be having dessert, and they even brought us a complimentary Panna Cotta (which was delicious). I would certainly recommend this place for a date.   

Service: 5/5
Food: 4/5
Atmosphere: 5/5

perfect for dates around $50 - $60
author: Chris S.

description: We had to wait a little longer than we wanted to, but the food was great and the service made up for the long wait.
author: Greer G.

description:
Bella has the best gnocchi I've ever had. Hands down.

My tongue is very picky about my gnocchi, and there's something about the their potato dumplings that I cannot get over. It's perfectly soft yet chewy...it's decadent. I like the spinach gnocchi - because it makes me feel as if I'm eating a little bit healthier, even though the creamy sauce is just filled with fattiness :)

The Butternut Squash Ravioli is another all-time favorite. The pasta skin is light and delicate, and the filling is just sooo good. With the brown suger, sage, and pine nuts, it's heavenly. Unfortunately, they skimp on the portions a bit here. I could easily eat 2 platefuls of this stuff.

The ambiance is cozy and warm and intimate. The wine selection is pretty good too. They also have a good lemoncello (that the owner raves about..."it comes straight from Italy, blahblah")

I adore this place, but the service can be inconsistent. One night you'd get a charming italian-accented waiter, the next an "i'm too cool to be serving you" Rico Suave. Hard to guage, but I usually just make sure to go with a great friend or date and ignore any hints of idiocy coming from the wait staff. 

Love the food here - they serve really good Italian dishes and I miss it dearly. If only they'd clone themselves and open one in Milwaukee...
author: Kris P.

description: Excellent service, nice atmosphere, great food, and reasonable prices.  My only wish was for a proper kids menu.  We were able to order some pasta for our more finicky child.  The gnocchi, the gorgonzola steak, the olives, and my daughter's angel hair pasta were all outstanding!  Our wait staff was terrific, I can highly recommend!
author: Aron S.

description:
Dinner at Bella Trattoria is arguably one of the best experiences that I've had in the city. This is a small - medium size restaurant with dark lighting, great for couples and small groups.

For starters, the misses and I got the antipesto salad, served on a chopping board (talk about being unique). The antipesto salad had everything you'd expected, but in a more friendly portion geared towards sharing for two. I was very impressed by the presentation and quality of taste. Although the salad had a few salty items, the bread (5 stars alone for this by the way) evened out the salt. 

After the antipesto salad, the owner went around the entire restaurant giving every table free sweet tomato bruschettas for free! 

For entree, I got the spinach ricotta and the misses got the mushroom gnocchi. Both entrees were fantastic, but a little smaller in size - I strongly recommend ordering an appetizer before the entree, or else you'll be hungry. The spinach ricotta was well made, I was impressed by the taste and presentation. The mushroom gnocchi was very cute and tasty.

After the entree, the waiter gave us the check along with on the house dessert for free once again! Talk about the service, each of the 4-5 waiters here spoke to us during our meal and made sure everything was as good as it can be and got everything we've ordered and more!  I'd definitely come back here again some time soon!
author: Ming S.

description: The food, delicious; the atmosphere, very cozy neighborhood-type comfort; the service, acommodating, friendly... Superb!  The kind of place you want to return to regularly.
author: Howard G.

description: This is the kind of restaurant I love to discover, but am hesitant to publicize - since it will make it that much harder for me to find a table in the future. Wonderfully cozy neighborhood restaurant with friendly, attentive staff and a kitchen preparing delicious, inventive dishes, with the freshest ingredients, at a reasonable price.
author: C D.

description: Our last night after a week on holiday + conference in San Francisco, a local friend suggested we venture out of the center city to the Inner Richmond to try this charming little trattoria.  What a find!  Staff, largely native Italian, were uniformly helpful and friendly.  Not the fastest service on the planet, but who wants to hurry on a Saturday night in San Francisco, with the great food coming out of the kitchen?  Best, airiest gnocchi we've ever had, the carbonara was amazing, and the polenta....  Heaven.  Reasonable prices, too, probably thanks to the rent on outer Geary Boulevard.  Bella Trattoria is definitely worth the trip, even for visitors.  Loved it.
author: Ron E.

description: Hey, this place was good.  Small, dark, simple room.  Interesting menu with new and different Italian dishes.  I had a Norcina pasta dish that had a tasty garlic butter and cheese sauce.  A little heavy but not over the top.  Our waitress was slow and screwed up the order, so stars lost for that, but we will come again because of the simple décor and good food.
author: Greg W.

description: as all reviews on Yelp, take this with a grain of salt. overall...ehh, not overly impressed. i ordered the gnocchi and although really flavorful, it was WAY too soft. now i've only eaten there once and ordered that entree, so i, apparently from all the good reviews for the restaurant, need to order something else and try to go off of that. also, my friend's dish (although very rich and heavy) was pretty darn good. what else? parking sucks (which is expected), service is awesome and despite it being small, it has cozy, romantic vibe to it.
author: Mike C.

description: gnocchi melted in my mouth, trout was good, and minestrone was yummy. they even gave us a complimentary dessert! waiter was super nice and it was easy to get a table (even with 2 4 year olds) on a wed night prime dinner time
author: Erika P.

description:
AMAZING. My boyfriend is always suggesting Italian food, and while I enjoy pasta (who doesn't?), I don't like to eat a heavily starch meal unless it's fresh, cooked perfectly and delicious--and this place is all of it.

Bread was the most memorable (which is actually a huge compliment), but the butternut squash ravioli were delicious, too. My boyfriend had pasta three ways. Not all of the sauces were to our tastes, but they all had unique flavors to round out the meal. Oh, and, yes, actually better than 99% of the places I've been to in North Beach. 

Prices are a little high, but the quality is worth it. Servers were very knowledgeable  and attentive, too.
author: S Z.

description: I was absolutely blown away. The atmosphere and environment were extremely relaxing and the food was incredible. The food was sophisticated, tasty, and genuine -- the flavor came from quality ingredients and preparation. This was some of the best Italian food I have had, ever. Initially, I felt the service was slow, but once I relaxed, I realized they were letting us savor the experience and not rushing us out.
author: Doug H.

description: I thought it was fantastic. We waited a little bit, but not anything worth mention. Our server brought us little samples of all sorts of things. The house red is great. Would totally go again.
author: Zach N.

description:
You wouldn't know of this place unless someone refers you there or you live in the neighborhood - but its really a wonderful place.  

Great atmosphere, awesome food, wonderful service, amazing wine.  It really doesn't get better.  Except that they also offer gluten free pasta which is cool for all those people allergic to it or gluten free for health.

And it is really not over priced - you can eat really well with great wine and dessert for a really reasonable price.

Mangia!
author: Alexis B.

description:
Charming and satisfying.  Two words for the atmosphere, food, and service.  The restaurant is dimly lit, but it livens and lights up as the night wears on with good music and chatter of the other patrons.

Ordered:
# antipasto, small (served on a chopping board --was very full after just this and the house bread)
# gorgonzola gnocchi (looked like little green marshmallows, were light and airy, and went quite well with the creamy sauce)
# spinach and cheese ravioli

Add-ons:
# bruschetta (same as the house bread, but the fresh tomatoes and basil were really good)
# panna cotta with strawberries (creamy and delicious)

Pros: Delicious food, fair prices, and attentive customer service.
Cons: Although the olive oil spread was nearly thrown on me by the owner (?) as he passed by, the apologies did make up for it.  Space seemed to be an issue as we were seated at a table for two and there was a lot on the table at one point with two plates, the large board for the antipasto arrangement, bread basket, the candle, two glasses, and the olive oil plate.  Probably'll try to get a window table next time since the couples who were seated there looked much more comfortable instead of worrying that something would get knocked off the table by the number of people and waitstaff shuffling by.

Overall, cute date night place.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
They made me pasta to order!
The noodles and bread are made fresh here. mmm.
It was very quiet when we went here. I was a tad unimpressed with everything though. Oh well.

Lots of wines though! Too bad I get nervous around drinking around my grandmother...otherwise I would have had a glass!
author: Lauren S.

description: Great food. Great service. Prices were about $15 a plate so I guess it's right that the food tasted really good. For a college student this isn't the ideal spot to take someone out on a first date (glad neither of us ordered wine).  The sauces were very tasteful. Portion sizes hmm.... well I'm 6'2'' 225 lbs and I was almost just about "full".
author: Dylan L.

description: My family went here for out annual Holiday dinner and I cannot say enough about the restaurant and wait-staff. We had the Eggplant Parmiggiana, Crostini al Pomodoro, Polpette della Momma, Taglolini al Ragu and several desserts. The owner brought over several complimentary dishes. Don't be put off by its location, this restaurant will be sure to astound you.
author: Hayley H.

description: I cannot say enough good things about Bella! It is sooo amazing! I hadn't had food all day when I came to this beautiful little trattoria, and was so excited that the smells, and ambiance were welcoming. The carbonara was to DIE for, the crispy pancetta, and salty pecorino made me go into a food coma, I also had the rusticanza salad. The light greens and delicious lemon vinaigrette was so light, and it complimented my dinner perfectly. The wine suggestion by my server was the perfect pair. I finished with an Italian fave, pana cotta, and that took me over the edge. It was a magical evening of food. On my next work trip to SFO, I will be heading directly to Bella! Also, the prices are absolutely perfect. Just around $20 bucks per person. Awesome! Thanks guys!
author: Anna R.

description:
This is an absolutely adorable little Italian spot, not a stone's throw away from much, but worth the trip.  The service is so warm here, and the bf and I found ourselves particularly lucky during our visit here last month because we got to sample some bruschetta, beef carpaccio, and panna cotta, free of charge, because the chef wanted to apologize for the wait.  Apparently, things were backed up in the kitchen due to a large party in the restaurant, and I found it a really genuine gesture to make sure we didn't go hungry by serving us the above, without asking.

For our pastas, we ordered the Linguine Nere (squid ink linguine with clams, calamari, eggplant) - $17.95, and the Spaghetti Tonno and Olive (spaghetti with Yellow Fin Tuna, olives, garlic, and fresh tomato) - $15.95.  While the pasta wasn't anything out of this world, it was still good.

Sometimes it's the little things that matter, however, and because I felt like they really care about their patrons, they deserve a solid 4 stars.
author: Kira K.

description:
I love this place! It's got a relaxing/romantic ambiance, yummy food, friendly staff, and good wine! I love their butternut squash raviolis, they're so rich and flavorful. Also the gnocchi melts in your mouth! And I always get the bruschetta!! Mmmm mmmm mmm!

All in all, great little Italian restaurant!
author: Heather B.

description:
This place has some really good tea surprisingly! 

I got the burro e salvia---butternut squash ravoli. YUMMM, so good. 

I would have wanted the proportions to be bigger, but it was definitely one of the best butternut squash ravoli dishes.

If's a great date place, but also good for sharing good company with friends. Place is quite intimate though, when I was laughing with friends, people were looking over at our table. So just a fair warning!
author: Carissa E.

description: Just moved into the neighborhood. I'm exploring new places to eat. This place is so good. The service was great, the food came out fast, really hot and fresh. You don't have to go to North Beach for great Italian!
author: Marissa M.

description:
I was on my long drive home from work, and I was craving Italian food.  I never crave Italian food.  Yet on this day, all I could think about was pasta drenched in a rich basil-y marinara and covered in cheese.  Mmmmm...  

After stumbling upon Bella Trattoria's 4-star rating on Yelp, my dinner companion and I trekked to the Inner Richmond and excitedly braved the icy San Francisco air for the 2 blocks from the car to the restaurant.  

We entered this cute, dimly-lit little establishment with high hopes and serious pasta cravings.  But sadly, our pasta-cravings remained unfulfilled.  We ordered the Lobster Ravioli and the Squid Ink Linguine, upon recommendation from the waiter.  The Lobster Ravioli's creamy tomato-based sauce was exactly what I was looking for.  

But alas, the Linguine's strange, fishy flavor was not.  The Squid Ink Linguine was completely overpowered by fishiness.  It's like they marinated the linguine noodles in tuna-juice.  Moreover, the tomatoes on top were disturbingly soft and flavorless.  We both grudgingly ate the linguine, but only because we didn't want to leave the restaurant hungry, and we both made sure to end our meals with a bite of the delicious ravioli to rid our palates of our unexpected undersea adventure.  Needless to say, neither one of us wanted to take home the leftover linguine.  

Though the ravioli was delicious, I must give Bella Tratoria 2 stars for the food.

However, the service was wonderful and I would give it 4 stars.  Our waiter gave us complimentary polenta-cakes topped with jack cheese while we waited for our meals, and brought us a delicious complimentary panna cotta after we paid for our meal. 

Though it seems like others have enjoyed the other options on the menu, due to my post-linguine trauma, I think it's safe to say that I will skip any return visits to Bella Trattoria.
author: Julie S.

description: I always walk by this restaurant and never notice this place. I had the "Pasta cu Salsiccia" and it was very delicious. Fresh made pasta and the portion is just perfect. I will def. come here again. :)
author: Sandy L.

description:
We decided that Italian was what we were craving and Bella was the place to be and I am glad we were not disappointed!

The service was amazing the entire night and the food couldn't be beat! We had the risotto (totally worth every minute of the wait that is requires to prepare) and the squid ink linguine! Everything from appetizers to dessert was delicious!
author: Alisa S.

description: Very very disappointing. Based on the reviews and rating had some expectations but resulted in disappointed. first and for most the service was pretty bad exception the host lady. The food was average nothing really special.
author: Anuj K.

description:
Came here recently for a Friend's Birthday and it was actually quite good.  It's a cute little neighborhood spot where the service and food are authentic.  

We started it off with a few starters for the table.  The Bruschetta, Pork Meatballs and Beef Carpaccio.  All of them were well prepared in presentation and they all made with fresh ingredients.  

My entree was really interesting and I got to try something I never tried before.  The "Squid Ink" Linguine with Clams, Calamari and Eggplant.  When it came out, it was not what I expected.  I just thought it was going to be regular linguine and then "Squid Ink" was a sauce or something.  But the linguine was literally black in color.  Again, the pasta tasted really fresh.  I am not sure if they make it themselves but it sure seemed to be "homemade".  Also, the sauce that accompanied the dish was really buttery.  But it was more a brothlike texture.  The sauce was a lot like a lot of places where Manila Clams is the appetizer and you get it in a broth.

My wife got the Gnocci.  Again, it was really fresh but I didn't like it as much.  I haven't really ate gnocci much but there's seemed to be small like the size of a mini scallop.  I thought they are usually bigger.  But the sauce was still pretty good.  

The only other thing to comment about is the bread they give with the table.  It had this really distintive taste.  Not really my favorite distintive taste but I guess it's unique nonetheless.  

Not your everyday Italian spot but they are different and unique so if you are ever in the neighborhood and want some Italian, try it out.  Though the place is small, though, so it actually might be better to make a reservation.....
author: Mark W.

description:
Okay, this place is in desperate need of an update. 

Went back to this place for my friend's birthday dinner and quite frankly, when she first announced that she was going to have her dinner here, I was a bit skeptical. Only because Bella isn't that big of a place and I usually see couples having a romantic dinner...not a big group of friends laughing and disturbing the quiet. But I'm happy to be wrong. 

I walked in and saw that they had arranged a long table for us, making it seem like the place was bigger than it actually was. The gnocchi never fails. Still soft and chewy as ever with the right amount of sauce. I could finish that dish in a heartbeat. But this time, I ordered the penne pasta and it's a good sign when I can finish that too. Means that it wasn't too cheesy that I felt like I wanted to barf after. The penne wasn't as soft as I would've liked it though, but that's okay - different tastes. 

Now, here come the reasons for why I have to give this place an upgrade. Service was top notch. I mean, we're not the most quiet group of people but they were so friendly and had a great time with us. They sang happy birthday to my girl and gave me the honor of shaking the tambourine with it. Then, they had us sing happy birthday to another man who probably was a little freaked out that complete strangers were wishing him a happy birthday AND knew his name. Top it all off, free dessert once again. I'm in love.
author: Steph W.

description:
Bella is the quintessential date spot for me.  FANTASTIC food, enormously romantic atmosphere, and awesome service that will make you feel welcome and taken care of.  The staff here is the type to remember your name after the first visit.  You really feel like you're in somebody's fancy but friendly kitchen. 

The carpaccio here is to die for, and they also do a mean squid ink pasta and rissotto.  Bella effortlessly straddles the line between high-class eatin' spot and serious Italian comfort food.  Honestly, the carpaccio though, I dream about that stuff.  

Go here.  Bring a date.  You'll have a blast for sure.
author: Corey D.

description:
I had an beatiful evening here again last Saturday. 
We tried the eggplant parmiagna (apetizer size) and unashemedly wiped the pot with our bread as the sauch was so delish as were the succulent slices of glilled egg plant ! For the entree, I had the pillowy spinach gnocchi with mushrooms, enveloped in a creamy bechamel. Was sinfully good....just melted in my mouth. The marscapone panna cotta with straberry coulis was a fantastic way to end the meal. One of the best desserts Ive had..

As is the norm, service was so friendly and nice. And they had great sugestions with the wine and choice of entrees.  The amous bouche (grilled polenta with gorgonzola and sun dried tomatoes) was sent with the chef's compliments. A great way to start the meal!

I cant wait to eat here again!
author: Shwetha R.

description: This restaurant is one of the best Italian restaurants in SF.  Their prices aren't too high either.  The staff is super friendly.  I brought my family here for grad school graduation as well as other occasions.  Perfect for a quiet dinner.  The lasagna, carbonara, and panna cotta are delicious.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Bella Trattoria, I really really wanted to give you 4 stars but I must be honest to my fellow Yelpers.  

Let me start with the positive...

Bella is a cute little corner restaurant on Geary.  Stepping in you can see that the decor is lovely and inviting.  Service was very attentive and greet you as soon as you step into the place.  Our server was a cutie and walked us through the specials and what was most popular.  They also had warm bread for us to dip with olive oil as soon as we sat down which was great because I was famish!  Even though we ordered the special tuna carppacio appetizer they still threw in bruchitta free of charge as an additional appetizer.  Anytime there is free food involved I'm a happy camper.  Also the pasta was all made fresh there which was a nice touch.   Even after all the food they still threw in free dessert afterwards.  More free food which made me even happier!!

Now moving on to the negatives....(the only negative)

My only complaint was that all the dishes were a little on the salty side.  It may just be my sensitive taste buds but if they just cut back on the salt a tad bit I could have just been giving this place 4 stars.

Don't get me wrong, I still recommend this place for everyone to try.  I was here for almost two hours and had a great experience.  Food was fresh, wine was great, and service was great.  I would definately try this place one more time.  Maybe next time the pasta won't be so salty?
author: Jenny H.

description:
Probably great for a slow quiet romantic dinner, not so much for a group.

I've been here a while back and from that positive exp. I'll bump it up a star.

Most recent visit:
+Food: Our party had about half of the menu and everyone seemed satisfied
+/- Service: A few too many hiccups to forgive and forget. 
        - forgotten entree, no check-in, slow with the check, random other mix ups
        + A few free appetizers for the wait, reserved table was ready

They were nice... but not really in a smooth and warm way... sort of obligated? (We weren't a big rowdy group of youngin's, if you think we were just being confusing/obnoxious.)

I know this is a neighborhood place, so there were regulars/family, but hopefully that wouldn't delay the service to the rest of the patrons. Also... could the groping of the waitress be a little more discreet. :/
author: Angel L.

description:
I decided to choose this restaurant for an annual Christmas eve dinner. I walked in without a reservation, and the waiter told me it will take about five to ten minutes for the next available table. The wait wasn't long, and we got seated right on time. The restaurant is very dim, which creates a more romantic feel to it. 

Our waiter brought out bread and olive oil while we were trying to decide on our orders. I love variety, so I ordered the assagini di bella, which had three types of pasta: penne, ravioli, and gnocchi. Waiting for our dishes to be made, our waiter asked us if we wanted any salad. We ordered caeser salad, not knowing it costed nearly as much as a pasta plate. It was literally just romaine lettuce with grated cheese. My order was very satisfying nonetheless. I usually don't like gnocchi, it always tasted like hardened pieces of dumplings, but their gnocchi here was just amazing. It was easy to chew and it didn't stick to your throat. 

Be cautious that they do urge you to order things like coffee, tea, desserts, etc after/before your meal. One of the waiters gave us the menus again to look at desserts without simply asking us. They also calculated our total incorrectly. 

Overall, the food was delicious and the waiters have pretty good manners.
author: Tina C.

description: Great date spot. The lighting, service and menu are delightful. I've had most of the items on the menu... All great.
author: JJ T.

description: We were in SF for the night to see a band we know and found this place on Yelp. The reviews were dead on! Excellent food, nice, laid back atmosphere, pleasant and helpful wait staff; we couldn't have asked for a better dinner experience. All four of us agreed we would come here again in a heartbeat.
author: David T.

description: What a wonderful Italian experience. The food was wonderful and our waiter really knew his stuff. I'll be there many more times
author: Constance M.

description: Very good food and reasonably priced. Pasta was cooked to perfection and really had a fresh taste. Staff was very atentive and helpful as well. Would reccomend a reservation but we were able to walk in and get seated, But the restaraunt filled up very quickly.
author: Michael W.

description:
Very Good!  You could drive up and down Geary 1000 times and miss this place, but once you find it you'll wanna come back time and again!  

If this place were located in North Beach you'd have to fight for a table.

But alas it's not and while a reservation is recommended, it's probably not necessary.

We started with the bread and olive oil (with sun dried tomato) Fresh and tasty.  So good I requested another.

The Anit-pasto came next and it too was a flavorful feast.

The entrees? I took the suggestions of fellow Yelpers and tried the butternut squash ravioli.  Homemade and flavorful with a healthy serving of pine nuts to compliment the butternut.  One observations was with the amount of oil.  It seemed to be swimming a little bit, but what the hell. Another wish...one or two more raviolis!

My dining partner had the pork filled raviolis.  A special for the day.  He was extremely pleased.

We declined desert, but the waiter brought us a panna cotta anyway. A great touch and nice gesture.

I only give it 4 stars because, while the atmosphere is nice, it could withstand a little bit more attention to detail and design.  It's close, but lighting and some work on the interior would make this one hot spot.

Bella Trattoria is so good i give it Four Licks of the Plate!
author: Charlie B.

description:
The fiance and I went here last night with our parents. It was really weird walking in because it not only looked closed from the outside, but the entryway is kind of...oddly-shaped and I thought I'd gone in the back door or something!

But inside it's really lovely and intimate, and there was live music playing--at a reasonable volume, no less! The servers were all really helpful and friendly, and very attentive.

The food was absolutely TO DIE FOR. I had spinach ravioli with bechamel sauce. OMG. It was heavenly. I also ate some of his gorgonzola gnocchi and was equally impressed. He's a huge gnocchi fan and he said it was the best he'd had.

One thing you should know is, the portions are on the smaller side! I really wished I'd ordered an appetizer, or stuffed myself with more bread, and when I came home I was still hungry. The portions weren't tiny, they just weren't whole-meal-sized.

Oh, and the desserts were amazing too! I'm seriously going to be thinking about this food for days to come.

One last thing: The menu on their website is NOT exactly up to date. It's a nice preview of the KINDS of food they have, but don't get your heart set on ordering something from it.
author: Lynae Z.

description:
Took my boyfriend's poppy here for his birthday, and it was a success. Ordered a coupla bottles of vino, felt pritty groovy, everything tasted delish. The butternut squash ravioli was like pumpkin pie - I think the waitress said it "tastes like Christmas." I had the special butternut squash risotto with brussels and asparagus, etc. that was equally as tasty. 

Nice place to show off to your folks, nice option other than the pan-fried alfredo served up in my neighborhood (Little Henry's shout out - I love you!!!!) Nice group of people working that evening, nice and dark in there. Picturesque view of Burger King?? They brought us free bruschetta (?) and custard for the birthday boy, so be sure to warn the waiter!
author: Brittany L.

description:
After living in the neighborhood for a little over 20 years, we finally went to this place.  We called this place at the last minute for a dinner reservation.  They were able to accommodate us and we arrived as they were unlocking the door for dinner.  

The staff was very friendly and quite attentive.  I had the Organic Greens, Endive, Kidney & Garbanzo Beams w/ Lemon Vinaigrette  and the Grilled Hanger Steak, Sauteed Spinach, Gorgonzola Beschmel (yep, copied and pasted from their website).  It was great and just enough to satisfy my appetite.

We didn't order dessert, but they brought us a complimentary dessert.  

It was great to find a new place in the neighborhood.  We'll certainly be going back.
author: Ken G.

description: Best pasta I've ever had!!! Great cozy place, super friendly wait staff, had great suggestions. I had to hold back to not literally lick my plate for it was so darn delisious!!! Would recommend it to anyone!!! If only I lived in SF I would make this my regular go to place, fantastico!!!!
author: Patricia M.

description:
Fresh, local, organic vegetables.  To say nothing of the seafood fare and the in-house prepared pasta, both excellent by the way, this restaurant really makes you appreciate how great fresh produce can taste.  They select their vegetables each day at the farmer's market, and the freshness is nothing like what you'll likely find on Safeway's regular isles.

If the ingredients are fantastic, the preparation of the food itself could use some polishing.  The bread was soft and chewy, but would've tasted better warm or hot, rather than cold.  The pasta we had could have used some more flavor.  

The service and the ambiance are both great.  The setting can be best described as intimate and cozy.  We went close to when the sun was setting, and they dimmed the lights gradually to match with the level of lighting outside.  Cheesy perhaps, but effective enough.  Definitely a friendly and unpretentious, but thoughtful atmosphere.

If I had the option, 4.5stars is what I would rate it.  I'm rounding down in hopes of some polish to put this place over the top.  A Richmond gem.
author: Hiro K.

description: This is one of the best little Italian places in town.  The food is consistently yummy and fresh and the prices are really reasonable.  The service is great too!  It's a wonderfully relaxing small restaurant and I'm always pleased after eating a meal there.
author: J D.

description:
SEVEN STARS! Here was my experience...

1. Was meeting up with friends on a MONDAY night who have a infant and toddler and was also looking for an Italian place, saw this place with pretty good ratings DING! (STAR ONE)

2. Yelp said it wasn't kid friendly so we called and ask if kids were okay and they said, "Yes! Of course!" DING! (STAR TWO)

3, My bf and I got there early and they welcomed us by offering M&Ms at the door and then lounge seating with water and my bf ordered an espresso. Since we got there early, they gave us Crostini's with brushetta ON THE HOUSE! DING! (STAR THREE)

4. Our friends came with the kids and they were nice enough to set us up comfortably with a high chair. We ordered the crostini that we had on the house earlier b/c it was DELISH...and had to have our friends try it. DING!(STAR FOUR)

5. During our dinner, our water glasses never got complete empty! DING! (STAR FIVE) this was especially important for the guys!

6. The toddler with us was semi-noisy, but customers and servers never complained and even stopped by our table to say hello multiple times to the kids! DING! (STAR SIX)

7. One of the servers saw that the toddler with us liked to blow out the candles and brought over a FEW MORE CANDLES for him to blow out! Now, can it get any better? DING! (STAR SEVEN)

a few other cool things we noticed:
- before our friends came, one of the servers went outside to wave a taxi down for another couple that had just finished their dinner at the restaurant
- both servers there were nice, but not overbearing and very polite
- their food was DELICIOUS
- they make all their pasta except for the rigatoni....YUM
-what we ordered: Norcina, Gnocci, Spaghetti and Meatballs, Crostini appetizer, squid ink seafood pasta, tiramisu, cream puffs, breaded pork cutlet
-what stood out for us: the meatballs in the spagehtti, the gnocci, the crostini, cream puffs
-
author: Cindy S.

description: Went for an early valentines day with the fiancé. Everything we had was yummy, especially the carbonara pasta. Dark, but in a romantic way. Owner was super nice and social with us, checking in frequently to make sure everything was okay, but i think it was because he knew people in this large, loud group next to us. maybe he could tell we thought they were getting special treatment, so i guess he wanted to make sure we weren't pissed. Other reviews are right about portions being on the smaller side. It was nice, but with so many places to eat in sf, it was something to try once. Don't know the next time I'll go back.
author: j w.

description:
I trusted yelp reviews on this one and was definitely rewarded!

The dinner started out with a recommendation of food by both the hostess and waiter (who had a perfect Italian accent). The rabbit stew sounded delicious, but I was in the mood for pasta. We ordered and got a bottle of wine with it. The waitress worked with me on selecting the perfect one for our tastes. (It was pretty good, too!) 

We got bread with a nice sun-dried tomato olive oil which was very good. Then, on the house, they served us a bruschetta each, also tasty. We finished a whole loaf of bread and they brought more.

I had the gnocchi in gorganzola. This is the best gnocchi I have ever had! By far. I don't even like gnocchi, but the waitress/hostess said that it was nothing like I have ever had before. She was right. It melted in my mouth. Most often, gnocchi is gummy and chewy, but this would have been chewable if I hadn't had any teeth. The gorganzola sauce that it was in was equally delicious. I am cheese nut through and through, but it was very, very good. 

My S/O had the three sauces/pastas entree and was also very pleased by it.  She liked the "pink" sauce the best, but enjoyed the gnocchi as the best pasta. The ravioli was also scrumptuous with a light white sauce.

We weren't going to have dessert, but we ended up getting a strawberry cheesecake like thing (I don't remember the name) which was served warmed and was a good ending. They ended up giving us a strawberry custard as well, on the house. It was surprisingly tasty as well, since I am not usually a fan of custards.

The atmosphere was wonderful, the waitstaff was attentive and fun. 

All in all, one of the best restaurants I have ever eaten at. And all at a much lower price than I would have expected with the quality.
author: Josh C.

description:
We made reservations ahead of time, which helps with wait time.  We went on a Tuesday evening and the place was full, with some even waiting.  

Excellent service and great menu selection.  Ambience and music were pleasant also.  The food itself was delicious, we ordered Gniocchi (sp??) - they had a spinach filled version.  Lots of cheese, very filling.

We also ordered dessert - the cram broulet (again, sp???) and it was so GOOD!  This is a decent place to stop for a casual evening, or a romantic one in a casual setting.
author: Yelpin T.

description:
I absolutely love this place.  The owner is so friendly, the food is deeelicious!  Their ravioli is always great.  Its a low-key, romantic spot to have a "date night".  My boyfriend and I try to go every month or so.

Love It!
author: Heather B.

description:
meh, i've had better for cheaper...

came here for a friends birthday (which was around july 4th - yes i know this is super late)...got the ravioli - disappointing cuz there's only 3 pieces and you're charged like $17 + tax & tip...

it is a cute little restaurant, just not sure if i would come back. parking is ehhh - but what do you expect its richmond - ___ -
author: Steph L.

description:
I am glad yelp has those "check this place out since youre looking at that place" because if it wasn't for that, I wouldn't have found this place to celebrate my friend's birthday.

I called in for a reservation a day before for 15. They were nice, friendly and totally happy for our business. And then, my friend said that two more people were going, and I called to say, i need it for 17, sorry! They were really nice about, saying "thats not a problem." I did it a third time because we had 19 people in total coming. They service was already great before we even stepped in the place.

We got there, and the place is a quaint restaurant. It's not very big, but they managed to fit all 19 of us in comfortably. The servers were very nice too, helping us pronounce the italian names of the entrees. I ordered the gnocchi, and man was it good. I also shared the carbonara with my friend who was having her birthday and it was really, really, good.  Aside from that, they knew we were still hungry, so the restaurant gives us a free dish (the penne) and it was GOOD. that's when I knew the food and service here deserved five stars.

But they go over the top! Honestly, i'd give this place 3 more stars because their attitude and vibe were just so pleasurable. I called in to say it was my friends birthday and expected her to get desert or something as the usual tradition goes with most restaurants --- but bella trattoria, they go ABOVE and BEYOND and gave all 19 of us free desert! Not only that, but when we sang happy birthday for her, it came with a tamborine! Woohoo!

This place OBVIOUSLY cares about their patrons because they asked our group to sing for another guy's birthday even though we didnt know him. It felt like one happy family! I'd go to this place again for anything. Family occasions, somewhat big group celebrations, to even a one on one date because the place accomodates all different types of situations

oh, and they say Ciao Bella when you leave. How italian?! 5 stars!
author: Gabe R.

description:
Who knew that my most favorite cuisine was available in my most favorite neighborhood? The s.o. took me on a long, winding drive on Valentine's Day evening, pretending to look for parking in Fisherman's Wharf, then the Marina until we ended up near my house. Just when I thought he was going to pull a the-recession-ate-my-wallet card, he parked near Bella Trattoria. I eat more Italian food than most Romans, so I put on my critic hat and entered, which brings me to my only complaint of the night. Nowhere to wait inside, in fact, they asked to go outside to wait for our reservation to come up. It was raining and freezing, but it was Valentine's Day so we snuggled digustingly, but how about they remove a couple tables and put in a waiting area?

    It was a prix fixe menu that started with a shot style glass of a gazpacho. Great presentation, a little to V8-ey to me, but likely better for more refined palettes. Then they brought out wonderful bruschetta, and even pronounced it correctly with a "k" sound. Next I ordered the gorgonzola polenta. Pure heaven on a plate. Polenta infused with gorgonzola just enough to achieve a rich, decadent taste that lit up my mouth into little cheese-worshipping fireworks. I then had the eggplant parmigiana which stayed true to the classic but had a lightness of texture and taste that filled me up just perfectly. My s.o. had the lobster ravioli which blew both of us (normally non seafood eaters away). I finished with the profiteroles which really completed the evening perfectly: light, not too sweet and utterly delectable.

I so enjoyed my food that when the server inquired about its taste I could not answer, as I had just stuffed another large chunk of eggplant into my already-full mouth. Ever the picture of politeness, he continued "I'm sorry to catch you with your mouth full." Knowing immediately what would result, I gasped and stared at my dimpled boyfriend who, despite his best efforts to hold it back, responded, in this wonderful, romantic restaurant on this almost-perfect night: "Won't be the first time tonight."

Sigh...
author: Katie T.

description:
I try not to give a five star rating unless the place REALLY deserves it...with that said...BELLA TRATTORIA gets five stars :)

It all started on a Sunday evening, it was warm outside and i was feeling very relaxed...all I wanted was a delicious plate of food to top off my lovely afternoon...

I always walk past Bella when I get off the 38 bus at Geary and 3rd Ave. after work but had never been here. I always thought well its a little pricey and I will save it for a nice dinner with a friend or when family visits...oh man how i regret not stumbling into this venician haven sooner.

As I walked in my friend and I were greeted with "Buona sera" by a lovely hostess who held open the door for us. We were prompted to take a seat at the tiny bar while they prepared our table. When we were sat, they gave us the fluffiest loaf of italian bread I have ever had and a small plate of oil with a few sun dried tomatoes..real good.

For the food...

the menu consists of some delicious choices. The main thing to note about Bella, which makes it stand out from all of the other italian restaurants is the quality of the food. It is all FRESH, AUTHENTIC RECIPES, and most importantly the pasta is homemade. I grew up eating homeade pasta that my MAMA used to make our family and it makes such a difference! 

I ordered the skirt steak entree...delicious sliced skirt steak with a creamy gorgonzola sauce over a bed of spinach and mushrooms, which was all on top of rosemary crispy potatoe wedges..SO GOOD, each bite was great and the portion was filling.

Friend ordered a more simple dish...homemade spaghetti with mushrooms, italian sausage in a creamy parmesan gorgonzola sauce...yum.

Since we were so tired, we didnt actually try the wine, but the wine list was very authentic with some good reds from Italy. 

At the end of the meal we were given a complimentary marscapone custard with a strawberry sauce, perfect ending to the meal. 

Things to note:

Ambiance: small, very quaint and dark, candlelit, romantic but also good for a small dinner group

Service: GREAT, you will feel very taken care of. The staff all speak italian or at least know a few phrases

Food: delicious and authentic (comparable to my Italy trips)

Price: most dishes between 15-25...reasonable for the uniqueness and quality of the meal

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! Cute place to go on a date!
author: Katie D.

description:
Modern Italy in San Francisco.  

On Mother's Day this was a nearby treat.  We decided to walk over, and found that this wasn't a North Beach style restaurant.  It was more like the restaurants I had seen in Italy.  

We started with the house antipasto to take the edge off our hunger.  This turned out to be a nice variety of meats and vegetables, ready to be split amongst us.  It appeared that real mozzarella di bufala was on the plate.  

For the main course, our Designated Mother chose baked veal with mushrooms, My Lady chose risotto with mushrooms, and I dove into a griglia mista composed of tilapia, salmon, and prawns.  A bottle of Taneo, a Tuscan blended Merlot, balanced the dishes nicely.  

At dessert My Lady drank tea, and our Designated Mother and I chose coffee.  A ricotta tarte for our Designated Mother was topped with strawberry, and my profiteroles were enjoyed by everyone at the table.  

The tab for 3 people was $137 plus tip.    

It was a relaxed meal; Italians don't rush things as important as a repast.  Our waiter explained the designations of the wines in the menu, including the relaxed rules that allowed Italians to blend their wines these days.  A musician played European melodies for us on a nylon-stringed acoustic guitar, to good effect.  With the bright, airy dining room, the traditional music, and the genuine Tuscan flavors, the whole afternoon was perfect.  And I'm sure Mom appreciated being invited and honored as well.  

---------------
P.S. this is what Yelp does best:  Searched on my cell phone for restaurants within 0.2 miles of 94118, and this was the 7th of 35 hits.  Clicked on the phone number to connect to the maitre d', and we had a reservation within about 30 seconds.
author: David D.

description:
My parents are amazing. 

They took time off work, and drove all the way from Los Angeles to San Francisco to support my first long distance bike tour. My Mommy even made a sign to cheer me on at the starting line on Saturday morning.

When they arrived on Friday evening, I was still in 'CARB CARB CARB' mode. I had previously visited Bella and remembered how much my date & I had enjoyed it--this would be my final (and huge) meal before the ride.

We arrived at 7pm, the restaurant already bustling with diners...waited about 5 minutes and were seated by the window. My Mom immediately starts freaking out, "Oh my god, Matt, that's the guy who was on General Hospital"...and she rattles off some name. We are now in the company of some C-List actor. Nice.

The server arrives with water, we order Stellas & he tells us about the specials. After catching up with the 'rents, I  get a little crazy when it comes time to order.

Carpaccio Salad to start, Bruschetta to share, and the Butternut Squash Ravioli as my entree. The presentation was exquisite, and each dish robust with its own flavors. My parents had the Assagni Di Bella-- a trio of ravioli, gnocchi and penne with different sauces. 

And you thought I was FULL? Hell no.

I finished with a tall glass of milk & a piece Tiramisu. And it was Mmm Mmm GOOD!

A wonderful & memorable dinner in my 'hood, thanks to this unassuming, semi-classy Italian joint.
author: matt m.

description:
This place was so unacceptable  that I had to fight the urge to warn the people in line that they leave before their night was ruined like ours.

The food was mediocre but the service at Denny's would easily surpass the service we received here.

We walked in a half empty restaurant and was not acknowledged for a good 10 minutes.  Finally, we were informed that we would have to wait 20 minutes for us to be seated.  We were directed to wait at the bar, but no one came by to offer us drinks, etc.  We were tempted to leave but it was already late and it was raining.

After being seated, it took another 10 minutes for a waiter to see us in which he just threw us the menu.  Our waiter never took our drink orders nor did he read us the daily specials, but we had overheard other tables being told the daily specials.

We ordered and was then given the olive oil "for our bread" but we were never given bread.

The entrees arrived and the only redeeming quality was that the food was  edible.  Our waiter never came by to check on us or refill out water.


At the end of the meal, we had to flag him down yet again to just ask for the bill.   He tried to give us a free dessert when he handed us the bill (doesn't dessert come before the bill?), but our experience was already ruined.    We were more than ready to leave and wished we had decided to brave the storm instead of wasting an hour of our life.

I have experienced bad service before, but this place drove me to write my first yelp review.
author: Amy N.

description:
Best Italian food EVER!!

The meatballs were amazing, and the pasta was unbelievable! Their pasta sauce is better than any sauce I have ever had in Italy even. We had a wonderful time and their service was slow but very nice people. They even gave us free fried polenta and dessert. This was the best Italian meal I have ever had in my life...go to Bella Trattoria the next time you are in san fran!
author: julien c.

description:
The first time I spotted Bella, I was walking and saw this fairly large poodle sitting outside and it was slurping down some large Fettuccine noodles, and I laughed at the site, and thought, "poodle with a noodle!" It was charming. 

 I used to live within walking distance of Bella, and frankly although I could have gone all the time for that reason alas, I did not and now that I don't live so close, I look back and regret it.  The cuisine is phenomenal, I truly believe some of the best in the city, and I adore that the owners are the hands on chefs and that they will welcome you and suggest a "New" creation made for the night, or which fish/poultry/meat entree is prepared that night, not on the menu.  The staff are perhaps more friendly and as competent as any place I have been to in the city.  

All of the fare I have tried were flavorful and aromatic of fresh herbs, I know what it means to have a "clean" taste to the sauce, seasonings are vibrant and simple but never over powering. I especially like that I can ask for a certain sauce to go onto a particular pasta, not just the already suggested combinations, and I particularly love the Mare E Monti, however I order it with the potato gnocchi, with that as my preference over the spinach ones. The mixture of mascarpone cream sauce of tender salmon, mixed with perfectly fat and fluffy gnocchi! What's not to love?!

They also often have open table 1000 points, so check it out at those times! It's a bit on the dark side, but it is romantic and I like to sit at the "bench" style seats next to my guy. Only down side is that there is no view, except over looking the burger king across the street, but it reminds you that you are happy to be at Bella.

I hope to see that noodle poodle again sometime, or perhaps a collie with some manicotti!
author: Mai G.

description:
And a revelation was visited upon me, and it went a little something like this...

"You, daughter of the great rock of the Mediterranean, descendant of the houses of Spada and Minaudo, Pasienza and Maiorana... You need not journey to North Beach for the cuisine of your homeland. You need not traverse this fair city on multiple MUNI lines including the 28 tourist express overloaded with chubby Midwesterners wearing fanny packs and swatting you in the head with their Streetwise San Francisco maps... 

Walk out your front door, turn left, turn right, and eventually you shall see the soft glow of a holy place, made of yellow stucco: a place where the sacred ingredients of your ancestors shall come together in just the right proportions, in just the right environment. And they shall be served to you like a superstar."

And so I went to this place. This place called Bella Trattoria. And when I sat at the lovely window table, and experienced the excellent service, and ate the superb food, and lingered over a glass of wine on a beautiful Sunday evening at sunset... I saw that it was good. And I blessed it.

And said fuck North Beach.
author: Lisa T.

description:
I'm protesting!!!  I SAY NO!!

*   *Waves sign and marches in circles*   *

NO to waiting 15 minutes for a table when you made reservations for 8:00 and there is clearly an empty table for two sitting right at the front of the restaurant.

NO to being shoved into by waiters trying to squeeze by while you are standing by the bar, waiting patiently for said table.

Then after finally being seated at the table that was clearly destined to be yours anyway, NO to waiting 15 more minutes before a waiter saunters by to ask for your drink order!

NO to bad bread and bland dipping oil.  NO to an Italian place that DARES to serve bread which is inferior to the baguettes and dipping oil I buy all the time at the ghetto Safeway!!!

NO to never getting the butter I requested, trying to cover up the bad tasting bread - or at least replace the weird dipping oil.

NO to realizing that the menu does not have the choices you had wanted when you looked at the online menu.

NO to appetizers that are supposed to come with Italian cheeses but DON'T!!

NO to having to ask for your wine more than once!!

NO to raviolli pollo that contains no dicernable trace of chicken and is swimming in tomato sauce that might as well have been straight out of a can.

NO to riduculously high prices for pork loin that was not much better!

NO TO PAYING OVER $70 for an Italian meal with sub-par service and sub-par food.

:(  I'm on strike.

* * * * * *
November 7th update:
Thank you to the management for offering us some free glasses of wine to make up for it... aparently we came on the night Bella was reopening after being closed for a couple weeks.  So, maybe Bella was just having a bad day :)
author: Laura W.

description: Great overall experience! Friendly staff, amazing cuisine and really inviting atmosphere. Highly recommended to anyone who is looking for a nice spot for a date night.
author: Emily A.

description: Wonderful food!  Absolutely the best gnocci that I've had in SF, maybe the best I've had ever.  We love the atmosphere and the service is spot on.  The food leads the way here, but the whole dining experience here is really nice.  Just came for a second time, we were so pleased that our excellent first time was not a fluke.
author: Michael G.

description: Atmosphere, OK, service OK, wine list reasonable, Food--fantastic.  This neighborhood haunt is as upscale as you get in the Richmond, with quality at a reasonable price.  Favorites: Eggplant Parmigiana, Meatballs, warm spinach salad, any pasta, trout.   Make a reservation on the weekend and don't expect to have your crumbs vacuumed up.  They are working on pizza and we look forward to the takeout they say is on the horizon.
author: Rita G.

description:
I love this place.

The people are so nice with excellent customer service and the creamy polenta is off the heezy.  I can't remember the name of my entree, but it was basically pasta in a cream sauce with Italian sausage, and it was delicious.  I secretly wanted to suck it all up in one second but because I was in public I took my time.

To top it off, the server brought us a complimentary dessert, which I thought was the icing on the cake!
author: Denise M.

description:
It's been awhile since I've been at a nice sit down restaurant and felt like everything came together.  Bella was good.  We celebrated a friend's bday here and I didn't walk out unhappy.  The food is good.

Started off with the mussels, enough to share and definitely soaked up the sauce with the bread, so yeah, good flavor.  The antipasto plate was very well plated, grilled veggies (the eggplant was a tad dry, but the zucchini was good), cured meats and sides were a great way to start us salivating.

I had the 3 types of pasta..the spinich ravilo was great, the pink sauce penne was delicious, gnocci was a bit floury but overall, i was happy with my order.  I had a taste of the lobster ravioli and wanted more.  

The service was great, not too over bearing, but we always had our plates cleared on cue and water glass was always full.  Pretty attentive considering the place was pretty packed.  

Best part was dessert, the panna cotta with strawberry puree was incredibly creamy and perfectly paired with the sauce.  The perfiteroles were very chocolatey and soft, the tiramisu, u can get drunk off  =)

Definitely a great place to have a dinner party.
author: Ames K.

description: I don't think there are too many places worth going to eat at outside North Beach. This place was amazing! Great food and great service.  The Ostrich Carpaccio was delicious.  Also split the hangar steak, sausage gnocchi and some Smoked salmon Linguini. Delicious.  My only complaint wouldhave been the Ceaser salad, which is why htey dont get a five star.  I have walked by this place a mission times.  Who knew?!!  Definately going back.
author: Donnie N.

description:
The service is good, however, I'm not sure if some of the servers actually have authentic Italian accents or if it's just to add an air of authenticity to an Italian restaurant in the Richmond. 

In terms of food...
I've been to Bella a few times, however, never on my own accord. Generally, I go with friends who ask me to join them and I agree because I'm hungry. 
The bread you get while you wait for your entree is merely bread to snack on while you wait--nothing too exciting. I've had the lobster ravioli which has a nice creamy tomato sauce, but the ravioli could use a bit more lobster. 
I've also had their grilled hanger steak with a gorgonzola-shiitake bechamel sauce (they may want to double check their spelling of "shiitake" on their menus). The hanger steak was good, but whoever's responsible of making the bechamel sauce needs to learn to make it properly. 
Their panna cotta is good, but I've definitely had better.
author: Ryan W.

description:
Update 1/19/08:

Message from the manager, which I appreciated.  

Patricia, just wanted to send you a quick thanks on your review of Bella. I felt that your review was very constructive and was actually read to all of the staff before service this evening. Again, thanks for your review and  I wish you luck in your dinning adventures and if your ever back in the neighborhood please stop in for a quick hello. 
sincerely 
David Gonzalez 
Manager

________________________________________________
I wish I could write a better review of this place....but I just can't!

We were greeted promptly and shown to a good table.  The space is pretty, with high ceilings, cool hanging lamps and a copper clad bar.  However, things started off badly when two of the wines we requested were not available.....the suggestions the waiter made were fine, and we settled in....and settled in....and finally had our orders taken.   They brought us some complimentary bruschetta - but it wasn't very good, albeit a nice touch.

As some yelpers have mentioned, the menu on the website is pretty different from the menu in the restaurant.  Some discrepancies are expected, but they really should update the on line menu.  

My hon of hons husband had the Caesar, while I opted for the clams in tomato basil sauce.  It took at least 15 minutes for those simple appetizers to arrive, and when they came, the waiter had to ask who got which dish, and set them down and left without offering pepper for the salad.  I didn't even get a seafood fork for my clams, and the tines of the fork I did have were so large I couldn't use them to pry out the tiny clams.  I finally flagged him over and got a salad fork, which was the smallest they had.  It did the job, but made me wonder why they don't have the proper cutlery.  The clams were devoid of flavor, and the portion was pretty stingy for $9.

We ordered a couple more glasses of wine, and they didn't come for nearly 20 minutes.  We had to flag down the waiter AGAIN and remind him.  When our entrees arrived, they were just delicious, even though once again we had to tell the waiter who got what. I had spinach gnocchi with a cream mushroom sauce and it was amazing.  My one complaint is that there was actually too much sauce on the dish.  My HOHH had whole wheat linguine with a mushroom sauce that worked perfectly - the combination really brought out the earthy flavors of the dish.

We decided to skip dessert since we had been there for nearly two hours.  The waiter brought out a small selection of delicious desserts on the house, which was very kind of him.

In conclusion, Bella Trattoria needs to get their act together.  Perhaps some additional staff would help.  The waits between courses, the forgetfulness of the existing staff, the lack of proper cutlery - were a big turn off for me, and I don't think we'll be back.  

The complimentary bruschetta and desserts were nice, but I'd rather just have good service than a bribe.
author: .Hon H.

description: lovely restaurant.  My BF and I took his grandmother here and it was a hit.  It would also be a great date night place.  Nice food, good atmosphere, and good service.  Overall, a nice dinner out.  The Osso Bucco and the pasta both excellent.
author: Becky T.

description:
The first time I went to Bella, I went with a group of friends.  The experience was ok, but because I went with a group, I wasn't expecting top-notch anything.  Nothing was really disappointing, but nothing was really memorable either.  

Recently, I went back with one other person, and found my experience to be disappointing.  I was expecting a bit more this time, as we went on an off-night and the restaurant was not busy. 

First, the bread came out; they were room temperature and burnt at the bottom.  Second, they didn't have a couple of items on the menu (it's not a big menu), which is understandable, but after about 5 minutes, we were told they just bought some ingredients and can now prepare the dish.  I'm not sure where they bought the ingredients, but it was late at night and it made me think twice about how fresh and/or "local" they were.  

So, my food came out, it was warm (plate was hot though).  The food was very average tasting, and a bit bland.  Again, nothing spectacular, not even above average I'd say.  However, I enjoyed the complimentary bruschetta (appetizer) and panna cotta (dessert).  The dessert could have used a mint leaf or berries on the side.  In general, the dishes just lacked taste and edge.  

The service was consistently below average.  One time, the waiter took the utensils away and forgot to bring us a new set.  Then, at the end, we had to remind them about our to-go boxes, which at this point, was getting annoying.  

Not sure I'd go back again.  There are way too many good restaurants (italian and otherwise) in SF for just an ok experience.
author: Roger W.

description:
They were really accommodating to my party of 8 (it was for my birthday).  The servers were really attentive and nice... they even laughed at my friends not-so-funny jokes... haha.  

Our group pretty much ordered the same thing, the 3 kinds of pasta and #11... but I decided to stray away and get the gnocchi.  I have to say that i really liked #11... I forgot what it was called but it has mozarella.. and sausage.
author: JUDY L.

description:
The owners are not actually brothers... maybe they used to be?  But now it's just two buddies from Italy.  Very friendly, and provided great service.  My 2 friends  ordered the gnocchi with fennel sausage special, the three pasta dish (gnocchi, penne, and ravioli), and I ordered the griglia mista (wild salmon, the daily fish which was tilapia, and a huge prawn in a lemon butter sauce, served over a bed of arugula and spinach which were seared/sauteed in the lemon butter.  Really good stuff.  The Carpaccio we started with was probably the best carpaccio I've had in a couple years.

THe owner that was there that evening came by about midway through the meal.  My friend (a girl) already finished her tinily portioned 3 pastas, and was still hungry, and asked him for some more, because it wasn't enough.  He apologized profusely and tactfully, and asked which of the three she wanted, and he'll bring it out.  When I first got the salmon, I asked him if it was really wild (it wasn't the dark red orange inside that expected, and the flavor was rather weak), and he said it was.  This time, he just told me, "I know.  you're not feeling the salmon.  I'll bring you something else."  He came out with some more penne for my friend (who was still hungry) and a bowl of large clams with cherry tomatoes and eggplant.  SO tasty.  I was totally satisfied.

The wine he chose to pair our 3 dishes was good, I can't remember the italian name, but it had a nice fruit nose, some spice, and earthy aftertaste.  Went perfectly with the carpaccio and some parts of my fish.

Ambience was dark and romantic.  Not cramped, and decently spacious.  Only problem is a lack of waitstaff I think...everything was a little bit slow.  However, the owner's attentiveness and level of service more than made up for it.

And the prices were reasonable too.  Entrees were between $12 (gnocchi) and $20 (my fish).

This has become my new default italian joint.  :)
author: Fong L.

description:
Torn.
Torn.
Torn.

We celebrated a very important birthday party here this last Saturday. The food was wonderful, the restaurant itself was very comfortable, and darkly romantic. 

However, we had made reservations for our large party, and still ended up waiting on the sidewalk outside the restaurant for an hour. To their credit, there is a nice bench out there. It doesn't fit 12 though. They didn't really check on us, they just came out twice to confirm that we were a party of 12. When we finally got seated, they complained that the party before us wouldn't leave. It took them another hour for us to be served our food, and when they brought that out, they had lost half the party's orders. 

This was all rather disappointing, because others who had been there before clearly felt this wasn't their typical service. Also, from looking at these other yelp reviews, I would say that this just isn't the place to take a bigger group of people. 

I would love to come here again with the husband though. I think that, that is the sort of party Bella would handle perfectly.
author: Dixon T.

description: Not the best Italian food I had for sure. The sauce was so greasy and non flavorful. Bread was not even fresh!
author: Wine L.

description:
Went there on a rainy Sunday night because we didn't want to wait the hour for Burma Super Star.  The place only had two tables when we sat down and we were attended to quite quickly.  This is where is all goes down hill. 

Took our orders for soup and drinks and then we waited.  And waited, and waited... Then the soup came and we put our order in for dinner and then waited, waited and waited.  We watched three tables that sat down and ordered after we arrived get their meals.  After having to ask about our meal the server said it was one the way out.  Five minutes later our food came out.  

We had included an order of meatballs with our meal and those came out cold.  The table next to us also had the meatballs and they too were delivered cold.  We sent it back and never saw a replacement come back so canceled it when we finished the rest of our meal.

We too got the "free dessert to make up for it" and received an extremely runny Zabaglione. Uuugh!

Next time we are going to suck it up and wait for Burma Super Star.
author: Aaron F.

description: Cute restaurant with good sauces  on homemade pasta.  With all the good bread in SF this loaf was disappointing.  We missed service with a smile.  The portions were nicely sized.  The gnocchi were light as feathers.  The  meatball appetizer was good and 3 of us were able to share it.  Too full to order desert but was brought a lovely panne cotta gratis.  Would certainly revisit.
author: Elaine F.

description:
Okay...  David, the owner is a huge Zoo Station fan...  So he gets 5 stars for crossing the street on crowded nights to check out a show at Ireland's 32.  But for a pre-gig meal Bella's Muscovy duck Gnocchi is tops!  The pana cotta makes for a great conclusion to an always divine meal.  Great caesar dressing also.

Never had a bad experience.  Awesome wine list, very reasonable.

Bring in a bottle, share it with the staff and you will have friends for life!
author: Scott S.

description:
Very happy to have discovered an authentic, lively, relaxing (if timed correctly) pasteria!  Quite a happy surprise over the weekend.

Whilst the overall service might seem a bit scattered, it certainly adds to the authenticity.  No doubt a very talented chef and team is in back, cranking out hand-made, delicious pasta and authentic salads / entrees, and with a short but complete wine list, sit back and enjoy the real personalities out front making the dining experience quite complete.

Timing is key -- hit the bluehair special timing if you can; grab a seat early (6-7p) and enjoy the madness as the place begins to pack in the peeps.

All in -- a great experience.  If we could, we'd hit Acquerello once a week.  Until the lottery is won, we'll blend in Bella much more frequently -- avoiding the far less satisfactory 'Italian' pizzeria/pasteria mishaps (e.g., Flour and Water) that are out there.
author: James D.

description:
Location was nice. setting was romantic. 

Food selection was minimal. and they "strongly discourage" substitutions unless you have a food allergy. the only thing that sounded somewhat appetizing was some Baked penne pasta with chicken and mushrooms. knowing that i hate mushrooms i still ordered it. I thought, maybe i can pick the mushrooms off. well my dinner was coated with mushrooms and very little chicken.  I didnt really eat. although they brought us a "free" appetizer and free desert. those were ok. 

Service was ok until the check arrived. they charged me for someone else's tab. my tab was just shy of $70 minus the tip....I left a $20 cash tip (on the table) and wrote on the receipt $0 for tip.....In the end i was charged $95. i didnt notice until i saw my bank statement the following day.
 
    i called to speak to the manager and some guy named Matt Lupini claimed to be the manager. he was short and unkind. He didnt care about my situation. He said he'd give the owner my name and number to call me back regarding my issue. I never got a call.  i understand the restaurant is busy but  their "management" should be taught about customer service over the phone..

     i called again to speak to the owner David and he was very polite and looked into my issue. he even called me back with a resolution. He said there was a mixup in tabs.  and that my tab was only charged $81.....however i mentioned to him that i'm not trying to be a cheapskate but I left a $20 cash tip and only shouldve been charged the $70. the manager promised to refund me the difference. i was content with that...

      Looks to me like that waiter tipped himself aside from receiving a cash tip. WOW that is annoying and disrespectful.   Im not at all impressed with their service. If you are going to this restaurant save your receipts....it couldve been a better expericence had the waiter not  been so avaricious.
author: Love To Run L.

description:
The Good: The dishes here are solid. I especially liked the carbonara, a special entrée on this night, and the antipasto. Reasonable selection of wines. We were seated on a table by the window - also nice.  Good timing of bringing out the dishes.

Needs Improvement: Service is warm and welcoming, but uneven.  A young woman who initially greeted us did not seem to know how to welcome customers into a restaurant, which requires more than a smile and hello.  It took the next gentlemen (who may have been the owner or manager) to come by after 10 minutes to let us know what was going on with our table.

I'll return to try again, especially because it's in my neighborhood.
author: Keith K.

description: absolutely delicious!!!!! we order the amatreciana?( it hink that how u spell it)!! it was divine!! their bread and dipping oil is sooo good!!!! my favorite parts were definitely the bruschetta and the panna cotta for dessert!!! I love visiting this place everytime I am in San fran.
author: Marci A.

description:
This is the best Italian restaurant in the city. I've had a lot of the ones in North Beach and they just don't measure up. 

+ nice ambiance - nice music, lighting, and not overly crowded
+ great customer service - funny waiter and hostess
+ + + food was amazing - i had the gorgonzola gnocchi which was so creamy and delicious. They gave us a free dessert - this flan looking thing with strawberries - (i forgot what its called) and yummmm it was good.
author: Alicia V.

description:
My boyfriend was studying for the Bar Exam (3 days of hell) but was sweet enough to want a quick anniversary celebration, so I was looking for a relatively quick "fine dining" type meal with nice food and wine, genuinely sincere service, easy parking, and no wait.  I posted a request for tips from fellow Yelpers, many of whom were really helpful, one guy who suggested I celebrate "Steak and a BJ Day," and one guy who said: "Sounds like the perfect place. Good luck finding it."  (http://www.yelp.com/topic/USMhoJQteYWOYa3R_oqvlw).

Well, I found it ! ...other than the fact that there was no parking lot or valet, which is just typical SF.  I rsvped for 7pm Saturday on the day of, and surprisingly the place wasn't even half full, but it wasn't the type of place where you're awkwardly gawked at while being waited on.  Waitstaff here were amazingly friendly and super timely about refilling our water.  

To start, they brought out bread with the most yummy sun-dried tomato infused olive oil with sun dried tomato pieces!  For an appetizer, we split al-dente spaghetti (mmm bouncy!) with albacore tuna, olives, and fresh tomato.  Then I had a wonderful seafood trio of halibut, salmon, and tiger prawns in a bed of spinach and slices of potato in butter-lemon sauce, and my boyfriend had hangar steak with the same slices of potato and gargonzola cheese.  We were so full we didn't have room for dessert, but then the waitress was kind enough to bring us some complimentary marsala custard with seasonal fresh berries that I had been eyeing on the menu.  She was totally right -- there is always room for something that delicious!

The prices were totally reasonable -- with the above and 2 glasses of wine and tip, the total was around $85.  It was delicious AND a wonderful celebratory romantic experience in less than 1.5 hours!
author: Erica Y.

description: Simply excellent service.  Great food.  The complimentary bread and sundried tomato dip is delicious and addictive (we had two baskets!).  The eggplant and meatballs were perfect appetizers.  Squid Ink Pasta and Gnocchi Verdi were good, but not amazing.   The Oxtail Pasta was the clear winner of the night, tender oxtail with a delicious sauce.  Generous entrée portions.  The complimentary dessert panna cotta was also a perfect way to end the night.  We'll be back!!
author: Poki B.

description:
We really enjoy this place, great for a date night in the Richmond.  
The service here is excellent and the homemade pasta is really lovely.
author: Robyn S.

description:
Good food, nice space, and waitstaff that are attentive. I enjoy my lunches at Bella (it's near work, so you know), and dinner is cool too, but my choice would be for lunch.

TIP! Bathroom door sticks a bit so you'll have to tug like the devil from the inside to get out. I wish someone would have told this little rotund kid who  was pounding the door like the devil and sobbing with tears to boot. i was the only one who heard (his pops was by the door, on the other side of the restaurant).  I gave the door the shoulder heave ho and released the child from his prison. Oh to be trapped in a bathroom at any restaurant....it'll be his nightmare for years to come. So be a good boy and eat all your gnocchi or it's back in the bathroom you go!
author: Charlene L.

description: We found this little place when we did a search on Yelp for a restaurant in the neighborhood where we were renting a home for a week.
