We passed it in the car many times but never took notice of it. SO glad we found it on Yelp. The service was lovely and the food amazing. The ostrich carpaccio was incredible. I could eat 10 plates of that.  The gnocchi was light; didn't know that was possible. The flat iron steak was tender and seasoned perfectly. This is a MUST restaurant if you're in SFO. Loved it!
author: Janet D.

description:
Came here because of a friend's recommendation and I'm glad I did. The courteous service from the waiters was just unbelievable, they knew the right things to say and do to make us feel appreciated. The food was delicious too.

The second we walked into the restaurant, we were greeted with a warm smile from one of the waiters and were offered a larger table despite there being only two of us. We didn't want to spend too much that day and we weren't that hungry so we only ordered an entree each. Though it seemed to be a slow night, the waiters did not try to push us into ordering more or make us feel as though we were a waste of time. And despite the fact that our order was minimal, us first timers did not receive any less attention than the other patrons and regulars. Our glasses were constantly refilled with water and we were never interrupted during our meal/conversation, they had absolutely graceful manners.

The food was amazing, definitely worth the price. My bf ordered the seafood linguine dish and though the menu said it included clams, the waiter told us the chef replaced the old clams with fresh mussels instead, which came as a pleasant surprise to us because we're big on fresh food quality over quantity. The waiter did not lie, we could taste the salty fresh flavor of the mussels which definitely pleased the bf who was craving clams at the time. I would give this restaurant extra stars for this gesture because I'm tired of places taking advantage of us being young and not knowing any better. I ordered the three pasta dish which included penne, ravioli, and gnocchi. The penne had the perfect amount of spices, and the ravioli was good too. I don't know how gnocchi is supposed to taste, but it was a little too mushy for me.

Overall, this place was wonderful. Service was just extraordinary, I can't praise it enough. Would recommend, especially great for those quiet romantic dinner dates.
author: Cristal G.

description:
They gave us free panna cotta! It was quite delicious.

I had the lobster stuffed ravioli, and that too was quite delicious. It doesn't seem like a whole lot of food but it was very filling.

It did not help, however, that we were in a hurry because we had tickets to the 7:00 Jersey Boy's show, and so the long (about thirty to forty minutes) wait between the antipasti and the entree was kind of frustrating. I can't blame them too much, though, because I feel like if we weren't on a schedule, and we were free to just sit and chat, it would have been quite pleasant.

Also, that photograph from Rick H. makes this restaurant seem bigger than it actually is. 

All in all, it's nice, it's quaint, it's in a random area in the Inner Richmond off Geary, it's got nice signage. The name is kind of cheesy, though.
author: Anna H.

description:
Surprisingly cozy restaurant.  I never gave this restaurant a chance. Have driven by a million times, didn't think spending that type of money to eat on GEARY ST would be worth. Was I wrong...once inside you forget that you're on that busy street.  The atmosphere was cozy and dare I say romantic.  Nice dimmed lights and chill music set the mood.

Service was on point.  Very friendly and accommodating to our large birthday party.  We must have met every employee that night, even one tried to entertain our one-year old (my friend's...not me!) The food was very tasty.  I have to admit, we weren't the best customers.  Our party kept getting up to smoke outside or take shots at the bar next door, but the employees kept smiling and waited for people to return before serving. Sorry guys and thanks!!!

Recommendation:  The duck gnocchi was incredible as was their meatball appetizer.
author: Ezduzit S.

description:
The lobster ravioli is heaven on a plate. So good, I wanted to lick the sauce off the dish when I was done so as not to waste a drop. The polenta with Gorgonzola and mushrooms, the bruchetta, the pana cotta - all of it was excellent. It had been a few years since I had been there and I won't wait that long to go back. 

The service was fantastic, everyone was very friendly and helpful. Thank you Bella for a fabulous romantic evening!
author: Gucci M.

description:
My co-workers took me to Bella for Lunch.

It was 12:30 and the restaurant was still closed. Finally the cook open the door for us, apologized due to the waiter running late.

I ordered Manzo, it was delicious. And so was my co-workers orders.
The price is affordable and the service we rcvd were good. They even gave us free dessert.

I'm going to try to come here during dinner time with Mr so I can experience the romantic vibe of the restaurant because during day time it's just cozy. ^_^
author: jubi l.

description:
I had two friends from Ann Arbor visiting and my friend wanted to have an Italian dinner (after eating at several other ethnic restaurants). I put on my thinking cap and asked other friends for advice but didn't come up with anything that excited me.  The friend they were staying with suggested Bella after an evening at the free Friday DeYoung event. Oh. My. God. What a terrific choice for a nice, intimate evening with great food! 

I was impressed with everything starting with the homemade bread. I won't go on and on about every dish, but in viewing other posts, I think I can safely say you will not be disappointed if you go to this restaurant. The salads, great. The antipasto, great. the main courses, TERRIFIC. Yes, it's small but very lovely indeed. Please do go and try for yourself. The service was impeccable. Very friendly attentive and friendly staff...at all levels.

5 stars and I will definitely add this to my list of regular restaurants.
author: Lynne B.

description: Gnocchi translated means "little pillows." That's exactly what eating the gnocchi at Bella was like. Hands down the best gnocchi I've ever had. I'll be back.
author: T P.

description:
gentlemen - i have found your perfect first date place:

-romantic ambiance with dim candlelight lighting
-low key, neighborhood vibe
-solid, safe italian cuisine standbys (lasagne is a winner)
-meatballs!
-warm friendly service (sometimes a bit slow, but still friendly!)
-reservations on opentable.com

the food didn't knock my socks off, but the ambiance is really what you're here for.  if your food was cold in the middle like mine,  you should have them reheat it and then you get free dessert.  :-)

for my 3rd date tip, see 
http://www.yelp.com/biz/giordano-bros-san-francisco#hrid:tCgLYmsCleLx-bNxn0q9cw
author: Josie M.

description:
We celebrated my birthday here on Saturday night and it was wonderful!  We did have to wait for our table to be ready, although we had made a reservation but that was the only negative thing.

The food was incredible! The polenta appetizer is so tasty and all of the entrees were great. The osso bucco was a little bit too sweet but everything else was perfect. We had lasagna, rigatoni, and carbonara.

The staff was very funny and they treated us very well, bringing extra appetizers as well as a dessert and even sang happy birthday to me in Italian. Our server was really Italian which was also a plus! Our server was very knowledgeable and was able to answer all our questions and helped some of us with food allergies, gluten and dairy, make our decisions! They even had gluten free pasta! 

Overall great experience, great food, the ambience was cosy and the servers were very knowledgeable and friendly. 

We will definitely be back again!
author: Elisabeth C.

description:
Bella is a rather decent restaurant with sauces that are a bit on the salty, slightly-too-flavorful side, but homemade noodles with a unique and delectable texture that are almost worth the visit.

We had the tuna pasta with tomato sauce and the rabbit pasta with a white sauce, with an appetizer of meatballs.  Both entrees had excellent pasta but suffered from the overly salty-sauce syndrome, but the meatballs were just right and had nice consistency.  The bread was unrefined but surprisingly delicious and easy-to-eat.  Our server was very nice and gave us the hook up for a dessert (panna cotta) because they were out of the Tiramisu.

There seemed to an asian sorority get-together when we were dining, complete with cheap evening dresses, boyfriends with spiked hair and collared shirts, and sporadic camera flashes.
author: Peter L.

description:
This is one of my all time favorite places. 

OK, so the location isn't great for out of the area people like myself. Chasing parking in the neighborhood is dicey proposition at best. 

The food is wonderful. I love the ravioli, the gnocchi and the pink sauce in the three pasta sampler. Last night I tried the pork tenderloin baked with delicious red sauce and cheese. Another hit! My only complaint is that I'm not that fond of the potatoes that come with it. 

The staff is very friendly and have always been willing to accommodate special requests from vegetarians and people with dietary restrictions. David, (the manager I think) is a really good host. 

We always bring out of town guests here because Bella never lets us down.
author: Chuck K.

description:
My sister and I rocked up here on a Saturday evening without a reservation and were seated at a nice four-seat table within 2 minutes (they had to clear the table).

We munched on bread while we looked at the menu.  Bread - not fantastic.  The olive oil with sun-dried tomatoes - good but not great.  You'd think there would be more flavor in the tomatoes.  Alas.

We shared the grilled polenta with gorgonzola and musrooms.  It was lovely.

I opted for the linguine nere and my sister got the three-pasta combination.  Rather different dishes, but we have different palates and we both really enjoyed our dishes.  My linguine nere came with lots of seafood so I spent a lot of time happily removing clams from their shells.  Love it.

We were going to skip dessert but someone accidentally brought us the dessert menu and so we ended up sharing the panna cotta (I was horrified that my sister didn't know what it was) which was divine.

And all the staff members were attentive and not too bad on the eyes.  ;-)
author: Christine C.

description:
After reading other reviews, I have to say that I agree with many of them.  Bella has to be some of the best if not the best Italian food in the city.  If someone suggests Italian for going out in the future, I will definitely suggest Bella.  It's small and intimate, so for parties of four or less, it's just perfect.

Absolutely everything from the service to the food was just wonderful. I loved the winter vegetable soup and the tilapia.  My friends ordered the three kinds of pasta, and they all raved about it.  They make all of their pasta in-house.

The dessert was great accompanied with real, tasty Italian coffee.  I'll definitely be back!  It's well worth the trip to the Inner Richmond!
author: Christina N.

description:
I love everything about this place - the ambience, the staff, the food and the prompt service. My fiancee and I drive in from Berkeley at least once per month to come eat here. And every time our family is in town visiting from NYC, they request we take them here. It's that good- I think it easily beats the italian restaurants in nyc! 

David is really welcoming and happy to accommodate my gluten allergy. Finding gluten-free Italian food is never easy! But Bella does it right.

Since I'm gluten-free, this place is a real treat for me. They have incredible gluten-free pasta that they can put with any of their delicious sauces. The pasta is al dente and doesn't fall apart like some gluten-free pastas can. There are lots of gluten-free apps to choose from - I recommend their polenta with mushrooms and a gluten-free dessert - their melt in your mouth panna cotta. 

You have to try their carbonara! It is seriously out of this world!
author: E A.

description: Ended up here as a second choice.  Have never been or heard of this restaurant and was very impressed with the food and the wait staff.  Will be coming back here again!
author: Gabriela Y.

description:
Just one of those nights that you walk into a random restaurant  w/out knowing what you're hungry for or even knowing anything about what you're about to be walking into.....

The 1st visit to Bella was a VERY pleasant visit. The food was fabulous, atmosphere had a nice calm charm to it, and above all of that, the service was just phenomenal.  

Several months down the road, I visit Bella for the second time expecting the same delightful service and food; but surprisingly, the service was just horrible. Point blank: it was just noticeable as switching the light switch from on to off.

But after a hint of our disappointment to the cook that made a visit to our table, we were very satisfied on how the cook went the extra mile to make us happy, along with serving us extra champagne and making us dessert (which was comp'ed)...and in the meantime, the server came by and also was very apologetic about his lack of service.
author: Tomasz B.

description:
I would write a whole long review, but my girlfriend Laura, who went with me, has already written pretty much exactly how I feel about this place....

http://www.yelp.com/biz/msT3LrLB4fhN04HYHuFsew#hrid:lKDEYBNgqeyRRQjRtz8wXw
author: Matthew S.

description: I dug this place.  Good atmosphere.  Great service.  Great food.  We had Frutti Di Mare, slightly spicy.  Yum.
author: Steve K.

description:
Who said you should go to North Beach in order to dine at a nice Italian restaurant? Just come to Bella Trattoria! I love Bella's decor and it definitely has a very welcoming and pleasant atmosphere, not to mention great food and service. I came here with a few of my friends and all of us had a great time.  There is even a 38 bus stop right next to Bella's, so it's very convenient to arrive if you don't have a car or if you don't want to spend time finding parking; speaking of which, parking is not that hard to find in the area. With all of that said, I highly recommend coming to Bella. Hands down one of the nicest and yummiest Italian restaurants in the city.

Bon appétit!
author: Narina A.

description: We had a full late lunch one Sunday. Every dish was better than expected, even after reading several glowing reviews. Small antipasti, two pasta dishes, 1/2 L of very good house red, two deserts (three if you count a complimentary panna cotta) and two coffees came to just over $100 with tax and a generous tip. The service was friendly and fun. We were the only folks there for much of the meal. The pace was slow, but as we liked it.
author: Kevin D.

description:
Very nice dining experience.  It was a last second decision, and we were in the the neighborhood.  We didn't have a reservation, so we sat on the comfy couches and only waited 5-10 minutes.  The hostess was pleasant.

Ordered the small antipasto, which made for some nice bites for the three of us.  I really liked the zucchini on it.

I had the gnocchi with pork ragu.  Yum!  Another had the baked ziti, which was completely devoured.  I can't remember what the 3rd person had.

The only drawback was there were only two women working the whole room.  I mean hostessing, serving, taking orders.  They needed another server.  I will give the women props, though.  They both worked our table and were friendly and never rushed us, or seemed in a hurry.

At the end, they brought over a complimentary panna cotta.  As much as I liked the gnocchi - this was the best dish of the evening.

A pleasant surprise!
author: Lil P.

description: We checked out this restaurant based on reviews from Yelp. At first we were concerned as we walked into the place at our 1:00 time and not a sole was in the restaurant. We had the whole place to ourselves. But as we settled in our waiter and part owner told us the specials and helped us to choose a wonderful wine for the table. We had a fantastic lunch. All the entres were good sized portions and incredibly tasty. I would definitely go back and have already started speading the word.
author: Leiann W.

description:
My wife and I always think of this place as one of our special places to go for a special occasion. Yes, it's right across the street from a Burger King and maybe that throws my sense of taste off. Yes, you have to put up with an occasional ghetto looking crew walking past the window. But hey it's life in the big city...
Anyway, the place is great but small... some say intimate. But if there's some big dude over 200 lbs sitting behind you prepare to occasionally feel the vibrations of his undulating stomach as it savors the fantastic morsels of food sliding dowm his gastrointestinal tunnel.
Also, a few yelpers complain about bad service but it seems like that has to do with big groups (read larger than 4). Otherwise, they've been a "can't miss" spot for us.
author: C C.

description:
Really enjoyed the food here, especially since it's not to far from where I live.  
It's been about a year since I ate there last, but I remember really liking the Squid ink.

Food-
Linguine Nere- Squid Ink with clams, calamari, eggplant in a nice wine sauce.  That was excellent.  
Gnocchi- Is great here, no matter which  sauce you have it with.  I enjoyed the braised lamb ragu is my fav. 

Decor/Atmosphere-Nice here!  Quite and comfortable.  Small too, not too many tables so the staff can give you more attention. 

Prices- Pretty standard prices for Italian- Around $13-$20 dishes.
author: Chase F.

description:
My gals and I decided to check this place out for a girls night out dinner.  And all I remember was the slow-@ss service.

We were quickly seated on a Friday night, but the food didn't come for a good hour and a half even though the restaurant was not packed.

Unfortunately, stomache acid came before the food, and no matter how good the food was, I couldn't enjoy them.
author: Gigi T.

description:
Awesome dining experience all around. 

Service: Attentive but not intrusive. 

Atmosphere: Romantic and comfortable. 

Wine list: Well thought out list of (mostly) Southern Italian Wines. 

Food: Amazing. Top notch from the appetizers to dessert. I had the Hangar Steak prepared with a Gorgonzola cheese and mushroom bechamel on top of crispy potatoes (Tagliata) as my main entree and, well, it was heaven. 

All of this and we didn't break the bank. Sweet. We'll definitely be back, and you should definitely go.
author: Mark G.

description:
Prolly one of the best Italian outta North Beach in the city - it scores well with the fresh/seasonal produce. That I LIKE. 

Ordered the spinach gnocchi with gorgonzola bechamel and warm spinach salad...and some prosecco.  According to the menu, they handroll gnocchis daily. Simply succulent. 

Prices in reasonable range, not to mention that we were given a fresh serving of pannacotta on the house (which means 'cooked cream') sludged in berry sauce and marionberries (honestly I dunno which berries, but would like to pretend they were as above!)

Waiters are nice... just sweet homey guys reminiscent of my times in Rome off the beaten tracks.
author: Jesada P.

description:
I was told this place has hunky waiters. I didn't see any but buff Italian dudes aren't my type.

Anyway, the food here was pretty good. I had the spinach gnocchi. The gorgonzola cheese melted on top made it extremely yummy and the little dumplings kinda melted in my mouth. I really liked the bread dip they have at the table. It's like a mixture of olive oil, vineger and something else....but I can't really put my finger on it.  

A good/bad thing about this place is that they have profiteroles but they didn't have any at the time I was there! I was really bummed. I just have to come back at some point when they do have them.
author: Nikki M.

description: I had a delicious dinner here last night with my sister and the food was SOOOOOOOO DELICIOUS! We sat down and started with a glass of the Lambrusca which is a sweet red wine that almost tastes like sweet grape juice. It had a hint of bubbles to it almost like there is still a little bit of fermentation going on in the bottle but after a couple of sips it smooths out and you can taste the complexity of the wine. For Starters we had the Brussel sprouts which were cooked perfectly and had a wonderful combination of olive oil and pancetta and were tender but still firm and just the right temp when they came out. We also tried a dish that had thinly sliced venison topped with arugula sprouts, olive oil and some sort of sauce that was a creamy red color the plating was very pretty :) Then for our entrees we had the Macarones Salchicha and the Tagliolini Salmon E Caviale which were both in a cream sauce the Macarones was in a red cream and the Salmon a white which just melted in your mouth very smooth not over the top rich but tasty. Then to top it off we had dessert Tiramisu and their sherbert and other chocolate ice cream thing, and Panna cotta all complimented nicely with a chilled glass of champagne and punctuated with a petite shot of limoncello. Super yummy all around. If you want a unique Italian food experience do come and try! We came on a busy night and the service was excellent everyone is friendly and this is not somewhere you come in to demand a quick meal you must sit back enjoy the atmosphere and the company of the people you are there with. The menu in house is far more extensive than the one online. Bon Appétit!
author: Vanessa C.

description: While waiting on my son who was at a high school function nearby, and feeling hungry, I popped in to see if they had a bar where I could sit since I was alone. They welcomed me at their small bar in the back, and made me feel not just comfortable, but like they were glad to have me there. How refreshing. I had the fantastic antipasto ("the small will be plenty" they told me correctly) as a light meal, along with a great glass of Barberra wine. They brought me out a small complimentary dessert and then sent me on my way. Hospitable, lovely service and delicious food. It's not in our neighborhood, but I'll go back soon.
author: Ann K.

description: They make the best butternut squash ravioli I have ever tasted!
author: Carrie C.

description: Panna Cotta here is to die for! And it was complimentary! Definitely best part of the meal.
author: Denise W.

description:
Had dinner with friends for a party of three on Tuesday night and the places was filled with customers in the small restaurant.  We didn't have any issue getting a reservation on Opentable and even if we walked in the wait would only have been 10-15 mins.  

I had the lasagna with pork ragu and it was excellent, but the portions were a little small.  My friend had the squid ink risotto and he ate the entire plate.  I'd say the food and wine were very tasty and reasonably priced for San Francisco, but the service was little slow.  The head waiter was informative, but the other waitress seemed new and didn't know everything on the menu.  Also when we asked for some things like milk for our coffee it took a little while.  But overall I'd go back.
author: Brian H.

description: We went here for valentine's day a couple of years ago. The food was amazing. I'm not normally wild about Italian food (I like it fine), but this was remarkable. Maybe it's because I normally get pasta at Italian places, but the meat here was delicious, as was the dessert. Also, I was very impressed that the staff managed to keep a romantic, relaxing atmosphere on a busy and crowded night. It was a great experience.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Oh Bella!  Bella is my favorite Italian restaurant in the city.  It's a small but intimate spot, ideal for dates.  Prices are reasonable, but I recommend choosing a few items as the portions are a small to decent size.  On the plus side, every time I've gone (and I've come to Bella more than a handful of times), we are always offered complimentary appetizers.  I admit, the service does tend to be a little slow, so don't come here when you are starving!  Although, the slow service can actually work in your favor, if you're on a (good) date--you don't feel rushed to eat and you can enjoy the conversation with your "interest".  I've also heard this is a great place to spend dinner on Valentines since they offer a prex fixe menu on Vday.  Of course, if you do decide to spend Vday here, reserve in advance as sitting is limited.

My favorites:
- Parmiggiana (eggplant prepared in a fresh tomato sauce, baked in parmigiana)
- Angollotti di aragosta (lobster ricotta ravioli prepared with a San Marzano tomato cream sugo)
- Penne al forno (baked penne pasta with fresh mozzarella and Italian sausage)
- For dessert: Zabaione
author: jeanious a.

description:
Went here after a reading some positive yelp reviews.  The atmosphere was very mellow and enjoyable.  Great for smaller parties (4 or less).  
The food was great.  I really liked the bruchetta and the owner (I am guessing) gave us a complimentary dessert.  The staff was friendly and knew the menu well to explain and make suggestions to their guests.  Go on the free corkage night and your bill won't break the bank!  Very reasonably priced.
author: Kra C.

description:
Such a good meal. Old-school Italian, but not cliched Roman-ruins Italian. 

Old, that is, but not ancient. 

I haven't had two dishes with sun-dried tomatoes in them in one meal in a long time, but Bella pulled it off with style. One was the infused oil that came with the opening bread (a light brioche, I think). Then came a perfect bruschetta, the tomatoes soft but not runny, the bread crispy on the outside and almost fresh-baked on the inside, the sun-dried tomatoes mixing in nicely. 

Then a carpaccio of tuna, so thin it was easily torn when edged with a fork. Then two entrees: a potato gnocchi that was super-soft, in a pork ragu sauce; and a risotto that was well worth the 25-minute cooking time, a thick mix of sausage and dueling mushrooms. No room for dessert.
author: OuterLands X.

description:
Honestly, Bella may have been 5 stars were it not for a few service problems. It is a small restaurant and thus glitches in service can occur, but altogether they were too sizeable to forgive. When we arrived at Bella, they made us wait even though tables were empty and we had a reservation. BUT, to the owner's credit, he realized we were not happy to wait at the bar and seated us shortly after. 

The only other service glitch was that they mistakenly made the wrong risotto for me, and instead of admitting it, they pretended like the correct one was right on it's way. My poor boyfriend had to wait something like 10-15 minutes as his food overcooked under heating lamps until my hurried and undercooked risotto arrived (they warn on the menu that the risotto takes 25 minutes to prepare).

ANYHOW, onto the good part. The food is excellent and quite a pleasant surprise. Good italian in the Richmond? Yes! I've tried the bruschetta, salads, risotto, gnocchi, and pasta and ALL are good; ranging from good to out of this world. Even my undercooked risotto had awesome flavors and would have probably been cooked perfectly had it not been rushed. The ravioli was BY FAR the best ravioli I have ever eaten and pasta was on par with Europe. Bravo!

I have been thinking about the food ever since I ate here and that is RARE, my friend. You must eat here. 

ps. You can make reservations on opentable.com
author: Amanda C.

description:
Although it's a little jarring when you first get in (it's a bit too small and the place can get crowded), Bella exceeds with great food, amazing service, and a nice atmosphere (romantic yet comfortable). The service is great because the staff aren't assigned just one or two tables so everyone is helping you, yet it doesn't feel chaotic or overbearing. 

My only complaint was our potato dumplings in meat ragu sauce could've used a bit more flavor, but everything else (including our complimentary wine custard... holy sweet jesus that is tasty) was fantastic. We would definitely go back, but because of the price and the ambience, we'll save it for a special occasion.
author: Roman H.

description:
If you are craving for GNOCCHI - this is the place to get them. 
Little pillows of love is how i describe them :)
Bella is a find in the lower avenues of the richmond district - warm intimate atmosphere, freindly service - great prices!
author: Christian S.

description:
Great Restaurant. The gnocci was perfect, and the waiter was so friendly and attentive, even gave my friend and I a glass of wine on the house b/c it was the end of the night. 
I will go back for sure - just for the gnocci really, I mean it's hard to make gnocci perfectly but they can do it.
The decor leaves a little to be desired, but the food makes up for it!
author: Emily L.

description:
I love this place. I usually go around lunch hours since it's not as pack.
The food is very authentic. My favorite dishes is Homemade Tagliolini w/Smoked Salmon, Caviar, cream sauce and their Homemade Green Fettuccine w/Duck meat, in Brandy Pink Sauce. I heard at night time, it's has a romantic setting with the dim lights ...
author: Selina L.

description:
Zabaglione Zabaglione Zabaglione!  Delish!

My boyfriend and I dined here for our 7-1/2 year anniversary and had a very nice and romantic candlelit dinner.  It was on a Friday night and I was glad that we made early reservations at 6:30pm for the restaurant quickly filled up within 30 mins.  The decor and ambiance of the restaurant was nice with a rustic Italian feel.  

I loved the complimentary bread they gave at the beginning of the dinner which was dipped in a mixture of olive oil, balsamic vinegar, and sun dried tomatoes!  Yum!  

The best was when they gave my boyfriend and I the Zabaglione desert (Marsala wine whipped custard with strawberries) at the end of our dinner, on the house.  Not only was it absolutely delicious, but it only made me crave for more!  I was pleased that they offered us dessert even though we said we would pass. =)  

Pros:
1) Reservations can be made through Open Table
2) Nice decor and spacious restaurant
3) Great for a romantic night out 
4) Very reasonably priced!

Cons:
1) I wanted more Zabaglione!
2) Street parking can take a while as there are many restaurants and shops around that area
author: A W.

description:
My favorite Italian place in SF (even after living close to N. Beach for 8 years)...

Bella is homey, fresh and satisfying.  
You can't beat the butternut squash ravioli (any time of year).  Gnocchi is melt-in-your-mouth (whichever flavor you choose).

Parking is tough, so try to avoid driving if you can.
If they are crowded, they offer you wine and make you as comfortable as a tiny little place can while you wait.  
Let me say that it is completely worth it.

Once, I went on a night when they were technically not serving the regular menu.  Just for me, the waiter agreed to prepare what I was craving (I'm sure he'd do it for you, too!)

I could live off of the bread and olive oil alone (which comes with sun dried tomatoes floating in it).

Delicioso!
author: Heather P.

description: It was my birthday and after scouring Yelp for a romantic, Italian restaurant that also served gluten free options, I finally reserved a table for 2 the same day. My boyfriend and I were sat right away. Our server, came by and after some of our questions it seemed that he expected us to know what all of the Italian meant and barely bothered to explain it to us. We started with the Polenta di Bella; I wasn't super familiar with Polenta or Gorgonzola cheese. The appetizer was tasty, but very strongly Gorgonzola-y. I ended up ordering a pasta with the gluten free spaghetti. The flavors were yummy, but the pasta was very stuck together and sort of mushy. My boyfriend's pasta was good, but nothing too special. We were served by the owner and wish he had been more helpful and welcoming.
author: Erin H.

description: Just had my birthday party at Bella and the staff did a great job!  We were a fairly loud and demanding group and they handled it with grace.  Prix fix for the group.  We brought in our own bottles of vino.  Great job all around.  Great vibe, music wasn't too loud.  Great food.  BTW we had a group of 25!  Well done!
author: Sherrie P.

description:
This is one of my new favorite places in SF! We ate here for my friend's birthday and I loved everything they put in front of me. I had the butternut squash ravioli. I was perfect....slightly buttery with just the right flavor and texture. You could tell the pasta was very fresh. My boyfriend had the risotto with truffle oil and mushrooms and I had some and it was excellent. It's rich though so order the butternut squash ravioli if you want something light. I also tried my friend's gnocchi with ragu and pork and it was sooo good! It was soft and a little chewy and it was just how gnocchi should be. 

Yes, the service is a little slow. Also, I could barely understand a word the waiter said (not being mean) but I did think it was cool that he was actually Italian. However, I would say this place is definitely worth trying. The food is worth the wait. 

I was a little disappointed that they were out of the grilled polenta so I think I'm going to go back and try it sometime soon.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
I ate here a dozen times now. I live around the corner in PArker. I am a gourmet food lover and ate in Babbos, Aqua and many other super expensive Italian restaurants. I can tell you that Bella has the same quality food for one fifth of the price as Babbos in NYC. Gnocchi, Clams, and all other entres are spectacular. The Chef knows what he is doing and the staff is super friendly. THis place is truly a gem. It is worth driving from an hour away to eat here. If this is your first time, try the gnocchi. 

I wish they had wine by half bottle and a better, higher end wine selection. I especially am bummed that they do not have Barolos. But it is a fantastic Italian restaurant for unbelievable prices.
author: bora o.

description:
I absolutely adore this venue. First off, David the owner and server is amazing. He is kind and authentic. He's clever and can carry a conversation. He always shows my boyfriend and I much love when we go there.

Now the Brushchetta, the best I have EVER had and I've been to Italy.  Yep, I said it. 

THe other pastas are a jumble in my mind, but I've never tried one I didn't like. Nuff Said.

Go if you haven't gone! 

P.S. You get 1,000 points on OpenTable if you go at like 5pm or something. . .Check it out!
author: Annette M.

description:
I love this little unassuming Italian restaurant! After reservations at another restaurant got screwed up, an hour before dinner I frantically searched for a restaurant that would take a reservation for a party of 9  on a Friday night. This place was my savior! It was close to my apartment and they were gracious enough to take our reservation but they warned us that there would be a large party of people coming half an hour before us. I was surprise when getting there how small the restaurant but it had a very cozy, romantic atmosphere. The waiter was super friendly and nice. Our food took a bit longer than we wanted, but the waiter explained that they had a small kitchen and the orders were just put in for the big party before us. The waiter was very apologetic and nice enough to give us free appetizers as we waited. 

When the food came & we tasted it... oh man, was it was worth the wait! Some of he dishes we ordered was eggplant parmigiana, bruschetta, the melt in your mouth gnocchi, the veal parmigiana, to name a few. I don't really remember the names of the dishes we ordered because the menu was mostly in Italian. All I know is that everything I tasted was amazing! To top the night the waiter gave us a plate full of different desserts on the house! I love this place!
author: Maritess N.

description: First time to Bella Trattoria and the service and food was amazing. Definitely coming back next time we are in SF.
author: Lauren D.

description:
I like Bella, Bella likes me. I often see her in the fog, or with lots of people inside her. 
KIdding- okay, its a cool spot to take a date or when the folkers are visiting from out of town cos its kinda out there, and its a bit of a secret... in my opinion that is.
Also, they have a decent wine selection, and great Bruchetta.
The crew is cool, and the sometimes have a guest chef and DJ spinning.
author: Pete T.

description:
I was all set to go to North Beach for some Italian food when a friend suggested this place.  I was beyond impressed.  The food was superb, especially the gnocchi. It melted in your mouth and wasn't overdone.  The portions were perfect sized, not american-overkill sized.  And the prices were very reasonable and a great value.
The service was top-notch. Our waitress Mia is the reason this review gets 5 stars!  She was warm, friendly, engaging, and knowledgable!  She made suggestions about the menu that I wouldn't have ordered, but glad i did. 
If you want to get away from the tourists of North Beach, i highly recommend Bella.
author: Tim G.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here for our reservation a few weeks ago, and we have nothing but good things to say! 
The gnocchi, amazing! If they're in the menu when you go, you have to order them. We also had the whole trout, delicious. And we can't forget the polenta squares! The staff was fantastic.  We would recommend this place to anyone!
Only complaint was our table was small, but it was to be expected in a small Italian joint
author: Cait H.

description:
Wow.  The other reviewers were right about the Gnochi.   And the salads and the veal and the espresso and the desert were all good.   The wine recommended perfectly cut through the thick sauce on the gnochi.   The staff was very friendly and helpful.   All for an good price.

I'll be back.
author: Mark N.

description:
Pluses:  Excellent service, very good starters and dessert, short but very nice wine list, romantic ambiance and prices are in the 'just right' range.  Minuses: the entrees were mediocre.

This place should be a solid four-star every night of the week -- all the elements are there.  On the basis of Yelp reviews, Transit Man and I visited last night.  We were a few minutes late for our reso, but they were gracious about that.

I really loved the service, it was just right - not too much or too little.  The service was prompt, but felt un-hurried.  We shared the Carpaccio and the mussels and clams in a pomodoro sauce to start -- both were excellent.  I particularly loved the fragrance of the tomato sauce with the clams and mussels and the carpaccio was just right.

Transit Man ordered the  butternut squash ravioli in brown butter and I had the gnocchi with arugula and gorgonzola cream.  What can I say? I so wanted them to be up-to-snuff but both were kind of tired tasting.  My gnocchi were mushy and TM's ravioli were soaked in the butter that overwhelmed the squash taste.

Dessert was a different story.  Our waiter kindly treated us to a little combo of zabaglione and panna cotta -- both were divine!

I'm hoping it was an off-night as far as the entrees went, because I'd love to return.
author: Nancy W.

description:
In a city with thousands of  tiny, busy restaurants, it is difficult to find a place where you can comfortably eat dinner and escape the bustle. Bella, is this place. 

The ambiance is warm, the food is incredible (everything I've tried), the wine flows, and the music is the perfect heartbeat to the wonderful experience. 

In terms of the staff, you get the feeling that you could easily befriend anyone of them. The owner, David, is friendly, genuine and grateful. 

I've suggested this place a number of times for a date, family dinner, or even a treat to yourself. In fact, I think I'll do so myself this week.
author: Vicky V.

description:
This is my favorite Italian place in SF.   The food here is great, and I consider it a tremendous value.  The restaurant is small and intimate.  The food is excellent.  I almost always get the spaghetti al tonno.  The pasta is always perfectly cooked.  The tuna and olives are amazing; the whole dish comes together beautifully.  I think it's a perfect dish.  I've also had a lobster ravioli there that is quite nice.  

Staff is friendly and attentive.  They always treated me like a friend when I came in.  I was a bit of a repeat customer I suppose.  Still, they made me feel welcome.
author: Kevin W.

description:
I had just returned from Italy, and was trying to get into the pizza place around the corner. They were booked, so my friend and I went to Bella Trattoria. The food instantly brought me back to Italy -- and the wines on the wine list were the same ones I had tried on my trip!

I had the pasta sampler, and they were all delicious. My friend's gnocci was amazing. While in Italy, I couldn't put my finger on what tasted so different there compared to the so-called Italian food in the States. Whatever the difference is, Bella has it nailed -- the food is very authentic, as well as the serving sizes. Some people don't seem to realize that the plates are smaller because in Italy, pasta is just one of a three-course meal.
author: Heather T.

description:
The good:  
                   Delicious food 
                   Good Service
                   Beautiful atmosphere

The bad:
                  Menu and prices do not match the online version.
-they had a valentine's day special and really jacked up the price by having a preset price of $80 per head which they don't state on the "special menu." You get that "little" surprise when the bill arrives. I personally felt jipped. If I wanted to pay for an expensive dinner I would have made it a point to go to an expensive place. 

                  Cramped seating space.
- I kept having various waitstaff bump into my right elbow because the tables were so cramped together. I guess they chose maximum possible profit over customer comfort.

Overall...great food but thought I paid too much for what should have been a casual dinner. They really should update their menu.
author: nancy l.

description:
It was time to kick the American out of his - our - little Asian food comfort zone and see what else was to be sampled in Inner Richmond. We settled on this place because of a) proximity b) good Yelp reviews and c) free corkage from Monday to Wednesday. c) was probably the true swaying factor. 

We decided on the spinach gnocchi in gorgonzola sauce with mushrooms. The waiter teasingly said that it was too cheesy to finish. Shamefully, we finished it easily, along with a full serving of the evening's special, pork shoulder ravioli. The filling was meaty and rich to the point of pâté-ness. Dessert was tiramisu and some kind of fruity custard. Both were delicious but the combination was probably inadvisable as the extremely strong espresso flavour of the tiramisu had the American believing that there was coffee in the coffee-less custard dessert as well.

Good attentive service. Bruschetta on the house. Dashing waitstaff. A great Monday's dinner out.
author: Korrena B.

description:
This is clearly a neighborhood place, and the locals I've talked to rave about it.  My experience there was very similar to others.  Inattentive waiters, a bit chaotic on busy nights, and very intimate seating (which is not an attractive feature for any restaurant in my book).

That said, I thought the food was fantastic, and sitting at the bar, I thought the staff was very friendly and very knowledgeable about Italian wines.  I loved everything we had.

I'll definitely go back, but I agree with some of the posters that this is more of a neighborhood place.  After all, this is San Francisco, and every neighborhood has good Italian!  If you're meeting a few Richmond District or Marin friends halfway this may be a good middle point for you.
author: B M.

description: Amazing, fresh, homemade Italian food with excellent service!  The pastas are all amazing - rich in flavor and delicious.  The bruschetta is awesome - it has homemade mozzarella on it which is a nice addition.  Third time here and the food and service have been consistently great!
author: KK R.

description:
I was craving Italian, and an intimate, romantic dinner.  I had heard wonderful things about this restaurant from my sister, and so I thought I'd check out this spot.  

It was a Friday evening, around 6:50 pm.  We called and asked if we could come in around 7:15 and they said sure.  Love that.  It was a very, very cold San Francisco night, and upon entering, the hostess offered to take my coat.  How sweet.  And, no, I'm not being sarcastic.

The food:  For appetizer we shared the polenta with mushrooms.  Heavenly.  Melt in your mouth.  I had a glass of white wine, which was nice.  For my entree, I selected a lobster ravioli.  It came in a tomato cream sauce, which was excellent.  I like the portion size- not too big, not too small.  My date ordered the whole wheat spahetti with sausage.  He said he wished he ordered the steak.  Anyhoo...  for dessert, I had a Sicilian blood orange gelato, which very much tasted like a blood orange- except with sugar added.  

The service was great.  The waiter was non-intrusive and knowledgeable.  The staff was not snobby at all- actually very nice.  The inside of the restaurant  is really cute and warm.  I think a wonderful first date spot, or to celebrate anniversaries or friends in town.  All the gnocci is hand made, fresh.  I want to try that on my next visit.
author: Sarah F.

description:
I really thought that the small but comfy setting was really nice. We spent our 7 yr anniversary dinner here and it was well worth it!!! Man, some of the best sweet French bread I have ever had. I almost ate the whole loaf! The bruchetta was toasted perfectly and the tomatoes were sweet!. The vinaigrette dressing on the salad was a perfect blend of herbs and vinegar.  The main course was a little lighter than I expected, 5 ravioli, rather small, but the flavor made up for the size. 
I will return!
author: A P.

description:
Best Italian food in the city! 

The men of Bella are as talented as they are charming! Ladies, look out!

As for the food, the crab ravioli with asparagus cream sauce is so light and full of deliciousness it's just crazy. The sample plate of pasta will let you try different specialties, and I adore their gnocci (and I hate Gnocci everywhere else.)

The texture of the pasta is always amazing because they make it fresh and they don't pre-cook it like so many places do so it's always nice and firm, a MUST for those of us who know the difference between real pasta and that mushy shit that is so common is lesser restaurants.

The food is never heavy and you don't leave painfully stuffed and needing a nap. After you meal save room for their AMAZING Zabaione a delicate, liquid custard made from eggs and Marsala served with fresh strawberries.

When we talk about the Zabaione it makes my friends and I a bit horny because it's soooooo delicious. Add in all that fabulous attention from those suave Italian men and you have a great place to take your favorite girls out to dinner.
author: Deb L.

description:
I went to Bella last night for the first time on a recommendation form a coworker.  I called ahead and asked if they would have any trouble seating 2 at 8:30.  They told me to head on over.

Parking is a little rough, but not that bad.  We ended up walking a block and a half.

When we arrived, the only open table was right next to the door.  We asked if we could wait at the bar until another table opened up. The host accommodated us, but the bar was not staffed.  We ordered wine from a waiter and waited.  Bruschetta was brought to us while we were waiting, and the staff was very friendly, but just opening the wine when we ordered it would have been preferred.  I enjoyed the bruschetta though.

When a table opened up we were brought over by a friendly waiter.  Service was good, considering that the staff was clearly busy, we asked a bunch of questions, and were not ready with our order even after looking at the menu for about 30 minutes including time at the bar and the table.

Some have knocked the bread and dipping oil but I though it was great.  The bread was fresh and the oil had sun dried tomato in it, which I really liked.

We both ended up getting the gnocchi. I had the one with lamb ragu which was delicious.  Not the best I've ever had but very good.  My GF really enjoyed her gnocchi with tomato sauce and mozzarella as well as well.

We got the cream puffs for dessert, which were also good, a nice light finish to the meal.

I"m giving 4 stars because everything was good, I really liked the ambiance and feel of the place, and the servers seemed to really care about whether we were having a great experience.

With a few tweaks, maybe one more staff person this place could definitely improve, but I enjoyed the experience and will be back.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Ugh, ew. All the food was dipped in butter 6 times over.

The service was a bit spotty. The waitress was nice for a bit, until she kept trying to take my plate. I still had a half a piece of fish on it! 

Maybe would go back, like maybe next year, or 10 years from now.
author: Nicole W.

description:
After reading the reviews, I decided to take the wife out for a nice dinner on Valentine's day. 

I called and made an appointment and when we arrived, they had our appt down for half an hour later. What is this all about?

I insisted we were on time after looking at my PBA. They finally sat us down to start our dinner.

Before I move on to the dinner, I will say that this place is small and has no lounge for people to wait, this is bad news after reading review after review that reflects lack of appointment management. The bar was closed for the day so waiting there would not have been an option.

Our orders were taken and drinks brought out rather quickly. I noticed that the waiter didn't have experience recommending wines but he still gets 4.5 stars for doing a great job and getting things out to us quickly. The waiter was friendly and payed great attention to detail. This made all of the difference.

The cold veggie soup with a hint of red peppers was a nice touch, as was the bruschetta with the extra crunchy crostini. The wine variety was excellent and a must when I go out to eat.

The bread with the dipping oil was ok....the bread was of cheap variety and the oil tasted stale/old. (after having the good stuff I am spoiled)

Out came the entrees and the servings were generous but not overwhelming. The pastas were al dente and the ingredients 
delivered a nice orchestra of flavors to the palate. I would consider this the highlight of our outing. This is where Bella shines.

The deserts were good...I would go back only if it isn't on Valentine's day where they lock the price at $70 per person.

3 glasses of wine (total) and a 4 course dinner later, $230 was a bit steep. 

The Napoli-style chef did a decent job....but one knows when a meal is worth $200. Was i convinced? Not really....I'll have to give these guys one more shot.

I like to dine out, it takes a good combination of things to get me to come back on a regular basis.

Service = 4.5 stars
Ambiance = 3 stars
Price = 3 stars
Quality = 4 stars
author: Roberto L.

description: You have to order the Risotto Di Seppia. So yummy!
author: V L.

description: Good pasta, decent bread, friendly staff (received a free desert just because).
author: Steven V.

description:
I have not explored many places in this area, so was happy to eat somewhere new. After a day of shopping, and an early Happy Hour we sauntered on the early side of Sunday. Dinner was great. I had the gnocchi, and CJ had the veal. Both were good. 
 
We did start with a soup- Cream of Mushroom, that lacked luster. I think it wasn't on the menu, however they wanted to serve it, so they heated up some broth. Not very good. 
 
Our waiter was personable and attentive and all in all it was a pleasant dining experience. 
 
*** I must include however, for the sake of Yelp being my dining journal, the dialog that transpired upon leaving the restaurant...
 
"What is it" 
"Gnocchi" 
"No, I mean, like what kind" 
"Like Pasta" 
"Does it have meat in it?" 
"No no, perfectly vegetarian" 

"Oh well, I don't want it then, I only want it with meat" 

- People these days, I mean if you are Homeless!!!
author: Danielle V.

description:
2.5 stars - came here for dinner on New Years Eve with my boyfriend for the $60 prix fix four course menu. We had reservations and were seated promptly sort of in the middle of the restaurant and had wait staff whizzing by either side of us throughout the night. 

Pros:
*Lots of staff on hand - we were checked up on after each course (I liked this but my boyfriend found it to be a bit too much)
*Romantic atmosphere - the restaurant itself is very small and intimate
*Water refills were plentiful! 
*Yummy complementary bread and sundried tomato/olive oil dipping sauce
*Polenta di bella! (gorgonzola and shitake mushrooms) mmm!
*Easy time parking

Cons: 
*Meal was rushed - it was apparent that they were trying to get us out so they could turn the table, really ruined the dining experience. I went to grab my jacket after the meal and left my purse at the table, when I returned they had already moved our table and started resetting it. (We were also given our check while we were eating dessert, we hadn't even asked for it yet - very rude and uninviting). 
*The prix fix menu was expensive for what the restaurant normally charges - I had the polenta, a small vegetable and barley soup, eggplant parmiggana, and tiramisu for $60! (polenta at this restaurant is typically $8.95, eggplant parmiggana is typically $8.95, soup was probably $5 or $6, and the dessert $6.95). Conclusion - new years eve menu here is a rip off! Try the special prix fix menus at other places in the city for NYE
*Dessert selection was unimpressive - we had the panna cotta and tiramisu and were not wowed by either
*Eggplant parmiggana (two thinly sliced eggplant pieces with what tasted like canned tomato sauce) as a main course? It was a disappointment
*Was not impressed by the wine selection - we ordered the most expensive chardonnay they had and were disappointed
*Not good for groups larger than four (small restaurant) 

Bottom line, in all I was not impressed by the prix fix options and was expecting a lot more.  Luckily I had the perfect date to save the night but we won't be returning here - San Francisco has too many excellent italian places to settle on Bella Trattoria
author: H T.

description:
The ambience was cozy and quaint.  The waiting area was minimal.  The bar made the people waiting there, face the patrons  eating in the restraunt.  A bit uncomforable for both parties (waiting and eating)

The staff were friendly and knowledgeable.

We had a party of 6 for Mother's Day, and the restraunt seemed busy,

The food was a bit on the Salty side.  The gnocci and oso Bucco were our favorites.  The desserts were good as well
author: Satoko B.

description:
ok.. I know these people well.. and love them dearly!  Of course they would get 5 stars.  The food is amazing!  Dave always tries to make everyone happy.  Morgan is the best DJ in the city but that's a whole other post and he would get 5 stars too!  WINE GREAT!  FOOD GREAT!  LOCATION FUN! OVERALL FANTASTIC!  Again, it's not cause they're my friends - cause if they sucked I would tell them.  They don't!!!  :)
xoxo guys - see you soon!
author: Jodi B.

description:
Dining here was excellent. I had tried to book a table for 14 on Open Table but I was informed that it was not allowed so I ended up booking two parties of 9 and 5. However, a few hours prior to our arrival at the restaurant, a woman called and asked if we were a party of 14 and not two separate groups. I confirmed that she was correct and she was totally fine with our giant group sitting together. Just for this I love Bella Trattoria. In addition, the wait staff was super friendly and tried to make conversation with us while remaining professional. Everyone seemed to enjoy their food and that's saying something because three of us are really picky eaters!

I recommend the gnocchi verdi. Spinach potato pillows were melting in my mouth! Three other of my friends also couldn't keep their forks off my plate.

Oh and desserts on the house? Amazing.
Love this restaurant and will be back again.
author: Elsie L.

description: I ate there last night. Great place, good location. Service was excellent. The food was very good. The portions where a bit smaller for my liking but my wife loved it. Highly recommend.
author: Chris H.

description: A gluten free Italian paradise, this place is worth the hike!  Incredible, authentic Italian dishes and a fun environment to go with it. David makes his guests feel so welcome and right at home (and they speak Italian!) For the gluten free/celiac diners, they offer gluten free pasta (try the carbonara, it's delicious and the house specialty) and can modify most other things on the menu to be gluten free. David has a close friend who must follow a gluten free diet, so he is very attentive and knowledgeable about it. Tell him Aet sent you :)
author: Andrea V.

description: Me and my husband celebrated our wedding anniversary here. The food was simply amazing! We had the meatballs as an appetizer. My husband had the salmon pasta with caviar and I had the osso bucco ( this is my favorite Italian dish!) for dessert, we shared a vanilla affogato-so good!  To end the night, one of the waiters gave us compiimentary moscato to cheer our anniversary! Now that's customer service! We will definitely be back to this wonderful restaurant especially since we live 2 blocks away :)
author: Agnella Y.

description:
Bella Trattoria has the feel (to me) of a Tuscan Inn.  The room has a high ceiling, well spaced tables, a cool yellow tone.  The young ladies who serve are well-meaning, a bit too familiar perhaps, but nice none-the-less.  

The food not so much.

 Lobster ricotta ravioli comes as four discs covered by a sauce that is cool at the perimeter of the plate and only slightly warmed by the ravioli in the center of the plate.  The ravioli are al dente but the taste of either lobster or ricotta is nowhere to be found.    

A baked veal cutlet comes is topped with fontina cheese and what the menu describes as a porcini mushroom sugo.  The so-called sugo atop the  veal is actually a glop of a sauce, some tasteless mushrooms within it, that completely overwhelms the veal.  

Everything about the food seemed amateurish.
author: David D.

description:
This place is absolutely amazing. Very traditional Italian food at its best.

Went there with my dad by accident. We were looking to Bella pizza, but with his broken foot we weren't going anywhere else. The waiter was very nice and accommodating for my dad.

The food was delicious. We got the eggplant parm for an appetizer, i got the gorgonzola gnocchi, my dad got the carbonara. All the food was cooked in house and was so amazing. Nothing was too heavy or too light. The gorgonzola sauce was the most delicious thing i have ever tasted. even after eating all of that we still had room for dessert because everything was just right. 

Even though its a little on the pricey side, it is totally worth it. I can't wait to go back there.
author: Casey Z.

description:
I would have never thought to come here for Italian food simply because it's located on Geary...I'd rather go to North Beach for Italian.  But to my surprise, this place wasn't bad at all.  Cute, small, intimate interior. We came right before the rush on a Friday night (a little after 6), and got seated quickly. The wait staff were all friendly, young and hip people.   

The bread is by far the best I've ever had; very, very soft and warm with a touch of sweetness to it. The olive oil dip with sun-dried tomato went well with the bread. I had the rigatoni pasta with Italian sausage in a red sauce and mascarpone cheese, which was enjoyable, but nothing too special.  I thought the portion was a good size, especially compared to my friend's Ravioli Di Pollo dish- homemade chicken ravioli in tomato & basil sauce.  I had a bite of the ravioli, which was interesting because it too had a sweetness to it.  Nonetheless, it was some good ravioli. 

Overall, good place to try once since I drive pass it all the time, but probably wouldn't be the first place that will come to mind if I'm ever craving Italian in the future.
author: Lisa C.

description:
I loved this place. The service is wonderful and everyone is super friendly and attentive. 

We were given an amuse bouche of bruschetta, which was very tasty and garlicky. 

I am a huge fan of butternut squash ravioli, so when I saw Bella made a homemade version, I knew I had to order this dish. And goodness, I am so glad I ordered it. The squash filling inside was very creamy and had the right amount of sweetness. The outside pasta tasted very fresh and al dente. All of my friends loved their pasta dishes as well.

For dessert I shared a zabaglione flavored with marsala wine. The consistency was a bit runny but tasted great! It was very creamy and smooth, without any taste of alcohol.

I normally don't venture out to Italian restaurants, but Bella Trattoria stood out for its homemade pasta dishes and wonderful service. The inside environment is elegant and not snobby, and I enjoyed my visit there. I would definitely go back!
author: Jessica L.

description: We went here for dinner with out of town guests. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. It's a great place to eat family style. We had the Rigatoni with Italian Sausage, the Pork Ragout and Linguini, the Carbonara and the Spinach Salad. I recommend trying them all. The flavors were fantastic! Our only complaint was the portions could have been a little bigger. Lastly, it's a kid friendly, but still upscale atmosphere.
author: Greg C.

description:
I hate putting three stars, because the food and atmosphere is truly 5-star quality. But the service the last time we went was just abominable - sufficiently so I got my lazy bum on yelp to review it.

We showed up 5 minutes before our reservation, and were told that there were no free tables, and that they were waiting on a few couples that hadn't left yet. Ok, that happens, no big. They tell us to go back and wait at the bar, maybe grab drinks.

We waited there ten minutes trying to flag down SOMEONE to take a drink order. Eventually we ordered white sangria (which I'll admit, as usual, was top notch and delicious). It was almost 25 minutes total before we saw a chair, and right as we sat down they asked us to get up again and MOVED us to a different table next to the window, which was substantially colder. 

Insult to injury, we were informed by our waitress 20 minutes later that there was a slip-up in the kitchen, and our appetizers were only now being submitted.

Given the bill for a romantic dinner for two, with drinks, can run around $80 there, I was a little shocked that not even one drink or app was comped after all the run-around and inconvenience. We didn't even make our movie.
author: Caitlin W.

description: Best Lasagna I've ever had. It was on the special menu that night.  Amazing.  Great service.  Cozy and elegant place.  Wish I lived near here!
author: Robyn W.

description: amazing!  Its a small place, but very good food.  The servers are very friendly, and all the food is quality!  Best tomato soup i've ever had, the bruschetta is amazing, and my personal favorite, the gorganzola gnochii!  The desserts are amazing too!  For the price you can't get better!
author: Rebecca W.

description:
Everything was great, but there was just no wow factor here.  I tried the 3 type of pastas and they were each pretty good.  But really, I've had better pasta.  The waiter was the only person working the restaurant and I give him props b/c he was also the bartender and server and even bread person when we asked for it.  That's why the service felt like it was lacking.  It took awhile for our server to welcome us.  We asked the bus boy if we could order wine and he said our server would be there, but it took awhile.  so we were just sitting there eating bread.  

I guess this place would be much better if you came in here on a slower day.  BTW, the vanilla cream puffs were pretty good as well.  The risotto was a bit overly salty.
author: AhLin C.

description:
This place was amazing! We had a couple glasses of some Pinot Grigio mixed drink which tasted amazing. My girlfriend and I split a plate of brussel sprouts and seasoned with olive oil and Bruschetta which tasted sooo good. The main courses included the Cotoletta Napoletana which was breaded pork, mozzarella, and a tomato base of sometype...translation...yum. My girlfriend had a pasta with chicken dish a light cream sauce that truely made her night. In between these amazing dishes, our server was kind enough to offer a taste of some amazing fried Polenta...even after we were done with our meal and refused to over stuff our stomachs with dessert...out comes our server with a little taste of this mystery dessert. I can only describe it as a flan texture with a heavier influence of cream or perhaps a whipping cream of some type.
The atmosphere was very quiet, however that was probably because it was a Monday night. Nice spacious seating inside and great decour throughout. Service/Food/Atmosphere= 5 stars with no hesitation. Thank you Bella for an amazing evening.
author: Chris M.

description: Love their pasta dishes and the prices!  Great place to go to if you are craving Italian food.
author: Francine T.

description: Just had lunch there, i came in a little late. Great service, and awesome food!
author: Abner P.

description: Wow! What an unexpected gem. Everyone was incredibly friendly and the prices were very reasonable for such great food. Make sure you get the polenta and then panacotta  for dessert- yum! I will defenitely go back.
author: Adrienne C.

description: This place is amazing and the Owner and staff are so attentive,caring and hospitable,This is definitely going to be a regular place for me to go!!!!
author: Di E.

description: Wow! My dining experience here was wonderful. I started off the evening with a glass of sangria. We received a small sample of their baked polenta.  For my entree I chose the special pasta of the night Linguini with slow cooked pork ragu. The flavors of this dish were mouthwatering. I also had the panna cotta with mascarpone and fresh strawberries. So smooth and creamy. Overall, an A+ rating. I was very please with the friendly service and smiles.
author: Lisa C.

description: So excited to have some good restaurants here in the Inner Richmond.  Definitely a great addition.  Have eaten here several times and, not once, have I been disappointed.  Great pastas and desserts!  Love the panna cotta and zabaione!  Great atmosphere and the staff was very friendly.  They even gave us a complimentary antipasti, fried Polenta.  The baked polenta with mushrooms and gorgonzola is also fantastic!
author: Greyson Z.

description: Had a group of 9 there on Saturday and the service, food and ambiance were all great. Found it here on yelp and was not disappointed. Just make sure that you have a reservation if you have a larger party and give yourself lots of time to find parking. Can't say enough good things about this place the staff was great and very attentive to our needs, food tasted wonderful and the wine selection was good too. We will be back there very soon :)
author: Tori M.

description: Great food and ambiance.  I've had both the ostrich and beef carpaccio in the past, both are great.  Their brussel sprouts appetizer is amazing, a heaping pile of steaming, delicious sprouts seasoned with pancetta and lemon zest (it will make you rethink the mini-cabbages).  I had the trout and the squid ink linguini; my friend who is a seafood lover enjoyed both.  All in all, the service is excellent, the ambiance is great, and the food is wonderful.  Plus, they have free corkage nights during the week.
author: Michael L.

description:
I'm not a fan.  Just came back with my wife since she was craving ravioli, quick to jump on Yelp we found this place.
  
1.  We ordered kalmata olives, which were right out of a can.  I've never been an italian trattoria where they serve pitted canned olives still drenched in the brine.  No balance at all and mushy.
2.  My wife's butternut ravioli was way to sweet and tasting the texture, it was canned butternut mash!  We've had this dish at probably two dozen italian restaurants over the years.  This was the worst.  
3. I ordered the three pasta dish plate.  The spinach ravioli was fine, but the penne with vodka/pink sauce had the consistency of mac/cheese but runny.  Not good at all!  The gnocchi was good, but I can't stand the canned sauce tomato sago sauce!

I'm not quick to knock on a place, service was decent but the food was really bad.
author: Sheetal S.

description:
holy crappola. this place is amazing. absolutely amazing. the prices are good, the service is fantastic, and the food is to die for. 

DO EAT: meatballs, bruschetta, rigatoni, pork cutlet, tiramisu,... and everything else. 

I'm absolutely dreaming about this place - had a birthday dinner here and the staff was so nice, the food was plentiful and the prices were more than reasonable. I will definitely be back... on a weekly basis. 

you also can easily walk in - no reservations, and there will likely be a table available. when can you find such great food at such a great price without a wait!?
author: linda t.

description: The pasta was good and the bread was great, we didn't have to wait for service that long and when the food came to the table it was very hot and delicious we will be back soon.
author: Fuji F.

description: I went there this last weekend on saturday night, the place wasn't overly crowded for such a small place. The service was great and everyone was nice, the only reason I'm rating so low is because they dont give you enough food for the price you pay. The food was great dont get me wrong, its just for an italian place they leave you almost still hungry when you leave. I don't think i'll come back just for that reason
author: Jillian W.

description: So delicious! I had the carbonara...made without cream or butter and my mom had the baked rigatoni with chicken and really good mushrooms. Plus appetizer and dessert on the house! Super cute corner location too
author: Gigi S.

description: I managed to get back for a second time, and my five stars still stand. Greatest desserts ever, perfect lasagna, excellent carbonara. The parking near here SUCKS the most ever, but it's worth the fight.
author: Sarah S.

description: The service was impeccable! The food, fantastic! We especially loved the butternut squash ravioli and the sausage gnocchi - these are don't miss dishes! If you find the room don't forget the panacotta - it is to die for! We really enjoyed the manager and his delightful company!
author: Robin C.

description: Came here with my boyfriend and it was great! They sat us right away, and our server was super friendly. I had the oricchiette and loved it. Only downsides were the limited winelist and the gnocci was a little too soft-- but the dessert was incredible. Best tiramisu of my life. And the coffee was surprisingly good, even better than blue bottle or four barrel. Would highly recommend to everyone.
author: Sara J.

description: Went here on a date on a Saturday.  The place was small and intimate, and not overly packed with people.  The food was DELICIOUS (I highly recommend the Pasta Trio), the service was great, and the prices were very reasonable.  I highly recommend Bella Trattoria for any date or  family dinner.
author: Janice W.

description:
Great friendy service and the staff are loads of fun. I like to go here for an early mellow dinner. 

It does have a special place in my heart since we had our wedding rehearsal dinner here. We had the whole restaurant,a specialized menu and they allowed us to bring in as much wine as we wanted with no corkage fee- SCORE!

We set-up a screen for a slideshow and all the staff felt like they were part of the party yet still very professional. Great times.
author: Adrienne P.

description:
I had a lovely experience here.  Excellent service, delicious food.  When they delivered one wrong order, they apologized, fixed it, and then topped off both of our wine glasses.  They also gave us a free desert.  

Butternut squash ravioli with butter sage sauce...divine.
author: Amy H.

description:
I visited Bella Trattoria last night for the first time and must say that the quality of the food was excellent. My friends and I shared the pasta carbonara (daily special), gnocchi with a gorgonzola sauce,  and the veal cutlet with mushrooms and fontina cheese. Yum! Yum! Yum!

For dessert, we had the panna cotte. Rich, creamy and delightful. 

The service was fairly good. We had to wait a few minutes for a table to be available. One of the servers brought over some great bread and olive oil to help us pass the time. This place is a great neighborhood restaurant.
author: Arne B.

description:
My fiance and I visited Bella Trattoria with some friends on a Saturday night, and we were thoroughly impressed.  The restaurant has a cozy, authentic Italian feel which made me forget that it is located on busy Geary Boulevard.

The food is delicious and very reasonably priced.  I ordered the Linguine Nere, a distinctive "dark" linguine dish that gets it color from squid ink.  The pasta was accompanied with an array of different seafood, include a bunch of mussels and some shrimp as well.  The portion size was not as large as you'd get in a more "american-style" italian restaurant, but I found that it was just the right amount of food to feel full, but not stuffed.

Both of our servers were very friendly and helpful, and they went out of their way to make us comfortable.  All in all, it was a very nice italian dining experience.
author: Tim N.

description:
I'm in love! As soon as I walked into the restaurant, it felt like I entered Italy (which was totally bizarre since we were facing Geary Blvd). Such a quaint and well-decorated establishment. 

For dinner, warm and exquisite bread is served with this excellent sun dried tomato olive oil! I've been trying to find something similar, but no luck. My bf and I ordered the gnocchi and rigatoni, both were made al dente (perfection!). I enjoyed every single bite. We were also gutsy enough to go for dessert. The pistachio flavored gelato was absolutely AMAZING and my bf loved the Nutella crepes.

I'm usually pretty skeptical when dining at Italian restaurants, but this was a winner. I'll be back Bella!
author: Anne K.

description: Great ambience, lovely decor, looks promising... but wow, waitress/hostess ignored me and my date in being seated. It was a Tuesday night at 630pm and there were five empty tables. We didn't have a reservation, but we were made to wait for 15mins and we finally just left feeling unwanted. First impression will always be the last impression.
author: Ryan C.

description:
This is my neighborhood Italian trattoria, but I think I'd still go every so often even if it was not only a block away.  We enjoy going a few times a year and will be back.

We celebrated my wife's birthday the other night and had a good time.  The staff was very accommodating to our party of 15 with 2 infants.  We ordered the food for our party using their family style menu that they give you suggestions on.  We went for 3 appetizers, 2 pastas, a meat dish and dessert sampler, for $30 a person before drinks, tax or tip.  

The portions are a bit small for each person, we got a plate to share between 4-5 adults which after you divide it up are pretty tiny portions, but by the end of the night, I think most people had enough, but I'm sure big eaters would have left a little hungry.  I think they realized this afterwards and and only charged us for 14 instead of the 15 adults we had.

 I thought all the food was good.  The bruschetta was good, with really ripe tomatoes, fresh mozzarella on top of a garlicky crostini.  I like the really tender gnocchi, but some of our guests thought they were too soft.  The inguini carbonara was good, as was the pork cutlet.  I liked almost all of the dishes, butt most of their food tends to be on the salty side.  I could do with a little less salt in almost all of the dishes.  The desserts are good.  I like the panna cotta best which really cleanses the palate.

Service was great.  Marco took care of us from start to finish.  Water glasses were always full and plates were cleared very promptly.  Atmosphere is very nice.  Our larger group, might have made dinner for the other guests a little less than romantic, so I hope we didn't get the management in trouble.

Overall, we were pleased with our experience.  The only knock, is that we can't help but feel like we could have gotten more food if we had ordered ala carte.  Usually when it's just my wife and I for dinner, we spend about $50-70 and are quite full.
author: Curtis C.

description: Really friendly staff.  Very good food.  Cozy place.
author: Mike S.

description: The polenta appetizer with portobellos, pasta trio, and squid ink linguine are knockouts. Based on other reviews, you'll probably get a little something free if you're in a group. We got fried polenta. Everything seemed a little over salted, but the flavors were definitely authentic. The space is intimate and the prices are typical of Italian. You'll have a good experience.
author: James P.

description:
I started going to Bella about 2-3 years ago when we moved to the area.   We really enjoyed our first couple of meals there.  Then, since about 1-2 years ago,no matter how empty the restaurant is, when you walk in,  they *always* make you sit on their couch to wait.   My guess is that their kitchen is tiny and can deal with a couple of tables at a time, so they want to stack their orders.  That really irks me, the way I look at it is, if you're going to have a restaurant that has, say, 15 tables, then be sure you can staff to serve 15 tables should everyone decide to show up at once.  As usual, tonight, they made us sit down to wait even though there were literally 3-4 empty tables there.

The food has slipped in quality in the past year.  Had squid-ink pasta tonight, the pasta was doughy and a little soggy, the sauce was heavy, oily and salty.  It was supposed to be seafood, but it was almost 100% clams and mussels, maybe 2 shrimps, and that's it.

The service was slow, but polite, but honestly, with so many restaurants in the city, and tons of great Italian restaurants in North Beach, I think I'll drive 10 more minutes to get there.
author: Frank S.

description: Holy crap. How had I not tried this place before? The pasta is divine. The service is perfect. We had a miscommunication and they let us keep the dish that came out wrong. It too was excellent. I can't remember the last time I ate out and every dish and appetizer (4 people) was truly excellent.
