I'd highly recommend, except it is still relatively easy to get a reservation here and actually, I'd rather you stay away.
author: Megan M.

description:
3 stars - decent food, accomodating for groups even though it's not that large of a place, nice decor.

1 star extra - good service, really nice manager/owner (?), great wine recommendations.  Really great tasting wine.  I'm not a wine person, so there have been 4-5 wines that I really liked, and this was one.  Although I'm not a wine person, I've had really expensive/nice wines at nice places courtesy of work.  The italian wine that he recommended was wonderful!
author: Minah L.

description: I'll go there again.  Food was good and the place looked nice.  We went with a large group of people (with a reservation) and accommodated us really well.
author: Sally R.

description:
We had a reservation for 8:00 and were running a little late so we called them and said we'd be about 20 minutes late and they said that was fine. When we arrived, we had to wait about 30+ minutes for a table to open up. wtf. mad. 
And all they offered us was water and olives. 
Their bread is not warm and probably from safeway.
Their pasta was not that great - nothing too out of the ordinary. I had the lobster ravioli which was OK - the only redeeming quality of it was the sauce. By that time I was so hungry, I used all the bread they gave us and sopped up all the sauce. 
I think the best thing our party got was the lasagna. It was quite tasty! The gnocci was ok as well - but I don't know, maybe i'm not that big of a fan of gnocci in generally, but it just didn't do it for me. 
The atmosphere is very 'romantic' - dimly lit. I came with a large party of non-romantic friends - perhaps this is why we didn't appreciate it as much!
author: Tim B.

description: While visiting SF and staying in the inner Richmond neighborhood I read about Bella and wanted to give it a try.  This is a neighborhood gem!  The staff was very attentive and very nice.  We all enjoyed our appetizers and dinner.  The Sangiovese wine pairing with dinner was perfect.
author: Joanne H.

description:
Thanks to my friend (who really is quite the knowledgeable foodie around SF), I was introduced to this quaint, cute restaurant. I never thought I could be such a big fan of pasta  until I went to SPQR and to Bella - both are great, but different in style both in their dishes and in the atmosphere. Bella's struck me as being more home-style, more exquisite, and definitely a much more relaxed, quiet environment. For appetizer, we had the grilled bruschetta with spring tomatoes and mozarella on top - absolutely fantastic. At first we didn't think we'd get that dish, but as soon as we saw another waiter bring it past us to another table, the decision was simply point and done. That's how good it looked, and we did not regret our choice. For entree, I had the pasta trio (ravioli, rigatoni, and gnocchi i think). It's a bit on the creamy side, but definitely an excellent pasta dish. I highly recommend you try it when you visit. 

Overall, great restaurant in the Richmond area to go with a friend or a significant other. Our waitress was very nice and attentive (and attractive) as well. I never got her name, but maybe it's just another incentive to go back! :)
author: Kevin T.

description: I should have given this restaurant just one star but I gave one extra because of one nice waiter there.  Our waiter was HORRIBLE.  He sat us down and gave us the menu.  Walked away and didn't come back for a long time to get our order.  Two couples came in and sat next to us.  They got their food way before us even though our order went in before the waiter took their order.  Even my 22 year-old could tell that our waiter was ignoring us,   Another waiter noticed our annoyance, he came by to give us more bread and water and tried to explain the kitchen was taking a little bit more time to prepare our food.  We didn't even order anything special, just pasta.  We were there celebrating my child's 22nd birthday.  She didn't even want to order dessert afterward.  We couldn't wait to get out of there.  The pasta was just ok - nothing out of ordinary.  The nice waiter gave us a free dessert at the end.  I am giving one extra star just because of him.  How sad!!!
author: A Y.

description: Went there late on a Saturday night. After a ridiculously long search for a parking space, we were treated to a wonderful meal in a surprisingly calm (perhaps, due us arriving late) yet romantic environment. Staff was patient yet attentive and the food was incredible. First, I'd kill for the Carbonara. Fresh, and flavorful. My friend had the Pasta a' Norcina. Perfectly prepared, hearty and rich. Can't say enough about how simply delicious the food was. It actually made everyone think I knew what I was doing in picking the place!
author: Ralph G.

description: A+++++, would Bella Trattoria again.  Everything I tried was great, but this place gave me a new respect (see also: obsession) for carbonara.  Get that.
author: John D.

description:
I really wanted to like this place. The ambiance was adorable, and it was warm and cozy inside. I live near Bella, and I was excited to have a potential favorite Italian spot in my neighborhood. To my disappointment though, I was not impressed with Bella's food.
The menu is rather small, which is fine in normal circumstances. When I ordered the Lobster Ravioli, our server said "oh, we ran out of that." Then, when my fiance ordered the Lasagne, she said "oh, we're out of that too." Mind you, our reservation was at 7:30 pm on a Saturday... 
I ended up ordering the butternut squash ravioli, and it was decent. It was really sweet and buttery, and only had 5 raviolis on the plate. It was almost cold when they brought it out to me. My fiance ordered the pork cutlet, which came on a plate by itself (no pasta, no salad, etc) and was overwhelmingly greasy. We came with 2 other couples, and nobody seemed impressed with their dish. 

I'm giving this place 2 stars because of the ambiance (really cute) but I won't be going back for the food.
author: megan s.

description: My second dinner at Bella Trattoria was poor.   The warmed baguette was stale and.   the bread and dipping oil with dried tomatoes was nearly tasteless.  I ordered a fennel salad with oranges (with no orange flavor) segments and no fennel!   While the cream sauce was decent, the gnocchi were grainy and soggy and also tasteless.   I got indigestion that night.   Interesting note is that last year when I ate the 4 star meal there, it was a by French chef and French staff at this restaurant.   There is all new staff now and while the new waiters are good, I miss the prior, better quality food.
author: Perry S.

description:
I wanted to take my boyfriend somewhere romantic for his birthday, but on a budget. I yelped "affordable, romantic" and Bella came up. I made a reservation with ease, and when I needed to change the time because we ran late, they were completely accommodating and reassuring that we would get a table.

From the minute we got there, we felt like pampered guests. They put us at  a window table, brought us a complimentary bruccetta, gave us the thumbs up when we ordered our beer in bottles (rather than glasses), and were just generally gracious and easy-going. Later, the waitress brought us a complimentary dessert - and we hadn't even told her it was my boyfriend's birthday! I think she just liked us (must have been the beer). I got the Spaghetti Tonno and Olive - delicious. My boyfriend ordered the gnocci and loved it. He was very happy with the evening overall. We even made it home in time for the "Creepy KOFY Movie Show." Couldn't have been a better night.

Anyway, if you want to impress your sweetie with some pampering and not break the bank, dinner here will put stars in your lover's eyes, and it's a good excuse to put on a snazzy outfit and go out. An excellent meal that is affordable with very romantic atmosphere, I think you'd do well to eat here. They make you feel like they appreciate your patronage.  I am looking forward to going back.
author: Caliope S.

description: The ONLY reason I didn't give this place five stars is that too many times I've driven all the way out there to find that they're closed...sometimes even when there is no message on the machine. In the future, I'll always call and talk with a live person before going there. That said, I will be back. The food is outstanding. The owner is very friendly. Just call first.
author: Jeffrey H.

description: Good place to go and eat tasty, authentic, homemade pasta. They also have a few fish and beef dishes. Portions are sufficient to leave you full without being stuffed. the ambiance is quaint and unpretentious. Good place to go on a low key date or with friends to unwind.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating so that is a plus! The only thing I would say is that as in many places in SF parking is at a premium so keep your eyes open for a spot.
author: mary s.

description:
its a veryyy cute as everyone said "date place". but i came here for my friend's 21st, a girls night thing. right on a corner and found parking quite easily. 

the waiters were very nice, oh i loved the bread! so soft! ( i dont like sourdough, too hard). mm i got toe carbonara penne pasta thingy, it was EXTREMELY cheesy..X____X good but oh man....someone's gonna call me a fatty. my friend got the squid linguine thing, pretty good, total opposite of my cheesy and heavy meal, hers was light. also ordered sangria, tastes pretty good.

im not a fan of italian but eh. aroundd....25 for each person. we had our own cake, and they helped cut it in the back, no extra fees, andd they served it so evenly! LOL fruits and everything were evenly split. i think its worth a try.
author: Christine M.

description: I have been wanting to try this place after reading all the reviews. I was disappointed with the service.  It took the waiter quite awhile to get our orders and we hardly got our water refilled.  The food was ok and I've had better at other places.  The squid ink pasta with seafood was good but do not order the skirt steak. Ordered medium rare and got medium. The sauce did not taste good on the steak and it was bland. The potatoes and spinach that came with the steak had so much garlic that you can't taste anything else. Unfortunately I won't be back.
author: Mary L.

description: Best lasagna I have had in a long time.  Very nice service too.
author: Kevin W.

description: Oh Tilapia that I had 2 days ago ... I dream about the night you melt in my mouth with your white, juicy meat smothered in marinara sauce. You were worth every penny of 19.95 plus tips. I can't wait until we meet again.
author: Enji L.

description: It is now my new favorite Italian restaurant. I made reservations for 730 but we arrived early so they had us sit in a lounge area with a couple of comfortable leather sofas. A few minuets later we were seated; early mind you. The hostess was great very attentive and kept an eye on what the table needed. The waiter was also at the top of his game. He recommended a excellent wine the perfect compliment to dinner. I ordered the lobster ravioli which was excellent, it just melted in your mouth. We had a great evening a perfect meal, great service and good friends. Living the life.
author: Josh E.

description: I always have a good time when we eat here. Good food and wine and we often end up striking up a cool conversation with the waiter. It's a laid back and get fed well kind of place.
author: Wren C.

description:
Keep telling myself I need to at least start writing reviews of places in the neighborhood - maybe here's a start.

After three years of living nearby, finally headed in last Saturday night. For some reason I don't usually think of going out for Italian food. It's refreshing to be able to walk in to a nice restaurant on Saturday night at 8 PM without a reservation. It was full once we sat down, but not loud or crowded.

Carbonara - Great. Rich but not too heavy.
Gnocchi - Very good, my girlfriend only said that the mozzarella on top could have been a little better. Our server said the gnocchi was pillowy, and she was right. Super soft, pretty unique and I really liked the texture though I guess I could see some people preferring more chewy gnocchi.
Panna Cotta - very good

Service was also great. Definitely enjoyed this place and I do think it competes for one of the better Italian restaurants in the city. Will be back - sooner this time :)
author: frontpack e.

description: I have held a private engagement party here that was simply amazing. The food was delicious, the service was outstanding and the atmosphere was perfect. Everyone had an excellent time. I also came here for dinner with a friend recently. The service was upbeat, attentive but not suffocating and the food again, delicious. My friend commented that the Carbonara tasted exactly like when she had it Northern Italy and my Gnocchi was so good it melted in my mouth. Our Pinot Grigio was very tasty and reasonably priced for the bottle. A definite must dine at.
author: Heather G.

description: Ask for Dave as he had good jokes & great stories!  Eggplant parm was a slam dunk app, really got the appetite rollin.  As far as entrees we got the pasta & sausige as well as the pork cutlet - both were excelente!  Organic wine was stamped with a seal of approval!  Love this joint!
author: Duke H.

description: Really quaint little neighborhood spot. The pasta was very delicious and fresh. Loved the entire dessert selection.
author: Amber M.

description: We revisited an old favorite that we havent been to in prob 6 years.  The food was not only more than reasonably priced they also have a happy hour offering 3 beers and 5 glasses of wine.  The food was great and they also offer Gluten free menu options.  My wife has celiac and she loved the food..   we highly recommend a visit
author: kevin t.

description:
Last night was the second time I've dined at Bella Trattoria--the first time was for my wedding rehearsal dinner!  We made a reservation at Open Table but when we arrived we realized that there was plenty of seating available--I love when I don't have to wait hours for a table.  I can't say enough how good the food is.  My husband and I started with soup--the minestrone was the perfect consistency while the tomato soup was on the sour side--the only disappointment of the night.  My main course was the Norcina--heavenly!  The Italian sausage had the perfect amount of seasoning and the pasta was divine.  My husband had the gnocchi with meatballs with tomato sauce--he almost passed out because the food was so good.  We ordered the panna cotta for dessert which was the best way we could have ended a perfect dinner.  When going over our bill, we noticed that the panna cotta was on the house!  

Of note, Bella Trattoria was the perfect place to hold our rehearsal dinner for 25 people.  The service was prompt and friendly, the atmosphere relaxed, and the food unparalleled!
author: Shirley J.

description: This place is terrific!  The owner is very friendly and inviting, the food is good quality Italian, not too heavy with the sauces.  The Gnocchi is wonderful, you can have them  with gorgonzola and mushroom sauce, or tomato and meat.  Along with pasta, they have good risotto.  And, every time we eat there, they give us a free dessert.  A really charming, small, pretty place.
author: Andrew L.

description:
So we consider this our favorite new neighborhood hidden gem - we've been a few times and each time, feel right at home with awesome and attentive service and amazing food!

The owner is hands on and his staff is all friendly and attentive but also laid back so the atmosphere is relaxed elegant. The bruschetta is delicious as is everything else and they have a great wine list. 

I almost don't want the secret to get out - it would be easy to miss Bella on Geary - the location is odd but once you are inside, you are transported to yummyness! We've eaten at MANY fine restaurants in the city but Bella is consistently delicious and a very good value as well - definitely try it - you won't be sorry!
author: Kimberley Y.

description: the service is awesome! the food is amazing! the house gnocchi is to die for!! its like savory marshmallows.. puffy puffs soo good.. great for date nights .. the entrance is kinda weird cuz i banged my knee when i was walking in (not good for 6 foot guys i guess) but nevertheless the food was amazing!!! i would give 6 stars if i could!
author: Akiliano T.

description:
Overall, a great place for solid, traditional Italian food in a romantic setting away from the cheesiness in North Beach.

Food: Bella has great traditional Italian food.  You will not find anything fancy, just straight forward Italian that you will enjoy.  My favorite is their Pansotti (large ravioli's).  Bella also serves a great three variety pasta dish so you can try a few different things.  The wine is decently priced and the tiramisu is good finisher.

Service:  I have always had great service from the folks at Bella.

Location:  It is not located in North Beach, however, I find this place benefits from being away from all of the buzz because its location adds to its secluded-ness.  Note, that I do enjoy the feel of North Beach, but if you are looking for something w/o the noise this is your place.

Ambiance:  Bella is a bit small, but romantic.  It feels like your neighborhood Italian restaurant.  The tables are covered with white table cloths and one wall is painted with an Italian landscape.  The lighting also adds a romantic feel.

Price:  The prices are affordable and equals the food and experience.
author: Christian X.

description:
I went here for my Girlfriend's birthday. We'd just moved to San Francisco (from Palo Alto) and had been really busy. We hadn't time to plan a party or to make any sort of fancy arrangements. We just decided to head out onto the street (We live on Euclid) and see what the fates had in store for us. 

I had gotten my girlfriend a waterproof camera for her birthday, and wanted to find a restaurant that would cooperate with hiding the camera in a drink or something so she'd be surprised. I asked an older couple who happened to be walking down the same sidewalk as us if they could recommend a nice sit-down restaurant. As luck would have it,  
they recommend this place, and I'm so very glad they did.


This ended up being one of the better birthday dinners in recent memory.
All of the food was tremendous, especially this cheese ravioli thing they made... the sauce was where the magic came from, very heavy, but with enough bread (and they provided extra bread when we ordered it) it was just awesome. 

Then they did a great job with my special request (bringing the camera to the table in a glass of water), and seemed really delighted to be a part of my surprise birthday gift.

I really look back fondly on that night, and it's hard to imagine we could have found a better place if we'd had the luxury of time to find one.

Birthday: rescued.
Review: 5 stars.
author: rory l.

description:
Bella, I LOVE YOU. Please, don't change, don't expand, don't do anything except continue being awesome. You are a perfect restaurant.  

I've been in several times. Every time it's been fantastic in different ways.  I'm not going to get into all of them here, but Davide.. you are awesome. 

The last time I came in was, thus far, the BEST dining experience I had in San Francisco.  The service was incredibly personal and flawless, the food was to. die. for.  And we had personal wine pairing recommendations (that we happily took) that were absolutely perfect for each thing we had.

Food:
-House Bruschetta: Somehow these people got a hold of delicious tomatoes. In the winter.  Simple buffalo mozzarella, tomato, basil. Simple, but fantastic. Bread was wonderful.
-Ostrich carpaccio and venison carpaccio: BOTH killer. Venison edges ostrich in my personal book
-Eggplant Parm: Eggplant was light and not mushy, sauce delish, special famer's market pecorino.. delightful.
-Squid Ink Rissoto: BLACK with squid ink, but awesome. Had baby squids and mussels and clams.. so good.
-Brickoven roasted game hen with whipped potatoes and brussel sprouts: Oh. My. God.  The hen was intact, but completely deboned. So cool. Had a nice crisp exterior, super juicy interior. Whipped potato was simple and salty, a gorgeous compliment to the hen. And the brussel sprouts!!! Best I've ever had ever. Sauteed with pancetta and honey.. still had a little bite to them. 
-House carbonara: You have to be brave to put something like Carbonara on the menu. It's simple, rustic, and easy to eff up. This was sublime. Perfectly cooked pasta, perfectly dressed with egg sugo. MMMMMM.
-House Panna Cotta and Tiramisu: So good. Both desserts were light, delicious, and absolutely satisfying.

Mind you, reader, this dinner was a MONTH ago. The fact that I remember everything we ate, what it had in it, and how it was prepared is a testament to HOW GOOD IT WAS. 

Go. Go immediately. Preferably in a small group or date-type setting.
author: Clair B.

description: This place was great!  Very intimate little place, great food and great service!  Highly recommended!  We even brought 3 bottles of wine and had free corkage on a Sunday!
author: Prabal D.

description:
This restaurant was amazing! The food was scrumptious and the service was unbelievably tentative and delightful! My boyfriend and I went there for our one year anniversary and the staff treated us fantastically without even knowing we were celebrating a special event. It's a little pricey, but everything is absolutely delicious! 

Oh and!-- the music is new and trendy... gives a different spin to the classic Italian restaurant feel! completely fun!
author: Sarah B.

description:
Service: 3/5
Food: 2/5
Wait: 3/5
Price: $$$$
Presentation of food: 3/5
Presentation of restaurant: 3/5
Overall: 2/5

so...came here for Vday with the boyfriend, he yelped this place; we made reservations. came, ate, and was NOT IMPRESSED. the service was decent, the food was whack; for a set sharing menu price of $70!/per PERSON! ($140!!!) + tip & tax... i dont even wanna think about it. On their website it said that its $70/PER COUPLE; so when we arrived and see that the bottom of the menu claims 'PER PERSON' we were thinkin... alright; this shit better be off top good... i expected food to be waaaay better for that pricing! i dont think i will be EVER coming back here nor will i suggest it to n e one i know everrrr. sorry but for the rip off price; it could've been waaaay better. i could've spent that at GARY DANKO! the only thing on that damn menu was decent was the main course. steak & shrimp. i had to stuff myself with their side bread and oliveoil dip!!! cuz everything was so horrible. its like I COULD'VE MADE A BETTER MEAL (i dont cook!) AT HOME FOR WAAAAY CHEEEAPER AND WAYYY BETTER MEAL!! one word before i end this.... WHACK!
author: Eva H.

description: They have great service and great food. I especially enjoyed their Caesar salad. Though the salad was simple, the dressing was flavorful and balanced and there was plenty of Parmesan. I would definitely return to this small Italian place in the Inner Richmond. You don't have to go all the way to North Beach to enjoy some home-cooked Italian food!
author: Kelly T.

description: When I found Bella Tratorria online I was a little apprehensive about going. There were no pictures of the inside of the restaurant on Yelp, and when I looked at it on the Google street view, it was across the street from a Burger King. I'm so glad that I gave this place a chance; it's small, but very intimate and cozy. I went there with my boyfriend to celebrate our two year anniversary, and the candlelit dining experience was exactly the romantic atmosphere that I had been looking for. The food was delicious, I had Pasta Cu Salccicia and my boyfriend had a trio of pastas that he couldn't keep his fork away from. To top it all off after dinner, our server (an authentic Italian) gave us free desert! I love this place.
author: Rahel A.

description:
Went here last year for Valentines, and a few other times as well. The food is consistently good, the service nice, and the atmosphere charming. 
When I say the service is good I would like to emphasize this point. When we were made to wait for one of our courses, they came along with all sorts of snacks, and a free glass of the house wine. . .it may not seem like much, but their are not many places I have been to that have been so attentive and conscious of customer service.
As I said the food is good and the choice is too. The  house wine is tasty, and the prices are quite reasonable. For Valentines the place was quite packed and so space was lacking and it did feel a bit like I was on top of the couple next to me, but in general there is enough room to feel cozy but not cramped. This is a nice restaurant for a good multi course meal, and very good for dates!
author: Michelle C.

description:
Glorious.

Outside of the coked up Connecticut girl next to us who threw up all her food in the bathroom (seriously), this place was grand.

The cook came out and ordered our food and had a shot of grappa with my date and I, and let me tell you, it was just the best I've had in a while.  The Ravioli were amazing, the spumoni melted in your mouth and I've never been a polenta fan, but wowsers.  Definitely order the bruschetta too.

I now go every Sunday, seriously.
author: Jack H.

description: San Francisco is a great place for food everyone tells me, but I find it just okay.  This is trendy Italian well plated food. Just didn't have the charm  of good loud Italian grub. Sorry Bella.. Just eh okay , but feels pretentious- if you want to pay for that try Bella's. Be sure to make your reservation 2 days out.
author: Valerie B.

description:
Came here for some friends' (twins!) birthday dinner on Saturday night. The place is a tiny hole in the wall that manages to be quiet enough even when you're sitting right next to some other party. I have to say that overall this place has some great points and some really low points. I should probably preface this with the fact that I lived in northeastern Italy for 6 months during my college days, so I have a general idea of what things are supposed to taste like.

It took a while for our party to get here and the waitstaff was fine with that. They even brought us olive oil + tomatoes for us...but neglected to bring out bread with which to eat the oil with until 15 minutes after the last person in our party had arrived. I hadn't eaten all day so I was starving and the tiniest bit annoyed, but I let it pass because I wanted to have a good evening. 

Everyone else loved the bread but I didn't particularly enjoy it. It wasn't super crusty (which made it hard to dip properly) and the inside was light and squishy...but also super super dense. I dunno how to explain it, perhaps it was some sort of quick-bread recipe? At any rate it pretty much tasted like fresh baked wonder bread to me. 

We all pretty much got pastas and gnocchi cause a few of the people in our party were observing the weekly lenten meatless diet. As we ordered our entrees, the waiter asked if we wanted a salad with it...so without looking at the menu we said "sure" and all got one. Much to our surprise, they charged us for the salads on the bill. Okay okay maybe we shouldn't have been THAT surprised but it would have been nice for the waiter to remind us that there would be an extra charge...cause none of us thought the salad was worth NINE dollars. Just because the half-fistful of lettuce doesn't show signs of oxidation on it doesn't mean it should cost that much. I grew up in an agricultural community so I know how much lettuce costs and you can't say that the dressing and cheese were worth the remaining $8.50. That's right folks it was a plain caesar salad. Ugh. Anyways the salads weren't bad, just super pricey (I was thinking they'd be $6.)

I ordered the gnocchi al ragu because a)I always get the squash ravioli wherever I can find it in a fairly good Italian restaurant and b) even though I really wanted carbonara (in the authentic style, sans cream) I know how ridiculously easy it is to make and figured I will just have to go buy some pancetta and make my own next week. Plus, the gnocchi is made in-house. They can't be too bad...and I was right. Super soft and tasty! My friend's gnocchi al gorgonzola was even better, the sauce wasn't tooooo heavy like most places do it and it was spinach-infused gnocchi...yum. Others raved about their squash ravioli. I didn't hear too many comments (good or bad) about the linguini con polpetti (although, isn't it usually spaghetti with meatballs?) or the risotto.

Then it came time for dessert and because I had opted to have a sangria (pretty good at $7.50 per glass) I opted out of dessert even though I really really wanted a zabaione. Someone got an affogato and the birthday girls got a zabaione...and then the waiter brought us two free "tastes" of panna cotta which were more than enough for the remaining 4 of us to share!

Then the bill came and it took forever to figure out how much extra we needed to pay (since we were splitting the cost of the twins' dinner) cause the bill just listed "6 salads...53.70" and so on rather than individual prices. Combined with the shock of the realization that the salads were very costoso and that last part of our evening didn't go so great. I hope that the twins didn't feel bad for making us all have to whip out our credit cards for them cause we were all happy to do it...just annoyed at the lack of transparency with the waitstaff.

55 bucks later, I had paid for my dinner and roughly 1/3 of another person's meal plus tax and tip. The extra $10 meant I didn't have cash for cover at the lounge we headed to next!

Overall, if I wasn't paying for this meal and the bread was better, I'd love this place. It's closer to my house and easy to get to and the food is pretty good. But since I did have to pay for meals I can't say I love this place very much. Extra star for the panna cotta and not trying to kick us out even though it was well past closing. Even though it's more of a chain, if you want an elegant Italian dinner...I'll head to Il Fornaio, which remains my favorite "we're going out for a nice dinner" place (even if everyone else in the place has some grey hair).
author: Katies F.

description:
We really like this restaurant - tasty Italian food, very friendly attentive staff and a nice ambiance.  Plus they often bring out appetizers and/or dessert on the house.

The gnocchi verdi is amazing here - melts in your mouth and great flavor.  Also really like the Assagini Bella - the trio of ravioli, rigatoni & gnocchi - let's you sample a little of everything and it's all delicious!

Also love the no corkage on Monday-Wednesdays - great way to enjoy all the wine we have accumulated from trips to wine country.
author: N. J. K.

description: Come to Bella Tratoria if you want amazing homemade pasta....The desserts there are also fantastic.
author: Jonathan G.

description:
I haven't written too many reviews on places I love because I'm scared I won't be able to give them the credit they deserve but I can't contain my love any longer for Bella Trattoria. This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. I am constantly thinking about their amazing dishes. Not only do they try to use local and sustainable ingredients but it always tastes delicious and with care like it was made just for you. I love their ravioli, whether it is the lobster or spinach and ricotta. Each bite is tender and melts in your mouth perfect. Same goes for their gnocchi. I think someone said they were like little puffs of clouds, soft, flavorful, fantastic and always with the right amount of sauce that is both creamy and savory. Even when I am beyond full, I get sad that my meal at Bella is about to end. The penna cotta served with strawberries is the most wonderful way to end your dining experience here. 

Yes, I love Bella more than Edward.
author: Julia T.

description: Pleasing my diverse group of friends was easy at Bella. Everyone loved it.  Warm spinach salad and baked  polenta with mushrooms for starters,  delightful gnocchi , fresh crispy  troute, pasta with a light slightly creamy sauce with sausage, homemade raviolis, everything was lovely! Good for date night or for small groups. Very nice waiters. Charming owner.
author: Mary D.

description:
My Italian grandmother would be proud of the authenticity of this restaurant.  When I say authentic, I mean a contemplative, European experience.  Remember when we actually drank our wine, enjoyed our conversations and laughed the hours away?  This is the place to live those days again, or for the first time.  With all the hustle and bustle of our lives, why are we asking our restaurants to follow suit?  

The homemade gnocchi is lovely; the trout special is succulent; the game hen melts in your mouth.  

David, co-owner, will charm you all night -- especially if you are a pretty woman in stylish shoes (preferably high heeled).

This is a truly lovely establishment, a throwback to easier times, a place to sit back and really enjoy your food and drink.  Come with an easy attitude and you will not be disappointed.
author: Kristen H.

description:
I arrived at 7 on the nose for my reservation and the host refused to seat me until my friend (who was looking for parking) arrived. He asked me to have a seat at the bar, but since I don't drink and the small bar area was crowded already, I declined his offer. I stood at the door waiting to be seated, and finally by 7.30 he sat us. Apparently they had to move around some tables to make my reservation and one of 14 people work. I wasn't too happy about having to wait around for 30 minutes for a reservation I was supposed to have.

Once seated, it took the staff a little longer than I expected, to get some water. I was a little thirsty, so I was more eager for water than usual. The service after that was fine and the food arrived pretty quickly. The bread was good, but I tried to be good and only had one piece. 

Prices seemed fair enough.
author: Joelle G.

description: Hands down the best Italian I have had in SF to date.  The atmosphere is soothing - romantic and mellow, the waitstaff knowledgable and attentive, and my god - the food... the food is delicious!  This is definitely a hidden gem and I will be coming back:)
author: Karen K.

description: The service here sucked.  I came in a big group of 8 people.  They did not give us bread plates, did not refill waters, did not even bring grated cheese to the table which we watched happen everywhere else.  The pepper boy was totally HOT, but did he grace my plate with fresh pepper?  NO.  We ordered 2 bottles of wine, appetizers, entrees and desserts so you think the service would have been exceptional for such good patrons!  The food was just so so .  I disagree with a previous review about the gnocchi.  It sucked.  I could have bought better gnocchi frozen at Trader Joes.
author: Starla D.

description: This place has the best gnocchi in the city, and perhaps the best pasta - certainly the tastiest carbonara I've ever had, and perfectly cooked.  The bread is soft with a cakelike flavor; it's apparently controversial but we find it quite nice, especially dipped in their special peppery oil.  Great wine recommendations.  Reasonably priced, amazingly easy to get into early on a weekend night.  Service can be slightly spotty, but who cares?
author: Jeff W.

description: Probably my favorite Italian place in all of SF due to the great staff, food quality, ambiance, and price. To top things off, they gave us an appetizer and even a small dessert on the house. Although I no longer live in SF, I will make time for dinner here when I visit.
author: carter u.

description: If you can get past the bad bread they serve at the beginning of the meal - everything else is perfect.  The owner is friendly and chatty and likes to chat up the tables.  The ambiance is wonderful - dark and candle-lit.  The food is terrific - probably the best italian food I have ever had in the city and 1/2 the price of Poesia in Castro!
author: Jenn D.

description:
Went here on a date last night with my charming Canadian lad who's oh-so-handsome.  When in his hood...do as the Roman's do? Err...maybe not...but whatev, you get the point.  We arrived early and were offered seats at the bar where they had an attractive and entirely edible display of cherries.  Mmmm...cherries are good m'kay.  Then we were given water and glasses of the house wine which comes in a keg.  Note to self: try and get one of those bad boys for the DYL B2B event.  We were seated at our table that overlooked the street and our waiter was humorous enough to point out our sweeping view of the lake and hills aka the Burger King.  We started out with the antipasta sampler and at our waiter's suggestion stuck with the small instead of the large we originally ordered.  It was perfect for two people and I appreciated the candor and honesty of our server.  We ordered a bottle of the Montalcino Lindo and our server made some recommendations of menu items that would be complimentary to that particular wine.  I went with the Gnocchi with duck ragout and my handsome squire went with the steak with gorgonzola cream sauce.  Both of our plates were cleaned.  Dessert for me was the ricotta tarte that had fresh strawberries and was delicious and the dessert sitting across from me had a very generous piece of tiramisu that I tried and found really fresh.  We washed said desserts down with glasses of port that were topped off gratis.
I will definitely highly recommend this place due to the service alone which was personable, educated, and solicitous.  Seriously, some of the best service I've ever had.
Even more kudos for putting me in the mood for romance with Prince Charming.
author: Jill D.

description: This place is delicious. The two owners are brothers from Italy and they will walk you through the whole menu if need be. I have eaten here three times and I have never been disappointed. The pasta sampler is always delicious. It is normally quiet with only a few patrons at a time but I can believe with a full house it would be on the noisy side. It is a good restaurant for traditional Italian food.
author: Jessica K.

description:
Thank god the food was good. 
It must have been an off night for our server/possible owner? We were waiting outside for Bella to open. The owner/server jumps out of a cab, runs into the restaurant, opens the restaurant. Fine. Girlfriend/wife/? sits at the bar the whole time, odd. Maybe she was the distraction.
We ordered the mixed antipasti plate. Grilled eggplant, sun dried tomato's, mozzarella, zucchini. Very good. When we were deciding on which gnocci to order the server suggested the Gorgonzola,  we ordered the calamari gnocci,  the Gorgonzola gnocci was served to us.  Huh, okay. It was delicious, we were happy, wanted the calamari, but the gnocci were excellent. Not gummy or chewy, little pillows of love.
Then the dinners were served, steak over there, correct ,steak there, wrong, a plate of red sauce here, don't know what's hiding under it yet. Hmmm. Where's the seafood I ordered. The guy who brought out the plates could only say "no". Yes! No, is not the right answer. Yeah, go talk to the owner guy and find my fish please. We figured out the pork was hiding under the red sauce, that's what hubby ordered. So they took away the 2nd steak, owner comes over with the menu, this is what you ordered, no?  No! I don't have a great Italian accent, but the words were VERY different. He leaves, comes back, says the cook didn't understand him. Oh, that's nice. It must make for a lot of mistakes, I would imagine.
 So my dining partners start eating, and I sit waiting for my food. 
It was great. Three grilled shrimp, 2 kinds of fish, over spinach, and yummy roasted potato's.  Lot's of apologies. Thanks.
Had pistachio gelato, yummy. They were out of 2 of 4 after dinner drinks. 
The check comes. Nothing is comp'ed?  I didn't ask, just sort of assumed. I've been in customer service for 20 years, and my dining companions have about 50 years bartending exp. , Ummm,  a sorry is nice for one flub. A sorry for 2 flubs without a free esspresso, or something? Not so good.
At least the food was yummy.
author: C B.

description: The prices are reasonable in a small cozy atmosphere. The food is pretty good, and also they have a good wine list , too.The service were good. We went there without a reservation on a busy sat, we were waiting about 15-20' , not bad at all.
author: christy l.

description: This place has great service, great food, and an awesome wine selection. I had the butternut squash ravioli, my sister had the tomato sauce gnocci and my fiancee had the lasagna. The pasta was fresh and delicious. The service was prompt and friendly.
author: Emily C.

description:
i might be a bit biased(!), but having spent the summer in Italy, i feel qualified to say i found in Bella: 
* a pleasant, charming space 
* delightful wine offerings!
* starters: Tono Dell'alalonga - arugula & capers give it a clean, fresh flavor.
Crostini al Pomodora - with sun-dried tomatoes done right & truly fresh basil - delightful!
* seconds: Gnocci Pomodoro was melt-in-your-mouth creamy without being "mushy."  
Linguine Nere - shelfish provide a kiss of brine which compliments this pasta perfectly.
* dessert: Spumoni with kahlua(?) - yummy!
never been? go for a late lunch & throw yourself into David's very capable hands!!
author: Anna S.

description:
I'm so happy to have found this new (to me), affordable, and delicious Italian restaurant.
I had a friend visiting from out of town who wanted Italian food and I wanted a low-key setting after a crazy day of work.  I went on Opentable, and lo and behold, there was a 1000 point reservation here.  So, I booked it at the last minute and off we went.
Upon arrival, I was very impressed.  The decor is very nicely done, somewhat muted, and lends to feeling relaxed and at home.  We were immediately brought this very delicious bread with a yummy, crispy crust and olive oil with sundried tomatoes.  The waiter was friendly, funny, and helpful.  He suggested a great Syrah and we chouse the Heirloom Tomato Caprese salad as our appetizer.  Unfortunately, the tomatoes were a bit underripe and hard, but the mozzeralla was tasty.  The waiter came by to check on us and truly was interested in how the tomatoes tasted since they were a new arrival to the restaurant.  I informed him that they were a bit too hard, and he immediately brought us bruchetta on the house.  And, that, was excellent.
I had the gnocchi in a gorgonzola bechamel and my friend had the 3 pasta dinner.  The gnocchi was fluffy and light and, even though I finished a huge plate of it, I didnt feel like I had rocks in my stomach (as I have at other places).  My friend was very happy with his meal, as well.  Unfortunately, were were too full for dessert, but the menu looked incredible.  
The only drawback was that the service was a bit slow because there was only one waiter serving all the tables.  Despite the slowness, he was incredibly friendly and funny, so I can't really hold it against him.
I think this is an excellent neighborhood gem and I plan to return over and over again.
author: Jessica L.

description:
My friends and I came here for dinner on New Years Eve and when I first walked in, I was thinking the place would make a great date spot cuz its cozy and intimate.  

So our evening started pretty nicely (despite taking me 20 minutes to find parking).  We had decent sangria, and I really enjoyed the bread and dipping sauce.  We all ordered from the $60 prix fix menu--I enjoyed the ravioli appetizer and vegetable soup.  My main entree, the short ribs was very tender and delicious, and we all shared our desserts from the prix fix. . .but I was the only one in my group who enjoyed the meal.   My friends thought their osso buco was just so so not to mention one of them only had about 1/2 the amount of osso buco than my other friend. In all, we agreed that the $60 was waaaay overpriced. 

Another thing that was annoying was that the waiter must've thought my friend was flirting with him because he was extremely attentive to her- and kept thinking she was making sexual jokes with him when she really wasn't.  She was merely pointing out that her portion was much smaller than others who ordered the same thing.  AND at the end of the meal when she said she wanted to take the bones home (for her dog), she shouldn't have to ask twice for a box.  The waiter like, just stood there, smiling at her, "You want bones?" What a slimeball.
author: hsindy c.

description: The BF was sick so we stayed near the house. I really enjoy seafood dishes especially fish. I was a bit hesitant to order the talapia because after visiting Monterrey, I'm more careful with where my fish comes from. Luckily it came from the Pacific Coast which is good! We ordered a specialty drink that was suppose to be carbonated but it was flat. Wait staff took it back and made an attempt to fix it. It came back a little better. complimentary bruschetta, Talapia in tomato broth was delicious!
author: Tiff W.

description: A really great place overall; nice atmosphere, nice interior, very friendly and helpful servers (they gave my girlfriend and I a free appetizer and an amazing dessert!), and really really excellent food! Even the bread they serve is amazing and comes with delicious olive oil and sun dried tomatoes. All of their pastas are homemade and you can taste the difference. Very nice!
author: James W.

description:
ugh... this place...

considering it has an average rating of fours stars with approximately 450 reviews, a first-timer would think this is a safe bet.  "eek! methinks not" sums up my experience very well.

the old ball n' chain and i visited bella trattoria for a valentine's day dinner.  $75 prix fixe menu per person.  i'm expecting quite a lot for such a hefty price tag.  it failed in every sense... at least they got our reservation right.

our initial wait took quite a bit.  we didn't know who our server was. since it was our first time we took a little longer than usual with the drink menu and finally selected our drinks.  when did they come? after our amuse and our first course was finished.  why? they forgot. how did they finally figure it out?  i asked them where our drinks were.  was it worth the wait?  not really.

the food is mediocre.  our antipasti platter looked like it came from the safeway hors d'oeuvres bar!  not creative at all.  gnocchi was lifeless, browned sage ravioli was bland, and my girlfriend's vegetarian lasagna left so much more to be desired.  

my seafood stew was decent.  broth was flavorful, peas still had good give and taste, and the sole was tender yet firm at first-bite.  the mussels must have been old because they quickly disintegrated in my mouth.

the dessert platter was mediocre as well.  coconut ice cream, tiramisu overly-powdered with dark chocolate, and a custard flan with sliced strawberries.  flan was bouncy and just the right amount of flavor to mix with the strawberries.  fine, two enjoyable aspects of the evening.

one of my biggest pet-peeves is the check being dropped off without being asked.  we were "enjoying" dessert and conversing with one another when someone dropped off our check and speedily walked away.  i get the hint.  you want us out of here.

the restaurant was still at half-capacity and we were only there for an hour, but i took it as "we did our part, now pay us".  i reluctantly paid the $180 for the two prix fixes and two bar drinks plus 20% tip.  i didn't want to, but it's a given... unhappy or not.

yelpers - please think twice about visiting this restaurant.  poor service, boring food, completely overpriced.  it sucks.
author: mike l.

description: Great service  and the waiters were friendly.  For appetizer we had the Ostrich Carpaccio.  A little salty but good and we were surprised it was raw!  Yay for raw ostrich.  I had the Rack of Lamb and it was excellent!  My girlfriend had the Osso Bucco and it was Exquisite!  Definitely get these two dishes.  For the dessert they brought out the complimentary Panna Cotta - sweet and smooth, like flan.  For drinks I recommend the Rosso and Rosato, their Vermouth drinks.
author: Derek F.

description: Came here tonight with my husband to celebrate his belated bday (I had made reservations closer to his bday, but the restaurant  cancelled it due to maintenance of some sort). Arrived and was greeted promptly. Asked for a nice quiet table, which they did accommodate, but then a chatty woman sat next to our table ( not enough distance between our tables that you could tune her out).  Ambiance is dark, yet warm and intimate. Others who have reviewed about the wait time from ordering to service of each dish (app., entree, dessert) being too long are spot on. (granted it did get a little busy and there were only two servers and one busboy).  The complimentary bread was soft and chewy. Like others have commented... Would have been even more better if the bread was warm.  My husband and I shared the spinach salad which was only okay.  We also share the crostini appetizer-- excellent.  Very fresh and loved how the crostini was toasted and crusty on the outside but still soft in the inside.  For our entrees, my husband enjoyed his tagliorini with salmon and black caviar in a light bechamel sauce. I, too enjoyed my entree-- sorrentina--gnocchi with sausage and fresh mozzarella in a tomato sugo.  The desserts were only okay. We shared a dish of the chocolate gelato and the tiramisu. The gelato was ok. For the $8 it cost, I would gladly pay for a pint of the devishly chocolate gelato at Holy Gelato over on 9th Avenue and Judah in the Sunset.  The tiramisu was rather skimpy, especially for $8. I would have liked and expected a larger layer of mascarpone.  Overall, the meal was good. I would dine there again, but I wouldn't RUSH to go back.
author: Jenn T.

description:
delicious! the gnoochi literally melted in my mouth.

get ready for a long, relaxing and romantic dinner! we were there for at least 2 hours, enjoying bottle after bottle of delightful proseco. the wait staff was friendly and helpful in their suggestions.

i've already made a date to go again on my birthday and i can't wait!
author: Kate Y.

description: Hands down, it was THE single best lobster ravioli dish I've ever had. From the first bite of it, I could not stop singing its praises. I'm sure it annoyed my boyfriend.
author: Monica N.

description: Hit or miss.  The most amazing bruschetta anywhere, ceasars are not impressive, entres are pretty good but the service sucks, especially with a big group.
author: Jared F.

description: If you like prompt service, reasonably priced food that taste great, then this is the place for you.  I didn't understand a word the waiters were saying underneath their thick italian accents, but who cares, we were there for the food and the romantic decor. Definitely a great place to dine,  this place works whether  you want to come a bit dressy or come in your jeans.
author: Andrenaline R.

description: All I can say is Scrumptious! Yumm! If you love Italian food, this is deffinately a wonderful place to come!
author: Sheryl F.

description: Food, service and ambiance were all superb. My lobster ravioli was flavorful and rich, but prepared with a light hand so I didn't feel overly full afterward (as too often happens when chefs overload creamy sauces with too much butter). The warm spinach salad to start was equally good with well balanced flavors. The service was friendly, attentive and informative. I appreciated being offered tastes of the white wine by the glass, and being guided into the revelation that I do in fact like Pinot Grigio, if it's a good one!
author: Martha M.

description: Mixed feelings about this place.  Service seemed a little off in the beginning, but ended much nicer; could've been because we were a large group.  As for the food, I don't know a lot about gnocchi, but I tried it and it was good, but I actually liked the gnocchi appetizer at Frascati much, much better, BUT the pomodoro sauce was absolutely delish!  Had the zabaglione for dessert (marsala wine cream with seasonal berries = strawberries)--it was my fault for ordering it.  I always equate marsala wine with chicken...so--my dessert reminded me of chicken; not a good thing!  Others loved it, though.  Oh, one more thing--yummy bread!
author: Joyce L.

description: This place was excellent, with good service, great food, perfect advice on fair-priced wine, and a nice atmosphere.  I would definitely eat there again.  The restaurant is small and reasonably quiet, so conversation is easy.  It also has the advantage of being in a fun neighborhood.
author: Steve G.

description: Went there based on the Yelp reviews and the curb appeal.  Perhaps I was there on an off night..?  I found the service to be extremely slow to the point of, "I wonder if they forgot us", but in a place so small, how could they right?  Well then one of the dishes was cold and mushy and we had to send it back - that took about 15 extra minutes so by the time the one person got their dish, everyone was starting to finish up.  No real apologies either - it was as if they had better things to do  - go figure. Very sad performance.  If I go back (which is not likely), I'll update this review.
author: Scott B.

description: My boyfriend took me here for the first time few years ago and I immediately fell in love with this place! The ambiance is good, just like their food. Complimentary bruschetta and awesome panna cotta on the house most of the time we're here! The staff here really know their stuff well. My only complaint is that parking can be tough sometimes.
author: Tesa B.

description: Bummed. Ambience was quaint and nice, but food was lackluster. Especially for the price. And the food took a long long time to come out.
author: Matt H.

description:
bella is hands down my favorite italian place in the richmond (and there is definitely some competition, e.g., mescolanza, giorgios).  being 100% italian, i am easily and frequently irritated by bad italian food. but bella never disappoints.  every pasta i have had is delish. i especially recommend the assigini di bella, which comes with small portions of rigatoni, ravioli, AND gnocchi, each in a different sauce.  so amazing for those us of who want to try it all. i like the house red wine, but it's also really fun to bring your own wine on a monday, tuesday, or wednesday, and save money by taking advantage of their free corkage on those nights.  
also, while i am a vegetarian, my friends have all enjoyed the meat dishes they have ordered at bella.  the last time i was there, my bf got the carbonara, which i examined and was impressed with (while i don't eat it anymore, i remember it well from my childhood).  it looked just right, very creamy without grossly and american-ly containing actual cream (cream should NOT be an ingredient in carbonara, people), and reportedly tasted delicious. 
be warned, the service is often, though not always, slow, and it is somewhat expensive, but the ingredients are fresh and the pastas are made in-house every day.  if you go in expecting and accepting that your service may not be the world's quickest, you won't be disappointed with your experience. relax, bring a pleasant dinner companion or a good book, and enjoy the food- it's worth the (possible) wait.
author: Jessica C.

description: Still, one of the best Italian places in the city for incredible food and service.  My wine snob friends appreciated their wine list and the guy makes great recommendations to go with the meal. Hard to believe the how good the food is and yet, it's very affordable.
author: Y C.

description: I used to love coming here when I lived in the Richmond and now that I've moved back I'm looking forward to coming here often. I ate here again recently and was reminded what a warm and friendly atmosphere it was. And the food is delicious too! We complimented the waiter on how much we enjoyed the bread and he kindly brought us out a bruschetta appetizer on the house. So nice! I had the trio which is great because I'm one of those people who loves trying lots of different things, it comes with penne with tomato cream sauce, ravioli with cream sauce and gnocchi with tomato sauce. All are delicious. Also this place has zabaglione! One of my favorite desserts! The atmosphere is quiet, nice and not too pretentious. I highly recommend this place for a nice, reasonably priced night out.
author: Cathy T.

description: I have had four wonderful meals at Bella Trattoria over the last 6 months.  The staff is very friendly and helpfull with their wine and food knowledge.  It is advised to always make a reservation since the dining area is limited.  The service has always been prompt and the meals prepared as discribed.  Presentation if picture perfect.  Oh and the desserts are tops expecially the panna cotta.
author: GREG C.

description: They gave me a free appetizer, they poured a deep glass of wine, the butternut squash ravioli was top notch, and....I got a free dessert! great spot, sweet service, nice decor, Amazing food for a decent price. I'll be back for sure.
author: Summer C.

description: The food was great!  I loved the wine accent in my red sauce and the meat was seasoned well.  Not overpowering but flavorful.  The service was great and very personal.  They made my salad special because of my dislike for anchovies and the chef brought it out for approval and the dessert portions were just right.  Very rich but not huge slabs of sweet madness.  I enjoyed my time there and will bring back company to visit.  I hate huge busy eateries with salt and pepper food that is better from costco.  This is truly a cute little find.
author: Nikki W.

description:
so completely loved this place.

served attentively and thoroughly by two very nice servers --  one hailing apparently from somewhere near milan.  they talked us through the menu, told us about their specialties (gnocci!  yes!) and helped us pick out a good wine to go with our meal.

were brought warm tasty bread while we waited for our entrees accompanied by sun-dried tomatoes in oil.  (being hungry, we ate the bread quickly and they brought more bread and tomatoes without us even thinking to ask.)  we were also treated to free bruschetta appetizers on the house!  crunchy bread, tasty fresh tomatoes and topped again by the delicious sun-dried tomato oil.

my boy got the house made gnocci in a gorgonzola sauce for his main course.  he loved it.  i got an entree that offered me a taste of three different things: a small portion of penne topped in a pink sauce, house made spinach ravioli in a white sauce and house made gnocci al ragu.  the gnocci was especially impressive.  normally, when you think of gnocci, it's very heavy and dense while theirs was light, airy and you could actually eat more than 5 without feeling super full.  the spinach ravioli was also to die for -- the sauce was a milk-based one that wasn't heavy like you expect white/cream sauces to be.  lastly, the penne portion was a perfect pink sauce on regular penne noodles.  i made sure to save a gnocci with the pink sauce for my last spectacular bite! :)

dessert was also very pleasing to my taste buds -- plus, they threw in an extra dessert on the house!  

overall, a great hands down 5-star experience.

will definitely go back again!  so many more things on the menu i'd LOVE to try!
author: Lily B.

description:
Went there for a date on Tuesday, and was very impressed. The food was great, and they had a fun wine and beer selection. All Italian wines, so it will test those without knowledge of international wines (namely, those like myself). 

That said, the servers were very helpful, and funny without being obnoxious. We really enjoyed the appetizers and entrees. Only complaint was that my Arrabiatta ("angry pasta") was a little on the oily side, meaning there was a pool of oil on the plate. Nonetheless, it was very tasty.

Desserts were awesome. Save some room for the zaballone (spelling?).
author: Scott D.

description: You know...i've tried this place twice and damn. I really want to love this place. My sister has been there plenty of times within the 5 yrs and even she says it's just gone down. certain food were out-of-stock, i mean u'r a restaurant of business. how are you going to run out of food. reminder that im limited to food becoz im a pescatarian who has a limited palette to dairy. well i ended ordering the 3 different ravoli dish and end up with one kind of ravoli. totally lame. not going back. i dont want to think about this place, im done typing.
author: Janet W.

description: My Dad took me here for my birthday 5 years ago. It's the only time I've ever been there but it's still a shining culinary  memory, and every time I happen upon the place again I salivate. The most memorable part? Squid ink polenta. Get it. The hot flirtatious waitstaff sticks in my mind as well.
author: Sara W.

description: Great neighborhood restaurant.  The staff is friendly and knowledgeable.  The pasta is made from scratch.  I highly recommend the gnocchi sorentina.  It is a great date restaurant.  Dimly lit and quite.  You have to go.
author: David C.

description:
Oh Bella Bella... you have me believing in amore...

This adorable cozy trattoria is conveniently located in my neighborhood and I always thought I should stop in. After doing some research from fellow Yelpers, I was amazed by the rave reviews and picked Bella for my birthday dinner. Oh, I'm so glad I did. Bella is truly wonderful.

Coming from a discerning palette of East Coast Italian cuisine, Bella ranks right up there. However, I have to say I've never found softer, more deliciously prepared pasta ever. The texture is buttery, yet holds up very well in the various sauces - for very tender yet not overcooked pasta... come here. My room mate had the lobster ravioli, his tomato sagu sauce over the delicate raviolis was bliss. J is such a picky eater yet he was very impressed with the texture and well paired sauce. I had the three pasta sampler, I was not disappointed - the much reviewed gnocchi was not disappointing. I loved how they melted with every bite, not to much potato, and not to much flour with the addition of spinach - nice touch. As was the spinach ravioli in creme sauce - wow. Thin ravioli filled with fresh (not wilted) spinach and a light creme sauce, I loved it. The penne vodka was also a nice compliment between a creme and tomato sagu sauce. The pairing of these three pasta is genius, you don't get overwhelmed with too many tastes, but each one has it's on unique signature. My fiance had the mushroom risotto - rice simmered to perfection and mushrooms not overcooked as most often in a mushroom risotto. We also had the beef carpacci for apps, I loved it with the bread. We were thinking it was weird that italian bread not be crusty, but after eating two baskets we enjoyed the potato bread consistency of it. Made great for pasta sauce absorption. Does anyone else think it's potato bread?

Overall the staff was very friendly and attentive, and atmosphere very intimate. Our conversation flowed and dinner went by so well, being seated by the window didn't matter because we were absorbed into our meal, and felt really comfortable. Again, my uber opinionated roomie even appreciated the details of his Trummer Pils glass. As there is a sense of detail in the service.

Especially when I was surprised with a complimentary panna cotta with a little candle in it for my birthday. I'm usually not a fan of panna cotta, but this was sweet with fresh strawberries on top. It does have this after hint like a strawberry Starburst. I loved it. And as much as the boys wanted to take credit for planning ahead, they both swore no one told the host. But Bella took care of me anyway, that's how attentive they are.

Thank you Bella for making my birthday so wonderful, you've made a fan out of me.
author: Jacquelyne L.

description:
This is a very cozy and romantic place.  Great place for a candlelight dinner.  You wouldn't expect this considering the location on Geary.

The service is also really great, as well as the food!  The servers were very attentive.  The food was delicious, the menu had a lot of variety, and it's pretty inexpensive considering the quality.  Highly recommended!  I told two other friends about this place, and they really enjoyed themselves too!  I would definitely go back here for some good Italian food.
author: Howard-Daisy L.

description: Second time here, and it's even better than I remembered! GO here!!! Even foods that I normally don't like (mussels and tira misu) are great here. The point is, this place makes EVERYTHING great.
author: Andria M.

description: My friends used to work at the bar next to this place and they had an ongoing flirtation with the guys who worked at Bella Trattoria.  So, the Bella guys would bring the girls food and whenever I was visiting my friends, I got to partake of free and yummy Italian food.  So, I've never actually dined in the restaurant but I have eaten their food.  Very tasty stuff.
author: Melissa Y.

description: This is a lovely little place. It is cozy and delicious.  We went on a Thurs. night about 7 pm. There was no wait when we arrived but the place filled up by the time we left.  I was expecting slow service but it was fine. Service wasn't exceptional but it was efficient and friendly.  I had the gnocci in tomato sauce. The gnocchi melted in your mouth.  the sauce was simple but tasty.  My super boyfriend had the butternut squash ravioli and that was REALLY good.  The house red wine was good, not dry but I prefer sweet.  I don't know what the wine was though. The  insalata mista was a waste of money. The tiramisu was really good. The bread was different a little sweet. I liked it, the boyfriend would have liked something more like a ciabatta.
author: Jessica D.

description:
Rare is the restaurant that delivers such an outstanding culinary experience at such a reasonable cost. We risked dining somewhere neither my dining companion nor I had ever been. We did not look at the menu prior- abnormal- but we were in a rush. I honestly just went with the name and because we wanted to be in the general neighborhood. 

This wonderful restaurant is such because of the fantastic, attentive service, delicious food and ambience despite being in a Geary corner plot. 

We felt like wine and were open to suggestion.  David, our server, suggested the perfect wine to accompany our meal. The taste offered only hinted at how much fun we'd have over the next few hours. The typical bread on the table at an Italian restaurant was elevated to a whole new level by the sun-dried tomatoes generously left sliced in olive oil. It was an enjoyable departure from the balsamic vinegar/ olive oil combo typically offered. We started with bruschetta and the carpaccio. The bruschetta should not be missed - it is perfection. 

I ordered the lobster ravioli in creamy marinara. Mmmm... I will be hard pressed not to order it every time I return. My friend ordered the tagliolini pork ragu and was very pleased as well. Hours passed and we were oblivious. 

We decided to just glance at the dessert menu. Honestly, 9 times out of 10 I will pass, but I was tempted to try darn near every offering. We decided to split the tiramisu. Superb. As I briefly mentioned wanting to try the panna cotta with strawberries, I was generously offered a sample of that as well. 

This place has a diner for life in me. If you're looking for a great Italian outside of North Beach, give this shocker of place a try. What a great night. The risk to try someplace out of the blue worked this time. Go with confidence- I hope you'll love it as well. If you don't, let me know, because I sincerely doubt it's possible.
author: Alix ..

description: Ohh, the attention to details and flavors is what really makes an Italian restaurant great.  The waiter was nice and prompt, and made sure everything was to our liking.  If you are looking for a great Italian restaurant, then you can't miss this place in the Richmond.
author: David P.

description: I got to see first hand of how alcoholic Italian dudes work.  I've never seen waiters drink so much while at work.  Anyhow, they made it up by giving us some tasty dessert on the house.
author: hello k.

description: Really enjoyed my dining experience here! The food was really good and inexpensive! Most importantly, the service was FABULOUS!! With so many great Italian restaurants in the city, the service is what is going to make me return to a place. The server overheard my friend congratulate me for graduating and at the end of our dinner they brought out a dessert with candles for me....now that is going above and beyond! I will definitely return!!
author: Debbie L.

description:
Hands down, best Italian food in the city. I've been coming here for 10 years and I would recommend it to anyone. The food is carefully prepared and doesn't disappoint. The pasta and gnocchi are outstanding and housemade! The pastas vary from the traditional (best carbonara I've ever had) to innovative (lobster ravioli or squid ink linguine) and I haven't found a dish I didn't like. Also the menu does vary based on what is in season (I go there a lot) and that keeps things fresh and interesting. 

The wine selection includes a lot of rare Italian gems that are specially imported for Bella and are not commercially available, so that is another major draw.

I also can't say enough about the service, which is always attentive, even when the place is packed on weekend nights. The atmosphere is very classy and romantic, so it's great for a date or just a nice dinner with friends. Overall a fantastic experience! Don't miss it!
author: Diana Z.

description: Had a great lunch at Bella Trattoria today after hearing wonderful reviews. The gnocchi was outstanding-little pillows of comfort covered in a blanket of gorgonzola cream sauce and portobello mushrooms-made my heart sing. Was told the secret to the fluff and lightness-rice flour, amazing. The bread was that perfect mix of dark and crunchy crust and soft inside as a good italian bread should be, Nice glass of wine, seat by the window and all is well.
author: Fredda A.

description: I usually stay in the neighborhood for a meal but the family and I were on our way north to Stinson and stopped in (thanks to the Yelp ap) for a quick dinner. Oh my goodness were we delighted by the little restaurant we discovered!  We were seated promptly and greeted by the nicest staff. The hostess was lovely and found us a seat near the window. We were given water and some delicious home-baked bread with olive oil and sundried tomatoes. We ordered the three pasta meal and the butternut squash ravioli and the meatballs as an appetizer. The meatballs were divine! Just the right amount of garlic and olive oil. The butternut squash ravioli made me wish I was going again tonight! I also tasted my fiance's three pasta dish and was in love with the marinara sauce. The wine and beer were well-balanced and nice. While we were eating they brought us the polenta to taste for free. Tasty but improved with a dash of salt. We then had the panacotta with strawberries for dessert. OMG!!! So yum!  From the lovely service to the delicious food and reasonable prices, I can only give this place 5 stars. I wish they were in my neighborhood!
author: Sari S.

description: All I can say is, fresh, homemade pasta totally trumps any frozen store-bought stuff.  And their pasta is hand rolled every morning.  Now that's tasty.  Romantic atmosphere, very nice staff.  I will be back.
author: Jessica H.

description: The butternut squash ravioli, cute atmosphere, and super-friendly staff earn 5 stars.  I have to disagree with other reviewers about the gnocchi and the busy street corner was a detractor but everything else more than made up for it.  This was a great find!
author: Stephanie H.

description: We came across this place when we were looking for a restaurant near USF where we were dropping off our son for an event.  We were so pleased that we had found it. It had a great menu and my husband and I both thorougly enjoyed our meal.  David, chef/owner, was really charming and hospitable.  Took my sisters there for lunch and recommended it to my brother and his wife for her mother's 90th birthday celebration.  Looking forward to getting back there again as soon as we can.
author: Jane B.

description: The best gnocchi...pillowy goodness.  Service was top-notch, and we enjoyed some treats from the kitchen: complimentary bruschetta and panna cotta for dessert.  Molte dolci!  I love a friendly neighborhood restaurant...and remember go for the gnocchi (we loved the maiele - slow cooked pork ragu).
author: Amelyn C.

description: Based on the reviews, maybe we went here on the wrong night. There was only one other couple in the restaurant so I can't say they were too busy to get things right. Both of our pastas were way underdone. There is al dente and then there is crunchy.
author: David T.

description: The gnocchi is soooooo good.  Don't waste your time getting anything else.  The service was great, we got free dessert, the recommended wine was delicious.  But seriously.  Gnocchi.
author: Carolyn B.

description:
made reservations recently for a party of 6, then had to increase last minute to 10.  they totally accomodated.  when we got there, had about a 10 min wait.  good service.  good food.  we brought 2 bottles of wine and they told us if we ordered one bottle, they would waive corkage fees for the others - very nice of them.  everything was really good and not too $.  after ordering many apps, entrees and dessert, it was only $47/pp including gratuity for our entire group.  you cannot beat that price.  

some of my favs were the following:
risotto di seppia
burro e salvia
carbonara
*appetizer special for the evening - i believe it was bone marrow 

would like to go back and try other dishes.
author: vivian y.

description:
ok... so it looks like there are some service issues? maybe this is a hit or miss kind of thing?! i went to bella last night and didn't for one second feel like i was being ignored or getting slow service. i was actually... dare i say it.. slightly impressed?! haha the waiter was super friendly and even gave us a free appetizer and some free dessert.. just cuz! it wasn't crowded and the vibe was very intimate. 

i ordered the gnocchi sorrentina which was pretty de-lish. i love love love gnocchi! the problem with ordering gnocchi is that it's sooo easy to make, but sooo easy to f up. then...when the moment of truth came...it wasn't a nasty potato blob! :D YAY! 

this is most definitely a nice little place for dinner and i will for sure go back!
author: Kristin Y.

description: Great Italian restaurant in SF!  The service was amazing - I don't know our servers name, but she is from London and was very sweet and attentive.  The food was delicious - we will definitely be back.  The chef sent out a little bite of fried polenta for us - delicious and such a nice gesture!
author: Elizabeth O.

description:
I really enjoyed our dinner at Bella Trattoria. I was really tired of all the Asian Fusion on Clement street and was craving something different. Its a cute romantic place with a very sophisticated vibe compared to Clement street restaurants. Our waiter was very friendly and after he forgot to put a candle on our dessert for my friend's birthday (per my instx on open table reservation), he brought a second small dessert with a candle without me asking for it. 

Food was really good too. Gnoochi with Gorgonzola sauce was just to die for! Corkage on a Friday night was $15 but I believe its 0.00 from Mon-Wed. Tiramisu was a little heavy on the rum but I don't have much of a sweet tooth so it may just be me. 

I was there with a girlfriend but will go back with my hubby on date night.
author: Anu Y.

description: I really should not complain too much.  I am very grateful that they were able to accommodate our group of 8 for dinner on a Friday night at 7:30pm.  Also, overall the food was good especially the bruschetta.  The fish dish I ordered was not so fresh.  The staff were pleasant but appeared inexperienced. The appetizers arrived quickly but there was then a long break before the entrees arrived.  Staff were not quick to clear plates and refill drinks.  It is a nice enough neighborhood restaurant with some tasty dishes.  Prices are very reasonable.
author: Jac C.

description: This is probably the top "date" place in the Inner Richmond.  It's a smart, cozy Italian restaurant across the street from Rohan.  The waitstaff went out of their way to be polite and helpful (constantly picking up my napkin that fell to the floor).  The food won't blow you away, but it will hit the spot.
author: Tim G.

description: The amazing Italian food and cozy atmosphere make you feel like you're in Europe.  Great live music- I don't know if that's a regular occurrence or just for Valentines Day.   Our waiter was great and very friendly, genuinely seemed to care that we were enjoying ourselves.  Would give 5 stars but I made a reservation with my credit card number for valentines day and still had to wait an hour once I got there.  I highly recommend this place as a date spot or for a group dinner if your friends are willing to shell out the loot and appreciate good Italian food.
author: Nate W.

description: Oh Bella, I almost hate to tell everyone about you because I don't want to fight for a table. The food alone would have earned you 5 stars, but the service is also just wonderful! I spent my bachelorette dinner with a large group of girls in the capable hands at Bella and all our food was wonderful, warm and came out at the same time...not an easy task for a small restaurant! I had such a wonderful meal that I brought my family back the next week when they were in town for the wedding. So go to Bella and enjoy this neighborhood gem!!
author: M M.

description: Cozy restaurant; friendly and fun waitstaff. Good wines. The lamb gnocci is, um, orgasmic.
author: Jane R.

description: Food is good, not super delicious.  Don't go in a big group, if you have to-- request for a separate bill before ordering. The place is cramped, overpriced for wanna froufrou eatery, service is not even satisfactory.  Because of restaurants like this, makes me miss fritto mistro in santa monica.
author: Hana ..

description: Quaint in a not-so-quaint neighborhood.  Great mood lighting.  Able to hold a conversation at a low-level but there is still music in the backround.  Friendly, knowledgeable staff.  Good menu.  Complimentary soups and desserts.  Moderately priced.  Great spot for a date.  Leisurely dining (took 2 hrs for our entire meal).    One of the best spots I've been w/ my lady for a date/dinner ever.
author: Brian H.

description: nice, quiet place (especially on a week night). great food and wine choices. attentive staff.
author: Vadim B.

description: Food is really good and the waiters are always pleasant.  It's a little on the pricey side but the flavor's worth it.  More for quiet dinners than large or loud groups.
author: Deb T.
