description:
well my wife & i found this place after our favorite italian hang out down the street closed (cafe riggio).  the place is a smaller restuarant.  the lighting is dim & the table spacing is abit tight.  there is a open bar at the end of the restaurant for people waiting for a table (you do not want to be seated near here if possible).  the menu is abit limited in comparison to most italian restuarants i have have been to.  they have a daily special.

i have been here with my wife several times & i always come to the same conclusion.  overall, our experiences have been good.  the food is pretty good but the portions are small.  i always order more & funny thing is that i eat it all & still leave there feeling hungry.  the cross talk from the other tables & awaiting patrons can be quite annoying, as everyone is competing to speak louder to drown out the other cross talk.  

the place can & will get crowded on a friday & saturday evening, so if you are interested it would be best to call & make a reservation.  if you are looking to bring a date here, best to go during the weekday as it is not as busy.  again, the restuarant is pretty small & the seating is close together, conversations are pretty difficult due to the cross talk.  parking is a big problem here in this area.
author: larry s.

description: Who would've thunk it? A fab Italian place in the Richmond?  I had been eyeing Bella after seeing a "Check Please Bay Area" and gotten numerous recommendations for the place, including a neighborhood regular. I must say, it did not disappoint. Free corkage on certain days early in the week and super friendly service just enhance the food. I had the pasta trio - a trio of rigatoni in a rosa sugo, gnocchi in tomato sauce and spinach ravioli in cream sauce. They also happily let me add sausage to my rigatoni. All three were fab - the homemade pastas are perfection.My dining companion had the pillowy spinach gnocchi in cream sauce - decadent but not too much. The cream sauce was a nice complement to the soft light gnocchis. We picked a couple of glasses from the nicely edited wine list. We also got a couple of fried polenta amuses and had a nice ending to the meal with panna cotta with strawberry sauce. Yum!
author: Jennifer C.

description: What a pleasant surprise!  In a neighborhood filled with Asian restaurants this Italian place is a keeper.  the owner & chef is present and very attentive.  Highlights for us were the spinach salad with warm dressing, butternut squash ravioli and the squid ink pasta with seafood.  The prices are very fair and the service was perfect!
author: laurel t.

description: I really love this place.  When I used to live in the Richmond, we would come here frequently.  Everyone who works there is extremely nice, and it's such a cute little place.  I am completely and utterly in love with the butternut squash ravioli in the butter sauce.  Holy cow...I'm drooling right now just thinking of it.  I've had a good experience every time that I've come here, and I will definitely make the trip back here again sometime soon, because it's worth it!
author: Katie J.

description:
I have overlooked this small restaurant so many times when perusing my Richmond restaurant options. I was looking for a place to take a friend for a birthday lunch and I'm so glad I chose this place after reading reviews. 

The interior is clean and well kept, but homey. I know it makes me sound old but, they play the music just the right volume to enjoy it and still hear your tablemates. 

The service was absolutely wonderful. Our server was the perfect amount of attentive (I never wanted for water) without hovering. Her suggestions were right on.

For lunch we both had the specials of the day:

Swordfish Carpaccio with mixed greens, avocado, capers and a citrus dressing. The fish was fresh and had a good taste. It's fresh fishy flavor stood up to the strong avocado and other ingredients. We really enjoyed it. 

Rabbit with housemade pasta and simple sauce with mustard seeds. Rabbit and mustard is my ultimate weakness when it comes to an entree. The rabbit was perfectly tender and the mustard seeds, though large in quantity, didnt overpower the rabbit or other components of the sauce. I was also very happy to see that they served the pasta perfectly twisted into kind of a ball shape. It kept  the pasta hot as I slowly pulled rabbit and pasta strands from the outer layers.

Also, in honor of my friends birthday, our wonderful server brought an assortment of their desserts for us to try and they were all great. The profiteroles were tasty, but we adored the pannacotta and the warm ricotta tart. They were rich tasting but light enough to finish our lunch meal with. The incredibly reasonable bill was the perfect end to great a lunch.

I will definitely be returning to this hidden gem on Geary Street.
author: Elyse G.

description: Bella Trattoria FTW! Wow, after looking for hours on Yelp for a decent vegetarian friendly prix fixe menu for Valentine's Day I stumbled upon this little gem. We made reservations at 10pm, so it wouldn't be too crowded. It was super packed even at that time. The prix fixe menu for this time was only 3 courses, but we could live with that. Plus, the price was right at around $60/person. The poor table next to us was so enthralled in our conversation they just couldn't have one of their own. Anyways, the hostess was super sweet to begin with, I loved that. We sat at the "bar" to get our table ready and shared a glass of our wine with the bartender...who was amazing. The service was outstanding, our brushetta...to die for! I could have just eaten that and I would have been happy. I ordered the mussels to start with, delicious in a nice red sauce, definitely goodies. My friend got the eggplant, 5 stars! All this time, the servers were attentive and polite with out being overbearing. David, the manager (owner?) was on it, had a great conversation and as we toasted a bottle of champagne the main course came out. I got the steak and she got the...I have no idea I was digging into my tender hangar steak. After this point, and another glass of wine all I can say is...I remember having excellent service, food to die for, and all out awesome Valentine's dinner! Thanks, Bella, I'll be back!
author: Morgan P.

description: The four of us were excited to try Bella after seeing it reviewed on Check Please and reading the Yelp reviews.  I think people have lowered their standards for good cooking to give this restaurant  four stars.  We had no serious mishaps....just a series of miss-steps and weak food.  It started when the waitress brought us the wrong salad but one of our party accepted it as a substitute for what he'd ordered.  Then the appetizers came and two of the four of us were openly disappointed.  The albacore and avocado came without any avocado.  They had run out and the waiter never came to ask if we'd prefer a different dish......also the albacore was sliced paper thin.....almost like tuna prosciutto and seriously lacked the expected flavor and texture.   I had the meatballs which were rather bland and seemed to have more vegetable filling than meat and lacked any "character" to the flavor.  They were served on a bed of diced vegetables which didn't help the dish and were more bland than the meatballs.  Then came the main courses.  My wife's gnocchi verde was rather mushy and tasteless.  I know she doesn't like a dish right away when shortly after tasting it she offers to share it with me for some of what I had ordered.  Wrong move!  I had the "famous" carbonara with no creme and no butter.  This had to be the worst pasta I have ever had and I am 66 years old and frequent Italian restaurants.  It was dry and nearly tasteless......it reminded me of a lump of mashed potatoes which had been sitting overnight.  I thought the best dish was my friend's osso buco, but this was a little "heavy" as well and lacked any specific aroma of spices which would have improved it.  The story behind the owner and his success story is nice, but when I go to a restaurant, the company is first, but closely behind is the food and we found that Bella disappointed.......
author: Don L.

description: The food and wine were great.  The service was a little slow, but the ambiance and great date night atmosphere made up for it.
author: Alex E.

description: Went there for my 1 year anniversary weekend. talk about a winner. Truly is a hidden Gem. I had a nice wine paired by they server which was cool because i don't know the first thing about wine and food. Over looked its location when we tried to find the place. but it had a nice ambiance to it. we'll definitely be going back here for sure.
author: Andrew C.

description: Went here on a Wednesday night for a girls night. As we spent ages catching up, they were extremely attentive and made sure that we had everything that we wanted. The food was amazing- balanced flavors with a very European feel. I can't wait to go back!
author: Ashley C.

description: Went here the other night to celebrate a birthday and had a fantastic dinner.  Within minutes of our being seated, fresh, warm bread arived at our table along with an olive and sundried tomato dipping sauce.  I had the Tonno and Olive pasta which was perfectly al dente and delicious.  The rest of the party had the 3 pasta  and the baked penne, both of which were devoured.   Since we had cake at home we declined dessert, but the  server had overheard us talking about it being a birthday and brought out a complimentary panna cotta for dessert.  How can you not love that?   It's true that the portions are not huge, they are large enough that you leave content.   Which we did and will definitely be back!
author: Francesca T.

description: I LOVE Bella. I have taken a 91 year old friend of mine there for lunch on several occasions and the food has been fabulous. Plus David's attention to us, especially to my elderly friend, made me feel completely at home. This is a gem, kinda hidden away in the hub-bub of Geary Blvd. But don't miss it!
author: Nancy R.

description: Great find in the Inner Richmond!  Excellent food and service...and they even threw in some dishes compliments of the chef!  Would highly recommend.
author: Melanie L.

description: RECONSIDER ORDERING THE LINGUINE WITH MEATBALLS!!!  This was my second time at Bella's (last time I had some ravioli dish which was fine).  This time, I was shocked by a startling revelation-I kid you not, but the meat tasted EXACTLY like some frozen pre-made meatballs I bought at Safeway!  When I mentioned this to the waiter, he did admit the meatballs are made 3-4 days in advanced and are kept frozen,  He assured me they were hand-made but I know what I know.  There was definitely something wrong with their texture and taste/flavor.  So with that, BOOOO to Bella's.  Not only am I flabbergasted they could mess up on a simple dish, but to serve poor quality tasting meat.....well, I will never step foot in there again!
author: S. C.

description:
Short and sweet:
Gorgonzola gnocchi (fantastic)
Parmigianna (eggplant over cooked, tasted burnt) 
Wine was great and service was the best  I've had to date anywhere in the country or overseas (including Rome). Thanks Maya (desert was a nice touch)!
author: Dee S.

description: This place is the best! Everything on the menu is delicious, there is not one thing I won't eat and i am a very picky eater! It is a cute, really chill atmosphere with a great staff.  The owner is super nice and very helpful.  The wine is also amazing! this place is the best and the prices are good too! Everyone should try this place!
author: marissa g.

description: Our third dining experience here and Bella is as sumptuous as it has always been. The gnocchi melts in your mouth, the service leaves you with a smile and the price doesn't have you waiting for a couple of years to return.
author: Getafix O.

description: I always like to take recommendations for what is special and fresh on a menu. This tactic can lead to a disaster in some restaurants, but at Bella it is always spot on. Tonight they inspired me to eat something I normally never would have (boar lasagna?!?) and it was outta sight. They also steered us away from two dishes, one because one of the ingredients wasn't as fresh tonight as they would like it to be and the other because it included raw egg, a no-no for the pregnant ladies like me. I think the awareness of the strengths of the menu, attention to seasonality of certain dishes and excellent customer service combine to make Bella a top choice. Great food, fantastic service, comfortable ambiance. What a treat!
author: C H.

description: I think this is the place I'm thinking of.  I remember it being really yummy and having sort of dim lighting, so you feel comfortable and also romantic, and it was fancy enough to feel like you were treating yourself to something but not SO fancy that you felt out of place.  The chocolate profiteroles are delisheeous.
author: Sarah G.

description: Dim all the lights and have handsome, friendly waiters with captivating foreign accents serve delicious if not spectacular Italian food in a charming traditional setting. That's a recipe for an enjoyable dining experience. The ultimate neighborhood "nice spot to drop in for a meal." I only wish I didn't live so far away. Good selection of Italian wines. Co-owner Antonio is a dreamboat. The Dungeness Crab Ravioli is to die for. Skip the mixed antipasti platter. Nummy desserts.
author: David V.

description:
Its too bad about this place. My boyfriend and I had our first date there, and it was a great night. the time after was equally good. But then... one of the worst dining experiences ever. 
We came on a night that was mildly busy, but were seated rather quickly. Then we were brought the wrong drinks and no bread. This was quickly sorted out. But then our order took almost an hour to get to us. By the time we had finished eating the restaurant was pretty much empty. Unfortunately we had come on a night when they were testing out a new hostess, and all the waiters were flirting with her like crazy. After 20 minutes of trying to get his attention from out table, I finally got up, walked over to him, tapped him on the shoulder and asked for the bill. Pretty sad when you consider we were the only table in the place!
The food was as usual, not great, but very good. Delicious sauces on their pastas, and the totellini is always on point. The meat dishes are ok,  but the starches are the best  Thats the only reason they are getting any stars from me.
author: Taler C.

description: Aside from the secondary elements that Bella has no control over (ie parking) I found the restaurant to be perfect for a date as well as a small family gathering I had.  I did not mind in the least the size of the place as I think this is a nice change of pace from large, loud restaurants. The staff was extremely courteous and attentive, the food was on par with what I paid, and I feel as though the owners (who were kind enough to stop by my table both times I visited) are really trying hard to do the right thing.  Also, we as "The City" folk seem to relish in knowing about places that no one else knows about, and in that respect this place is right up your alley.  Take it for what it is and I think you will be very satisfied.  Try to make it into something it isn't and you will be let down due to unrealistic expectations. You can have your Nopa, I will take my Bella...
author: Christopher V.

description: This is a wonderful Italian Restaurant with real, authentic Italian staff.  I was most impressed with how friendly and accommodating the staff was.  The hostess went out of her way to get us seated on a busy Saturday night (no reservations) and our waiter was super friendly and unrushed during our meal.  The pasta dishes we ordered were fabulous, the best I have had in SF.  The only thing I found lacking was the bread they served.  I will definitely be back for more.
author: Rob C.

description: Searching the city for Zabaione? this is the ONLY place to get it! I would give Bella 5 stars but no-one knew how to make a cappuccino.... so sad.
author: Julie M.

description: I went to this restaurant to enjoy a Christmas Eve dinner with my wife. We were the first ones to arrive (admittedly a bit too early), but the staff was nice enough to let us chill for a bit until they were completely ready to open up. This early arrival was due to a mix up with our reservations from opentable. Nonetheless, we enjoyed our pre-dinner time because our server happily came over and gave us a great free apéritif. We toasted to a great night and not too much later ordered our meals. I ordered the prime rib. BIG MISTAKE! It was not good at all- very gross in fact. But the waiter was nice enough to let me switch up my dinner entree after I only had a few bites and let him know I was not enjoying the meat at all. I was able to get their ravioli dish. This dish was delicious! It sort of made up for the horrible prime rib (which they advertise on their website for some unknown reason) they served me. Overall it was pleasant, but I will only order Italian themed dishes from them. That common sense would have served me when I orginally went to the restaurant, but no matter. One bit of news for you all-  I looked on the city health boards website with respect to overall cleanliness and this restaurant did not have great grades. However,  I will go again someday because those raviolis were THAT good!
author: Tony M.

description: The meal was fantastic. The pasta with mushroom/sausage was out out of this world yummy. Ostrich carpaccio, delectable. The special pasta with pork meatballs was comfortingly familiar yet special.  Service was attentive despite the fact there was only 1 real waiter for the entire place.
author: Gi G.

description: i wouldn't come back here again.  the service was really bad.  we sat for almost half an hour before even getting a menu.  our water glasses were empty almost all night long. the food was not very good either. some people in our group didnt evewn finish what they ordered because it tasted so bad.  i fell bad giving this place a horrible review, because our waiter was really really nice.  unfortunately though, despite his niceness, he was hardly ever there, so we were always waiting around.  plus, as i mentioned before... the food wasn't good.
author: vlad k.

description: Dinner at Bella was lovely.  The dishes are super yummy and fresh.  The wait staff is attentive and polite and I never felt rushed.  When we weren't seated promptly the owner sat us at the bar and gave my friend and I a complementary glass of wine while we waited.  The bone marrow is a must have and my favorite main dish is a toss up between the butter nut squash ravioli and the carbonara.  Both are really tasty. This was not my first time to Bella and will not be my last.
author: Becky T.

description: I was really happy after my dinner on wednesday-nice atmosphere and gracious,casual but efficient service.The food was solid,great caeser salad and my Spinach Gnochi(sp?) w/Gorgonzola sauce was tasty although very heavy.The free corkage was also nice....and w/1 desert and an expresso it was only 75 for 3.....nice.All n all-Great
author: james m.

description: So one of my best friend's had a birthday coming up. After reading reviews and trying to find a good restaurant for a party of 14, I chose this place. They had the table waiting for us and water and bread were already out on the table. There were candles on the table and the ambiance of the place was perfect. As our party slowly rolled in, we began ordering. The hostess, who actually became our waitress, was so sweet. Her and her sister chatted with us and made us feel at home. When the food came out, it was delicious. VERY VERY GOOD. I ordered the dish with three different pastas and sauces. It totally hit the spot. After dinner was almost over, I was able to walk into the back kitchen to prepare the cake that they had been storing for me. As I stacked some cinderella figurines on the cake (yea i know, a 22nd birthday and still figurines, it was a joke!), we started to light the candles and bring the cake out. My friend Melanie blushed and everyone in the restaurant sang. We loved the food and the hostesses, we would definately come back again. YUM.
author: Christina R.

description: My funny valentine and I so enjoyed our wonderful "Fiesta de Amore" 5 course meal at Bella Trattoria!  This was their special valentines day event and it was so good I hardly know where to begin..  The mood was very romantic with cozy tables and candle light.  The atmosphere is warm and they have a beautiful mural of gondolas to gaze at.  We were greeted by an inviting host who we think is the owner he was hospitable, passionate about his food and perfect for the Italian experience.  Our meal was amazing with starters of beef carpaccio and a salad of baby squid and potatoes (kind of like a seafood potato salad).  Next the host provided a sampling from the chef of brushetta with hedgehog mushrooms and Gorgonzola... it was warm nutty and yummy, this was later followed by another sampling from the chef (we love these) of basil, tomato soup in a shot glass.  Our entrees were lobster ravioli and osso bucco.  Both knocked our socks off!  The ravioli had the most delicious tomato cream sauce and a scattering of sour squid rings just a perfect compliment to the richness of the dish.  We were told the Osso Bucco was going to be phenomenal and it was; so tender and flavorful served with very fresh tasting fettuccine.    We also had an amazing wine from Italy to accompany our meal.  Admittedly we were to full for desert but we went with it any how in the spirit of la Dolce Vida, for profiteroles that exploded with cream and a nutella sauce and the classic tiramisu (which was a little icey cold for our liking but good) was too tempting to resist.  Finally our meal was concluded with a champagne toast to our love and great dining experience!  This was a two hour extravaganza!  The place was packed but intimate conversation was achievable and they had a really wonderful guitarist who played all of our favorites.  The little trattoria was very busy and the service was a little scrambled but we were there not on a clock, so we were able to enjoy the mood, music and our time together.   We have been here a few times before on regular nights and were just as impressed.  We'll continue to go to enjoy our little piece of Italy right next door.
author: Lori T.

description: My boyfriend and I had scoped this place out a few times - but walking by and noticing candles and white table cloths we never thought we were dressed up enough. Saturday we finally said the heck with it - dressed casual. We walked in and were instantly greeted - asked to wait at the bar and shortly thereafter were seated. Atmosphere is really relaxed - low lit - nice music and can be a little romantic if your in that kind of a mood. The reason why I gave this place 4 stars instead of 5 is because it took awhile before a server finally came over to tell us he'd be with us in a minute when we had already waited about 10 at the table. The good thing is while waiting we were given water and bread - and just enjoyed the vibe. Once our server introduced himself - it was consistent the rest of the time. Not the in your face every 5 minutes - but water glasses were kept full, plates cleared, and enough time to enjoy without feeling rushed. My BF is Italian - so he knows good Italian food - and he really liked it here as did I.  Our waiter spoken fluent Italian to the table behind us - so that was reassuring as well that we'd found a good place! Honestly it was a nice break from the normal Clement street food. The BF had the Linguine w/ clams, and I had the Spinach Ravioli. Melted in my mouth like butter. Good Salads but a little on the expensive side being that the entrees were from $10.95 - $19.95 and the salads (small) were $6.95-$7.95.  Great bottle of wine as well and desert to top it off.  2 salads, 2 entrees, 2 desserts, and a bottle of wine - total 85.00 + tip which is a steal right?!  We'd put this in our top 5 favorite Italian restaurants in SF.
author: J S.

description: Recently, I had a very enjoyable dining experience at Bella Trattoria. The atmosphere is very romantic & relaxed...want to escape the  hustle & bustle of the city...come here!...significantly better quality Italian food than I have had anywhere in North Beach.
author: Kevin D.

description:
This is my first Yelp ever and this restaurant was my inspiration.  I just wanted everyone in San Francisco to know that this place is absolutely delightful.  
My date and I shared the bruschetta which was just the right balance of crunchy, garlic butter-soaked bread and large, juicy chunks of tomatoes.  So good, I could have had that for my entire meal.  Totally recommended.
I ordered the loster-stuffed ravioli and my date had the gnocchi.  I must say that I found my dish to be totes yummy but after trying a bite of the gnocchi, I so wished I had ordered that!  Oh well, guess it's a reason to go back.  Because, I swear, that gnocchi was so light and fluffy, it makes my mouth water just thinking about it.
The service was wonderful and I definitely felt that the entire staff really seems to care about the restaurant, the food and their customers.  All around a great experience and I completely reccomend you visit.

P.S.  There is an awesome bar next door that is like an adult playground!  If you want to make a night of it, you've got to hit this place up after din-dins and play games like: darts, shuffleboard (!), pool, skee ball, or just dance to the grooves on their dance floor.  Yay!
author: Lara B.

description: This is the best Italian food I have had so far. We had the Bruschetta to start with. And we ordered the lobster ravioli and tuna cu olive. both are very delicious!! Our meal ended with panna cotta. The food is owesome. You should try it out!
author: Ant W.

description: Sarah's comments on the feel here hit the nail on the head as far as what I wanted to say--i.e., that it's nice enough to feel like a special dinner spot without being so stuffy as to feel intimidating.  The lighting is very dim here, and it works, creating a hushed and intimate environment that helps to focus your attention on your food and your own party rather than the other patrons.  The food is not the best I've ever had but is certainly excellent--worth the medium/high-level prices you'll find on the menu.  It's not an incredible value, but despite the cost, you won't feel ripped off.  This is, as you'd imagine, a nice place for romantic dinners--not so hyped that it's ever been crowded (in my experience), and they definitely offer up fine Italian haute cuisine with a pretty decent selection of wines.  The gnocchis, in particular, are quite good as I recall, but everything I've ordered here has been pleasing.  One of the Inner Richmond's better-kept secrets.
author: Michael T.

description: definitely one of the best italian restaurants ever!  i tried the vermicelli integrali and the gnocchi gorgonzola--both delicious, but i absolutely LOVED the vermicelli!  the service was excellent and i enjoyed practicing my italian with one of the owners.  overall, a fabulous experience!
author: Amy K.

description: I went here on a Thursday night with one of my girlfriends. When we arrived, the hostess apologized for the super dim lighting and told us their power in the diningroom was out! She was so sweet but it really made no difference to us. The chef sent out a complimentary appetizer of polenta which was so delicious. We ordered the beef carpaccio and let me say I almost licked the plate it was so yummy. My friend got the butternut squash ravioli which was to die for. The brown sugar sauce was the cherry on top. I got the lobster ravioli which was also very good. Halfway through our entrees a chef came out and served us complimentary wine to make up for the electrical problems. Fine by us! We ended up getting a couple glasses of free (very nice) wine and two free desserts when the chef found out my friend was in culinary school. Overall such a great dinner out and such nice people! We will absolutely be back!
author: Bethany D.

description: My husband and I took his parents here when they were visiting. We wanted an Italian dinner while we waited for the Wednesday Open Mic Comedy Night at nearby Dirty Trix Saloon. We were not disappointed ! We ordered, and then were pleasantly surprised with an Amuse Bouche of lightly fried polenta squares - Nice! Each couple split a 'NZALATA ROMANA ( a Cesar Salad with shaved Parmesan) perfect amount to split with no fishy overtones from the anchovies dressing. The two men had pasta, again well portioned and delicious. The ladies had the NERO DI SEPPIA a seafood risotto with squid ink and the SCALLOPPINE DI VITELLO, veal with a light, creamy and surprisingly complex mushroom sauce. Service was attentive but not obtrusive, friendly and knowledgeable. The room is intimate and lovely. The only comment is there was a bit of a lag time between courses, but not enough to deduct even a 1/2 a star.
author: Lee P.

description: A month after my birthday dinner here with my parents and boyfriend, we are all STILL talking about how incredible all of the dishes were. My mouth waters every time I think of this place! I recently went to the raved about NOPA, had some pasta, and it was not even close to the one I had at Bella!! Bella's food plates seem small, but my father who reaches 6'5'' and has the biggest appetite left completely full! The food is rich in flavor and well portioned, so it seems small compared to the generally OVERLY large American plates. I had the Spinach Ricotta pasta with a cream sauce that I never wanted to end. All our dishes were phenomenal. If you like butternut squash, try their butternut pasta with pine nuts... you won't be dissappointed. Bella is an awesome find in the Richmond district. Small, romantic ambiance, a very pleasant experience. I highly recommend it to anyone, go to  Bella if you are a fan of Italian food!!!! No need for tourist North beach. Bella takes the cake :)
author: Kate V.

description: came here for my friend's birthday along with her best friends. i had the 3 kinds of pasta. it was good . they didn't give alot, but surprisingly i was full and thats coming from a pretty big guy.
author: Patrick T.

description:
a nice cozy little place to go for comforting italian food.

atmosphere was nice, but really dark. some call it ambiance, i call it ridiculous. i like to see my food and my company, thankyouverymuch.

aside from that, the space was nice and inviting. the wait-staff was friendly and attentive, despite the crowd. the dishes were good-- bread was tasty, and the tilapia was tender and moist. the dish i had, tagliolini with smoked salmon and caviar in a cream sauce, was rich rich rich. smokey salmon, salty, full-bodied caviar swimming in sauce. it was good, but if you're going to get this one, you should DEFINITELY go halvsies and share it with a lighter dish.

the profiteroles were good, as was the tiramisu. the panna cotta was kind of runny though, so beware.
author: Kerry N.

description: cool little italian restuarant in the richmond.  went on a sunday night right when they opened, so didn't have any problems in terms of seating.  service and atmosphere was good.  i had the gnocchi, and man was it really good!!  give it a try if you're ever in this part of the city.
author: R K.

description: i LOVE this place. the decor is cozy and romantic without being boring. and, perhaps more importantly, the food is amazing. i had a trio of pastas and each one was better than the next. the ravioli is by far the best i've had (and that includes in italy) and the gnocchi were so light and fluffy it was like eating little clouds. definitely check this place out.
author: Jessica B.

description: Bella was a wonderful experience!  The service was impeccable as was the food.  I will definately be back and I highly recommend Bella to anyone!
author: Siobhan C.

description: great food! i had the spinach ravioli with red sauce instead of the white sauce on the menu.  also had the polenta appetizer. everything was delicious. i also love the mural on the wall, it's very cool.
author: Marni S.

description: Four of us dined at Bella the other night for the first time.  The atmosphere was nice and relaxing and the food was great.  I would have given 4 stars if it had not been for our waiter.  I did not get his name but he was a younger guy, dressed in white with messy hair and a sloppy beard and mustache.  This guy was a joke.  He had no clue of how to be a waiter nor did he care.  This is the kind of wait staff that will kill a restaurant.  Now with that said, I do reiterate that the food was quite good and the wine was fabulous too so if you are fortunate enough to get a different waiter, you will have a very enjoyable meal.
author: A B.

description: I don't think there is a single complaint I have with Bella. The atmosphere is charming, the service is friendly and attentive, and the food is delicious. I have been coming here for over 2 years now and whenever I need to take someone out for a nice dinner, I always think Bella.
author: Annie L.

description: okay.  i don't know what others are saying about this place, but i have eaten a lot of italian food, and tonight, bella hit a long homerun for me.  my wife and i shared a splendid warm spinach salad.  simple, but great tasting.  perfectly just wilted leaves, with just a hint of lemon, but a good dose of garlic.  then we did the crazy thing and ordered three pastas.  guess what?  all of them were GREAT.  first, the butternut squash with sage ravioli.  this was fantastic and could have easily been a dessert.  then, they brought out the gnocchi verdi and puttanesca.  the gnocchi were in cooked with mushrooms and a gorgonzola sauce.  if i hadn't gotten so full, i would still be eating them.  correction.  melting them in my mouth.  light, delicate and outta sight.  long, fly ball well over the 410 marker.  and, what can i say about the puttanesca?  great flavor that got better as the dish cooled off.  did i have any things that i would change?  well, maybe make the puttanesca a tad spicier (sp?).  flavor galore, but i just wish it was a bit more "hot".  i asked if they would make it with a different pasta, but our excellent server said that the home mades were the way to go, and he was correct.  great service and they threw in a free dessert, panna cotta with strawberries.  would i go back?  hell, yes.
author: AJ L.

description: Wonderful hospitality.  Lovely ambience.  On warm evenings the large french windows open up onto 4th avenue.  I loved the gnocchi with duck ragout.  Every once in a while I still get a craving.  The only downside (and the reason I don't eat as much duck ragout as I'd like) is that there are very few vegetarian options (Curses.  Damn you wife and your healthy ways!).
author: alan b.

description: I have been taking my daughter Bella here since she was five years old for her Birthday dinner, every year this place just gets better. David and his team do an outstanding job at creating some of the best pasta dishes ever and the wines they have are amazing! This year we celebrated my daughters move into the double digits! I look forward to the day when we celebrate her graduation form 8th grade at Bella's!
author: isabella m.

description: Bella is a great Italian Richmond find in the land of Asian cuisine. The staff is 100% Italian and completely unpretentious about it. They are more than willing to inform you the perfect bottle of Italian wine for your taste, and then send you a complimentary dessert. I've been there 3 times now and am always pleased. Their earthy plates are delicious, such as their special risotto with mushrooms and black truffle oil, as well as their vermicelli, but PLEASE don't pass on the penne, it sounds simple enough but once you taste the combination of their amazing Italian sausage and sweet sugo, you won't be upset. The prices are great and the ambiance and music transcend you. It's a great place for an intimate date on the weekend, try around 9pm after the crowd clears out and you'll feel alone, especially if you get the "mafia" table. They also have a few tables along the mural wall that is usually merged and saved for large groups, I would say for a party of 16 max. However, this is the one thing I don't like about the restaurant. Granted, it depends on the group, but from the groups I've seen they are rude and loud and completely take away from the ambiance. David, who seems to be the manager/owner is a personable and extremely likable man, just try it and I think you'll be very surprised to find such a great Italian restaurant so far away from the typical fare of North Beach.
author: Angie M.

description:
my boyfriend and i felt like having italian and just stumbled upon this place. it had a great atmosphere and i liked everyone working there. i had the butternut squash ravioli which was very sweet and rich. i am a big eater but could not finish this because it was too rich. this is why it loses a star for me. it was more like a dessert than an entree. my boyfriend had some kind of homemade pasta with mushrooms, dont remember what it was, but it was good. especially the homemade noodles. 
oh, the bread was icky. i would take off half a star for that if i could.
author: brandy r.

description: Our group had reservations for 20 people on a friday night at 7pm.  Ya...I roll in a huge gang...I actually hate large parties.  So luckily the resturant was pretty empty and we got our seats without a problem, no wait.   I ordered number 14...it came with three types of spaghetti.  I'd say it was pretty good....but not really filling.  I thought the service was pretty good, so I can't relate the other yelpers who complained about it.  I even got free dessert on the house.  Well ok it wasn't free.   The male waiter came up to me and somewhat whispered in my ear..."here I'll make you a deal, we'll give you either a free glass of wine or dessert for your chair" *points at my chair with my jacket hanging over it*  My friends thought he wanted my jacket....anyways I was about to tell him to take my chair anyways cuz i could easily scoot over and grab a seat next to my friend on the couch/bench.  But my female friend yells DESSERT!  So we got free dessert =).  Best deal ever...although all my friends ate my dessert.  Cuz you know, sharing is caring!
author: Nelson W.

description: Awesome spot! The place has a decent vibe (not great, but not bad); the space feels more Richmond than Italian Trattoria. But, none of that matters once you get settled in. We had a reservation via OpenTable, but rather than put us in a less than ideal table, the owner offered us a couple of complimentary glasses of wine while we waited for a prime spot. We were fine hanging out for ten minutes. We instantly felt like old friends of the owner and were quite happy to be there. When we got to our table, the owner made a point to identify the popular dishes for each course and made us feel completely at home. The service from our waiter was top notch all night. I guess I should talk about the food...it was awesome. My wife is quite picky about gnocchi, and said Bella's was the best in the city. My specialty pasta dish was also great. Prices are moderate and worth it. The only major drawback is no surprise, parking in the Richmond on a Friday night; we circled for about 15-20min.
author: Joe C.

description: this little restaurant was packed with big surprises!!!! my best friend decided she wanted to celebrate her birthday low key for dinner with her closest friends at a quaint italian restaurant. when driving by the restaurant, on the corner of geary, i just didn't expect anything to be extra special...just regular italian food. once we entered, the dim lights and exotic yet modern italian music set a very sexy chill vibe. the decor was adorable, and one wall had a whole painted scenery (which we were sitting behind...really cool pictures!). we were greeted by not just anyone...an actual authentic italian man!!! he made the night absolutely wonderful. he reccomended the best items on the menu (which we ordered!) such as the lobster ravioli's, bruschetta, butternut squatch ravioli's, eggplant parmigiana, etc. the food was to die for!!!! the italian waiter cracked jokes, took pictures, and gave us an overall great experience!!! once we were the last ones in the restaurant, i thought we would be kicked out for sure, but instead the waiter turned the music up, dimmed the lights some more, and not only topped our wine glasses off,  but surprised my best friend with the best tiaramisu that was just melt in your mouth good. loved it loved it loved it, will definitely be going back and recommending to the fullest!!!!
author: Mona M.

description: This place was GREAT! It's the perfect date night setting. Small and intimate, low lighting, and wonderful music playing in the background at the perfect volume. The service was wonderful, I swear we had 3 people waiting on us! I had the lobster raviolis...wish I got more, they were GOOD! Hubby got their lasagna special that had a pork ragu...yum, yum and yum! Their bread is so good, it's not the typical cold, stale sourdough...this was warm, soft and made you feel warm and fuzzy inside. And they weren't stingy with it either! We got 2 baskets! Both of us had the merlot/red sangria, it was good, not the best, but good. Maybe next time I'll try the white one. They noticed we were celebrating and they sent over a complimentary plate of dessert (have no idea what it was, but it was goooood! There's a picture of it on their site under the menu section, last pic). To top it off, I let them know we had a show to go to and what time we needed to be out by and they hit it...with time to spare! Next time I'm in the city, I'm DEF going back!
author: vanessa m.

description: What a treat and a surprise! I came across this place when invited to join some friends for a birthday dinner. I was skeptical. Like most people in SF, I like my own neighborhood spots, I'm a bit of a food snob, and with so much good food in the city it's hard to leave your favorites. Wow was I surprised! I've been back several times in the last few months and find that whether busy or mellow, the ambience is second to none. It's a perfect spot for a date, a conversation with an old friend or a place to make new friends. The service is incredibly warm and hospitable and the food is substantial italian cuisine that never fails to please not only in taste, but variety. The relaxed pace of the service keeps the ambient perfectly Italian and authentic only adding to your dining experience. And I love the fact that I'm supporting a local business owner.  Bella has become part of my regular repertoire. Enjoy!
author: Katie M.

description: Loved it!  Feels very European, they make you feel like you are dining in Italy.  Everything from the decor to the authentic friendly wait staff and the very relaxed atmosphere makes you feel like you are very far away from Geary Blvd.   All that being said, I still think the best thing was the food.  I was able to try a couple of things since there were a couple of us sharing and the food was out of this world.  We had the Vermicelli ala Norcina which was fabulous, the Lasagna with meat sauce was amazing too, great texture combos and flavor. The best thing though was the gnochi. Its not like the Gnochi that you get at most restaurants. Instead of being heavy and filling it was light, fluffy and delicate, definitely tasted homemade, the gorgonzola cream sauce made this dish to die for.  My mom is 100% Italian and an excellent chef so when I say this place is good, I mean it. Highly recommended.
author: andy f.
